name: Blarney Estate - Indoor Pool and Unique River View
title: Harpers Ferry, West Virginia

Back stairwell leads to the 3rd and 4th bedroom
75" TV in pool room, leading to screened patio
Foyer with stairwell leading the primary and second bedroom
Primary bedroom with a King and Queen bed
Second primary bedroom with 2 queen beds
Bathroom shared by the River room and Bunk bed room

hosts.about: Follow us @theblarneyestate

recent.comments: Perfect place, awesome space, great access to everything Harpers Ferry has to offer! Highly recommend staying here!

items.comments: Perfect place, awesome space, great access to everything Harpers Ferry has to offer! Highly recommend staying here!

We loved staying at this beautiful house. It offers amazing views, a terrific heated swimming pool, and smart TVs and Alexa devices everywhere… very convenient!  The location is great for spending the day in downtown Harpers Ferry, Charlestown, or Shepherdstown, and coming back to enjoy the pool and relax. The house had a bunch of games to play, and the kitchen was stocked with everything you could need. 10 out of 10, loved visiting here and would love to come back again.

Lauren and the co-hosts who run this property are absolutely amazing! Always responsive with helpful questions and made us feel very comfortable ◡̈ there was 13 girls for my bachelorette party- more than enough room to sleep and plenty of things to do! Thank you so much for our stay- we appreciate it more than words can describe!
Thank you to Lauren and her team for the most incredible stay! We had the greatest weekend ever! :)
This place is one of kind! The hosts put in so much attention to detail for our stay. Beautiful views to match a beautiful house. You will not regret staying here!

Lauren was an incredible host!  She made us feel very welcome and was incredibly accommodating.  The house had everything we felt we needed and more!  We had such a relaxing stay and couldn't speak more highly of our stay at the estate.  Beautiful views.  Highly recommended!

Stunning estate with beautiful decor, fixtures, and furniture! The views were absolutely breathtaking all throughout the estate. We appreciated the greeting by the host as we checked in along with the estate caretaker. We were also greeted with nice fresh flowers and wine.  

Our family had a great time with the board games, swimming pool, and outdoor games. The restaurants are nearby and the estate info book had great suggestions for food and other details.  This estate is definitely a 5 star+!!!

description.summary:
Escape to a spectacular view of Harpers Ferry gap located conveniently near historic Harpers Ferry on 11 acres. Enjoy an all year indoor pool and fire pit overlooking the Potomac and mountains of three states.

We're just minutes to great hiking trails as well as wineries, breweries, the casino, boutiques, restaurants, museums, historic sites, rafting, ziplining and much more.

*Please read entire listing details and house rules and discuss any special requests with the owners before booking*
description.space:
We bought the Blarney Estate during the height of COVID, when working from home became a reality and we were no longer tied down to one specific location. We found the listing online and immediately fell in love with the house and the view. For the next year we worked tirelessly to renovate the estate and make it what you see today. Halfway through this process, after countless visitors, contractors, friends and random strangers told us we ought to turn the house into a BnB, we decided to go for it! 
 
The house is over 5,000 sqft, with an indoor heated pool and views of the Potomac and mountains from almost every room. The decor and furniture is soft and warm, and our focus is on comfort and refuge.

Our caretakers have chickens, ducks, and turkeys and love to show our younger guests how to feed them, just ask!
 
1st floor
----------

Living room
The front door of Blarney leads directly into the foyer with the main stairwell, and to the living room on the left, with a pool table, two large couches and a smart TV. A cabinet full of board games for all ages will keep everyone busy and an oversized window will leave you mesmerized by the beautiful scenic mountains, trees and river.
 
Dining room
To the right of the foyer is the large dining room, with an extra large window so you can host your dinner party with an amazing view. 
 
Kitchen / Family room
The dining room leads to the kitchen and family room with an extra large island, with room for plenty of seating and socializing. The family room has a smart TV, along with a cabinet with toddler toys and drawing materials.  The kitchen is fully stocked with pots, pans, utensils, dinnerware and a coffee station, with complimentary drip and pod coffee, tea, sugars and creamers. Other amenities include a large side by side fridge/freezer, a toaster, air fryer, blender, food processor, sous vide and wine/beer fridge (BYOB). All stainless steel kitchenaid appliances and butcher block countertops. Doing the dishes is slightly more enjoyable with such picturesque views… or so my husband likes to think. 
 
Pool Room
The pool room has - you guessed it - a pool, which is heated all year round. Enjoy a fun swim or lounge quietly while watching a movie on the 75” TV. Yes, please!  Please read the pool rules thoroughly and don’t hesitate to reach out to the hosts or caretakers if you have questions.
 
2nd floor
-----------

The Grand Suite - One king bed and one queen bed. Views of the river and mountains. Coffee station and smart TV. Ensuite bathroom with double walk in rain showers, jacuzzi tub, a panoramic view and a smart TV. This bathroom is large; you could drag a mattress in this bathroom and sleep on the floor and still have one of the best rooms in the house. This bedroom and the Queen Suite have their own stairwell. The 3rd and 4th bedroom use a different hallway/stairwell.
 
The Queen Suite - Two queen beds, one sitting area with a couch and a coffee table. Views of the river and mountains. Coffee station and smart TV. Full bathroom with an extra large tub connected via the hallway with two vanities and a large soaking shower/tub.  This suite and the Grande Suite share a stairwell.
 
River Room - One queen bed and views of the river and mountains. Coffee station and smart TV. Large sliding glass doors leading to the private balcony with seating so you can ditch your party and enjoy a romantic time with views to die for. The River Room and Bunk Room share a stairwell and a full bathroom with a double vanity and shower/tub. 
 
Bunk Room - Two extra sturdy bunk beds (rated for adults up to 350lbs), each with their own side table, a coffee station and smart TV. The Bunk Room and the River Room share a stairwell and bathroom with a double vanity and shower/tub. 
 
Laundry room
The laundry room has a large capacity washer and dryer with complementary detergent, scented booster beads and dryer balls. There is also an ironing board and a space to hang clothes to dry. 
 
Outdoor space
The front of the house has a big open lawn, perfect for playing games and running around. We have rocking chairs on the covered porch overlooking the front yard. 
 
The side yard has a small playground with two swings and a slide. Play at your own risk, and please no adults on the swings/slide, as it is only rated for up to 150 lbs. In the summer months we have wild raspberries growing behind the playground and are available for all to enjoy.
 
The back of the house has a terrace with dining tables, a sitting area and a charcoal grill. The terrace leads to the screened patio with a large, comfy couch, table, fan and swing. The Blarney Tiny House found in the backyard has a number of yard games available to use, just please return them afterwards. Unfortunately, it is not accessible at this time. The backyard also has a fire pit with Adirondack chairs and corn hole boards. The entire backyard overlooks the Potomac River and the Harpers Ferry Gap. Maryland, Virginia and West Virginia are all three visible in one picturesque view.
 
------------------------------------------------------------------------

Though we have never seen one at the Blarney Estate, black bears are known to roam the area. This is West Virginia after all, and the house is in a wooded, mountainous area, so expect to be exposed to all things wild: stink bugs, gnats, deer, mice, foxes, snakes, moths, ticks, spiders, bears, oh my!

We provide complimentary insect spray for outside use. The house has brand new windows with screens, brand new pest resistant insulation, and is regularly treated by pest professionals, and yet you should still inevitably expect to encounter a few bugs inside during your stay. It is almost heaven, after all! 

------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
General
High speed internet access provided by mesh WiFi throughout the estate. 
 
All smart TVs have complimentary Netflix, Hulu/ESPN+, Disney+, Curiosity Stream, and Peacock subscriptions in every room.  Additional installed apps include HBO MAX, Apple TV, Prime, and Youtube installed if you have an existing account.
 
Complimentary toiletries are provided.  Tap water is filtered through a softener, UV, and whole house filter and reverse osmosis water is available in the kitchen.
 
We have a portable Bluetooth speaker and microphone in the family room for use by guests who dream of being a super star.
 
Books, games and toddler toys are available throughout the house.
 
Amazon Alexa digital assistant devices are located throughout the house and have Unlimited Music subscriptions, which allow for a variety of fun and useful things you can do, such as:

“Alexa, tell me a joke”
“Alexa, what’s the weather in Harpers Ferry today?” 
"Alexa, set an alarm for 5 minutes"

“Alexa, announce, Lunchtime! Come and get it” - make a house wide message
“Alexa, play pop music everywhere” - plays pop music throughout the house
“Alexa, shuffle playlist Skyrim” - plays an owner favorite playlist
“Alexa, lights off” - will turn off the lights in room or area you are in
“Alexa, downstairs/upstairs on/off” - will turn on or off all lights downstairs or upstairs

If you really want to get in the spirit of things, try “Alexa, play Country Roads Everywhere” and enjoy the unofficial West Virginia anthem played throughout the house. At least one member of your party will hate it, but that just makes it even more fun! 

All indoor and outdoor lighting come on every day around dusk and turn off again around dawn. You can also control the lighting via the Alexas and a full list of useful voice control commands is available on a printout in the kitchen.

Alexas can also be disabled before you arrive by the caretakers or unplugged by guests if you wish, but please do not physically move or reprogram them to use your account - they already have unlimited streaming subscriptions tied to them.
 
As this is our personal home, and several of us suffer from severe allergies, there are no pets or animals permitted. 

We are not a commercial venue or to be used for hosting business events.
 
We have two junior mattresses and a travel cot available per request. There are no beds for the junior mattresses, they would have to go directly on the floor in a bedroom. We offer bottom sheets, but no other bedding for the junior mattresses and travel cot. 
 
Should you find you need something else for your stay, please don’t hesitate to reach out to the hosts or caretakers. If at all possible, we will try to accommodate your requests. Our goal is for you to have everything you need for your stay. 
 
NOTE: Your safety and privacy matters. This property features 3 exterior actively recording cameras, located at the front and side doors and facing the driveway. The cameras do not look into any interior spaces and all Alexa devices can be disabled upon request or unplugged by guests.
 
------------------------------------------------------------------------
A maximum of 14 guests can sleep at Blarney and there is parking for 10-12 cars maximum, depending on size. Please do not park on the grass. 

Blarney can not be used to resell business services or as a hosting venue. 

Unfortunately, due to capacity and insurance reasons, we cannot accommodate events or weddings.

While we understand the desire to get to Blarney as early as possible, we kindly ask, out of respect for the privacy of our guests and staff, that no guests arrive at the property prior to the agreed upon check-in time. If you plan on arriving at Harpers Ferry earlier in the day, we are happy to help with recommendations for restaurants and/or activities to help pass the time. 

Pool Rules: SAFETY FIRST, please!

No lifeguard on duty. There MUST be someone over 18 that can swim with minors.
No glass of any type inside the pool room, only paper or plastic. Please keep any food and drink to the table area.
No diving, running or jumping.
No water guns or water squirting toys (due to TV and speakers).
Babies must wear proper pool diapers such as "little swimmers".
Food is allowed at the table area, but not near or while in the pool.
No water balloons in the pool (it clogs the pumps).
Please lock the pool room door when not in use for safety.
The pool is treated on a regular basis and sometimes the pool is off limits if the water has to be treated. Typically this can take up to an hour.

If you’re on an extended stay, please understand that our staff needs to access the pool at least once per week to maintain water quality.
description.access:
Blarney is accessed using keyless entry on the front door. 

As we still call Blarney home when guests are not here, we have to restrict access to a few closets within the house, to accommodate our personal belongings. We have also restricted access to the utility rooms. This way you won’t have to worry about your youngest family members wandering into those areas. Guests will otherwise have access to the entire house. Guests are also free to roam the property, although we ask for some courtesy to be given to the caretakers’ house next door. The large hangar on the property is used for separate business purposes, and is not accessible for guests.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
 
Parking
We have a long driveway and large parking area that comfortably fits 10 cars. Please do not park on the grass.
description.notes:
IMPORTANT: Maximum guests staying overnight is 14. Parking is available for approximately 10-12 cars depending on size and no parking is allowed on the grass. 

Due to insurance reasons, no candles or fires of any type are allowed inside.

Unfortunately, due to capacity, zoning, and insurance reasons, we cannot accommodate events or weddings.

Blarney is not a venue and is not to be used as such or to sell business services.

Celebrating a special occasion? Please reach out to discuss options. We will try to accommodate special requests, but they must be cleared by the owners before booking.

You can web search The Blarney Estate WV to find out more.
description.neighborhood:
There are so many fun things to do in and around the Harpers Ferry area. With Charles town to the west, Shepherdstown to the north, Frederick to the East, Loudoun wine country to the south, and historic Harpers Ferry in the center, you could spend weeks here and still have more to see. 
Museums, ghost tours, breweries, wineries, restaurants, boutiques, historic battlefields, bike rentals and biking along C&O Canal, Appalachian Trail hiking, river rafting, ziplining, fishing, and so much more!
description.transit: The MARC commuter train on the Brunswick line picks up at the Harper's Ferry Station in the morning by the river and brings you to Union Station in Washington, DC. In the evenings the train brings you home to Harpers Ferry. At Union Station the Metro (subway) station provides direct access to the Nation's Capital.
description.interaction: Our caretakers, Rebekah and David, live on the neighboring property and are available to help out with any on site questions or concerns.
description.house_rules:
IMPORTANT: Maximum guests staying overnight is 14. Parking is available for approximately 10 cars and no parking is allowed on the grass. 

Blarney is not a venue and is not to be used to sell business services.

We will try to accommodate special requests, but they must be cleared by the owners before booking.

Due to insurance reasons, no candles or fires of any type area allowed inside.

No shoes in the bedrooms or upstairs carpeted areas.

No diving, glass, food, squirt guns or party materials in the pool area. Infants must wear swim diapers.

Check-in with the on-site caretakers.

name: Virginia Wine Country Cottage
title: Purcellville, Virginia

gallery.caption: Dog Friendly! Our Lucy loves it here.
Cozy Fire pit for cool nights
Three Creeks Winery. About a 10 minute drive away.
Just another sunset on an evening walk.
Shampoo, conditioner, and body wash from Ginger Lily Farms.  Vegan, organic, and cruelty free.

hosts.about: My husband and I are DC natives who have moved out to Virginia Wine Country after falling in love with our historic, 1840s home.  Sharing our cottage and this beautiful area is such a joy!

recent.comments: 2 adults and 1 dog. Spent a weekend at Martina’s place, liked it a lot. Nice and quiet, large lawn for our dog to play fetch. Martina is really a super host, very welcoming! Will come again!

items.comments: 2 adults and 1 dog. Spent a weekend at Martina’s place, liked it a lot. Nice and quiet, large lawn for our dog to play fetch. Martina is really a super host, very welcoming! Will come again!
Well located, charming cottage.  Great for family with infant and puppy - big yard, big kitchen and plenty of living space.  Close to Purcellville/ Middleburg and good wineries/breweries in between.
Great place for a weekend away!

We had a wonderful overnight getaway! The cottage was perfect! Martina and Jim were lovely and made us feel incredibly welcome. We brought our pup and she loved the space to explore! There was also many many wonderful books to enjoy! Thank you for a wonderful trip!

Our family loved the stay. The cottage was perfect for a small family and the owners really included so many details to make you feel at home. The home is super clean, organized, accessible and well decorated. We would definitely stay again.
Very peaceful stay in the picturesque north Virginia countryside
Very cute cottage and very helpful host!

description.summary: Come and enjoy the beauty of Western Loudoun County. In between Middleburg and Purcellville and surrounded by rolling hills of the Blue Ridge, come and enjoy the beauty, visit a winery or brewery, take a walk or a hike, go antiquing, stop at the Philomont General Store for a sandwich, bottle of wine or ice cream. A perfect spot if you enjoy gravel biking.
description.space:
The cottage is very private and just a walk across the lawn to the Philomont General Store where you can pick up sandwiches, wine, sodas, ice cream, etc. 
The main house (Three Lost Chickens) was built in 1840 and Jim and I can be found doing some project or another or playing with our two dogs, Lucy and Matilda.  
The gravel roads provide a lovely placeto take a morning or evening walk.  In the cooler weather enjoy and evening by the fire pit or snuggle up next to the wood burning stove. 
Our property is not fully fenced but
nice walks for dogs is right out your door - either way on Philomont Road takes you to pretty countryside views.   If youtake Philomont Road  across Snickersville and take a left on Beaverdam Bridge Road, there are great morning  and evening Mountain Views.  
Wineries and breweries surround us , each with their unique experience.  
Fabulous hikes along the Blue  ridge and Appalachian trail are all within a short drive.  
There is wonderful food in Purcellville and Middleburg and in the surrounding area.  The farm to table commitment is provides for exceptional meals. 
Come, relax, enjoy.

The area is rural and agricultural.  Please respect by leashing your dog and minding horse riders when walking or driving.
description.access: You will have access to the whole cottage and the yard.
description.notes:
If you would like to use
The fire pit just let us know and I will leave a fire starter and lighter.
description.neighborhood: Philomont is a lovely neighborhood.   The name "Philomont" comes from the greek word "philo" meaning loving or beloved and the french word "mont" meaning mountain, "Beloved Mountain."
description.transit:
The General store is across our lawn and open Monday through Saturday.  
Beautiful walls on Philomont Road. 

We are a 10-15 minute drive from Middleburg and Purcellville.
description.interaction: We live in the house on the property but want to give you all the space and privacy you want - this is your getaway.  We are here if you need anything - happy to recommend, assist with any issues, etc.
description.house_rules:
This is a family friendly  and pet friendly cottage.  At the moment, we do not charge a pet fee.  We love to travel with our dog, Lucy, and trust that you will make sure that no damage happens to the cottage. 

I have specific quilts at the cottage for covering the sofa or laying on your bed if you bring a pet (I wash them after each visit, don't worry)!  We also will have some dog bowls, poop bags, and treats in addition to a couple extra cleaning supplies (accidents do happen!).  

Philomont is a lovely village and area with perfect places to dog walk just outside the door.  There are horses, donkeys, chickens, etc. on these walks, so be mindful if your dog gets excited (mine does!) by these things.  

There is an indoor wood burning stove that would need to be monitored if using it when small children are present.

name: 1813 circa Historical Farmhouse
title: Knoxville, Maryland

recent.comments: Thank you so much, everything was perfect for our family.

items.comments: Thank you so much, everything was perfect for our family.
Awesome place for a girls weekend! Probably the nicest air bnb I’ve every stayed. Clean, beatiful and spacious.

We did an 8-day stay at Cindy & Beth's lovely old home.  Our children and grandchildren together.  Gorgeous and fascinating house and surroundings.  We had to make do with the 2 bathrooms and all 12 of us, but it was a fun challenge!  :-)  It was so quiet and peaceful there.  Kids hiked down to the stream a couple of times and played there.  They made use of the bin of outside toys as well.  We enjoyed the wrap-around porch with all its seating.  I personally enjoyed hearing so many different birds and identifying their sounds through my Merlin app!!  We utilized the fire pit twice and enjoyed watching the fireflies each evening.  We gathered there from FL, TN, and WA for our youngest son's wedding near Haper's Ferry.  We certainly couldn't have asked for a better choice and our hosts were spot-on with accommodating our needs and inquiries.  Highly recommend!
~ Frank & Sally Ruscio, Orlando FL

Amazing stay to celebrate my nieces wedding with grandparents, aunts, uncles, and grandchildren staying in the home.   Cindy and Beth were very responsive and the home was impeccably clean…we felt right at home.  Wonderful stay in a charming area.

We loved staying here- It was an amazing girls weekend. We spent the weekend going to wineries, breweries and downtown. This location was close to everything and was big enough for all 12 people to be comfortably accommodated. We would definitely return to this location!
the place was great for our group.  We were in the area for the 100 miler race.
beautiful place, great for large gatherings, enjoyed it!

description.summary: Nestled atop a knoll with breathtaking views of rolling hills, pastures and beautiful South Mountain, our farm is your peaceful home away from home. Swing on the wrap around porch, or enjoy dinner on our 800 sq ft back patio. If adventure is more your thing, you will enjoy the walking trails, creeks and ponds.  Guests will have exclusive access to the farmhouse and surrounding 2 acres. The remaining 27 acres is a working farm,  with seasonal farm activity. Guests may explore the whole farm.
description.space:
The farmhouse offers 4 bedrooms and one bonus room with accommodations for up to 12 people. Upstairs, we have a full bathroom and one bathroom with  shower on the main level. The main level also boasts a newly renovated and fully stocked farm kitchen, formal dining room with seating for 12, breakfast nook seating for 4, living room/library and cozy den.  Laundry room is also available for your use during your stay.  If business brings you to our farm, please be assured we have what you need to make your trip successful. Wi-fi and a designated desk with a printer available for your use.
We do not allow more guests than booked for the reservation. No parties or celebrations without our prior approval. Please contact us if your intentions are for something other than a family getaway.
description.access: Guests have access to all parts of the house except attic, upstairs storage room and basement.
description.notes:
This is a 200 year old farmhouse with hardwood flooring.  There are many changes in elevation throughout the house, just a note of caution with families with young children who like to run or older people with mobility challenges.
There are three indoor fireplaces but no wood burning allowed.  One fireplace has electric logs with a remote.
We have chickens and crops on part of the farm so you will see us come and go near the barn area each day.  We will not be around the house you are renting during your stay.
description.neighborhood: This charming 29 acre farm is located in rural Knoxville Maryland offering a serene country space.  Nestled just outside of Harpers Ferry WV, and less than an hour drive from Washington D.C and Baltimore MD, this working farm, is now a beautiful site for you to enjoy. This unforgettable setting sits alongside Israel Creek, has views of rolling fields, and a backdrop of beautiful mountains perfect for precious sunrise photos.  Amazing history surrounds this farm from Harpers Ferry West Virginia to Antietam Battlefield in Sharpsburg Maryland.  Located only 3 minutes from the Appalachian Trail, C&O Canal and River & Trail Outfitters, there are tons of outdoor adventure.  Looking for city attractions?  We are 10 minutes from the Marc train to Baltimore or Washington D.C. or an easy 1 hour drive by car.  We are available for any information on the area, we have multiple binders with local area attractions, food, wineries and outdoor activities including maps of trails and historical sites.
description.transit: The property is located 2 miles from Route 340 which takes you into Harpers Ferry West Virginia or towards Frederick Maryland where you can reach major highway Interstate 270 towards Washington D.C. or Interstate 70 towards Baltimore Maryland.  The MARC train is located 10 minutes away in Brunswick Maryland.
description.interaction: We are only a phone call away.  If you need us to come out to fix something, we can be there in 20-30 minutes.
description.house_rules:
*We get a lot of requests for early check-in or late check-out.  There is an extra cleaning fee of $75 if you would like to check-in early or check-out late so we can hire extra cleaning staff to get the house ready in between bookings.
*We do not allow pets.
*We have a wonderful fire pit constructed by local Girl Scouts for their camping events on the farm.  They have cut, split and stacked the wood to use for the fire rings.  Our Airbnb guests are welcome to use wood during their stay.  We ask that you donate $10 for a ten log bundle.  If you would like to use the fire wood, please let us know and we will send a money request through Airbnb to go to their troop.
*During stay, no one allowed to enter house other than booked guests.
*Please note, this is a working farm, people may be on other parts of the property working.
*Contact us if booking for a party or family event, we will review requests in advance.
*Please stay out of barns, they are unusable to Guests.
*No Fireworks, and discharging of firearms permitted anywhere on the property.
*Please do not move furniture. Loss of any items or damage to the property/furniture could result in the loss of your security deposit. 
*Guest will not remove any items from property. If a guest has been found to have stolen or removed an item(s) from the property, they will be prosecuted to the full extent of the law.
*Homeowner reserves the right to enter property if given reason of damage, disturbance or if a repair is needed as necessary. Homeowner will attempt to notify guest.
*Renter must be an adult of twenty-five years of age or older. Other guests in the party may be under the age of 25, however, the renter is responsible for any damage caused by the guests under the age of 25. Guests will be asked to vacate premises immediately without refund if this rule is not followed.
*Smoking is not permitted anywhere inside the home. Guests may smoke outside, but please do not dispose of cigarettes on the property.  If we smell smoke inside the house, renter will lose their security deposit for professional smoke removal cleaning fee.
*Guests are not permitted to alter the wiring of any TV or Internet equipment.

name: Potomac Overlook Farms: 6 BR, 10 Acre River Estate
title: Leesburg, Virginia

gallery.caption: The Oak Suite is located on the First Floor of the Main House. This King Suite has a cozy gas fire place and bay windows that look out into the front yard. The room has a closet, Roku TV and shares a Jacuzzi bathroom with the main floor.
Pool Area: includes sun deck, gas fire pit, gas grill and pool house
Main level bath, shared with Oak Suite.

The River Birch is the Master Suite which includes a cozy king size bed with king size pillows, fireplace, private bath and beautiful views of the Potomac River while enjoying lazy mornings with your loved ones.
River Birch Suite. The en suite bathroom contains two separate sinks, shower, Jacuzzi tub, separate toilet room and plenty of storage space.

The Dogwood Suite is an Upper Level Bedroom that can sleep 6 with 2 full size beds and 2 twin beds. There is a private attached full bathroom. This room shares a Jack and Jill closet with the Maple bedroom.
The Sycamore room is a bright, cozy Queen room located on the lower level with Roku TV and closet. It has a shared bath with the Foxglove room.

Foxglove is on the lower level. This room is furnished with a Queen bed and a Daybed that contains an additional pull out sleeping option. The room has a closet, Roku TV, dresser and opens out onto a patio. It has a shared bath with Sycamore.
Game Room located on lower level.
The Kitchenette is located on lower level. With an extra fridge (nice for bulk items, groceries and beverages!), coffee station, toaster oven and microwave, it's great to have space to spread out.

Maple Suite is a light filled, corner suite on the Upper Level. Relax in a Queen Size bed with views of the Potomac River. The room is equipped with a Roku TV, private bathroom and a cot should you need to sleep an additional guest.
Maple is a quaint nook on the second level with a private bath and a lovely view of the Potomac River from a  Queen bed.
Front Walkway: view of entry into house and optional guest house beyond
Oak is a lovely Main Floor bedroom where you can relax in the king size bed next to a cozy fireplace overlooking the beautiful front lawn.
Foxglove Bedroom is a Lower Level Bedroom that contains a Queen size bed with a daybed and pull out trundle. This is perfect for a couple and one or two kids!
Foxglove Bedroom w/ queen bed and day bed with trundle
Sycamore is a beautiful and bright Lower Level bedroom boasting a Queen size bed, closet and additional storage.
Steps from Living Room to Entry
Sports Court w/ Badminton Net, Basketball Hoop and Tether Ball

hosts.about: We are a family of four that loves hosting, exploring and is always on the go. Amber prides herself in cleanliness and attention to detail while Charles makes sure everyone has FUN! But no matter what, as your host and hostess, we are always here to make sure you enjoy your stay. If there is anything you need from "what to do in the area" to I love "chai tea for breakfast", our goal is to make your stay as relaxing, comfortable and enjoyable as possible.

recent.comments: Our family of two seniors, 6 adults and 7 children had a fabulous time. The house is beautiful, well equipped and with lots of amenities including outdoor equipment and indoor games for the children and the adults. Kayaking, sitting by the pool, exploring the area including ropes courses, Harper's Ferry, and Frederick, MD. The house is well cared for and well equipped to allow us to function as a group. The hosts are very responsible. Took care of any problems very quickly. A fantastic experience and the second (but probably not the last) time for us.

items.comments: Our family of two seniors, 6 adults and 7 children had a fabulous time. The house is beautiful, well equipped and with lots of amenities including outdoor equipment and indoor games for the children and the adults. Kayaking, sitting by the pool, exploring the area including ropes courses, Harper's Ferry, and Frederick, MD. The house is well cared for and well equipped to allow us to function as a group. The hosts are very responsible. Took care of any problems very quickly. A fantastic experience and the second (but probably not the last) time for us.
Charles & Amber are excellent hosts.
Wonderful house in a remote area. Lots of activities on the property and space for a lot of people. Charles and Amber communicated great prior to and throughout the stay.

Charles & Amber's home was an absolutely perfect setting for our family Thanksgiving celebration!  

The property is stunning with its beautiful river views and truly has so many available game or activity options ... beyond walking along the Potomac, we enjoyed pickleball, s'mores at the fire pit, basketball, and the hot tub.  Plus, the home was very well-stocked, super clean, and all beds were incredibly comfortable.
Loved the house, the views were fantastic! Great kitchen, fully equipped with e erythema you need! Matched the description perfectly! Amber and Charles were very responsive!
Great property! One of the best most accommodating stays for families and awesome hosts.

We (three couples and 5yr old and 6yr old) had a great time!

Everything was well stocked:
Kitchen even had sharp knives (I feel like most rentals have dull knives). 
Lots of pool toys and kiddo stuff in the outdoor shed - we used the awesome kid life vests. 
Fun toys and movies for kids in basement!

Beds were mostly memory foam and very comfy. Nice linens and pillows too. Lots of towels for bath and pool. 

We hope to return with larger group and rent out the guest house maybe next summer!

Thank you!!!! ☀️

This was not an issue for our group, but those with mobility issues (or toddlers) should be aware of the stairs/steps throughout the house/deck and uneven walkway to front door.

description.summary:
Welcome to Potomac Overlook Farms. This 5,000 square foot home sits on 10 acres and is located directly on the Potomac River with water access from the estate. The home is surrounded by wineries, breweries, parks, historic towns, art, and culture. 

The house easily sleeps 16, and the optional guest house can add 5 more. Please inquire about the Guest House at booking. 

This home is not wheel chair accessible. 

The pool is open April-October.
description.space:
Potomac Overlook Farms is a 6 bedroom / 5 bathroom home that sits directly on the Potomac River.  The house has a large game room and a big screen movie studio.  The private attached pool and pool house allow guests to take-it-easy while enjoying the scenic river views. 

This home is not wheel chair accessible. 

Each bedroom has a bathroom directly attached to it.  Bathroom #4 and #5 also double as common area bathrooms.  Several of the rooms have 50" Roku TVs and blackout shades.

The property also has a 2 bedroom Guest House available for rent. Please inquire at booking, as we can not guarantee a last-minute reservation for the Guest House due to maintenance and staffing.

Please also be advised that the Guest House may be rented to a separate party November-April, who will not have access to the Main House you rent. Shared spaces include the parking area and grounds activities. This is ONLY a possibility during November, December, January, February, March and April. All other times of year, the entire property is occupied by only your group. 

Renting includes access to a small fleet of canoes, kayaks, and tubes if you would like to spend a day on the river.

The house also includes outdoor and indoor games as well as fishing rods and tackle for your use.

There is 1000 square feet of deck and porch space, outdoor shower, hot tub, and 3 jacuzzi tubs inside the house.

We'd like to advise groups that there is potential for insects on the property.  This home is on 10 acres in a rural setting where there are various insects and wildlife. Please inquire at time of booking about the season if there are any insect allergies or phobias.
description.access:
During the rental period you will have full access to the entire property except for two closets in the main house and the guest house/detached garage area.  The guest house is available for rent under a separate contract for $150 per night.  Please inquire at booking if you're interested in the Guest House as an add on.  We cannot guarantee a last minute reservation for this due to maintenance and staffing.

Please also be advised that the Guest House may be rented to a separate party, who will not have access to the Main House you rent. Shared spaces include the parking area and grounds activities. This is ONLY a possibility during November, December, January, February, March and April. All other times of year, the entire property is occupied by only your group.
description.notes:
Guests must sign a rental contract upon arrival.

The home is not wheel chair accessible.

The exterior of the house has a security system with cameras.  The cameras display on a screen within the house and the guests have full access to the system.

There is a commuter train within sound distance. The whistle gets blown during the rush hour and rainy/foggy nights.

We'd like to advise groups that there is potential for insects on the property.  This home is on 10 acres in a rural setting where there are various insects and wildlife. Please inquire at time of booking about the season if there are any insect allergies or phobias.

Please also be advised that the Guest House may be rented to a separate party, who will not have access to the Main House you rent. Shared spaces include the parking area and grounds activities. This is ONLY a possibility during January, February, March and April. All other times of year, the entire property is occupied by only your group.
description.neighborhood:
Potomac Overlook Farms is surrounded by hiking trails, fishing spots, small towns, breweries, wineries and distilleries! 

Destinations and Mileage: C&O Townpath 2.2 miles, Vanish Brewery 3.3 miles, Tarara Winery 4.1 miles, Winery 32 6.0 miles, Creek's edge winery 6.5 miles, Barnhouse Brewery 6.7 miles, Lost Creek Winery 6.9 miles, Fabbioli Cellars 7.7 miles, Village Winery 8.7 miles, Terrra Nebulo Vinyards 9.7 miles, Smoketown Brewing Station 10.9 miles, Catoctin Creek Distililng Company 17.2 miles.

Brunswick, MD 11.1 miles 
Leesburg Outlets 11.3 miles 
Old Town Fredrick, 16.1 miles 
Harper's Ferry 21.5 miles.
description.transit: Uber and Lyft are generally available on the property. We are 2.5 miles from Point of Rocks MARC Train Station, which brings you to DC in 1 hour during the week. 15 miles from Leesburg Executive Airport. 27 miles from Dulles Airport. 30 miles to Wiehle-Reston East Metro Station.
description.interaction:
You will probably see one of us or a staff member on the property performing lawn services, pool maintenance, repairs, etc if needed; however, the space is yours during the rental and we will not use the pool, tiki bar, basketball courts, etc. while you are there.  Our goal is to make your stay as comfortable as possible and we are always just a phone call away in case there are any issues.

Please also be advised that the Guest House may be rented to a separate party, who will not have access to the Main House you rent. Shared spaces include the parking area and grounds activities. This is ONLY a possibility during November, December, January, February, March and April. All other times of year, the entire property is occupied by only your group.
description.house_rules:
- Airbnb account holder must present a photo ID and sign a rental contract upon arrival

-This is a rural property, located on the river in a private 10 acre setting and there is a potential for insects. Please let us know if there are any insect related allergies and/or phobias. Insects are seasonal and based on the season the potential for insects changes. 

- Check in age:  Due to the nature of alcohol being stored on the property the minimum age to check-in is 21.  This person must book through the airbnb system and agree not to allow access to alcohol to any persons under 21.

- Any damage must be reported immediately

- Guests must swim at their own risk and all minors must be escorted in the pool area

-Pool can be heated in April, May, September or October to 80 degrees for $300. Please send us this request at least 5 days before your arrival. 

-Host/hostess must be notified of any additional people/guests that are visiting the property.

-Guests must send driving directions to all persons staying on the property.

-Noise reduction at 10pm. Please respect the neighbors.

- There is no hunting or discharge of firearms allowed on the property

name: Ballenger Farm
title: Hamilton, Virginia

gallery.caption: The white painted section on the left was added in the 70s and is occupied year round by my folks. The stone section on the right, courtyard, and deck are for you! This photo and the interior photos were taken by David Andrews.
The courtyard's little pond has a few sweet fishies in it.
Look at our cute ducks! I promise more photos of our farm animals if you keep looking.
After you enter through the mudroom you reach the kitchen.
The doors allow easy access to the deck.
This table is awesome- both sides fold down. We picked this up from Nostalgia in Purcellville!
In the winter you can use the fireplace.
The first room is yellow. We don't have a name for it yet, I'm thinking of naming it the "rhymes with jello" room.
This room has a lot of ship pictures and its own full bath.
Jelly bean shaped desk is pretty crucial.
This little room is cute but also stately. Just look at that lamp. It's very serious.
That cute room just got an upgraded bed! Two people can be very snug in there now :)
This room has its own staircase, oo lala!
Spooky staircase :) Note: little ones love these spiral stairs, but we suggest they use the main staircase because this set can be difficult to use for kiddos.
Nighttime at the farm + some goats
People fall in love here. It just happens.
Chickens, goats, and a small human all living in harmony!
Our most interestingly colored bathroom is situated upstairs for easy access by guests staying in the green room and the red room.
This bathroom is attached to the blue master bedroom.
Lil blue, the downstairs half bath.
This is a downstairs bathroom. People in the yellow bedroom use it the most.

You can have little fires here! This is actually a huge cooking pit that’s 5 feet deep and for SERIOUS cooking (sometimes we rent it out for cooking whole animals), but it’s mainly just a hang out spot for s’mores making :)
Look at this genuine beer garten table! You can put all kinds of things on it!
You can fish in the ponds!
Our goats like people! These baby goats are friends with human babies!
This goat is named Cinnamon. She is naughty, and we love her. She likes to park on cars that are parked near the house, which is why we park in the back field (about 25 meters from the house).
Look at our cute sign! (But ignore the date - the first section was built in 1753.)
Ps. A mile of trail to walk on the property if you need extra nature time :)

hosts.about:
Check out more at #ballengerfarm, theballengerfarm on insta.
I am living my best life working on Ballenger Farm and helping it achieve its full potential. This old farm is my passion!
 I live in Leesburg with my sweet daughter, so I’m not always at the farm.

recent.comments: Very cool place to spend the weekend!

items.comments: Very cool place to spend the weekend!
Had a wonderful stay. Really enjoyed being here.
We absolutely love your time at Ballenger Farm! Can't recommend it enough!

We had a wonderful stay at Ballinger Farm.  The house is historic and really well preserved.  The farm is awesome- we loved the goats, chickens, and Peter Pan (our guard cat)!  We dealt primarily with David, who is a co-host, and he was very attentive and helpful with anything we needed or wanted to know.  We had a hiccup with the AC and David was there immediately to get everything working and keep it that way.  He even delivered us farm-fresh eggs one morning!  
Such a unique home and wonderful area - I’d be happy to go back anytime.

Elizabeth’s farm stay was one the best experiences we had with family and friends. Groceries and restaurants are in walking distance. Hosts were Elizabeth’s parents; David and his wife were so good and kind to us. It was perfect farmhouse experience with goats, chickens, ducks, fishes, ponds, bon fire and awesome landscape. Although it was raining most of the time, but we did had fun. My two-year daughter along with other kids thought David was Old MacDonald and they were enjoying moments like petting and feeding animals and birds. 

We thought of cookout but because of weather we had to cook inside, kitchen was well equipped. We had everything we need. David and his wife were awesome hosts. We would like to come back and also recommend this to others.
Loved their place. Would go back!
Great place! Would come back!

description.summary: Quaker colonial (circa 1753) on small farm with free range goats, chickens, ducks, rabbits, and other animals.  Ballenger farm is close to wineries, breweries, horse and hunt country, the WD&O bike trail, and the Appalachian trail.
description.space:
The farm is accessed via a private natural road. The property includes a barn, spring house, corn crib, and several streams and ponds. Outside, you can roam the property and visit ducks, chickens, rabbits, and fainting goats; take in the view from the deck;  enjoy the fish ponds (fishing allowed); and walk several trails. Looking to grill? Go back in time with an old fashion fire pit, wood fired grill, and five foot deep in-ground oven.

Inside, the vibe is very "East meets West mid 1700s" with a mix of classy antiques, funky vintage finds, and East Asian pieces.  In addition to the bathrooms and bedrooms, there is a living room. piano room that looks into the courtyard, dining room that sits up to 12, large kitchen with two ovens and six burner gas cook top, laundry/mud room, and special toy room accessed by a winding stair.
description.access:
The home includes an original stone section first started in the mid-1700s with a brick section added later. The entire stone section is open to guests, and has it's own private entry. 

Ballenger Farm is a working hobby farm. We raise chickens, ducks, rabbits, and goats. Feel free to roam the property - there is a mile of trails for walking. However, not all the buildings have been fully restored so they are not safe for adventuring in, especially for children.
description.notes:
> Ballenger Farm has no check-out Airbnb chores.  Enjoy your stay!

> The goats and other farm animals are friendly and like to investigate new folks. You can toss the chickens and ducks all kinds of snacks and feed the goats out of your hand :).  Please encourage children to move slowly as quick movements can frighten the animals.

> Cars should be parked behind the barns. When cars are parked near the house (which is the goats favorite space) the goats like to play king of the mountain on top of them. 

> Stays at Ballenger are limited to eight adults plus several children under 10 years.

> Per Airbnb policy, we do not host parties, events, or other gatherings via the Airbnb platform.

> Please note: my parents live and work on the farm in the brick section that is attached to the main stone house in which you will be staying. There are no shared entrances or indoor spaces. 

> Some guests have said that they think that Ballenger has ghosts. We have not seen or heard any. Instead, we think that after 270 years, any house can  be forgiven its quirks and creaks. :)

> Airbnb AI claims that this property is a '10 minute walk from a lake'. There are no lakes of any size in the entire county. Hosts can not change this. Airbnb suggested that I add this note to this listing until they can fix the bug.
description.neighborhood:
Ballenger Lane is an 18th century natural road with only two other houses and neither are visible from the property giving Ballenger Farm exceptional privacy for the area.

Horse and Hunt Country, the Appalachian Trail, the Shenandoah and Potomac Rivers, Harper's Ferry, and dozens of wineries and breweries are within a 10 to 30 minute radius.

Purcellville is next door. It has quaint shops with vintage goods as well as convenient grocery stores and resturants.

A walking path connects Ballenger Farm to Patrick Henry College. If you have relatives, friends, or business there, it makes it a very quick commute!
description.transit:
A DC commuter bus departs from a free parking lot 8 minutes away.

Dulles Airport is about 30 minutes away.

Lyft and Uber are available, but wait times can be a bit longer than in urban areas. Limos are popular for wine tours, but make sure to book in advance.

Metro's Silver Line is 40 minutes away, but opening much closer in 2023.
description.interaction: In Covid times you’re able to stay here free of any interaction with me and my cohost parents. You can reach us by phone if you need anything! Also, since the farm is owned by my darling parents you might see us working outside- and we'll probably give a little wave.
description.house_rules:
Please,  no additional overnight guests. The overnight accommodations are for eight adults/children (additional infants and toddlers that sleep in bassinets or pack n plays are most welcome!).

The speed limit on Ballenger Lane is 5 mph. It used to be the main North/South road in Western Loudoun back when Ballenger Farm was first established 270 years ago. And now it's in the same condition as it was then! A one lane natural road with washes and pot holes! Please drive carefully and all will be OK.

name: Le Poulet Palace
title: Marshall, Virginia

hosts.about:
Born in Warrenton,Va.  5th (Website hidden by Airbnb) career has been in the retail paint business .
Some of my hobbies are traveling , motorcycling ,kayaking and bicycling and in Airstream trailers.
I’ve been to United kingdom ,France ,Norway , Finland ,Egypt, Jordan , Kathmandu Nepal, Peru, China and Italy and I have walked The Camino de Santiago . please check both listings on the farm .

recent.comments:
I had a lovely weekend getaway here! It is so peaceful, yet close to lots of restaurants and wineries. 

The place and hosts were very welcoming and the shared farm fresh eggs were much appreciated. 

My partner and I also were able to catch some fish in the pond on the property, which was extra fun.

items.comments:
I had a lovely weekend getaway here! It is so peaceful, yet close to lots of restaurants and wineries. 

The place and hosts were very welcoming and the shared farm fresh eggs were much appreciated. 

My partner and I also were able to catch some fish in the pond on the property, which was extra fun.

We had an amazing time at the Poulet Palace. It was so charming and I sat in the rocking chairs on the porch most of the time. The view of the grounds were lovely and we instantly relaxed from our busy lives. James welcomed us upon arrival and showed us around. He even showed me where he has special treats for the miniature donkeys in the pasture right by us. Be warned, it is a tight space and the kitchen has only a 2-burner electric stovetop. But we still had many meals there so it is still doable. James even dropped off a charcoal grill for us to cook the steaks we bought at The Whole Ox (if you know, you know.) Plan on coming again.
Beautiful setting.  Just the get away we were looking for.
We had a wonderful stay! The place and land was beautiful and James/Cheri were super responsive!
Amazing stay! Absolutely would and will be coming back!

This our second time staying… once here and once on their other property. Always friendly… less than 20 minutes to Marshall and 30 minutes to Sperryville, Culpeper, and the Shenandoah. We love the peace and quiet but being able to visit local places! Place is always pristine and as expected.
Great little getaway with beautiful surroundings. Had some Fresh eggs waiting when I arrived on the counter. Checked in to make sure everything was ok. Will definitely recommend for a relaxing stay.

description.summary: A uniquely tasteful yet whimsical, completely renovated chicken coop. Meant for getting back to you.
description.space: You will have access to 130 acres of fields, woods, a good size pond if you desire to fish, trails to the Rappahanock River following in the footsteps of many two and four legged before you.
description.access: One hundred and thirty acres of fields and woods on a land easement farm, paths to the river, large pond for fishing if desired.
description.notes: There are chickens (and yes you can have fresh eggs) donkeys, and the owner has dogs with Davis being the self appointed Ambassador!
description.neighborhood: We are close to several wineries, Blue Ridge Mountains, Skyline Drive, caverns, restaurant’s ranging from five star to diner.
description.transit: Parking is right in front of Le Poulet.
description.interaction: We are available as needed either thru text or phone calls. Owner lives on the property and we love welcoming quests and showing them around in person.
