recent.comments: This place was AMAZING!!  The grounds more beautiful than expected. We had a house full and there was plenty of room to spread out and the outdoor space behind the house was wonderful.   Lots of room for games and relaxing. Bedrooms were lovely.  It could not have been better!

items.comments: This place was AMAZING!!  The grounds more beautiful than expected. We had a house full and there was plenty of room to spread out and the outdoor space behind the house was wonderful.   Lots of room for games and relaxing. Bedrooms were lovely.  It could not have been better!

Absolutely beautiful home on a beautiful setting.  Our family felt very comfortable here.  We loved the layout of the house, the porch, and seeing the farm animals.  Thank you for creating a beautiful farm stay!

We stayed here for a work retreat and everyone had a fantastic time! The house is well equipped to handle a large group of people staying over. The surroundings were beautiful and so fun to see the animals!
Perfect place to stay! Loved every part of it!
Excellent place, highly recommended
Beautiful home! Only wished it was warmer weather so we could explore the property

Lauren was the perfect host! She was very responsive & extremely helpful with any questions I had prior to booking the location. My family traveled here from all sorts of locations, not seeing the listing & everyone LOVED the house & grounds around it. The sunrise was beautiful to watch & we loved exploring to see all the animals located around house. It was a beautiful location in the winter, I can only imagine how lovely it is when everything is in bloom. The house was very clean & fully stocked. They had given lists of things to do/visit in the area which was super helpful. There was plenty of space for our large party. We wished we had stayed there longer! If we ever are in the area again we'd love to stay again. They also have a beautiful event space! if you're looking for the perfect place, this is it! Thank you so much lauren!!

description.summary: Nestled in the countryside, Comus Farm sits on nearly 300 hundred acres of sprawling hills, stunning mountain views, and positively serene landscapes. Our farmhouse is great for family gatherings with its cozy bedrooms, ample kitchen and dining space, quiet living spaces and outdoor gardens. Perched near Sugarloaf Mountain, Comus Farm offers guests from far and wide a place to truly unwind. Comus Farm also offers space for events. Please contact us for more info on weddings, birthdays and more!
description.space:
Our rustic yet elevated farmhouse offers seven newly refinished bedrooms and three full bathrooms with a powder room, laundry, full kitchen, dining and living spaces. Cozy up by the wood burning stove with a book and a blanket, or have a cup of coffee on the back deck or balcony while enjoying the serene sounds of the farm. You might even spot the chickens running around!

Comus Farm also has charming spots like the rose garden, vegetable garden, animal barn, two ponds, views of Sugarloaf Mountain and more. We’re located in the heart of Montgomery County’s farmland and offer a comfortable space if you’re visiting from near or far!

----

Should you desire to use Comus Farm for an event such as wedding, bar/bat mitzvah, engagement party, rehearsal dinner, bridal shower, baby shower, or any type of event - please contact us through Comus Farm Events. Events are billed separately.


License #: STR21-00580
description.access: Guests are welcome to use the entire farmhouse, with exceptions to the basement and staff areas indicated. If planning an event in the outdoor spaces, please contact us separately at Comus Farm Events.
description.notes: While we offer the farmhouse for accommodations, there are other residents on the property in separate housing whom you may encounter during your stay.
description.interaction: Please feel free to contact us anytime by email, phone or text. We’re happy to chat! If you are interested in holding an event on the farm, please contact us separately through Comus Farm Events. Thank you!
description.house_rules:
Please contact us separately regarding events/weddings. Comus Farm Events, Dickerson MD. 

Quiet Hours: 10pm - 7am
Do not adjust thermostat.
Be respectful of residents on property.
Do not chase or feed the animals.
Leave muddy shoes outside or rinse by tap on the side of the house.
Farm equipment is for farm staff only. 
Do not throw items into fountain.

name: The Coach Stop at White Hall
title: Middleburg, Virginia

gallery.caption: Wine and fresh eggs provided for every stay!

hosts.about:
A few of my favorite things: full-bodied reds, carriage rides into town, Nespresso and breakfast sandwiches, anything shiny, seeing kits on the farm

A few of my least favorite things: split ends, when Trader Joe's runs out of avocados, when you lose a shoe the morning of a show/hunt, when it's a windy day while tedding and hay gets in ALL the places

recent.comments: Enjoyed our stay! Thank you for having us

items.comments: Enjoyed our stay! Thank you for having us

One of the best Airbnbs I’ve stayed in! Supplied the house with snacks, wine, and fresh eggs from the farm! Very spacious and great amenities. Fire pit in the back was a great time and plenty of animal life to admire. Would absolutely stay again.

Good points: beautiful area, loved the horses and cows and dogs... very bright and clean. And the eggs that they leave you in the kitchen are delicious! They also welcome you with a nice bottle of wine and snacks. Make sure you know that, every three days, you will be awakened in the middle of the night with their well equipment, located in the closet with the washer and dryer. If you don't know what it is, you will think that a main waterline burst. It will last until 2:00 in the morning. Hopefully, you will be notified about this... we were not. Also, both tubs and bathroom sinks are very slow in draining. You will be up to your ankles in water while taking a shower. Last, but not least, you are issued one towel, and one washcloth per person.... no extra towels or washcloths and no dishtowels are in the kitchen. No laundry soap but Suji was really sweet and brought over some.

The Coach Stop was the perfect size and space for our family group.  I really appreciated the lack of clutter and cleanliness of the home.  Experiencing the hounds and horses was a special perk that we won't forget!
Very convenient and close to what we needed!
It was perfect! I highly recommend!
Beautiful setting and great setup for a girls’ weekend away.

description.summary: The Coach Stop offers peace and tranquility for the weary traveler wishing to experience the country life. Located on the west side of Middleburg, the tranquil location offers the country life, but with the convenience of access to Middleburg's attractions. The town of Middleburg and many attractions such as vineyards are only minutes away.
description.space: The Coach Stop was built with guest accommodations in mind. All the systems and finishes are new, including independent heating and cooling in every room. Accommodations include four bedrooms, two full bathrooms, a gourmet kitchen, living room, dining room, and patio. All four bedrooms have queen size beds. The bathrooms are centrally located between the four bedrooms, offering maximum convenience for any guest situation.  We pride ourselves in the cleanliness of the environment, and strive to provide simple but elegant accommodations with rural charm.
description.access: Guests have full access to the Coach Stop.
description.notes:
Your Wellbeing is Our Top Priority

COVID-19 may have affected part of your life, but it doesn’t mean it has to take away from your “home away from home” experience.

We have always prided ourselves in providing an exceptionally clean environment, and have implemented heightened safety and sanitizing measures, as recommended by the guidance from the world’s leading health authorities, including the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and World Health Organization (WHO).

The entire house is always thoroughly disinfected by professional cleaning staff and we also require at least 24 hours between each booking. We clean with environmentally friendly hospital grade cleaners, including every single doorknob and handle.

The accommodations were designed with comfort in mind, but in a setting that is comparable to hotel accommodations. All our linens are white, guaranteeing cleanliness, floors are a product that can be thoroughly sanitized, carpets are removable and large furniture has covers that are washed after every guest stay. There is also no ductwork in the home, guaranteeing that no airborne infections can occur. Additionally, three air cleaners are utilized in the home as well as dehumidification.

We also adhere to and exceed AirBNB's advanced cleaning protocols.
description.neighborhood: White Hall is situated on Snake Hill Rd, which is a historic gravel byway. Walk to Goodstone Inn, or just enjoy the still very rural western side of Middleburg while exploring Snake Hill Rd and Pothouse Rd. You will often see our horses on the road, being exercised, pulling carriages or doing farm work. Our hunt kennels are also on the property and hounds are walked out daily. The town of Middleburg is only a short drive away (less than 5 miles). Goodstone Inn and other eating establishments are 5-10 minutes away, as well as wineries and other attractions. Whereas other listings advertise “Middleburg”, and are actually in adjacent zip codes, the Coach Stop is actually in the famed 20117 Middleburg Zip Code.
description.interaction: White Hall is a working farm where we maintain many of the traditions of Virginia and the Piedmont region. During Hunt season you will often see us Foxhunting from the property, you will also see our driving horses pulling carriages, horses in adjacent fields and other farm activities happening. The Coach Stop is adjacent to our stable yard, so you may have the opportunity to meet and greet the horses and the owners. The Main House and other farm buildings are just down the gravel drive, feel free to reach out with any requests and staff will do their best to accommodate.

name: Poole House at Friendship Farm
title: Mount Airy, Maryland

gallery.caption: Enjoy the beautiful view from the patio
One of four winding, narrow staircases.
Plenty of parking as well as access to the three car garage.

hosts.about: I am a mom of three children ages 21, 19 and 16.  I love being outdoors, running and adventuring with friends and family.  I'm a former college basketball player and have a passion for coaching.

recent.comments: while a little hard to find, it was very hard to leave this perfect colonial farmhouse. Even better than the already great pictures. The addition of an amazing kitchen, AC, and wifi to the very period-feel of everything else was perfect. It was incredibly peaceful to rock on the front porch overlooking the manicured grounds watching the fireflies flit around. This farmhouse tucked away on private grounds was just what we were hoping for.

items.comments: while a little hard to find, it was very hard to leave this perfect colonial farmhouse. Even better than the already great pictures. The addition of an amazing kitchen, AC, and wifi to the very period-feel of everything else was perfect. It was incredibly peaceful to rock on the front porch overlooking the manicured grounds watching the fireflies flit around. This farmhouse tucked away on private grounds was just what we were hoping for.

One of the prettiest Airbnb's we have ever stayed in.  The directions to the home were very helpful.  The home, property and outbuildings were picture perfect.  The kitchen is well stocked with everything you need.  The beds and linens were very comfortable.  The bathrooms were very clean and there were plenty of towels for the whole family.  We greatly enjoyed the historical value of the home and appreciated the information left in the information binder.   We enjoyed watching the wildlife from the patio and the front porch.  Deer with their fawns came to visit often, along with a number of birds. Access to the garage was also very convenient.  The hosts haven't missed a thing.  We would definitely return and have already recommended it to some friends and family.  The only thing that was missing was maybe a lounge chair or hammock outside, because it is the perfect place to read a book or take a nap!  Thanks for a perfect stay.

Our family(my three children with their husbands and wife along with grandchildren) all enjoy the house exploring all the different places and the fire pit was a big special event. Would recommend and hopefully return some day.
Amazing place with a really interesting history. We'll be back for sure.
Great location. Fantastic host and exactly what our team needed to focus and get aligned with a busy work week to follow. Thanks for hosting The Commons team!

Probably the nicest place we have ever stayed, perfect for a quiet getaway or country hikes or family get togethers.  There is no shortage of things to do in the area, we could have easily stayed a month or more.

Jennifer is an exceptional host with a lovely home. I have booked this home with her twice. Each stay was amazing. Not only does the home offer great history, it is a great place to stay with family and loved ones. Everything was clean and put together upon entering. This home features many rooms and beautiful surroundings where one can find themself at peace. I truly enjoy my stay when I book with Jennifer.

description.summary: Welcome to Poole House at Friendship Farm!  Escape to the country at this historic stone house built in the 1700s.  With accommodations for eight guests it is perfect for a getaway with friends and family, wedding parties and work retreats.  The house received a meticulous restoration that includes all mechanical systems and a modern addition with a gourmet kitchen and master bedroom.  The property also includes a three car garage as well as a restored smoke house and log cabin.
description.space:
Friendship Farm is conveniently located one hour from Baltimore and Washington DC and 45 minutes from Gettysburg, PA.  Located just minutes from Linganore Winecellars and Black Ankle Vineyards.

Enjoy all that Frederick County has to offer including wineries, distilleries, craft breweries, historic civil war sites as well as biking on the C&O Canal and kayaking the Potomac and Monocacy rivers.  

Historic downtown Frederick is a 20-minute drive and offers delicious dining, shops and nightlife.  

A stay at Poole House is a unique opportunity to experience a beautifully restored historic house.  The house sits in a private, secluded setting with gorgeous views of 240 acre Friendship Farm.  The stone portion of the house was built in two phases.  The original part of the house was completed before the Revolutionary War and the second stone section was built in 1790.  The restoration and furnishings are true to the period in which the house was built but guests are also provided with modern comforts including wifi, television, central heat and air, heated floors in the kitchen and more.   Bedrooms and bathrooms have fresh new sheets and towels. 

Guests have full access to the large, front and side lawns as well as access to the walking trails that run along Linganore Creek and throughout the farm. 

Please keep in mind that this property was built in the 1700s and is not accessible or safe for small children.  There are narrow, winding staircases in the house that we ask you to take caution when using.

A two night minimum stay is required for weekend bookings. 
  
An outdoor fire pit and firewood are provided.
description.neighborhood: Poole House is the original manor house of Friendship Farm which consists of 240 acres of open fields and woods as well as walking trails.  Linganore creek runs through the back of the farm.   Our neighborhood is very rural and secluded.  Horse and dairy farms surround the house as well as farm wineries and breweries.  Grocery stores and restaurants are a close drive away in the towns of Mt. Airy, New Market and Frederick.
description.interaction: We live in a separate residence on the farm and are available if something comes up.  If you'd like we can show you around the property upon arrival and then the house is yours to enjoy in a private setting.  You are welcome to let yourself in with the keypad lock and only contact us if you need something.
description.house_rules: Please do not burn fires in the fireplaces

name: The Cottage at Dunthorpe Farm
title: Purcellville, Virginia

hosts.about: We have lived in many states but put down literal long term roots on our farm in Virginia.  You will likely see us working  around the place during your visit...it is a labor of love

recent.comments: Wonderful, peaceful farm with horses and friendly dogs. The space was open and inviting. Homemade jams with breakfast every morning were a treat. Wish we could have stayed longer!

items.comments: Wonderful, peaceful farm with horses and friendly dogs. The space was open and inviting. Homemade jams with breakfast every morning were a treat. Wish we could have stayed longer!

Kelly andPhil are exceptional hosts,  full of local knowledge and interest.  The cottage is homey and comfortable, and
the breakfasts are a delight.
We'd return whenever possible.

The cottage was just beautiful and exactly what I was looking for.  I was doing an online course, so spent quite a bit of time in the cottage and it had just what I needed—good wifi, a big desk/table to work from, and beautiful natural light!

There were many amenities and little things in the house that made it extra special—coffee, tea, kitchen and bathroom items, and, of course, a lovely breakfast delivered every morning.

What a thoroughly lovely place to stay. Delicious breakfasts, serene setting, cozy furniture, thoughtful amenities. We’ve stayed at many Airbnb’s in the Purcelville area, and this was by far our favorite - we’ll be back!
Amazing hosts! Great recommendations of the local food and wineries. The cabin was beautiful and they were quite generous. The breakfasts were all homemade and delicious!

Thank you! We had a fantastic stay! Even though it rained for the morning of our one full day in the area, we didn’t care because we felt completely comfortable staying in and enjoyed a yummy breakfast before going on a hike!

The restaurant recommendations were also great!
My husband and I had a wonderful weekend Anniversary trip here.  We would book again if in the area.  I had the best sleep I've had in a while.  So peaceful!

description.summary:
The cottage is a fully restored wagon barn sitting on a 48 acre 1790's farm nestled against the Blue Ridge Mountains.  You'll enjoy quality, comfort and pastoral views.
We are a fully licensed and inspected B&B.  The cottage is stocked with organic cereal, juice, coffee and tea.  Each morning you are treated to a continental breakfast of fresh pastry and fruit sourced from local farms.
We are close to Harpers Ferry, WV, Leesburg, VA and Middleburg, VA, and are just a 30 minute drive from Dulles.
description.space:
The cottage boasts a wonderful open floor plan with wood and stone tile floors throughout.  Downstairs has a full bath, laundry,  kitchen, and a large sitting area with a flat screen smart TV.  There are also two large sofas one of which is a queen sleeper that we can make up if given notice.  The loft bedroom is appointed with a queen size bed.  When you stay at The Cottage you enjoy over 1,000 square feet of pure privacy.   Perfect for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
We extend the way we try to live to all of our guests so that we clean and outfit the cottage in mostly earth friendly and or recycled products and supply recycling bins.  The food and snacks we offer are organic or produced with best practices and mostly local.  Because every day should be Earth day!
description.access:
When you book at The Cottage, you are our only guests.  The entire cottage is for you and your guest  to enjoy alone.  Relax on the patio or cozy up to the fire pit.  Feel free to walk the fields, and explore the wetlands.
Please do not enter any other buildings without Kelly or Phil in attendance.
We will supply a key code for self check in the day before or day of expected arrival.
description.notes:
We have consistently received 5 stars for cleanliness and during this time of COVID we are taking even more precautions including disinfecting all frequently touched surfaces including door handles, light switches,  stair railings, remotes, tables and appliances.  We also will not book inside of a 48 hour guest window for both our safety and the safety of our incoming guests.
In addition, the cottage is stand alone and there are no shared spaces as you are our only guest.  
For more pictures and information, visit our website.
description.neighborhood: We are surrounded by vineyards, breweries, cideries, horse farms and many historic civil war battle sites.
description.transit: Western Loudoun does not have much public transportation.  However, driving services will happily take you to the numerous vineyards and elsewhere in their van or your own vehicle.
description.interaction: We are always available in person or by phone or text.  We relish getting to meet new and returning guests and happily interact as much or as little as each of you desire.  After all, this is your special time to relax and enjoy our beautiful setting and all that Loudoun County has to offer.
description.house_rules:
Please do not allow dogs or cats into the cottage as we host many pet allergic guests.  Do not enter any barns without direct supervision of owners.
We do not allow children under ten years of age.

name: The Love Nest
title: Markham, Virginia

gallery.caption: The Love Nest entrance and porch
Morning view from The Nest porch
The view changes  all through the day
Winter view from The Love Nest porch
Morning view of sunrise from The Love Nest porch
The Love Nest has many rainbows in the summer
Another rainbow from The Nest porch
The clouds look like a wave over the mountains this day
Morning sea of clouds ever changing
Wild Turkeys love to visit in the spring and summer

hosts.about: I am a retired Art teacher and an equestrian rider.  I enjoy having others around to share the peaceful country life that we so love.  Cheers to you!

recent.comments: Kay’s place was wonderful.  Amazing views everywhere you looked.  The place itself was comfortable, well appointed, with nice touches throughout!  Would stay there again without question!

items.comments: Kay’s place was wonderful.  Amazing views everywhere you looked.  The place itself was comfortable, well appointed, with nice touches throughout!  Would stay there again without question!

We spent a wonderful couple of days at Kay's place:  spacious place, very well equipped, with a gorgeous view.  Great base for wine tasting and dining in Marshall and Middleburg (shout-outs for Field and Main and, especially, Tremolo Bar).  We look forward to returning!

The Love Nest was beautiful and peaceful and Kay and Joe were wonderful hosts. The home and farm were just like the photos and Kay sent easy to follow instructions to get to the property. The unit was spacious and clean, and there were plenty of little extra touches (welcome notes, homemade snacks) that made our stay feel more intimate and personalized. We loved being close to local wineries/vineyards and the views from the porch were just stunning. I'd love to return to the Love Nest again to experience another dose of peace and serenity in the near future.

This little getaway spot is well-named as the "Love Nest".  A great place for a couple to get out of the city and away from the hustle and bustle.  Great views of Virginia's Blue Ridge, and nearby state parks (Sky Meadows), wineries (Naked Mountain, Alterra, others)  and the Appalachian Trail.  Kay and Joe keep the place in great condition and ready for your quiet getaway.

Kay was a proactive, friendly and accommodating host. Her home and farm are so beautiful, we could have spent all day on the porch. She shared some wonderful recommendations for food and activities to do. Even her directions, and we arrived in the dark, were spot on. Overall, our first trip to Shenandoah couldn’t have been the same without staying at the Nest. Thanks Kay, we would love to return one day.

Finding the Love Nest was spot on for what we were looking for. Kay and Joe's hospitality made us feel like old friends. The farm and the "Love Nest" left us in awe arriving down the hilltop lane. Entering the Nest was amazing and every possible amenites were thoughtfully placed. During three day stay we were finding Kays thoughtful touches, games, ziplock bags, freshed baked cookies and welcoming wine. Each morning and night we found ourselves lingering on the deck with coffee or wine. Extra time at night listening to horses in the field and watching the  last light over the mountains enhanced by a fire element capped every perfect day. Looking forward to a return in fall. Cheers!

Lovely peaceful setting and wonderful hosts.  Lots of space within the unit and all sorts of extra touches to welcome us and personalize it for us.

Wonderful, wonderful weekend - can’t wait to come back in another season!

description.summary: The Love Nest overlooks the Shenandoah Valley and perches on 12 acres surrounded by thousands of acres on all sides including the Thompsons Wildlife Reserve & Appalachian Trail.   Wake up watching a beautiful sunrise as you sip your coffee from your porch with glorious mountain views.  The Love Nest is a great place rest, relax, and recharge in a quiet, tranquil setting. Located just 3 miles off Rt. 66, it is centrally located near wineries, hiking, sightseeing, events, restaurants, and more!
description.space:
The Love Next has the luxuries you want in a setting you will not want to leave!  With a private entrance and beautiful porch, it is the perfect setting for relaxing in your tall deck chairs in front of a propane firepit while enjoying a glass of wine.  The daily sounds of birds singing around The Nest is a sweet symphony to your ears.  Keep an eye out for deer and fox in the fields as they frequent The Nest periodically throughout day and night.  If you love peace and quiet, then The Nest is the place for you!
Inside the inviting décor of The Nest features:
•	1100 sq ft of living area
•	Large bedroom / great room
  o	Queen bed with new mattress 
  o	Gas log fireplace (switch operated)
  o	Bench
  o	Couch
  o	Reading Nook
  o	Makeup / writing table
  o	71” TV with DIRECTV satellite (including HBO) and Blu-Ray player
  o	Movies, Books, and Games
  o	(2) ceiling Fans
  o	Recessed lights
  o	Eucalyptus hardwood flooring

•	Full kitchen (fully stocked)
  o	Granite counter tops
  o	Refrigerator with icemaker
  o	Keurig Coffee maker with assortment of coffees and teas K-cups
  o	Full array of bowls, plates, cups, pots, pans, and utensils 
  o	Stove with glass cooktop
  o	Microwave
  o	Dishwasher
  o	Ceiling fan
  o	Iron
  o	Tea kettle & coffee maker with grinds
  o	Electric hand beater
  o	Cleaners

•	Dining area with open floor plan to kitchen
  o	Complementary bottle of wine, chocolate, hot chocolate mix, and snacks
  o	Ceiling fan
  o	Wooden floors

•	Full granite bath with washer and dryer
  o	Granite flooring
  o	State of the art rain shower with wand
  o	Granite walls
  o	Washer and dryer (stacked)
  o	Hair dryer
  o	Heat lamp over shower
  o	Soaps, shampoo, conditioner, creams
  o	Wall magnification mirror
  o	Toiletries 

•	Porch
  o	Private entrance
  o	Firepit - propane (for warmth / ambiance only)
  o	(2) Tall back Nags Head Hammock deck chairs (so comfortable)
  o	Retractable awning – to keep you out of the sun

Power outages - Hillcrest View Farm has an automatic facility backup power generator.  In the event of a power outage, the only thing you will notice is that the clocks will blink afterwards until they are reset.  Everything else will operate normally (heat, air conditioning, lights, water, etc)
description.access:
Come and enjoy country living on a Gentlemen’s Farm (meaning we have horses & dogs but no cows, chickens, etc).  You will have full access to the yard but please don’t enter the fenced off fields or the barns.  If you want to visit with the horses, please let us know and we will escort you.  This is for your safety and theirs.  
Dog Greetings – we have five dogs who enthusiastically greet any visitors by running at top speed to you and barking.  They are just letting us know you are there, sometimes loudly.  Getting them NOT to jump up has been a work in progress, so bear with us as they tend to get very friendly.  There is a gate at the bottom of your porch so they can’t come and bother you with kisses.
	If you want to go for a hike on the mountain, please go to the end of the driveway walk to the right down the road.  It is a beautiful walk that is mostly shaded on a gravel and dirt “road” (more like a path).  
There are lots of things close to the The Love Nest.  Here’s a small sampling:
•	Wineries – within three miles you’ll run into (5) wineries.  Within fifteen miles there are (14) of them all around us.  Eat, drink, and be merry my friends because you are in the heart of wine and horse country!
•	Hiking – Just across the road there are two entrances to G. F. Thompson Wildlife Management Area (4000 acres of hiking and fishing) including part of the Appalachian Trail (1 mile either direction).  Five miles away is Sky Meadows State Park with 22 miles of trails as well as horseback riding trails and fishing.  At Shenandoah National Park (27 miles) there are a bunch of hiking trails ranging from the novice (moderate 1 hour hikes) to expert (strenuous 7 hours hikes!)
•	Restaurants – there are some great dining options less than 20 minutes away including: the famous Apple House for breakfast (Linden), Hunter’s Head Tavern (Upperville), Red Fox Inn & Tavern (Middleburg), Salamander (Middleburg), L’Auberge Provençale (Boyce), Field & Main (Marshall), Red Bar Sushi (Middleburg), Best Thai Kitchen (Middleburg), The Melting Pot (Front Royal), The Red Truck Bakery (Marshall)
•	Towns / Shopping – Middleburg, old town Winchester, old town Warrenton
•	Equestrian Events – Great Meadows International Gold Cup (The Plains), polo (The Plains), point to point races (Upperville, The Plains, Leesburg, Middleburg, Ben Venue, Berryville), Charlestown Races (35 miles), Upperville Colt & Horse Show (Upperville) – oldest horse show in the US,   
•	Fun – Hollywood Casino at Charles Town Races (35 miles), white water rafting (41 miles), Luray Caverns (39 miles), Pick our Own peaches, apples, strawberries, and more (2 miles, multiple orchards)
•	Historical / Scenic – Shenandoah National Park and enjoy the views driving Skyline Drive for 105 miles along the Blue Ridge Parkway (might even see a bear or three), State Arboretum of Virginia (Boyce), Manassas Battlefield, Harpers Ferry
•	Day Trip Adventures – Mount Vernon, Arlington National Cemetery, Monticello, Advar-Hazy Center Air and Space Museum, Natural Bridge of Virginia, Frontier Culture Museum (living museum), National Firearms Museum, National Museum of the Marine Corp, American Shakespeare Center (theater), Wolf Trap (concerts)
description.notes:
The Love Nest is in the country so here’s a list of things you might encounter while here (some more common than others):
•	Animals – Dog, Cat, Horse, Deer, Fox, Squirrel, Fox Squirrel, Chipmunk, Raccoon, Groundhog, Frog, Mice, Voles, Moles, Skunk, Possum, Box Turtle, Black Snake, Bear, Coyote
•	Birds – American Goldfinch, Bald Eagle, Barn Swallow, Black Vulture, Blue Bird, Blue Jay, Broad-Winged Hawk, Brown Thrasher, Canadian Goose, Cardinal, Cowbird, Crow, Darkeyed Junco, Grackle, Great Horned Owl, House Finch, House Sparrow, House Wren, Mockingbird, Northern Flicker, Oriole, Pileated Woodpecker, Quail, Raven, Red-Bellied Woodpecker, Redheaded Woodpecker, Red-tailed Hawk, Red-Shouldered Hawk, Red-winged Blackbird, Robin, Rose Breasted Grosbeak, Ruby Throated Hummingbird, Starling, Tree Swallow, Tufted Titmouse, Turkey, Turkey Vulture
•	Flying Things / Insects – Ant, Bat, Bee, Bugs, Butterfly, Dragon Fly, Fly, Hornet, Ladybug, , Mosquito, Moth, Praying Mantis, Spider, Stink Bug, Tick, Walking Stick
If you have phobias of different animals, bugs, or things that go hop in the night, then perhaps country living is not for you.  On the other hand, if the possibility of seeing these things excites you, then you’ve come to the right place!  If you have questions regarding how common the animals, birds, flying things, and insects are or when is the best time to see them at The Nest, please email us with questions.  We cannot control nature (stink bugs, flies, lady bugs, ants, etc) and we do not provide refunds for acts of nature which is beyond our control, to include a few stink bugs that may get inside the home.
Some other important notes:
No Children or Infants (must be 20+) – The Love Nest is located on a second floor with a porch and is a farm.  In addition, the décor is not childproof. 
Wifi – there is no broadband out here in the mountains
Cellphone Reception – with many cellphone towers located on the mountain ridge to the west, cellphone reception at The Nest is never a problem
No Smoking / Vapes in Apartment – the porch is fine but please do not dispose your cigarettes on the grounds or in the commode (we will have a place on the porch to put them)
No Pets – we have plenty of four legged friends for you to meet on the farm (dogs, cats, horses)
Parking – your spot is reserved for you in front of the tall barn (in front of the welcome sign)!
Fenced in fields and inside barns are not to be entered without an escort.  If you want to see just ask!
Dog Greetings – we have five dogs who enthusiastically greet any visitors by running at top speed to you and barking.  They are just letting us know you are there, sometimes loudly.  Getting them NOT to jump up has been a work in progress, so bear with us as they tend to get “too friendly”.
Security Cameras – our security cameras cover the majority of our fields and the driveway to monitor our horses
"Off" Bug Spray - there is a can in the window for you to use.  Please return back to the window if you use it.  If you take the bottle by accident, you will be charged $20.
Contactless Check-in and Check-out – you can check in anytime after 3PM and check-out is 11AM
Wind – at 1000’ elevation there is always a soft breeze in the summer.  There are some nights during the year that can get quite windy, so if the sound of wind bothers your sleep, we suggest you consider using ear plugs if you are here during those times.
Non-functional Intercom system - the old intercom system hasn't worked for a decade and is disconnected.
No garbage disposal, so please dispose of food in the garbage
description.house_rules: You will have full access to the yard but please touch the horses and don’t enter the fenced off fields or the barns.  If you want to visit with the horses, please let us know and we will escort you.  This is for your safety and theirs. Because our residence is a farm and the apartment has stairs, two adults are only allowed.  No one under 21 including infants. Thank you.

name: Historic Renovated One Bedroom Cabin
title: Hamilton, Virginia

gallery.caption: Enjoy your privacy while connecting with nature
Original portion of cabin was built in 1740.
Kitchen with fridge, oven, and sink.

recent.comments:
We loved our stay in this peaceful cabin away from the hustle and bustle. The farm was the perfect place we were looking for from the lavender field across the way, sunrise coffee in the morning and firefly evenings. The chicken coop and the cute groundhogs only added to the charm. We were super envious of the garden on the property and recognized the amount of work to keep it going. Mona was proactive, responsive, and thoughtful in all communications, ensuring everything was clear. We look forward to staying with Mona in the future and highly recommend
the cabin for a singles or romantic getaway!

items.comments:
We loved our stay in this peaceful cabin away from the hustle and bustle. The farm was the perfect place we were looking for from the lavender field across the way, sunrise coffee in the morning and firefly evenings. The chicken coop and the cute groundhogs only added to the charm. We were super envious of the garden on the property and recognized the amount of work to keep it going. Mona was proactive, responsive, and thoughtful in all communications, ensuring everything was clear. We look forward to staying with Mona in the future and highly recommend
the cabin for a singles or romantic getaway!
Super private and cozy cabin with an amazing layout.

We were greeted just after 3pm on a wet & overcast day by the call of a barred owl from the trees by the cabin. Later in the evening we heard several, across the trees that skirt part that part of the property. Birdsong filled the air on the next morning, which was sunny and warm; we saw a fox running across the grass in front of the cabin being chased by a crow. A half dozen woodpeckers were drilling in the woods. On our left was undulating pasture land, including some curious goats. On our right behind the cabin was the small chicken coop. Occasionally, one heard a cow from the next property. The ancient cabin has been  nicely renovated while preserving its old character. Atmospheric, rustic yet very comfortable, and a thoughtful touch was a pack of fresh farm eggs in the fridge. If you are over 6ft tall you may  have to bend your neck just a bit; it is a cabin, after all. I am 5'9" so I was fine.
Gorgeous views and a quiet escape. Perfect for a weekend! Loved sitting on the porch and watching the sunset!
The place was great! Just as described. The animals were fun! Lots of wildlife.

I rented this for my parents who needed a much needed getaway and were coming to some breweries in bluemont for my birthday.  Mona was very communicative and helpful, my parents loved the property and walking the grounds.  Such a wonderful stay and place - we want to rent the manor house as a family next !

An idyllic farmhouse tucked way back in the property with lovely views from the porch. We enjoyed sitting outside for morning coffee with the roosters and wine in the evening with the deer. The cabin was so cozy and clean; simply and tastefully furnished. The beautiful tiled shower was big enough for two and had an endless supply of hot water. The king bed was a bit firm but there were plenty of pillows and blankets to make it very comfortable. Mona is a terrific host who answered all of our questions before we booked and provided our check-in instructions so we could arrive at our leisure. The question is always, would you stay again, and my answer is “definitely yes!”

description.summary:
Welcome to the Peugh Patent House, located on a private 150 acre equestrian family farm in Hamilton, Virginia. 
Originally built in 1740, enjoy all the modern day amenities while staying in this romantic property. Enjoy the rolling hills, hiking, fishing in the stocked ponds, and breathtaking views. Spend time with our horses, goats, turkey, chicken and peacocks. We are an hour to DC, 10 min to Leesburg and 5 min to Purcellville.

Can be combined with https://www.airbnb.com/h/historicmanor
description.space: Guests will have private access to the entire cabin. Guests are not to enter the other buildings or homes on the property. The caretaker is on the property. Guests will communicate with owner via text.
description.access: Cabin includes foyer, kitchen, living room, full bathroom and spacious bedroom.
description.notes:
This cabin is on 150 acres of private property. There are animals and wildlife on the farm. The cabin is kept clean, and we do our best to keep the outside out! 

We do have cameras on the property. None inside the cabin. Only the guests on the reservation may enter the property. No extra guests, parties, or friends visiting permitted. Also note that Loudoun County has an 11pm noise ordinance.
description.neighborhood: Entire farm is a fenced, gated property. It is tucked away in a quint neighborhood. We are 5 minutes to Purcellville, 10 minutes to Leesburg. Easy to access Middleburg or Washington, DC. In the heart of the second largest collection of wineries in the country.
description.interaction: Host is available via text.
description.house_rules: We request no shoes in the house. Stay out of animals sheds and paddocks. Do not enter any body of water.

name: 'Anny's Farm House' in Round Hill Wine Country!
title: Round Hill, Virginia

gallery.caption: Round Hill Vacation Rental | 4BR | 2BA | 2,200 Sq Ft | 1 Step for Entry
Living Room | Central Heating & A/C | Free WiFi
Bedroom 1 | Queen Bed | 2nd Floor | Linens Provided
Property Exterior | Built in 1800s | Part of a 54-acre Farm

hosts.about:
Hi! We’re Evolve, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.

recent.comments: This was a lovely house in a beautiful setting!

items.comments: This was a lovely house in a beautiful setting!
Amazing house!!

Absolutely gorgeous! We adored staying at Anny’s farmhouse! Steve is just a fantastic and friendly host. He showed us around the house, and made us feel right at home. The farmhouse was spotless and stunning! We didn’t want to leave! The peaceful setting and incredible views are fantastic. We cannot wait to stay here again. The perfect place for a relaxing stay, yet close to Middleburg and Purcellville for delicious restaurants and things to do. We will be back!

The house looked just like the photos. It was a peaceful location that was close to our son’s wedding venue. The host was responsive and helpful. We also had fresh eggs from his farm.  I highly recommend.

We had a wonderful time in a beautiful house. Steve, the owner greeted us and gave us a nice tour of the home.  He was friendly and we checked in early as the home was ready. We appreciated his flexibility as we had to get ready for the rehearsal dinner as my son was getting married the following day. 
The pictures are very accurate and the setting is beautiful!  We wish that we could have spent more time at the home.  
Would definitely recommend a stay at Steve’s home.
Beautiful farm house with morning views of horses and evening views of so many stars! Host was great. House is so comfortable. Highly recommend.

Loved the place! The house worked perfectly for our family of 10 while we were in the area for a wedding. Spacious and comfortable and perfect for the kiddos! Quiet and picturesque. Really helped a long weekend run smoothly!

description.summary: Embrace the peace, quiet, and tranquility of the rolling Central Virginia hills when you stay at this 4-bedroom, 2-bathroom vacation rental built in the late 19th Century. Remodeled with elegance and charm, 'Anny's Farm House' is located on the 54-acre Fox Tail Farm and caters to guests seeking a peaceful and harmonious getaway with all the modern comforts of home. Spend your days hiking the Blue Ridge Mountains, touring nearby wineries, or exploring the stunning surrounding area of Round Hill.
description.space:
Close to Wineries | 54-Acre Farm | Countryside Views

Bedroom 1: Queen Bed | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed | Bedroom 3: Queen Bed | Bedroom 4: Queen Bed | Additional Sleeping: Pack ‘n Play (Available Upon Request)

OUTDOOR LIVING: Covered back porch, seating area, dining space, 2-horse paddock (w/ fee)

PARKING: Gravel driveway (3 vehicles)
description.neighborhood:
WINERIES & BREWERIES: Red Vineyard (6.8 miles), Endhardt Vineyards (7.2 miles), Bluemont Vineyard (7.5 miles), Dirt Farm Brewing (7.8 miles), Slater Run Vineyards (8.1 miles), Lost Barrel Brewing (9.7 miles)

description.interaction: Evolve makes it easy to find and book properties you’ll never want to leave. You can relax knowing that our properties will always be ready for you and that we’ll answer the phone 24/7. Even better, if anything is off about your stay, we’ll make it right. description.summary: Our historic Farm is nestled in 700 acres of the Piedmont foothills. Your Farm Stay, in the stunning 1780s Manor home, lets you experience life on a working cattle operation. The home is decorated with period antiques, yet all modern comforts await you. Stroll the gardens, fields & forests. Fish in your private ponds. During your Private Farm Tour we'll meet the Wagyu and 4-wheel to the mountain top to enjoy the incredible views.  Private Wagyu dinner avail. Wineries all around!  Stable avail.
description.space:
Located on 700 acres in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains, our farm is steeped in Virginia history, predating the Civil War. The stunning Manor home, which was built in the late 1700's with additions added in the 1800's and renovated in 2014, has been lovingly and painstakingly preserved.  Although the Farm is the most photographed and painted farm in the County and has been featured in many articles & on garden tours, until now, the home has never offered FarmTour & Stay.   
To embrace its historic character, this magnificent home has been decorated with period antiques, yet includes all modern comforts. Each bedroom has its own theme and unique decor - from the Fox Room to the Blue Room.  The Master Bedroom's Turkish rugs and its adjoining master bath decorated with a wall-sized Turkish mosaic, provides a comfortable, quiet place to rejuvenate.  Take tea in the parlor and loosen up your rusty-fingers on the Steinway baby grand.  Relax or jump on the computer in the Reading Room paneled in original cherrywood harvested from the property.  Whether you're sipping a fine Virginia bourbon in the Cherry Room circa 1830, enjoying a gourmet meal on the 16-person dining table circa mid-1700's, or chilling with a movie in the modern basement theatre on comfortable, plush sofas,  you will feel comfortable and immersed  in a history few will ever have the opportunity to experience. 
Once you're settled in, we'll take you on your Private Farm Tour to see our farm operations,  meet our friendly Wagyu cattle, and 4-wheel to the top of the mountain to talk about the farm and our husbandry practices, while enjoying the most memorable views in the area. 
After the tour, you're off to explore.  Right in your backyard is the stone house where George Washington passed thru while surveying nearby land in 1769. You may prefer to fish in the 6 ponds on the property that await your prize-winning catch (& release) or hike through the vast pastures & forests. For the cowfolks, join us to feed the cattle and tend to the barn animals. Come evening, enjoy the beautiful outdoor terrace with a glass of local Virginia wine while watching the sunset over the Blue Ridge mountains.  Weather & season permitting, the full-size pool, cabana, bathhouse, basketball courts, and gourmet outdoor kitchen with Italian brick oven is available for your use.
The home's six bedrooms and 6.5 bathrooms  accommodates several couples or a large family easily.  
The Farm is close to Great Meadows for the Gold Cup, restaurants and shopping in Upperville, Marshall, and Middleburg, endless hiking trails, including the Appalachian Trail, and more wineries than you could visit in a week. During your Farm Stay, we can arrange a Private Gourmet Wagyu Dinner with one of our Resident Chefs.  You may never want to leave and we'll count the days 'til your return! 
Note: In order to ensure your safety and that of our animals, only the guests on your registered Farm Stay may stay and/or enjoy the amenities on the Farm during your Farm Stay.
description.notes: Stables and parking available.
description.neighborhood: Farms, wineries, forests... it doesn't get any better.
description.interaction: We will receive our guests when they arrive to show them around,  look over the rules and accessible areas, and confirm the scheduled Farm Tour.  Guests are welcome to spend time feeding with us on the morning after their arrival and will have lots of opportunities to enjoy a bunch or a little of Life on The Farm Stay.  We will be available and working on-site during your stay, so please reach out when you have any questions.
description.house_rules:
This property is an actual farm.  There will be farm operations going on as daily operations. During your Private Farm Tour, we will ask that you complete our Agritourism waiver form, available ahead of time by email.  
ATTENTION:  Under Virginia law, there is no liability for an injury to or death of a participant in an agritourism activity conducted at this agritourism location if such injury or death results from the inherent risks of the agritourism activity. Inherent risks of agritourism activities include, among others, risks of injury inherent to land, equipment, and animals, as well as the potential for you to act in a negligent manner that may contribute to your injury or death. You are assuming the risk of participating in this agritourism activity.

description.summary: Welcome to Doah House, your sanctuary nestled on a bluff atop Blue Mountain, just 30 min from Shenandoah National Park. This Scandinavian cabin on a private 4-acre retreat provides unforgettable views and wildlife. Unwind in a wood-fired hot tub, by a cozy fire, or explore nearby trails and wineries. Perfect for rest, rejuvenation, and reconnection.
description.space:
Disconnect to reconnect with nature and yourself at this unforgettable escape.

A few things we love:
• Soak in your private wood fired hot tub amongst the trees
• Step out of bed onto the deck. The hidden sleeping area features a queen bed and sliding glass doors, making it easy to wake up with nature
• Tuck away in the upstairs loft where a comfy queen bed and secret lookout window create the classic forest hideout experience⁠
• The spa-like bathroom features a rain shower, heated moroccan tile floors, and a floor to ceiling window to soak in the morning light
• Stretch out by the  fireplace as the sun sets, enjoying the surrounding mountain view from an expansive 16’ of sliding glass doors
• Prepare meals in the well-stocked kitchen with high end cookware, new appliances and heated kitchen floors (and perhaps a bottle of wine from a nearby vineyard)
• Practice yoga or enjoy a picnic on the expansive wrap-around outdoor deck
• Sit around the outdoor solo stove fire pit
• Disconnect with curated board games and books in your own  private library
• Enjoy the surrounding state parks, award-winning wineries, and top rated restaurants
• Hike the nearby Appalachian Trail
• Option to get groceries and take-out delivered on-demand
• Watch the wildlife: Foxes, woodpeckers, and hawks are common visitors
• Browse with blazing fast internet
description.access:
The only way to get mountain top views is to get to the top of the mountain. 
• Expect at least 10 minutes on a long, unpaved, sometimes bumpy 1 mile gravel road
• A few steep sections require caution
• The road is routinely and professionally maintained by the county, especially during severe weather
• However, from November to April, we strongly advise that you use a four-wheel drive (4WD) or all-wheel drive (AWD) vehicle
• While there are plenty of dry weekends during those months where a regular vehicle would be fine, you cannot know that in advance. 
• The rest of the year, regular 2WD vehicles (front or rear) are fine. Even vehicles with below-average ground clearances like VW GTIs and Volvo C30s have had no problems. 
• We provide a level parking spot for 2 vehicles
description.notes:
By completing this online reservation you are confirming that you read and agreed to the guide and rules. 

Bugs
Being in the woods means there is a chance for bugs in and outside the property. However, an exterminator routinely treats the area around the house to reduce the chance of guests meeting unwelcome guests. 

Children
The house is child friendly, but not child proofed. Please watch your kids.
 
Trash
Keep all trash inside the house to avoid unexpected encounters with wild animals, like bears, foxes, raccoons, etc.

Weather
In the winter, please check the weather before you go so that if you do get snowed in, you are covered with the necessities.

Heating
The wood stove is the most effective way to heat when temps drop below freezing, but supplemental heating sources include a mini split heat pump, radiant floor heating and a plug-in electric heater.
description.neighborhood: Private and secluded. Within short driving distance to Shenandoah National Park, the Appalachian Trail, and excellent wineries and restaurants.
description.transit: Please note that due to the mountain drive, it takes around 30 minutes to get into towns like Front Royal or Winchester. Feel free to walk the neighborhood but for more scenic hikes, we recommend specific ones that are best reached by car, e.g. Appalachian Trail (20 min), Sky Meadows (23 min) and others.
description.interaction: Available via text or phone
description.house_rules:
Dog-Friendly Stay: We welcome well-behaved, house-trained dogs. We kindly request you keep your furry friends off the furniture and ensure they're accompanied at all times. Please note, dogs are not allowed to sleep on the beds.

Winter Rescheduling Assurance: For stays between December and March, rest assured that if inclement weather, such as snow or ice, prevents access to the property, we will gladly assist you in rescheduling or provide a refund.

Hot Tub Enjoyment: Our hot tub is here for your enjoyment. Please ensure your safety by using it responsibly.

Guest Count Policy: Please note, the property comfortably accommodates up to 4 guests. Additional guests will incur a charge of $50 per person per night. To ensure a pleasant stay for all, we may need to terminate your stay without a refund if the maximum occupancy is exceeded.

Safety First: To ensure your safety and prevent potential fire hazards, we kindly request no candles in the property. 

Wildlife Respect: To keep our local wildlife safe and to avoid any surprise encounters, please help us by keeping all trash inside the house.

hosts.about:
Yocencia and I love to hike, bike and kayak especially around Shepherdstown and covington.    We love weekend outings around town and relaxing at Lost Dog coffee shop with my dirty chai tea.
I am an outdoorsman, old farm kid, and love woodworking.

We have an OutBack Bimodal backup solar solution on our main home and I have been working for nearly a decade designing and installing solar of all types.

Love a good book and glass of wine while relaxing by the river, or kayaking and watching the birds on the river.

My husband, Richard, and I love hosting.   We love the Shepherdstown area and vibe and the seclusion of our stone house.  We like to travel with AirBnB and sharing experiences, so it is a natural fit to share our space.   

We were interested in tiny homes so Richard rebuilt the 1940s fishing cottage as a tiny house using materials onsite and repurposing.  We hope you enjoy the homes.

Tag us for photos of your stay with us:  tweet @ButchDeal or Instagram @butch.deal

recent.comments: I loved the location both to the river and to the town. Great sense of privacy and surrounded in history.

items.comments: I loved the location both to the river and to the town. Great sense of privacy and surrounded in history.
A perfect, cozy getaway from the city. We loved relaxing by the riverfront after a long day visiting nearby Harper’s Ferry.

Super great host! Let us check in a bit early. Answered in a timely manner. Only downside was the bathroom light wasn’t working and at night that made the outside bathhouse a bit scary. But SO WORTH THE MONEY. I will 100% go again!

Our stay was all we could ask for. She described it thoroughly so we knew exactly what to expect. No surprises. Simple living, long weekend with no TV, just great view of the Potomac, nice walk in Shepherdstown and along the Canal, dinner at Blue Moon! Caught no fish but had fun canoeing up the river and floating back down. It was a good idea to have that stairway down to the river... very helpful!  Almost lost my shoes in the silt beds on the shoreline but figured how to work around  it.  thanks Yo !

This is a beautiful tiny home. The view of the river was spectacular. The inside of the tiny home was cozy and had all the amenities needed for our stay. The air conditioning was a nice touch, as well as, the air purifier. I would recommend adding a couple sharp knives or bringing your own along. We cooked out on the grill supplied and made steaks and they were a little tough to cut with the butter knives. There was some tea, coffee, spices and oils to cook with. We left behind some spices and microwaveable popcorn for the next guests. My only negative comment about the location is it was listed as “secluded.” I went outside to take a shower and as I was walking back to the house I could see the hosts in their yard next door. So, if I can see you then you can see me and that is not secluded to me. So, I felt that part was a bit misleading in the description of the property. Otherwise, it’s a quiet place with beautiful views and a lovely little town to visit and explore.
secluded, peaceful,  exactly we needed in the hustle and bustle of life. thank you for sharing your place. we will definitely ba back!

Beautifully placed tiny house in a fully enriched historical location. The property is gorgeous, from mountain top to river side. We loved it!! Be sure to bring plenty of bug spray, you’ll need it, from outside to inside, and especially for the outhouse(the spiders are insane and not afraid to mess with humans lol)  also come with ALOT of water, for drinking and hand/face washing. Over all we had a great stay, and would recommend to others if youre into the off grid type stay.  Yocencia is an amazing host, answers quickly and is super friendly.

description.summary: Relax and escape to the peace and quiet by the Potomac river, and wake to beautiful romantic views of the river and mountains, in this romantic 200 square foot tiny house situated on 2.5 acres, 450 feet of river front land.  Explore and partake of all the activities on the river and surrounding area, just 1 mile from Shepherdstown.  Fish, bike, kayak, tube, or just sit by the river and watch the birds and wild life.  Read by the river or in the quiet comfort of the house, w/ some wine on us.
description.space:
This is a 1940s refurbished fisherman's cabin.  It was likely built in or about 1942 as the original electric fixtures are from that date, we had to modernize them though as they don't meet current code.   It is very likely that the structure was built to replace an older wooden structure in the same location.   There is electricity but no running water, water dispenser is provided. 
NOTE that the bathroom is a pit outhouse located nearby.

On the west side of the 200square foot room, you will find a comfortable Queen sized bed with CertiPUR foam mattress and lots of pillows.  There are several blankets.   At the foot is a WWII mail crate restored and converted to a trunk that was found in the tiny house, used to store extra linens and blankets.   Above the headboard is a fantastic decorative shelf made from river maple that fell by the river in front of the building.   Right in front of the bed is a window affording great views of the river.

On the east side of the building is the sitting area with kitchen cabinets.    The counter is made from old reclaimed barn door complete with the clasp.   The shelves above are from the from of the barn door complete with hinges.   Equipped with utensils, a microwave, dorm fridge, and crock water dispenser.   A table for two in front of another river facing window.

Outside is a small porch with two comfortable chairs and BBQ, that has a commanding view of the river.   The cabin and this sitting area are nestled back into the wooded hillside loved by a plethora of songbirds and woodpeckers.  
To the East of the porch is a small three seasons outdoor shower and sink.  The shower is fed by cold water but has a 5.5 gallon solar warming tank attached (it is in tree shade so the showers will be cold).  NOTE that we will be shutting off the outdoor shower before the first frost and back on after last frost.

Home sits on 2.5 acres adjacent to the Potomac river with C&O national historical park across the river.  This section of the river is usually shallow and often can be walked across, near Packhorse Ford.   Between the property and Shepherdstown is the historic battlefield of Shepherdstown with walking path and markers.

Nestled to the other side of the tiny house is the very clean and comfortable pit toilet (out house).   It is in the original location but all rebuilt with modern seat and plenty of privacy, well vented and stocked with hand sanitizer.

Full access to all living spaces, parking area, all yard areas.

Free WiFi, but no TV
heat

description.notes: If you love nature or history, there are great many things to see and do in and around Shepherdstown, including hiking, kayaking on the Shenandoah and Potomac rivers, fish in the rivers, tour historic Shepherdstown, Harpers ferry, Sharpsburg, Antietam battlefield. Enjoy several local fantastic restaurants.
description.neighborhood:
The home is a short bike ride or drive to historic downtown Shepherdstown. You will go by some historic ruins and Shepherdstown Battlefield, on the way by Packhorse Ford.   
Close to NCTC, Antietam, C&O canal and Harpers Ferry.
description.transit:
The home is a short bike, kayak, or drive to historic Shepherdstown.  You can view the battlefield of Shepherdstown and old cement/grist mill ruins on the way.
Harpers Ferry, NCTC, and Antietam battlefield are short drives away.

Many guests have enjoyed renting bikes in town and riding on the C&O canal towpath. Contact Pedal and Paddle for more info on outdoor activities.
description.interaction: This is a private self-serve house. Owner will be available, via cell phone, for check in and check out, and any questions. Otherwise this space is yours to enjoy.
description.house_rules:

Please no trash or feminine hygiene products in the pit.
This cabin is nestled in the woods so there will be wild life and insects around the property.  Park on the gravel spot, do not drive on the lawn.     Guests must agree to Jefferson county Health department regulations for Covid-19 orders.
