hosts.about:
I moved to Harpers Ferry six years ago, together with my partner, Juan. We are both professional artists. We fell in love with our 1 1/2 acre property right in the heart of historic Harper’s Ferry and wanted to do something with the land besides building houses on it, so we started our lavender farm four years ago. We really love hiking, biking on the towpath, and walking in town. 

When Covid 19 hit, we temporarily changed our focus from art shows to hosting on our small lavender farm. It has been such a success and pleasure, that we just opened our sister property down the street! 

The Trouvaille House was built in 1837 and we updated it to create four luxury suites! A trouvaille is a treasure or lucky find, and we certainly feel that way about it.

 We have a welcoming committee at La Soledad waiting to greet you! Busta and Blu are two energetic, goofy puppies that play outside daily. Romeo is our very friendly cat that keeps an eye on them!

recent.comments: Such an amazing air bnb and in the perfect location! Will definitely be coming back again!

items.comments: Such an amazing air bnb and in the perfect location! Will definitely be coming back again!

As I pulled into the driveway of this beautiful place, I couldn’t stop smiling. From the charm of the lavender, to the friendliness of the two sweet dogs who may greet you, to the peaceful view  - it was a warm welcome. Christie is a gracious and thoughtful host who showed me the apartment layout and shared personalized suggestions for where to eat, hike, and meander while in Harper’s Ferry. She has thought of everything to make one feel comfortably at home and the space itself is inviting and well designed. I intended a peaceful getaway from the noise and pace of DC and I received that and more. Highly recommend this charming stay.

An outstanding space and perfect for our anniversary weekend getaway!! We loved the apartment and Christie and Juan were so welcoming and friendly. Their restaurant and hiking recommendations were excellent - we enjoyed all of the things we could get to and hope to be back to do more!!  When we do we’ll be staying here again.  Highly recommend!!! Thanks, Christie & Juan!

We had a great time at the Lavender Farm! Christie was very responsive for any our needs and appreciate the welcome party (Blue and Busta)! The dogs were always a delight to see and play with. The neighborhood had great restaurants and walkable to the national park. Thank you for hosting us for our mini moon! We hope to come visit again soon!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Christie’s place. The loft apartment was beautifully appointed and well located. We were within walking distance of several restaurants, coffee shops, and an event barn with live music and cocktails. Christie and Juan are friendly hosts. We will be back!
great space and good location. love Harpers ferry and everything is just right down hill.  would stay again.
Christie and her venue were both wonderful. She was extremely helpful with recommendations for things to do in the area.

description.summary: Brand open space guesthouse with private entrance over a detached barn style garage. Situated between our lavender field and view of Potomac River in historic Harper’s Ferry. Walking distance to lower town Harper’s Ferry and Harpers Ferry Historic National Park.
description.space: Brand new French country style open concept space (with private bathroom), soaring ceiling and spectacular views all around. Hardwood floors, marble bathroom. Queen size bed, sofa, smart tv, electric fireplace, dining area and full kitchen all in one light filled space with beautiful views from all four sides!
description.access: Entire apartment with private entrance. Completely detached from main house. Shared use of fire pit overlooking the river (watch the sunset over the mountains!), outdoor dining gazebo (bring a picnic!) and grounds of lavender farm (the scent is wonderful!)
description.notes: We have plenty of parking on our property (it is very scarce in this historic town!) You can leave your car here and walk to local restaurants, the park museums and shops, or go hiking or cycling. Electric bike rentals are available. There are hills and a few uneven sidewalks.
description.neighborhood: We are on 1 1/2 riverfront acres within the limits of the historic town of Harpers Ferry. It is exactly a one mile walk to the convergence of the Potomac and Shenandoah Rivers, as well as the Appalachian Trail! (The distance listed below is incorrect.) You do not need a car to go to wonderful local restaurants and coffee shops. There is plenty Civil War history here and lots to see and learn at the Harpers Ferry National Historical Park. We have three different rafting companies in town, and two rivers to raft, or just float on inner tubes! The Appalachian Trail Conservancy is just down the street, and the trail comes right through town. If you are into something a little more relaxed, we are surrounded by many local wineries and breweries just a short distance away!
description.transit: Most things here are within walking distance. Be aware that we are in a town with some hills, so wear comfortable shoes. You will need a car to go to the grocery store. We have several within just a few miles. There are limited paid parking spots within the small town if you are not into walking the short walk down. We have plenty of parking available here at La Soledad.
description.interaction: We are often outside working or enjoying our property, and love to share with guests. Texts and phone calls with questions are fine.
description.house_rules:
Light cooking only, no oil frying etc. Cuisinart mini oven / air fryer, microwave, hotplate, and full size refrigerator provided. Outdoor grill and eating area strongly encouraged!

We have a no-open-flame policy in the unit. Please, no candles indoors.

Please run dishwasher before leaving on the “Sanitize” setting.

We strongly recommend to leave shoes just inside the front door because of the pandemic.

name: The Log House at Sugarloaf Mountain MD
title: Dickerson, Maryland

gallery.caption: Outdoor seating and fire on deck
Master suite - King bed, first floor
Upstairs Suite 1. King bed, full bath.
Upstairs Suite 2. King Bed + 1 twin- Full bath
Huge grand room with gas fire and TV.
Double oven and 6 burner cook top
Master Bedroom - direct access to deck
Basement Bedroom 5: 1 King bed. 1 bunk bed.
Basement bedroom 4 - with full bath. 1 king 3 twins
Game room: Arcade with 1000 games, board games table, shuffleboard, foosball table, UHD Direct TV.
Game room: Arcade with 1000 games, board games table, shuffleboard, foosball table, UHD Direct TV.

1 mile from Sugarloaf Vineyard. 
Several other vineyards in the area, see guidebook.

hosts.about:
We are highly experienced hosts with over a dozen properties. We strive to ensure that all our guests have a wonderful experience. All of our properties are comfortable, well decorated, and located in the most desirable areas of Atlanta. 
We also offer rental cars and can have them waiting at the property for you.

InTownLiving dot us

recent.comments: This house is more beautiful than it’s pictures. Very quiet and peaceful. Lots of space to hang out and plenty of games to play with family and friends. Host was very friendly and responsive. House was very clean and well organized. Definitely will book again. We already recommended this house to our family and friends.

items.comments: This house is more beautiful than it’s pictures. Very quiet and peaceful. Lots of space to hang out and plenty of games to play with family and friends. Host was very friendly and responsive. House was very clean and well organized. Definitely will book again. We already recommended this house to our family and friends.

Huge house for a huge group! Very classy rooms and decorations, and games and things to do galore! Like others and the host mentioned, the internet situation is rough, but not a big deal for us. 

We all had plenty to do for the weekend playing disc golf, ping pong, ski ball, etc.
This house is an ideal place for larger groups to get together.  Everything was as described. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely recommend to friends.

We had four families and one set of grandparents here for four nights and it was perfect. Huge game room downstairs with shuffleboard, arcade games, nintendo, skee ball, etc, plus a pool table and ping pong table outside, as well as frisbee golf "holes" and a cornhole set. Bedrooms all had great bathrooms. Kitchen was massive and great for prepping big meals.

Beyond the house, it's only a few minutes walk on a beautiful gravel road to the well-marked and manicured trails on Sugarloaf. There's a great winery about a five minute drive away. We did a float trip on the Monacacy for half a day. And there's Frederick, MD about 20 minutes by car with a fun downtown.

Great stay!

We had a great time at Stewart's place.

We wanted to visit Harpers Ferry and the house location was convenient. Although we ended up not going out because of the storm, there's a lot to do in house and we really enjoyed using the kitchen and the game room. 

Stewart provides clear instructions to check-in and is very responsive. The property manger was in the driveway the morning we checked out and asked for feedback as well.

We had a group of 10 in town for a lacrosse tournament and could not have asked for a better house to spend our evenings recovering from the day.  The tournament didn’t go so well but the house and all it offered saved the trip. Our 16 year old boys had plenty of room in the bunk house and more than they could handle in the game room.  Highlight was a father son shuffleboard tournament that went well into the night. The room upstairs are super comfortable and spacious. We were able to cook multiple meals in the excellent kitchen and enjoy our dinners on the deck overlooking the woods. The house is surrounded by trails, so whether it’s running or hiking, there are plenty of miles to get your steps in. I highly recommend this house and would certainly return.

We stayed here for a co-ed bachelor party and it was amazing! Spent great time at the house, made amazing meals, and went to the winery down the road. We also got crabs from Buckeystown Pub, which really rounded out the weekend. Highly recommend for a large group of friends.

description.summary:
Escape the crowded city!   

This luxury log home is an off-grid eco solar house, and is perfect for your next corporate retreat, or family getaway. It is very private in a heavily wooded area with beautiful forest views. The home is located at the base of Sugarloaf Mountain, and is walking distance to hiking trails.
Pricing varies based on dates and length of stay. 
*Note: We do not allow large events at this property. The house septic and parking can't accommodate more than 25 guests.
description.space:
This eco solar powered home is off grid and features high end finishes, a large chef's kitchen, and a grand room with vaulted ceilings. Our back up generator will prevent guests from ever losing power.

The home is located at the base of Sugarloaf Mountain, and is about a mile from Strong Mansion and Sugarloaf Mountain vineyard.  It's perfect for yoga, golf, and other hobby retreats, as well as lodging for wedding parties. 

Bedroom Breakdown:
5 total bedrooms that sleep 17 in beds. 
Ground Floor: Master-King
Second floor: BR2-King+twin,  BR3-King+twin
Basement: BR1- 1 king and 3 twins,  BR2- 1 king+2 twins (bunk-bed).  
All bedrooms have a full bath.  
If you need additional space, you can also rent the studio apartment above the garage. Airbnb listing 41642631. This apartment is totally separate and can be rented by others. 

Some other features include: High end chef's kitchen & butlers pantry, heated floors, 900sf deck, 3 gas fire places, 2 UHD TVs, Free Wifi, game room with lots of games, Washer/dryer, custom furniture and hotel quality bedding. 

**Things to Note: We do not allow large events, or hosting additional guests at this property without previous approval. The house utilities can't accommodate more than 25 guests.

Wifi is fast thanks to Starlink. So wifi phone calls (smartphone) work well. Cell calls can sometimes drop.

In the event of snow or ice, the back deck will be closed for safety reasons. But we have a large covered patio under the deck that is always available.

If you smoke anything inside the house you will lose your security deposit. 
This is a cabin in the woods, so despite our best efforts, you may see insects.

Lastly, this home is off-grid, which means we produce and store all our energy.  We are also on well and septic.  Energy is not unlimited, therefore summer thermostats are set at 74 and winter at 70.  We appreciate any energy saving efforts, such as turning off items not being used, keeping showers short, running appliances (washer, DW) early in the day time, and closing windows.
description.access: Guests will have access to the entire property
description.neighborhood: Sugarloaf Mountain is a primarily undeveloped area of west Maryland that offers quiet scenic hiking, nice restaurants and local wineries and golf courses.
description.transit:
It's recommended that you have a car in this area, but Uber/Lyft can also be an option. 
4WD car in the winter time as we do get snow occasionally.
description.interaction: We do contact-less check-ins. But we are available via phone if guests need assistance.

name: Frolic Fields: A Mystical Retreat On A Woodsy Farm
title: Accokeek, Maryland

hosts.about: I am from DC by way of Brooklyn by way of Virginia by way of Mars. And Tim is a DC native who escaped to the woods of Alaska for a while and decided to come back because Mina wasn’t there.  We like to sing and paint and play.  We are easy going and pretty fuckin awesome!

recent.comments: Absolutely wonderful, creative, artistic space, surrounded by nature and animals was the perfect getaway. Had a little issue with working the projector, but how often can we depend on technology to always function right? My lady and I had a great time listening to music on the Bluetooth speaker and playing cards in outside in the covered deck. Feeding the goats and sheep was great. First time evening touching a goat and sheep. We had fun.

items.comments: Absolutely wonderful, creative, artistic space, surrounded by nature and animals was the perfect getaway. Had a little issue with working the projector, but how often can we depend on technology to always function right? My lady and I had a great time listening to music on the Bluetooth speaker and playing cards in outside in the covered deck. Feeding the goats and sheep was great. First time evening touching a goat and sheep. We had fun.

This place is a real gem for those who're looking for a peaceful rest spot away from the city noise! Farm is absolutely fantastic, kids were so happy with theire friendship with all animal stuff living there! Mina is very communicative and friendly, she shared with us fresh eggs from the chickens and some greens from her garden. Thanks for welcoming us and certainly would love to come back!
Had a great time. Lots of family games and fun. Would recommend for anyone looking for a place to relax.
This place was such a great find. Highly recommended!

Our family had a beautiful stay at this beautiful home!  We spent a lot of time in DC but knew we wanted a place to relax at after walking around with 3 children for most of the day. This was just the place!  Our 13 year old loved the variety of instruments to play (and it kept him off his phone!). Our 11 year old connected with the chickens and goats-feeding them and watching them roam freely. Our 5 year old loves all of the beautiful artwork and quickly made his own. My husband and I loved the quiet walks and peaceful surroundings. Thank you so much!

I booked this location for the weekend and had my baby shower as well! It was so lovely and spacious to accommodate guests! I loved the animals, everyone was very thrilled with the free roaming chickens. The lights strung up in the place made it great for minimal needed decorating. I am very happy with my full stay as well as my showers turn out. Thank you to Mina and Tim for allowing me to host it there. The home is very welcoming and you can feel a lot of intentioned love in it!

Loved the location.  Great for guys with bass boats to come back to after a long days worth of bass fishing on the Potomac River.  Never felt worried about having our stuff that we left in our boats messed with while we were sleeping.  And the lighting in all of the rooms and outside made it super cool when it got dark outside!

description.summary:
Easily escape to the woods on a 14 acre homestead that's only 20 miles from DC. 

Surrounded by the forest with amazing views, designed by artists, this secluded hideaway is a celebration of Nature and Art.

Recharge amongst these ancient trees and all the singing critters that soundtrack the night. 

Enjoy a fire, frolic in the fields, read on a hammock, strum a guitar, and feel the pressure of modern life melt away. 

Explore the many bucolic trails nearby.

Perfect for retreats and workshops.
description.space:
A woodsy home that's equal parts log cabin and modernist architecture. A working collage of creative approaches to home decor. Ultimately the feel is warm and pure Bohemia, from the unique art, antiques, plants, and lighting, to the musical instruments and the soul nourishing books throughout. 

This space is everything you thought you'd have to travel the world to find.
description.access:
Guests get the entire house and surrounding areas to themselves with freedom to explore everywhere else.

We visit the fields during the day to check on the animals and the garden. We’re also in the neighborhood if you have special needs during your stay.

The property has many areas: gardens, chicken coups, hammocks, ponds, creeks, fire circles, and glamping structures in the woods. 

You may enjoy all of them.
description.notes:
Please inform us if you have dogs. We are supportive of dog-owners but have had bad experiences in the past with dogs terrorizing our animals. Please only bring your dogs if you are confident in their docility. If you are not sure, we can keep our chickens locked up.


*Want to have a small wedding here?? We had a fully outdoor wedding here this year and would love to help you with yours. We actually offer a small wedding package that includes flowers, tents, tables, chairs, and a really exceptional ordained officiant. Our weddings are for couples that are madly in love and feel overwhelmed by the wedding industry. Our approach celebrates the sacredness of the union and avoids whatever can be avoided about modern weddings. Our pricing reflects this simple heart-of-the-matter approach so reach out if you're curious and like the way we do things around here. :)
description.neighborhood:
Dirt roads and endless woods with river access nearby. 

Shops and civilization are a 10-15 minute drive from the farm. 

Several  bucolic places to take long walks.
description.interaction:
We are in the neighborhood and available for support during your stay. 
No parties or extra guests without prior approval.  It's important to us that everyone here treats the land and animals with respect and uses their time here to connect with Nature.
description.house_rules: NO EXTRA PEOPLE without prior approval. We will find out and keep your security deposit if you try to have a party here.

name: Cottage Escape in Virginia Wine Country
title: Lovettsville, Virginia

gallery.caption: LoeLynn Farms Carriage House- escape to rural Loudoun County, Virginia- where fresh air, wine, artisan goods and delicious food greet you at every turn. The cozy little home is all yours during your stay!
The kitchen has a full sink with filtration system, dishwasher, full oven/stovetop, K-Cup machine and compact size refrigerator/freezer. Not sure if we have something? Send us a message!
The spacious upstairs bedroom offering privacy and serenity
Wine, beer, cocktails, iced tea, lemonade, coffee- we've got you covered with a variety of glassware suitable for every beverage.
LoeLynn Farms has a private 5 acre lake you're welcome to enjoy.
LoeLynn Farms has several historic outbuildings. The barn is certainly worth exploring!
We invite you to stay, relax and enjoy your stay at LoeLynn Farms.
Explore the 5 acre, private lake by kayak; bring your fishing rod; or take an adventurous walk.
The perfect prep counter, serving space or snack bar- spread out in the brand new renovated kitchen equipped with just what you'll need.
Welcome to this bright, fresh and updated carriage house nestled along the Blue Ridge Mountains.
Cook a meal you'll remember. The kitchen has all of your essential utensils and cookware for meals as simple or elevated as you'd like.
Enjoy a morning stroll down the lane while listening to the tunes of nature.
Morning coffee off the deck never looked so peaceful.
You'll find cooking oils, salt, pepper and basic spices to jazz up your meals.

The lower level of the carriage house is an open concept kitchen, living and dining with a front door and back door that leads to a spacious deck. The stairwell takes you to the loft style bedroom and bathroom with large closet for storage.
The back deck is a wonderful place to relax, soak up some sun, stargaze and listen to the sounds of nature.
View from the deck- country vibes as far as the eye can see.
Enjoy a hot cup o' joe anytime.
Closet space next to bed to for easy access
Charging ports provided on both tables for all of our guests.
Enjoy custom created lotions and soaps made by other small businesses.
If you're staying in, we have boardgames as well as Disney+, Netflix, and Hulu!
You're own washer and dryer for your convenience.
We understand work can sometimes follow you, even on vacations.  We have setup a small workstation next to the bedroom for those needing a little heads-down time during their stay.
Office is conveniently located next to the bedroom and closet on the second level.
Bathroom available in the bedroom which offers a stunning skylight to help bring the country sun wherever you are

hosts.about: The Summers family has a love for adventure and spending time together with family and friends.  My wife, Julia, and I recently moved to Lovettsville and have fallen in love with the people, the atmosphere, and of course all the hiking, vineyards and breweries!  You can usually find us with our two kids and two dogs playing outside, working around the farm or having fun around Loudoun County.

recent.comments: The cottage was perfect for my husband  and I, it was just what we needed a peaceful getaway from  busy city life.

items.comments: The cottage was perfect for my husband  and I, it was just what we needed a peaceful getaway from  busy city life.

Was the perfect little cozy cottage . My husband and I really enjoyed the beautiful and serene area . We’ll definitely be going back . Highly recommend for the perfect little get away from every day stress . My husband and I had some much needed reconnection time together .  Thank you so much Dustin

The place was beautiful, clean and exactly what we were looking for. The house and property was gorgeous. Being able to access the lake with the kayaks on the property and fishing was amazing. I highly recommend this house for anyone looking for a relaxing getaway. Dustin was very responsive and a great host. We look forward to coming back again soon.

A beautiful cottage surrounded by nature. I enjoyed waking up to birds and going to bed to the songs of frogs. Dustin was very quick to respond to my messages and even replaced the Keurig when it had an issue!  It was a great getaway from the hustle of work and family back home.

Wow! Such a beautiful  and peaceful home. It was aesthetically pleasing & also so stocked and functional. A helpful binder led us to breweries, wineries, great food, & fun hikes! The kayaks on the property were wonderful to use as well. Dustin was great at checking in & making sure we had everything we needed. I’ve already recommended this spot to my friends and family!🌞

Dustin's place was so beautiful and peaceful. We had a wonderful and relaxing time. Close to wineries and restaurants. Even had a little picnic by the lake, while my husband did some fishing. Thank you again for your hospitality.

This was our second time here and it was absolutely amazing! We actually left the house this time and was able to visit some of the wineries as well as restaurants. One of the new additions from last time we were here was the guide book to tell us about everything in the area and the  book that detailed history of the property. Due to a storm that came thru the internet went out. But we told Dustin and he did what he could try and fix it and offered a credit to compensate for the outage. It was truly okay because we were able to just enjoy each other’s company.  We love our home away from home and plan to return again soon! 
The champagne was great! Thanks again!!

description.summary: Nestled along the Blue Ridge Mountains, LoeLynn Farms is the quiet escape you need. The two story cottage offers two car parking next to the front door, a fully equipped kitchen, outdoor living, lake access and most importantly- peace and relaxation. The Cottage is conveniently located to many wineries, breweries, exceptional restaurants and outdoor adventures. We are just 90 minutes outside of Washington, D.C. in the heart of Loudoun County Wine Country.
description.space: The cozy Queen bed and full bright bathroom are located on the upper level of the cottage overlooking the grounds.  ﻿Stay in for board games and movies, or head out for a hiking adventure or vineyard tour.  Make it a grill-at-home night, or enjoy a meal at one of our favorite farm-to-table restaurants for delicious food and wine.  Take one of our kayaks out, or bring your fishing rod to our private lake stocked full of various types of fish.  Be sure to visit one of the 50 award-winning wineries or over 30 craft breweries in the area while you are here.  Whatever your preference, you are sure to find something to enjoy.﻿
description.access: You will have full access to the Guest House and the field behind the Guest House, which features some short trails around our Silo and up to the barn.  We also allow our guests to wander our farm, and our only ask is that you respect our privacy and don't wander onto "our" side of the farm.  We can provide a map upon request of the grounds if you are interested in exploring.
description.notes:
We welcome you to bring your own fishing gear to use on the lake. Please let us know in advance!

The home is most ideal for two adults. While we have not specifically set up the space for a small child traveler, you are welcome to bring them with your own pack-n-play and necessities.  Also, small, potty-trained animals are welcome.

Note, LoeLynn Farms is an old Farm that was built in 1910 and has gone through a number of hands, some of which neglected sections of the farm until we came to acquire it in 2020.  The majority of your payment helps us restore our farm back to its natural beauty.  However, areas of the farm are in much-needed repair.  Our only ask is that you respect the farm and the old structures, and do not attempt to climb on or scale the structures around the farm.
description.neighborhood: LoeLynn Farms is located in rural Loudoun County, just along the Maryland border. You'll enjoy quiet, fresh air and plenty of stars. You will need a vehicle to get around this part of Loudoun County. We are a short distance from the Potomac River, C&O Canal Towpath, Dulles airport, the MARC train and plenty of historic towns, including Harper's Ferry, WV and Frederick, MD. There really is SO much to do- check out our guidebook for ideas!
description.transit: You'll need a car to get around this area. Most sites and businesses have plenty of free parking.
description.interaction: The Cottage is completely yours when you stay with us- no sharing required! We live across the yard in the main house. Enjoy self check in, and if you need anything, we'll be around!
description.house_rules:
Be mindful of noise after 10 PM.

The First Aid Kit is located in the drawer of the bathroom vanity.

Smoke Detector/Carbon Monoxide Detectors are located in the bedroom and in the Kitchen.

Fire Extinguisher is located under the kitchen sink.

The light switch to the left of the entrance door has two switches on it. The switch on the left controls the outlet that is hooked up to the router, so if you turn that switch off, it will turn off the wifi.

We kindly ask that you not wander onto the main house's yard/porch area, as we do have dogs who like to jump on strangers.  

You're more than welcome to check out the red and stone barn on the property, but for your safety, please do not go into the other outbuildings. 

Do not attempt to climb the silo.

During your wanderings, you may see black garden snakes and other critters that are friendly/skittish and will most likely just run if they see you. While we have not seen any copperheads/rattlesnakes, our neighbors have and they are common to the area and are more aggressive, so if you see one, do not try to pick it up.

If you want to use our Kayaks, please reach out so we can have you sign our Waiver form to do so.

Thanks, and enjoy!

name: 'Waterfront' on 1796 Historic Farm
title: Lovettsville, Virginia

gallery.caption: Guests have access to stone  patio at the main house for relaxing and outdoor dining.

hosts.about: We have been residents of Lovettsville, VA for 8 years.  Dan is a contractor (Winner Construction) specializing in historic rehabilitations.  As an interior designer, Dan and I have worked together to design and sell many historic properties in Maryland.  Once our family started to grow, we spent 2 years looking for an ideal farm and community to raise our family.  We knew our search was over when we stumbled upon a 200 year old farm in the quaint, rural town of Lovettsville, VA.

recent.comments: Wonderful stay. Looking forward to coming back.

items.comments: Wonderful stay. Looking forward to coming back.

Had a great time in Lovettsville! So peaceful and so much to explore and do while also being so close to nature. A great AirBnB, with a beautiful pond and a balcony to sit and enjoy it! So much fun and the perfect place to come back to and relax in after a day of adventures!
Absolutely beautiful. Our stay was peaceful and exactly what we wanted for a calm honeymoon weekend. Loved the spring house so much. Would highly recommend this Airbnb.

We had an amazing stay at the Spring House. The property is so clean and well maintained. I love the aesthetic inside and that it’s by the pond which gives such a peaceful and relaxing atmosphere. This place has so much charm. Mary Ann is so responsive and kind. We’ll definitely come back! 100% recommend this place. :)

Such a lovely little place for a peaceful weekend getaway.  The springhouse was so comfortable. The bathroom was actually bigger that I thought it would be, going from the picture. The shower is nice and spacious.  The little deck is cute. Weather didn't allow us to sit out at night, but we did sit inside in the comfy chairs and could still enjoy the sound of the fountain and the drizzling rain through the screen door. I have chronic back troubles and the mattress did very well for me. I slept great. 
Overall, a very lovely, peaceful place to stay.

I have little to add to other glowing reviews. The Winner family has created an idyllic, quiet getaway. Well appointed, pastoral, stunning. The best AirBNB we have ever encountered. 

Thank you for sharing this gem on your beautiful land🙏🏽

Our stay at the Spring House at Brookdale Farm was perfect in every way. Mary Ann has thought of every detail to make her guests feel at home. We hope to return this fall. The property was beautiful … a cozy, intimate, and gorgeously designed guesthouse built onto the historic original springhouse, (dating back to the 1790s), with a private balcony overlooking the pond and lovely grounds.  Even their gorgeous pups, Norma and Russell, were so friendly.  My boyfriend and I wish we could have stayed longer. Don’t hesitate to book your stay! I cannot recommend this Airbnb highly enough … such a special place! 
Gretchen & Chris, July 2023

description.summary:
Feel refreshed when you stay in this rustic gem!  The Springhouse is nestled in the rolling hills of Northern Virginia’s Wine Country! 

Originally constructed in the early 1800's, this structure was built over a natural spring and used for refrigeration.  The water from the spring maintains a constant cool temperature throughout the year while also filling a pond.  The original stone well, channel and stone flooring are all intact for guests to explore and experience how our ancestors lived.
description.space:
This newly renovated building has been designed with a living unit.  Enter into a 2 story atrium and up the stairs into a cozy living space.
Upon entering is a  kitchenette equipped with a microwave and compact refrigerator.  Across the hall is a full bath with walk-in shower.
The main living space has a queen bed, dresser, with television above.  A pair of club chairs invite guests to relax and enjoy the view overlooking the pond.
description.access:
Parking is off the street.  We will direct the guests on the path to follow toward the pond.

Guests have access to the whole property.  Our stone patio is available for guests to have their morning coffee or enjoy a bottle of wine from one of our local wineries while watching the sunset.  A fire pit is also available upon request.
description.notes: The kitchenette is not equipped for cooking.  We encourage our guests to try our variety of local restaurants.  See my Guidebook for recommendations.
description.neighborhood: Tree-lined streets, gravel road, rural neighborhood surrounded by horse farms and mountain views.
description.transit: A car will be necessary.  15-20 minutes to antique shops, award winning wineries and restaurants.  We are 1 hour northwest of Washington DC, 30 minutes from historic sites such as Harpers Ferry, Frederick and many outdoor adventures!
description.interaction: Feel free to message, text or come to our door if you have any questions or need additional items.  We are usually around!

name: *Cottage at Firefly Cellars* Perfect escape for 2
title: Hamilton, Virginia

gallery.caption: coffee, sugar, and creamer provided for guests
Hot tub on side of cottage, only for cottage guest use

recent.comments: Firefly Cottage was perfect!!!  The property exceeded our expectations….especially the pool and view of the horses. We hope to visit again soon!

items.comments: Firefly Cottage was perfect!!!  The property exceeded our expectations….especially the pool and view of the horses. We hope to visit again soon!
This was our 3rd time staying at the cottage. It did not disappoint. Weather was perfect for time at the pool. Looking forward to going back next year!
This was a great five star stay. Andrea is wonderful and responsive without being intrusive. The place was exactly as described. Such a peaceful stay in a beautiful location.
The cottage was beautfiul, peaceful, and perfect for my stay! Andrea is super repsonsive and accommodating.
We enjoyed the amenities and proximity to the winery.

Our visit to the Firefly Cottage was refreshing, cosy, romantic, and restful. We enjoyed being so close to fun, slow paced activities like wine tasting, flower picking, and browsing curio shops. So many great places to dine nearby, and no matter the July heat, the cottage was always a cool oasis upon our return, not the least of which was the sparking private pool.  The ground were meticulously kept and the flowers and greenery were always a lovely sight. We definitely hope to return soon and enjoy other seasons in the area.
One of the best AirBnB's that we have ever booked.  Great Host and Great Place

description.summary: The Cottage at Firefly Cellars is a private, tranquil escape on the tasting room property. Come enjoy the private pool (in summer months), walk the property  with a glass of wine, enjoy views of the neighboring horses,  hop to local wineries, or just sit back and enjoy all the cottage has to offer. The cottage is meticulously maintained, beautifully designed, and you will feel at home the  moment you walk through the doors. Perfect for a couple, or an individual looking to escape from busy life!
description.space:
IMPORTANT: The tasting room is open Thursday-Sunday from the months of April-October, and Friday-Sunday in the colder months. If you are visiting on a day that the winery is closed and would like to buy wine to enjoy at the cottage, just let me know!

The Cottage is tucked away in a private space on the property, and guests will enjoy privacy throughout their stay. Guests will also enjoy the views from the adjacent horse farm. 

The great room boasts 18’ ceilings, and is attached to the modern, open concept kitchen and eating area. The bedroom includes one queen sized bed, and the bathroom comes stocked with towels and linens. The kitchen is equipped with coffee maker, cups, dishes, glassware, silverware, microwave, oven, blender, and a mini and full sized refrigerator (full size located in closet).

The bedroom and bathroom are on the main floor. The curved staircase leads to an upstairs loft with a couch and bookshelves. 

In front of the cottage, you will find a table for two that overlooks the pool, perfect for decompressing at the end of the day or to enjoy an outdoor meal. 

The pool is open from late May-September and is only for Airbnb guest use. A private hot tub and firepit are there and ready for guest use year round. Note about the hot tub- there are trees all over the property. It is possible that leaves may make their way into the hot tub when the lid is off. Hot tub is maintained by a company who cleans/maintains chemical levels/etc to ensure the best quality. There is a chance they will arrive during your stay, but it is a very quick visit and will be on their way shortly (their usual days of service are Mondays and Fridays). There is also a pool maintenance company that comes twice a week (Mondays and Fridays, unless extreme weather. If there is heavy rain, they may come on a different day) for a quick clean and chemical level check. A brand new hot tub unit was put outside the Cottage in May 2022, on the front porch. Its covered, so still able to use on cozy rainy evenings! 

The cottage is tucked away on a private corner of the property, so you will not have interaction on anyone else who may be on the property at the tasting room or the barn, unless you come spend some time with us at the tasting room! The pool/hot tub/firepit are for Airbnb guests only, not shared amenities.

The firepit is located outside of the cottage, and firewood and fire starters are provided. 

There is a table with two chairs on the front porch, perfect spot for drinking your morning coffee, reading a book, or enjoying a glass of wine in the evening! 

No one is allowed in the cottage except for the 1-2 guests staying there. Visitors are NOT permitted allowed during your stay.

IMPORTANT: If visiting during the summer months, you will be required to sign a pool liability waiver before visiting. Please send your email address when booking.
description.access: Guests have access to the Cottage, private use of the hot tub and the pool (in the warmer months), and their own parking spot. Guests are able (and encouraged!!) to walk over to the tasting room once it opens in the spring to have a glass (or 3) of wine with us before heading back to enjoy the cottage for the evening.
description.notes:
Please keep in mind that this cottage is on a winery/tasting room property. While the cottage is quiet and private, there is a chance you may hear cars coming and going from the tasting room or other events happening on the property.

This listing is NOT a child friendly rental. 

If you are at the property on a Thursday or Friday morning in the spring and summer months, you will hear landscaping vehicles around the property. They mow on these mornings (Thursday OR Friday, not both), so you will hear some noise for a few minutes around the cottage. 

There is an alarm system in the Cottage. This is NOT for guest use. Please do not arm the Cottage during your stay- this system is for days the Cottage is unoccupied and only for Firefly Cellars staff use. 

Doordash/Grubhub deliver to the Cottage and you have a large variety of places to choose from. So if you are planning on just ordering and food and not leaving the Cottage, you are set! 

The TV is not a smart TV. There is cable access (Xfinity) and you can stream from a laptop or phone if you bring an HDMI cord.

PLEASE READ: Feeding the horses is NOT PERMITTED. The horses belong to our neighbors, and while they are friendly and lovely to look at, they have allergies and cannot be fed. 

This property is located in nature, therefore you may experience nature elements such as deer, snakes, or other animals. 

If there is anything during your stay that needs attention or would affect your 5 star rating, please let us know! We are committed to making your stay as pleasant as possible, and we will respond to your message within the hour.
description.neighborhood: The Cottage at Firefly Cellars is located in Western Loudoun County, within close proximity to more than 20 surrounding wineries and breweries. We are a short, ten minute drive from both downtown Leesburg and Purcellville, providing many options for dining out and entertainment. Guests will also be close to several walking/hiking trails where you can enjoy all of the beautiful scenery that Loudoun County has to offer. We are 45 miles from Washington DC, and a quick ten minute drive to the toll road for easy access into the city. We are also directly next door to a horse farm that offers trail rides, a nice addition to your getaway!
description.transit: The Cottage is a 20 minute drive from Dulles Airport, a ten minute drive to the toll road, and one mile off of route 7.
description.interaction: During your stay, I prefer to keep my distance to give you privacy. The cottage is meticulously maintained and fully stocked, and should not have any issues. However, if something arises, I am available to contact between the hours of 8am and 9pm and will do my best to assist you as quickly as possible. I do not live on the property, but am a quick 10 minutes away in case of emergencies.
description.house_rules:
No guest are permitted in the Cottage. 

Do not wander onto the neighboring properties. Firefly Cellars neighbors a horse farm and a residential house. The Cottage area is marked by clear fencing, so please do not go past the fences into the neighbors' properties. 

The neighboring horses are beautiful to look at, but do NOT feed them. Some of the horses have allergies and this could be fatal if they are fed the wrong foods. 

No food or drink in the hot tub. 

Hot tub lid must be shut and clasped after every use. Please do not leave hot tub lid open while not in use. 

There is a security system in the Cottage- this is NOT for guest use. Do not arm the security system. The system is used only when the Cottage is vacant.

No re-arranging of furniture in the Cottage. All furniture must be where you found it at arrival. 

Do not use the dishwasher. You can load your dishes into the dishwasher, but we will handwash all dishes after your departure.

Such an incredible stay! The airbnb was beautiful, and the location was perfect. Will definitely be returning!

This is easily the most beautiful AirBnB we have stayed at. We absolutely loved it! The location was super easy to find and extremely easy to check into. It’s located right on the winery property, so it’s easy to visit the tasting room. It’s also right next to the brewery, so it’s a very easy trip over there and to the market as well. The place was extremely clean, well maintained, and so peaceful. We immediately fell in love with it. The fridge was stocked with some fresh strawberries, granola, beverages and fresh apple cider donuts- which were incredible!! The listing does mention that the property is right in the middle of the “you-pick” cherries, but we didn’t realize just how close to the windows people would be. We just left the property until the “you-pick” hours were over; so simple fix. There wasn’t anything negative about this experience. We can’t wait to visit again in the future. Highly, highly recommend.
beautiful nature, quiet and private location

description.summary:
The cozy, stone, studio cottage is secluded in the vines & orchards of Bluemont Vineyard.

    ~ spectacular sunrise views of Virginia Wine Country
    ~ Stone walls built from rock found on the vineyard property
    ~ 5 minutes to Dirt Farm Brewing & Henway Hard Cider
    ~ 10 minutes to local dining & shopping

description.space:
This stone cottage is nestled among the orchards at Bluemont Vineyard and boasts stunning valley views.  The former "loafing shed" was a home to the horses in the pasture and has been fully updated for guests to enjoy. 

    ~ Open studio floor plan with high ceilings
    ~ Enjoy the view from the porch equipped with a small table and 2 swivel rockers
    ~ Graciously appointed with a queen bed made with comfy sheets

    ~ Bathroom with separate water closet

    ~ Kitchenette equipped with a toaster oven, keurig with k-cups, dishes, glassware, microwave and full size refrigerator (NO STOVE or OVEN)

description.access:

The cottage is very private and totally at your disposal with adjacent parking.  During the farming season, we do have pick your own guests in the surrounding cherry orchard (June) as well as the apple (Sept-October) and peach (July-August) orchards below the cottage from 9am-6pm.

PET POLICY:

Although we do love dogs and have several ourselves, because we advertise the cottage as not suitable for pets, we do not permit pets in the cottage so that guests with allergies can book with confidence.  Thank you for your understanding.
description.notes: We are following Airbnb's enhanced cleaning and sanitation guidelines including sanitizing frequently touched surfaces.  This takes additional time so we are not able to offer late check outs or early checkins at this time.

description.summary: The Grotos Grove is a destination by itself and serves a very convenient base of operations to experience the regions many activities/events with Blue Valley and Barrel Oak Vineyards only ¼ mile away.   The house was completely restored in 2017 with large modern kitchen, and 3 full baths and 2 half baths;  2 master bedrooms, 2 bedrooms and a loft. One of Washington's top interior decorators furnished the home specifically with the idea of group/family use while maintaining its historic charm.
description.space:
The Grove is located in Delaplane where John Marshall, the former United States Supreme Court Chief Justice who grew up at Oak Hill Mansion next door. The Grove was actually built by John Marshall for his sister.  The town of Marshall (just five minutes away) is named after the former Chief Justice. The historic and popular towns of Middleburg, Warrenton, Paris and Upperville are all easy 15-20 minute drives.   The Grove can truly be your home away from home with all the comforts and quality, no more hotels who are regular visitors to the area!

        Please note that the Grove is located near I66 traffic can be heard.  The house is quiet with it's stone walls.  The positive is that you are just off the service road and fast travel to the vineyards and town of Marshall and great for cyclists as you are immediately along one of popular  routes according to Potomac Pedalers.

         Fauquier County is among the finest horse country in Virginia. Some of the most beautiful farms in the county are nearby. The Orange County hunt, sometimes comes in sight of the town when hunting foxes. It is not uncommon to see horse trailers and vans parked on Main Street of Marshall. Hounds and horses abound in this area.  However it is also a great place for writers, actors politicians and other well known people to live quietly and anonymously.   As a result, there are many new restaurants and local butcher’s, bakers and markets establishments to enjoy year round.

      In addition the home sits on 10 private acres to include a nice hiking/running trail around the perimeter.  The kitchen and the dinning area are designed for great gatherings and there’s a nice patio out the side to enjoy the agricultural setting of the area and boasts a nice fire pit.  The large high ceiling living room is perfect for events such as private recitals, acting and story telling and yes even watching sporting events on TV.  The famous round room offers another quite place for discussion and reading. The game room underneath provides indoor activities for all ages.  The internet café/wine tasting room provides a setting to enjoy all the samples of the nearby vineyards (Barrel Oak and Blue Valley actually within walking distance – but not recommended) to conduct your own tasting.

         The Grove is located in one of the prettiest and popular cycling areas you will find in the Northern region of Virginia.   Consequently, the County hosts many cycling events from the Spring to the Fall.  These popular rides pass by the grand estates and orchards of Virginia's Hunt Country, and following the spine of the "mysterious" Mount Weather and down along the bottom of the ridge line of the Appalachian Trail.  The Grove is located just off RT55 which is part of all the key rides so you don’t have to drive and park just get on your bike and GO!  - And for those you like to hike, Sky Meadows State Park offers great scenic hiking trails that connect with the Appalachian Trail.

 Grotos Grove LLC
Rental Agreement

ADDRESS: 3468 Oak Hill Road, Delaplane VA 20144.  Ph(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)

CHECK-IN TIME is AFTER 3 P.M. EST AND CHECKOUT is 11 A.M. EST.  Early and late check-in can be coordinated if scheduling permits. 

This is a NON SMOKING unit. 


FIREPLACES – There are multiple fireplaces the primary for guest use is located in the main living area and a wood stove in the basement activity room.  Wood can be found in alongside the driveway towards the detached garage.   Fireplaces are turned off from April 15-October 15; they are not operational during this time of the year.  

WATER AND SEPTIC – This house is on a well and septic systems.  The mineral content in the water is high.  There a purifying system for the well water. The septic system is very effective; however, it will clog up if improper material is flushed. All rubbish from food preparation and cleaning plates needs to be placed in trash and not down kitchen sink.  DO NOT FLUSH anything other than toilet paper.  No feminine products should be flushed at anytime.  If it is found that feminine products have been flushed and clog the septic system, you could be charged damages of up to two hundred dollars ($250).

STORM POLICY/ROAD CONDITIONS – No refunds will be given for storms.  Access is very good being located so close to I-66.

NO DAILY HOUSEKEEPING SERVICE – While linens and bath towels are included at the Grove, daily maid service is not included in the rental rate.  We do not permit bath towels or linens to be taken from the house.  The modest laundry and bath cleaning fee is primarily for those items, beyond that the renters agree to leave the house the grounds as they found it.   A departure checklist is in the Kitchen and also the information book

Lynn’s place is a slice of heaven! She’s a wonderful host and a kind person. She welcomes you to her property and has thought of every detail to make one’s stay easy and enjoyable. Tally Ho is clean, comfortable, quiet and has all the amenities you may need for a short or longer stay. We’d love to stay again and recommend this rental 110% ! Thank you, Lynn, for a great getaway!

We booked for two couples at the last minute and found the apartment quite charming. We used it as a satellite to go to Antietam Battlefield, Harper’s Ferry and MANY wineries. It was in a great location! The pool was an added bonus and we enjoyed some down time reading books by the pool.

This was an absolutely perfect stay, everything that I needed for me and my girlfriends. Lynn even went out of her way to give us recommendations for local wineries and breweries in the area. Would absolutely come again. Can’t wait to spend some time with Baxter (her adorable pup!) on our next visit!
Lynn was a wonderful host. The Carriage House was beautiful and peaceful. We had a relaxing time and hope to come back!

Stayed here for a few days with my family and we absolutely loved it! Lynn’s place was very beautiful and spacious. The farm was so peaceful and access to the pool was the cherry on top. Lynn was a sweetheart, coming by to welcome us and bringing apples to feed the horses together. We were also able to meet their cow, goats, and 2 adorable dogs! Our fur baby was able to enjoy the house and grounds without any issues. Overall a gem and a great escape from the city.

We booked Lynn’s beautiful Airbnb for a girls weekend in wine country. Our stay was amazing! Lynn was so nice and the place was gorgeous, so clean, and comfy. We felt right at home. We enjoyed a day at the pool and her precious dog Baxter hung out with us. He was adorable and wonderful company! Lynn was very kind and asked if we needed anything and offered to take us to see the horses on the property. She had an awesome guidebook with all kinds of recommendations. We found super fun things to do, like shop in Leesburg, and tried several of the restaurants she suggested. Overall best weekend! Would definitely recommend this Airbnb to anyone looking for a relaxing weekend away and we hope to go back soon!

description.summary: JCS Farms is an upscale farmhouse built on 4 acres, next to a creek, and constructed around a 200+ yr timber frame.  The unique architecture of this antique barn frame combined with modern design will be the perfect setting for your next vacation/wedding/group retreat.  Enjoy the sights and sounds of nature as you grill out on the covered deck.  Fully gated home.  Fire-pit, basketball, ping-pong, & more!  Close to Bull Run Park/Shenandoah/DC/Civil War landmarks/wineries.
description.space:
The home is approximately 4000sf with real hickory wood floors on the upper level.  Great room has 16 feet ceilings with an open concept living/dining/kitchen.  If you love to cook, you'll love the gourmet kitchen with professional appliances, including oversized refrigeration, a Thermador six burner gas stove and dedicated ice-maker to keep those tasty drinks cold.  The dining room can comfortably accommodate up to 12 people around the twin farmhouse tables that were constructed with reclaimed lumber from a local factory and a beautiful mesquite wood turntable with turquoise inlay.  The oversized bar area can accommodate an additional 5 people.  Dining room and kitchen has access to the covered deck with a gas grill and panoramic views of fruit orchard and rustic beauty.  Upper level consists of 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a dedicated office space with 50-inch HDMI monitor.  With sofa bed in living room, you can sleep a total of 8 on this level.  Bathrooms have tiled showers, with frameless glass doors and curb-less entry.  

Lower level consists of 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom with polished concrete floors throughout. Utility room has front-loading washer and dryer and a dart board.  Game room has a pull-out day bed that can sleep two.  You can sleep a total of 8 on this level.  Garage has ping-pong and foosball table with access to the backyard, covered patio and deck stairs.

Available electric vehicle 220 volt charging outlet is accessible from the garage.  Charging port is not provided, just the 220V outlet.

EXTRA SERVICES
Ask us about bike rentals and e-bike rentals starting at just $25/bike/booking!  There are a lot of great bike trails in the area!
We also have a S'mores Starter Kit available for purchase for just $40.  This will include everything you need to enjoy a fun evening cooking S'mores around our firepit.

PETS
All pets MUST be disclosed before booking and are subject to approval.  There is additional documentation required for service animals, so please let us know if you are planning on bringing one. Please review our pet policy and confirm agreement. Guests must adhere to the following pet rules before approval for the pet is provided:

1. Only dogs are allowed and no more than 2 are allowed per stay unless prior arrangements are made. 
2. A pet fee of $250 for the first dog and $50 for all subsequent dogs will be required.  This fee is for the privilege of having a pet at the property.  It does not cover damages or stains caused by the pet.
3. Dogs must be house trained and well behaved.
4. Dogs are not allowed on any furniture (i.e. sofas, beds, etc)
5. Dogs must not be left unattended in the house unless crated.
6. Guest must pick up and appropriately dispose of dog excrement from the property.
description.access: Entire home with the exception of locked inventory closets.  Tiny home,  workshop/studio/storage/garage/fenced back area is not available to guests.
