Complimentary onsite parking (maximum of 10 cars) - Please park only on the driveway.  Unregistered vehicles or vehicles found parked/driving over lawn will be assessed a fine of $50/vehicle/occurrence.  

Rental Party.  Guest agrees and certifies that they are 25 years or older and agrees to provide a copy of a valid Driver’s License in conjunction with signing this Agreement. 
All persons in the rental party will be bound by the terms of this Agreement.  Only persons listed on this Agreement may stay at the Property.  

The total number of adults in the Rental Party will be _____.  The total number of children under the age of 18 in the Rental Party will be _____. The total number of pets in the Rental Party will be _____. Guest agrees and certifies that the pets in the Rental Party are well behaved and house trained (see pet section below for additional pet policy details). Guest agrees that the Property will not be occupied by minors (under the age of 18), unless a supervising adult is present and the signer(s) of this Agreement is also present. 

Maximum Occupancy.  The maximum occupancy for the Property is limited to 16 people (not including infants 2 years or younger) at any time, unless prior approval has been given for more.  Once approval has been granted for groups larger than 16 persons, there will be an additional $50 per person per night charge for each person who stays at the Property above the maximum occupancy limit.

No Rights of Tenancy.  Guest acknowledges and understands that he/she is a temporary guest of the Property and not a tenant.  Nothing herein confers any rights of tenancy upon Guest. 

Rental Period & Check-in.  The term of the rental period shall begin on ____________________ (“Arrival Date”) and shall end on ____________________ (“Departure Date”).  The Property will be ready for Guest’s occupancy at 4:00 P.M., on the Arrival Date, and the Property must be vacated by 10:00 A.M., on the Departure Date unless otherwise authorized.  If Guest would like an extension on these times, please contact the property host 24 hours before your arrival/departure.  Extensions are not guaranteed. Hosts will need to check with housekeeping and see if the Guest request can be granted. Authorized extensions will incur an additional charge of $50 per hour.  If the guest remains on the property past their authorized checkout time, the guest agrees to pay a $200 late checkout penalty fine.

HOA and County Rental Rules.  Guest agrees to abide by all Fairfax County regulations at all times while at the Property and shall cause all members of the Rental Party to do the same.  Failure to abide by these Rental Rules shall result in the Rental Party being asked to vacate the Property and the forfeiture of any rental payments, fees, and/or deposits.  

Property Care.  Arrival and departure inspections are done on the property before and after each Guest stay.  Guest is responsible for immediately reporting to property host via photography if he/she notices any damages and/or missing items.  Failure to report may result in charges if these items are missing or damaged upon checkout.  Guest agrees to surrender Property in the same condition as of commencement of the rental period, reasonable wear and tear expected. Guest agrees to reimburse Owner the amount of all damages/extra charges, lost rentals and county fines associated with Guest’s stay, including reasonable attorney fees. Guest will be responsible for any cost of repair or replacement required as a result of damage caused by the Rental Party during the rental term. The following list contains examples of items that the guest will be charged extra for (not an exhaustive list):
Stains on furniture, carpets, linens, towels, bedding.
Any damages found upon check out that the guest did not report via photography during the check in process.
Missing items found during check out inspection (e.g. missing remotes, etc).
Movement of furniture from its original location.
Burnt on food or damages to cookware.
Loose trash or leaky bags resulting in extra dirty trash carts.  Not complying with the trash rules.
Leaving the house excessively dirty resulting in additional cleaning hours.
Dirty dishes found during checkout inspection.

Owner shall have the right to inspect and make repairs to the property, its fixtures, appliances, furnishings, and facilities during the rental period.

Rental Rate, deposit and Fees. As listed in the Airbnb/VRBO reservation system or separate agreement and subject to change. Refer to the official reservation for details.  The home will be checked upon Guest departure and if a security deposit was charged to the Guest, the security deposit will be refunded within 15 days from guest Departure Date less any itemized damages, citations or extra charges.

Cancellations/Refunds -  Refer to the official reservation for details.  Please review cancellation policy on Airbnb/VRBO or direct booking website.

Property Access - Gate and Main entrance access codes will be provided at least 24 hours before Arrival Date. If for any reason Guest is denied access to the subject property, Owner Liability shall be limited to the return of all monies paid on account. 

Firepit - Guest agrees to comply with the following house rules and Fairfax County ordinance regarding outdoor fires:
Burning is only permitted in the firepit provided
Permitted burning materials include dry clean logs, twigs, or other untreated wood products
Prohibited burning materials include, but not limited to, treated wood, fresh cut limbs, leaves, manufactured products, garbage or other material that may cause excessive odor or smoke
Adult supervision is required at all times until fire has been completely extinguished.
If winds exceed 10 miles per hour, burning is not permitted.
No fires are allowed during quiet hours between 10pm - 8am.  

Malfunctions - Guest shall not be entitled to any refund for inoperable appliances, hot tubs, arcade system, tvs, electronic items, etc. Owner, upon being notified by Guest, of any malfunction, will make every reasonable effort to have such items replaced or repaired but this cannot be guaranteed.

Pets - UNAUTHORIZED PETS are prohibited and are grounds for immediate termination of contract resulting in immediate eviction and loss of security deposit or $500, whichever is greater.   Guest could be liable for professional carpet cleaning, duct cleaning, and additional damages if an unauthorized pet is found on the property.  Guests must adhere to the following pet policy if owner agrees to allow said pet(s) on the property:

Only dogs are allowed and no more than 2 are allowed per stay unless otherwise authorized. 
A pet fee of $250 for the first dog and $50 for all subsequent dogs will be required.  This fee is for the privilege of having a pet at the property.  It does not cover damages or stains caused by the pet. 
Dogs must be house trained and well behaved.
Dogs are not allowed on any furniture (i.e. sofas, beds, etc)
Dogs are not allowed in any carpeted area.
Dogs must not be left unattended in the house unless crated.
Guest must pick up and appropriately dispose of dog excrement from the property and community areas.   
 
Prohibited at Property - FIREWORKS, INDOOR SMOKING, HOUSE PARTIES AND ILLEGAL DRUG USE are prohibited and are grounds for immediate termination of contract resulting in immediate eviction and loss of security deposit or $500, whichever is greater.  This would include loud music or noise levels, drunken behavior, drug use or activity that results in neighbor complaints or police reporting.  Guests will face possible State prosecution for using fireworks on this property.  Guests could also be liable for professional carpet cleaning, duct cleaning, re-painting and additional damages.  

Quiet Hours - 10pm to 8am - Refrain from loud outdoor and indoor noise between the hours of 10pm and 8am.  Please keep noise levels from music and loud talking to a reasonable level at all times.  

If we receive a neighbor or police complaint, the following will be enforced:

1st time - $50 fee
2nd time - $500 fee

Surveillance Devices - Exterior house cameras are installed for the security of the Guest and owner.  We have cameras to monitor the entry, driveway and backyard and decks.

Trash - ALL trash must be bagged and placed inside trash receptacles located adjacent to the garage.  Recycling receptacles are also available for recyclables and are located next to the trash receptacles.

Limitation on Liability.  Owner is not responsible for any accidents, injuries, or illness that occur to any member of the Rental Party or Guest’s visitors while in the Property or on the Property.  Owner is not responsible for loss of personal belongings or valuables belonging to any member of the Rental Party or any of Guest’s visitors.  Guest agrees to assume the risk of any harm arising from use of the Property.  UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES AND UNDER NO LEGAL THEORY, TORT, CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR OTHERWISE, SHALL OWNER BE LIABLE TO GUEST OR TO ANY OTHER PERSON FOR ANY DAMAGES OF ANY NATURE WHATSOEVER INCLUDING ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT OR GUEST’S RENTAL OF THE PROPERTY OR USE OF THE PROPERTY.  IN NO EVENT WILL OWNER BE LIABLE FOR ANY DAMAGES IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT EVEN IF OWNER SHALL HAVE BEEN INFORMED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.  

Indemnification.  Guest acknowledges that the use of the Property by the Rental Party and Guest’s visitors is entirely at their own risk.  Guest will indemnify and hold harmless Owner from any and all expenses, costs, damages, suits, actions, or liabilities whatsoever arising from or related to any and all loss of, or damage to, personal property, injury or death resulting from the use or occupancy of the Property, or the failure of any member of the Rental Party or Guest’s visitors to observe the Rules and restrictions set forth in Paragraph 7. 

Violation of Agreement.  If Guest, Guest’s visitors, or any member of the Rental Party violates any of the terms of this Agreement, including but not limited to maximum occupancy, visitors, or the Rental Rules, Owner may evict Guest and the Rental Party from the Property, and Guest will forfeit all rent and deposits paid.  Should Owner elect to hire an attorney to collect any sums due under this Agreement or enforce any provision of this Agreement, Guest shall be liable for all reasonable attorney’s fees incurred by Owner.

Governing Law.  This Agreement and all transactions contemplated by this Agreement will be governed by, and constructed and enforced in accordance with, the laws of the Commonwealth of Virginia (including its conflicts of laws provisions).

Severability.  If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable in whole or in part, the remaining provisions shall not be affected and shall continue to be valid and enforceable as though the invalid or unenforceable parts had not been included in this Agreement.  

Entire Agreement.  This Agreement represents the entire understanding and agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter of this Agreement and supersedes all other negotiations, understandings, and representations (if any) made by and between the Parties.

name: Waterfront Cabin with Large Great Room
title: Round Hill, Virginia

hosts.about: Reagan and I started Waterford Reservations in 2017 most of the properties we built or renovated ourselves,the majority of the materials used to make our homes is reclaimed or made on My sawmill. Make sure to check out all the listings especially my favorite the DonRea Villa and plan to enjoy all the areas best winery’s, brewery’s, and reastraunts and hiking the area has to offer

description.summary:
Sycamore Creek Farm Cabin sits nestled on a secluded property that will give you a taste of country life while still being able to enjoy and explore all Western Loudoun County has to offer! Spacious living areas, a large deck, beautiful scenery, a hammock & outdoor fire pit makes the cabin a peaceful place to gather with family and friends. It’s time to relax, reconnect & recharge at Sycamore Creek Farm! 
📍Located 10 minutes away from a plethora of wineries, breweries, and hiking trails!
description.space:
There are open living rooms in both the upstairs and downstairs spaces. 
Kitchens are perfect for hosting and have all you would need to prepare a meal! The upstairs dining table seats 8 while the downstairs seats 6. 
The bedrooms are comfy & cozy! Be assured that you will have a wonderful nights rest! :)
description.access: Entire house
description.notes:
House is located along the woods on a farm with cows and chickens. The house is accessible by rural road about 10 minutes drive to the town of Purcellville. The farm has cows and chickens along with wild animals and bugs, especially brown marmorated stink bugs in the early fall season. Again, there are bugs, pests and animals naturally in the country so expect to find them present on the property, too. 
Internet, electricity and TV cannot be guaranteed in case of technical issues with the provider. Weather is not guaranteed, and please stay away from the creek during or following heavy rain to avoid flooding. The reservation must match no more than the permitted number of guests at any time. Guests are subject to additional large fees and charges if guests do not honor reservation agreement by exceeding total permitted number of guests. Pets are not permitted and guests are subject to additional large fees and charges if they do not honor the reservation agreement by keeping any pets on the property.


This rental is managed by Sycamore Creek Farm LLC. When booking this property, all guests must acknowledge that any and all disputes, settlements, ect. will be made solely with Sycamore Creek Farm LLC or Air BNB. No others may be involved in disputes or settlements for any reason.
description.neighborhood:
The neighborhood is 10 minutes away from grocery stores, breweries, wineries, hiking trails etc. 
The closest dining restaurants are More Better and Tammy’s Diner! 
The owner of the house lives right down the road and if you have any problems during your stay they can come and resolve as soon as possible! Even if it’s something small like having trouble getting a fire started in the fire pit-please don’t hesitate to reach out! :)
description.transit:
The road leading up to the Airbnb in windy so please use caution when arriving and departing! 
There is plenty of parking spaces on the property for guests!
description.interaction: Please feel free to reach out to us if you need something! The owner of the home lives right down down the street and can be there as soon as possible for you! Please reach out via Airbnb or the number we provide you upon checking in
description.house_rules:
	Do not feed cattle or enter the cattle field. They are friendly but unpredictable. 
	Do not enter any buildings on the property. We have cameras inside!
	Any pets outside must be leashed unless inside the dog run. 
	Please do not let dogs on hardwood floors upstairs.
	Watch children around the creek. It gets deep especially after rain.
	Wood stove fires are not permitted. 
	Firewood for outdoor fire is in basement shed. Surcharge if over 20 logs per evening used during stay. Yes…we count!!
	Do not open locked rooms. We have sensors!
	Large parties without permission prohibited. 
	After 10pm please no loud music. We love our neighbors!
	Do not swim in the pond.

name: Whitetail Summit - Shenandoah/hot tub/wineries
title: Front Royal, Virginia

gallery.caption: Lots of light from the big chalet windows
Whitetail Summit provides top-notch year-round accommodations, whether you spend your time indoors or out
Our basement is meant for entertaining! We have a music nook, ping pong / pool table, TV seating area, and wet bar.
Modern, fully-equipped kitchen with everything you'll need to feed a group
Let your worries wash away in the 7-person hot tub
Spacious open concept kitchen/dining/living space upstairs makes gathering easy
Relax by the indoor wood-burning fireplace during the cooler months
Our living room couch has four recliners and seats nine. Our dining table expands to seat eight, with seating for two more at the kitchen bar.
Basement music nook with a right and left-handed guitar, violin, and electric piano. We also have a closet full of board games and children's books. This couch also has a queen pull-out bed.
The basement entertainment zone is perfect for movies, video games, or board games. If you're more of a reader, feel free to take (and keep!) a book.
Combination pool table and ping pong table makes nights in fun!
Our basement wet bar makes your favorite drinks readily accessible
Outdoor firepit with seating for ten. We'll provide the s'mores; just bring out a guitar for campfire songs or tell some stories!
Host a cookout on the gas grill with your group on the deck sofa
Plenty of outdoor seating to take in the views
Flat, fenced-in yard for playing with your kids, pets, or each other
In Shenandoah Valley, you'll have a peaceful stay steps from the Appalachian Trail and the Shenandoah River.
Parking for up to six cars on the parking pads and driveway
Master bedroom with en-suite bathroom and private balcony with rocking chairs
The Master bedroom has a TV for some quiet time
Master en-suite bathroom has a standing shower
Bedroom 2 has a queen-size bed and dedicated workspace with adjustable desk and printer
Bedroom 3 has a queen-sized bed and dresser
Bathrooms two and three have a shower/tub combo
Basement bedroom has a king-size bed, gym area, dedicated work space, and private entrance
Get your fitness on with our Peloton exercise bike, elliptical, hand weights, and yoga mat
Feel free to bring up to two pups (with fee). We have everything they need & they'll love it here!
Kitchen is fully equipped to meet all your needs
Be surrounded by nature at Whitetail Summit. This secluded retreat is a great escape from the hustle and bustle of regular life.
Relax during the day amongst the oak trees
Unwind at night under the stars
You'll have plenty of opportunities to see Whitetail Deer, but our favorite is from the hot tub at twilight
The Shenandoah River is only 5 minutes away & is wonderful for water activities. Bring your float tube, stand-up paddleboard, kayak, canoe, or fishing gear. Or, for a fee, you can borrow ours!
Dine at the renowned Ashby Inn 12 minutes away, or head farther to town in Middleburg, Upperville, Winchester, or Front Royal.

30 wineries within 30 miles; some as close as 12 minutes away. We can extend our winery membership to guests - start your vineyard tour with four free tastings! If you're more into beer, Three Fox and Bear Chase are both great.
Take a trail ride or sign up for a lesson at the Royal Horseshoe Farm, only 14 minutes away. They have plenty of horses for all skill levels!

Hiking along the Appalachian Trail is 10 minutes away, or go 14 miles south to Skyline Drive. Our neighborhood also has turkey/goose/deer hunting preserves, Sky Meadows State Park, and the State Arboretum of Virginia.
10/10/22, our family of five deer join us for breakfast

hosts.about: Hi I work in the tech field ; am originally from South Carolina ; avid athlete and reader . I am clean , respectful , and I love to travel !

Hello, I'm Jenny! My husband Craig and I have lived in Washington, DC for 14 years. When we're not working full-time downtown, we frequent live music venues, try new restaurants, and explore with our dog Charlie. We also enjoy escaping to the Shenandoah Valley, and invested in a mountain chalet in 2022. As AirBnB hosts, we love providing a home base for guests to experience all the natural beauty and fun activities of the area!

recent.comments:
We had a wonderful stay at Jenny & Craig’s home. Beautiful views, super comfortable furnishings, sparkling clean all in the most peaceful setting. Our thoughtful hosts had a bottle of Rose waiting for us in the fridge. 
Enjoyed a few games of ping pong. We went to a local winery which we had the pleasure of having all to ourselves.  Grabbed some delicious bbq from Jim’s Country Store. Ended a perfect day stargazing in the hot tub. My only regret is that we didn’t stay longer.

items.comments:
We had a wonderful stay at Jenny & Craig’s home. Beautiful views, super comfortable furnishings, sparkling clean all in the most peaceful setting. Our thoughtful hosts had a bottle of Rose waiting for us in the fridge. 
Enjoyed a few games of ping pong. We went to a local winery which we had the pleasure of having all to ourselves.  Grabbed some delicious bbq from Jim’s Country Store. Ended a perfect day stargazing in the hot tub. My only regret is that we didn’t stay longer.

We had a great stay at Jenny's Airbnb - it's a very fun cabin with a great basement with ping pong and pool, and sufficient cooking equipment. Check in was easy and the rooms were comfortable. Price is reasonable and I would come again.
We had a great time. The house is fantastic and location is terrific scenery.
Awesome place, comfortable and spacious. Private and surrounded by natural beauty; game room and bar area was a hit. Will stay again!

my friends and i had a great time at Jenny and Craig’s! they were very quick at responding to whatever questions we had and the house had everything we needed. we experienced a 3-4 hour power outage the last night of our stay and Jenny and Craig were so helpful the entire time. would stay there again!

Beautiful home, well furnished, plenty of room for 6 adults and 2 dogs. Visited several wineries, a brewery, a cavern and spent an afternoon on the  Shenandoah River. Pond within walking distance for dogs to enjoy! Wonderful home for a family vacation. Jenny responds quickly to the simplest of questions.

We had a girl’s trip to Shenandoah National park(4 of us ). Jenny’s place was perfect in terms of what we needed as each one of us wanted a separate room. The house was clean, very well-equipped and comfortable. Surroundings were green and very peaceful. Front Royal has quite a few restaurants and is about 20 mins away from the airbnb,which made it easy to go eat at the restaurants. The park entrance too is about 25 mins away which made it easy for out to go and do some hikes. Jenny was extremely responsive, I didn’t have many questions for her, but when I did, she replied very fast. I would not hesitate to recommend her place to others. It even had a table tennis table which could be converted to a pool table and they had all the equipment for both sports. The two giant tv’s in the living room and family room were great as after a day out hiking in sweltering heat, it was a nice to come back to the Airbnb and veg out in front of the tv
 Thank you for a wonderful stay!

description.summary: Whitetail Summit is a spacious chalet with stunning mountain views, river access, and hiking on property. You'll have close proximity to 30+ wineries/breweries, the Shenandoah National Park, the Appalachian Trail, the Shenandoah River, horseback riding, and hunting preserves. Or relax at home, with an indoor pool/ping pong table, music nook, outdoor hot tub, and fire pit. We are family/pet-friendly.  REMOTE WORK: 600MBps wifi,  two dedicated work-from-home spaces, and a GYM/PELOTON
description.space:
SLEEPING: Master Bedroom (King), Bedroom 2 (Queen), Bedroom 3 (Queen), Basement (King), Basement Pull-Out (Queen) 

INDOOR LIVING: 3,000 sq. ft. of living space, stone wood-burning fireplace, 3 large flat-screen TVs, board games, books, pool table and ping pong table, music nook with guitars/violin/piano

KITCHEN: Fully equipped, dishwasher, oven, microwave, toaster, Keurig latte maker, French press, Crock-Pot

GENERAL: Extremely fast WiFi, excellent cell phone reception, central AC/heating, ceiling fans, washer/dryer, toiletries, linens, towels

OUTDOOR LIVING: Deck with a gas grill, Master balcony, 7-person hot tub, fire pit, flat fenced-in yard, and multiple outdoor seating areas

PET AMENITIES: Fenced-in yard that connects to the deck, dishes, bed, and crate. Whitetail Summit welcomes up to two dogs with a $50 fee per dog. While we love pets, we cannot permit more than two.

PARKING: Driveway parking for up to 6 cars. Whitetail Summit is up a steep driveway off a 1.5 mile gravel road. 4-wheel drive is required in the winter, and SUVs are recommended.

DEER: Many Whitetail deer reside in the area, and you are almost certain to see some during your stay. We are transitioning our lawn to a natural deer habitat, so you are likely to get an up-close view. Please drive with caution and do not disturb them. While there are nearby preserves for hunting, hunting is not permitted at Whitetail Summit.
description.access: Guests have access to the entire home and surrounding property, except for an owners and maid closet.
description.notes: There are two dedicated work spaces, and we provide XFinity Wifi at 600 MBps, so the space is ideal for remote work!
description.neighborhood:
Whitetail Summit is paradise for you, your kids, and your pups! Enjoy stunning mountain views less than 5 minutes from the Shenandoah River; hiking directly adjacent to the property; and 12 minutes from several of Virginia's best wineries. You'll also be 15 minutes from horseback riding, and around the corner from the Ashby Inn, one of Virginia's most storied restaurants.   Whitetail Summit is perfectly located West of Middleburg (20 mi),  North of Front Royal (14 mi), and Southeast of Winchester (20 mi), in the Shenandoah Farms subdivision.

Note: If you're coming for a vineyard tour, we can extend our membership to Delaplane Cellars and offer you four free tastings to get your day started.
description.transit: You'll have to make the climb to enjoy the view.  Our property is located one mile down a well-maintained gravel road, and up a moderately steep hill.  We recommend AWD drive during inclement weather and the winter months.
description.house_rules: Quiet hours after 11pm

name: Serene Hideaway w/ Pool: Mim's Barn - Max 4 Adults
title: Delaplane, Virginia

gallery.caption: The barn at dusk. Charcoal grill and solo stove, along with charcoal and wood provided.
Open living space with living area, dining and kitchen.
Kitchen with 2 under counter refrigerators and a freezer.
Year-round spa pool (built-in hot tub) at dusk.
Dining and living (two new bar stools offer seating for four).
Living area with murphy bed allows for single-floor living.

Kitchen with 2 under counter refrigerators and freezer. 2-burner electric cooktop, 12" toaster oven (capable of baking brownies or pizza), blender, stove top espresso and french press coffee maker (coffee / espresso included).
Upstairs bedroom with king bed and twin daybed with twin trundle.
Fully tiled bath with two sinks.
Fully tiled bath with two sinks.
Fully tiled bath with two sinks.
Living area with queen-size murphy bed.
Single floor living with queen-size murphy bed, kitchen and bath. No steps necessary.
Private lawn between barn and the pool / summer pavilion.
Aerial view of the property. Privacy abounds.
Aging tennis court (works, but better for pickleball at this point). Pickleball and tennis equipment provided.
Enjoy the peace and quiet of the Virginia countryside! Our barn is the red roof in the middle of the image.

all.name: No stairs or steps to enter

hosts.about: I am a working mother of three, co-owner of The Mandy and David Team at Compass.
We like the beach. And where we live, even though it does not have a beach.

recent.comments: Great place for a relaxing and peaceful stay.

items.comments: Great place for a relaxing and peaceful stay.

I am reluctant to attract too much attention with this 5-star review — because the property was phenomenal, comfortable, stylish, and serene — and also a bit of a hidden gem in the middle of Virginia wine country. Owner was communicative, friendly, and accommodating. An absolutely first-rate ABnB experience for us (one adult, two kids).
Really enjoyed our stay! Great time for our kids and barn was beautiful.
This cabin is lovely and private. A peaceful oasis thoughtfully designed and furnished for a relaxing, minimalist stay. The birdsong and natural surroundings make a very good thing even better.

Beautiful cabin on an even more beautiful property. And lots to do in the area - my family and I ventured to Middleburg, went cherry-picking, went to Dinosaur Land (our toddler loved it), and enjoyed a quick hike at Sky Meadows. Highly recommend this cabin!
Very clean and comfortable. End of beautiful dirt road. Host very friendly and communicative.
Very secluded and perfect getaway for the weekend.

description.summary:
Escape from it all! Private, newly-renovated retreat at end of dead end road. One of a kind home surrounded by nature, an aging tennis court, salt water pool (seasonal) + built-in spa (year round). Air tight - warm & cozy in winter!

Inviting main level with eat-in kitchen and garden views. Queen murphy bed and tiled bath with safety handles allows for one-floor living, if desired.

Loft features a king bed, day bed with trundle and desk. No parties or loud noise outside. See below for pool use.
description.space:
Private drive at end of dirt road leads to a newly-renovated two level barn. The open main level living area offers lovely sun all day and includes sitting area, eat-in kitchen and tiled bathroom. Cozy 2nd floor loft with king bed, twin daybed with pull-out twin trundle and a work desk with chair.

The barn is tucked against the woods, with fruit trees and a sprawling meadow out your front door. A short walk past raised vegetable beds leads to a stone pavilion with table and seating for 6, a fenced-in, unheated pool (open May 10 - Oct 23, 2023) with built-in spa pool and an aging (but playable) tennis court with basketball hoop. South-facing views from the hilltop offer expansive treetop views, all-day sun and gorgeous sunsets. Charcoal grill and solo stove / fire pit area near front patio of barn.

Extremely private setting on seven acres. The barn sits on hill above main house, which is barely visible from the upper part of the property.

Kitchen offers 2 under counter refrigerators and a freezer, 2-burner electric stovetop, toaster oven capable of cooking a 10" pizza, stove top espresso maker and french press coffee maker. Dishware and cooking supplies included. Inquire for specifics.

Pool, spa pool and tennis court are shared only with the owners (if we are there) from 10-7pm. These areas are for the exclusive use of guests all other hours.  For exclusive use of these areas from 10-7pm, we charge $100 per day, to be arranged in advance. Please inquire for more details or to discuss specific arrangements. 

Provided: tennis and pickleball equipment, basketball, badminton, charcoal for grill and firewood for the solo stove. Inflatable floats and goggles are included with the pool, when open.
description.access: Dedicated stone paved parking space for two cars next to barn.
description.notes: There is not a stand-alone, traditional hot tub. There is a built-in spa pool inside the pool gate, with separate heating controls, lights and jets, which is open year round. The unheated pool itself and accompanying lounge furniture are open May 10 - October 23, 2023.
description.neighborhood: Extremely quiet, farm-like setting on unpaved road. 3 homes (including ours) at the end of the road are surrounded by 100+ acre farms with horses, cows etc.
description.transit: Private parking for two vehicles next to barn.
description.interaction:
Barn is located on hill above main house and is not visible from main house. If we are at the house, we will be available if needed.

If we are at the house, the pool and spa are shared from 10am - 7pm. Guests have exclusive access after 7 or with previously agreed upon arrangement. If we are not at the house, they are both exclusive to guests.
description.house_rules: All guests must sign a waiver regarding use of pool. Pool may be shared with owner from 11am - 6pm. Use of pool is exclusive to guests at all other times or through specific arrangement with owners.

name: Modern Farmhouse Getaway
title: Leesburg, Virginia

gallery.caption: Living space with dining table, seating and desk.
Fully equipped kitchen with everything you need to prepare and enjoy your meals.
Fully equipped kitchen with everything you need to prepare and enjoy your meals.

Close proximity to Middleburg, Virginia. 
9 miles / 14 minutes.

recent.comments: Lovely rural cottage. Very peaceful.

items.comments: Lovely rural cottage. Very peaceful.

Stephanie’s Airbnb is perfection! We were here for just about a month and found everything we needed and it was really easy to communicate with Stephanie. The fresh eggs, the robes, the animals and the extremely clean home were definite standouts. She even brought us a blender and waffle maker for our stay! Definitely book a stay here, you won’t regret it :)

I have stayed in dozens of AirBnB's over the years as well as being a super host myself. This is by far the best experience I have ever had. Stephanie's attention to detail was absolutely amazing. I can't say enough great things about the property and the quality of the entire stay. This is a must stay KINDA place!

My partner and I had the most amazing getaway at Stephanie’s Farmhouse Getaway.
The place was super super super clean and had all the amenities including extra towels, face cloths, and a full kitchen for us to cook throughout our stay. There is a lot of natural light coming into the place which was nice to wake up to. We really loved how slow paced the environment felt as we wanted to get away from the fast pace city living. We  couldn’t have ask for a more comforting and relaxing stay. Stephanie was super responsive and always made sure we had everything we needed. We most definitely will be staying here again!

Stephanie’s place is amazing! Everything is clean, modern, and full of personal touches like having fresh eggs waiting for you when you arrive. So yummy! The place is packed eight extra toiletries too, if you need them. Bring your shampoo. Country setting, but an easy drive to city amenities. We couldn’t hear the rooster(s) or chickens and slept like babies. I would stay here again and fully recommend.
As always a great stay.
Beautiful secluded stay!

description.summary: **New bedding & towels for 2023** our modern country retreat is perfectly located for visitors seeking a romantic getaway or quiet haven. Nestled on gorgeous wooded land our cottage is perfect for couples or individuals seeking an escape the city noise to enjoy serenity, while still being in proximity to Washington Dulles Airport, I-66, Middleburg and downtown Leesburg. If your trip lends to a more local experience, the area is known for its award winning wineries and unique craft breweries.
description.space:
This simple and elegant farmhouse cottage has been renovated to provide guest with a comfortable country retreat experience. The home décor is in a modern French industrial. Creating a relaxing home base after days filled exploring all that Leesburg and surrounding cities have to offer. The layout is as follows:
Living Room: The living room is the perfect mixture of class and comfort. The blend of botanical accents and plush furnishings allow for conversation and relaxation. If needed the sofa does convert into a bed allowing for an additional sleeping option. 
Kitchen/dining: The fully equipped kitchen features honed white marble, which has also been used in the bathroom, and white French farmhouse style cabinetry. You will find everything you need to prepare a home cooked meal or snack. We also provide guest with farm fresh eggs and seasonally freshly cut flowers. 
Bedroom: As you comfort is our main priority we have furnished the bedroom to reflect a space that is not only cozy, but also functional. The large king bed with high quality linens will guarantee guest get a full night sleep. All furnishing and room décor have been chosen to create the feel of being at your own personal retreat. 
Bathroom: Everything about the bathroom represents quality and relaxation. The main feature is the stunning Aston Vienne Corner Frameless shower. It brings a striking contrast of modern and French design to the overall look of the space. Beyond the beauty of the white honed marble and exquisite shower we provide guest with basic toiletries and all needed towels.
description.access: Guest have full access to the cottage main living quarters and outdoor space. The lower half of the structure is used for a floral company and will be locked when not in use. However, you will have access to the private driveway for vehicle parking.
description.notes: Staying at our cottage is a wildlife and farm experience, you will hear a rooster crowing in the morning, chickens walking by and sometimes a visit from Oliver, the orange farm cat while relaxing on the patio.  Please let us know if you would like daily fresh eggs from the coop or you may help yourself.  A Tesla charging station is also available for guests.
description.neighborhood:
The cottage is located in Leesburg, Virginia with close access to main travel arteries. These include: 
-	15 minutes to I-66
-      15 minutes to Downtown Middleburg
-	20 minutes to Downtown Leesburg
-	25 minutes to Washington Dulles Airport
-	Wineries/Breweries/Distilleries: The area is known for award winning wineries and unique craft breweries. Trying to visit all 50 locations will make a full trip on its own. A good start is  Stone Tower Winery.   You can check out VisitLoudoun.com for a full listing.
-	Historical White’s Ferry: The only cable ferry service that carries cars, bicycles, and pedestrians across the Potomac River. A great way to experience the area and travel to the Maryland side of the Potomac. 
-	Historic Downtown: The historic downtown area offers visitors a unique look at the past and modern culture of Leesburg. The aesthetic provides a picturesque background for a romantic stroll through shops, galleries and local dining. 
-	Historic homes: The rich history in the area lends too many homes and manors that are open to the public. A couple of the notable places being Morven Park and George C. Marshall’s Dodona Manor.
description.transit: Dulles Airport (IAD) is 14 miles from the cottage.  The closest metro station is the Wiehle-Reston East Station (1908 Reston Station Blvd, Reston, VA 20190) which is approximately 18 miles from the cottage.
description.interaction: Your comfort and privacy are our top priority. If you need any assistance or have concerns, I will be readily available throughout your stay. We do live on the property, but the size of the grounds allows for ample space between residences.
description.house_rules: 2 Night Minimum Stay

name: Charming "Cream of the Crop" Cape ~❤️of Middletown
title: Middletown, Maryland

gallery.caption: Cozy Cottage Stay!  Cream of the Crop!
I own the neighboring AIRBNB also. Bring the family!
Grill on the deck!  Grab some steaks!
Light that gas fire pit up!
Snuggle up next to the gas stove!
Kitchen open to family. Lots of entertaining!
So open!  Kitchen equipped for  a chef!
Gather around the center island!   Granite tops, ss appliances.
Have a seat in the breakfast nook! Hot coffee?
Smart TV in upper level master suite.
Walk in closet, BOHO bedding, tile shower....romance!
SOOO comfy! Plush King!  Hello Handsome!
Lower level suite with plush queen bedding.
Private suite with storage room, closet, full bath, laundry.
Wash your hands! Lower level suite bath!

hosts.about: A proud MD native who loves my Middletown hometown! I also love to travel! As a real estate professional and entrepreneur, I am always observing the wants and needs of clients.  I treat travel no different.  When traveling, I know what makes me happy ~ clean , comfy accommodations, plush beds, soft linens & towels, WI FI, cable, tasteful décor, well appointed kitchens, etc  and as a host I aim to offer no less and WOW my guests.  In my spare time, I am an avid boater spending time on the Chesapeake Bay in MD and in FL on the Gulf or in the Keys.  Saltwater is my soul food.    Beach, bay, mountains, trails, small towns  ~ you name it ~ I like it! I also appreciate antiques,  fine wine and breweries, good food ranging from the Cracker Barrel  to fine dining, farmers markets,  fairs and festivals, gardening, a cozy fire and a good book, a Jeep ride on country back roads, and last but not least quality time with family and friends.  I love my career and feel blessed with  the journey it has taken me on and the doors of opportunity it has opened.  I believe in “supporting local” every chance I get.   “Living  life to the fullest” every day is my motto. What can I say ~ “Life is good...” !  I look forward to hosting you at any one or ALL of my four unique, private short term rentals and I am happy to offer area recommendations for your stay ranging from activities to dining. My response time is fast and friendly.

recent.comments: Heather was an amazing host - everything was extremely clear and simple and the place is beautiful and very spacious. It was perfect for what we needed!

items.comments: Heather was an amazing host - everything was extremely clear and simple and the place is beautiful and very spacious. It was perfect for what we needed!
I highly recommend! Beautiful in every possible way.
Loved Heathers place and even had friends rent her cabin next door! Cute neighborhood (you can just feel the history walking down that street!) the house was super clean and comfortable. We loved it!
Great place to stay in Middletown. Clean, walkable to downtown Middletown. Close to Frederick, MD.  Would definitely recommend and stay again.
Great stay!
Heather’s home was absolutely beautiful and cozy. She is a wonderful host that is very attentive to small details that make a big difference.
Lovely home!

description.summary: Cozy cape in the ❤️ of Middletown, MD. Within walking distance to quaint Middletown restaurants, shops, & parks. Set your sights on adventure within a short drive. Enjoy downtown Frederick restaurants, shops, parks, & nightlife. Visit the local wineries, breweries & festivals. Hike the Appalachian trail. Float the Potomac River. Bike the C&O Canal. Ski the slopes @ area ski resorts. Golf 18 holes @ the championship golf course. Visit wedding venues. Go antiquing. Tour quaint nearby towns. Etc
description.space: Catch Cottage Fever! CREAM OF THE CROP in short term rentals.  Straight out of Pinterest ~this charming cape/cottage designed and built in 2015 personally by myself was designed with modern conveniences in mind paired with the charm of yesteryear.  Won't you be my guest :)   Everything about this charmer screams HOMESTEAD!  Enjoy the high speed WIFI and cable. As you enter the front door  from the charming "wood look" trex front porch graced with rockers you will be greeted with a soaring two story ceiling, wood floors,  a floor to ceiling stone hearth with a gas "wood burning" look fireplace.   From the minute you enter the cape a farmhouse, trendy, boho style feel will  embrace you.  Furnished in 2019 with all new Wolf furniture to include in the two story family room a reclining sectional,  smart 49 inch TV, toss pillows, plush cable blankets, industrial style end and coffee tables, burlap rug, gas fireplace, and  decor to catch your fancy for hours including antique hurricane lamps to catch up on a good read by.  Wander to the big, open kitchen and there is a chefs dream - farmhouse style kitchen with ss appliances, huge center island, bar stools, and furnished with all new 2019 small appliances and cookware to  include but not limited to coffee maker, blender, toaster, small gadgets ~ corkscrew, can opener, bottle opener, etc, pots & pans, bakeware, roaster, silverware, wine glasses etc.  Your brunch is served on Magnolias "Hearth and Hand" farmhouse dinnerware.  A few bottled waters and coffee & creamers are there on arrival. The kitchen nook is furnished with a distressed table and AGAIN, admire the decor throughout - a screen door leads to the trex deck in rear yard furnished with wicker lounger, whimsical string lights, and a gas firepit and grill.  The dreamy master on the upper level is just that - DREAMY! Furnished with a plush king size memory foam mattress, hotel style sheets, fuzzy blankets, and  boho style duvet and shams this bedroom assures sleep for hours.  A 43 inch smart TV to Netflix and chill. 2019 Wolf dresser and nightstand with a lamp for reading. More decor upstairs to admire.  A large walk in closet for longer stays, and a trendy master bath with floor to ceiling tile shower.  Soft, plush towels for a wonderful showering experience.   The lower level master suite is fabulous as well.  A plus queen size memory foam mattress awaits you there.  The decor in this suite screams patriotic from the new navy dresser and nightstand, to the red, white, and blue bedding, to the new red recliner.  There is also a desk in this area for those who need to work.  The lower level has its own tile full bath and laundry room as well.  There is a flat screen TV in lower level suite. There is also an inflatable queen size bed in the storage room. There is no shortage for extra towels, pillows, or bed sheets for either level suite.  High speed internet and cable make the stay very enjoyable not to mention work friendly.  A shed for storage during your stay if you bring bikes, kayaks,  skis, golf clubs etc...A paved drive with two parking spaces.  There are so many adventures to explore nearby but you won't want to leave your getaway cape.  For the business traveler, this cape offers an affordable, comfortable stay and a private place to unwind after the work day is over with many options to grab a bite to eat and a cocktail before turning in or throw a steak on the grill and enjoy some quiet time in the backyard or some front porch sitting in the rockers.  Please refer to cancellation policy for any cancellations as all cancellations/refunds  are outlined in the policy and only processed as such.
description.access: Guests enjoy the entire home  &  porches, rear deck, driveway, yard.  There is a small storage shed for storage as well as vacant room on lower level for storage of luggage, etc...
description.neighborhood: This cape is located within walking distance to the popular Main Cup Restaurant known for mouth watering cuisine, coffee, spirits, and Sunday brunch.  Also within walking distance is Dempsey's  diner, Moores ice cream shop, and LDS convenience store with a full service deli, convenience items, and gas for your day adventure. Rudys Cold Beer for your spirits during your stay. Within a short drive in town there is Fratelli's Restaurant voted #1 for their crab cakes, Valley Grill, a sports bar located at the Hollow Creek Golf Course, Black Hog BBQ, Tapias, and James Gang Pizzeria.  Dunkin Donuts is also nearby and a Starbucks in the Safeway.
description.transit: Centrally located to many hot spots but also a great small town to enjoy by foot as many of the other small towns in the area. A great location for those staying in town on business as a central location for a commute to Frederick, Baltimore, Virginia, Rockville, DC, etc..
description.interaction: I am available via txt and email and respond quickly.  Also via phone but the other two options offer quicker response time.

name: Vineyard View Chalet
title: Purcellville, Virginia

gallery.caption: Everything you could want for a fun family or friend getaway! Multiple firepits, Lots of seating on the deck and around the pool.  There is also a kids playset just past the pool that is not pictured here.  Has two slides, a rock wall, & three swings

The deck features ~900 sq ft from the master bedroom to the kitchen and panoramic views of the vineyard and opposing ridge line. 

Comfortable seating for the whole group!
Newly expanded deck with 7-person hot tub and plenty of seating.
The main living area has a wood burning fireplace with floor to ceiling hearth and majestic views out of the 16 foot tall windows.
There is an additional dining table not pictured to the left of this frame.  Three dining tables in total and a breakfast bar provide seating for up to 18 people.
Nothing like a relaxing snooze while swinging in the shade!

This is what you will see coming up the driveway.  Stay to the left and the pavement portion will take you directly to the house.

Note that the road to the house is gravel and the driveway leading to this point is also gravel.
Dining table seats up to 10. Additional tables and chairs are available upon request.
Entry foyer with buffet that contains formal dinnerware and extra serveware.

Foyer leads into the main living area.  To the right is the Master bedroom and bathroom. Central is the main stair to upper bedrooms and down to the basement.  To the left is the kitchen and dining area and another staircase to an ensuite bed/bath.

The main living area features 20+ foot ceilings, a wood-burning fireplace, and plenty of seating.  
Please note that the furnishings in this area make it unsuitable for rowdy activity.  The basement is setup for more rambunctious gatherings.
86" 4k TV with surround sound, record player and plenty of vinyl on hand.
Swing chair is perfect for relaxing with a good book!
Access to the living room from the dining area.
Half bathroom on the main floor between the living and dining areas.
Kitchen and dining areas feature vaulted ceilings and plenty of natural light.

Kitchen is stocked with coffee pods, coffee grounds, splenda/sugar, coffee syrups and green tea bags.  Not pictured is the recently added hot chocolate bar--10 different flavors of hot cocoa and mini marshmallows.

Austrian tile stove (we call it the Green Monster) has a firebox that heats a cooking surface, an oven, and the bench on the opposite side. 
Contact the property manager before attempting to operate as you can easily smoke out the entire house!

Bay windows and skylights make this room perfect for putting together puzzles or playing games; keeping the kids entertained while parents mingle in the kitchen and dining areas.  
The 65" 4k TV in the kitchen can display artwork when not in use.
Games and puzzles for the whole family.

Master bedroom canopy bed with sheers for romantic effect.  
Fireplace is not currently in service.
Master Bathroom water closet has Japanese toilet with all the bells and whistles!
15' tall Holiday tree will be up from Thanksgiving to late January.  It really is a sight to see!
Upstairs bedroom with a queen size bed.  Shares a bathroom with the kids room.
Kids room is appointed with loft bed and futon underneath, plus a bunk bed in the loft area-- up the stairs you see on the right.

Stairs to the loft level in the kids bedroom.  Stairs are sturdy enough for adults. 

Loft area is for sleeping only; no horseplay for safety reasons.
Looking down from the kids loft
Bunk bed in the kids loft.  Not recommended for children under 5.  Stairs could be treacherous for a young child that wakes in the night.
Fun decor and toys in the kids room will provide hours of entertainment.  Velcro darts, train tracks, toy food items etc.
Walk in closet in the kids room to store luggage, clothes, or to use as extra play space
Staircase in auxiliary dining area leads to a loft area and ensuite bed/bath.
Loft with bean bags is a fun hangout for kids/teens or can be fitted with a twin air mattress.
From the bean bag area you enter another bedroom with a queen bed, a futon, and it's own bathroom.
Sliding doors to a balcony with sweeping views of the opposing ridgeline.
Bedroom is fitted with a 65" 4k TV, a leather couch and it's own HVAC unit.

Rec room has fun for all ages and is a walkout with several windows.  No dark dank basement here!

Please note that the shuffleboard table plays best with MINIMAL sand.  You should barely be able to see it on the plank or the pucks will move too fast
Poker set is provided, however if you are serious card players, you might want to bring your own deck in case the one in the set is missing cards :-)
120' projector screen with 4k projector for clear and crisp picture.  Screen and sound system have been upgraded since this picture.
The skeeball table is popular with all ages.  It's my favorite game in the house!

Rec-Tec pellet smoker/grill is easy to use and app enabled.  Anyone can smoke a juicy prime rib or fall off the bone ribs with this user friendly appliance. Ask the property owner for recipes!

Blackstone griddle has air fryer and warmer drawer.

The vineyard is part of the property.  During the warm months, workers may be present but not in guest areas.  If chemical sprays need to be applied, you will be notifed in advance if you need to vacate the pool area-- usually for only 30-40 minutes.

recent.comments:
We had the best time. Keri was very quick to respond with any questions. The house was so lovely, and so much to do, especially for the kids. It was great cooking in the kitchen, had everything we needed to make large family meals. The living room was my favorite space for the adults to relax and listen to the great album collection with a glass of wine.  Location perfect to get to any of the many winery’s in the area, and quick ride to explore Harpers Ferry. Be sure to visit Stoneybrook Farmer’s Market close by in “The Gap”. We went almost every morning for fresh sourdough bread and sweet rolls. 
Overall and amazing vacation, and we will be coming back.

items.comments:
We had the best time. Keri was very quick to respond with any questions. The house was so lovely, and so much to do, especially for the kids. It was great cooking in the kitchen, had everything we needed to make large family meals. The living room was my favorite space for the adults to relax and listen to the great album collection with a glass of wine.  Location perfect to get to any of the many winery’s in the area, and quick ride to explore Harpers Ferry. Be sure to visit Stoneybrook Farmer’s Market close by in “The Gap”. We went almost every morning for fresh sourdough bread and sweet rolls. 
Overall and amazing vacation, and we will be coming back.
We had a great family vacation ! The house is well equipped and the host was extremely accommodating. Great place to do as little or as much as you want. Our family plans to return next year!
Very nice house! Lots to do for the kids! The AC unit did go out but was fixed very quick! Loved the house.

This house is truly gorgeous. The furniture is beautiful and the kitchen is fit for a chef. Our family of five and two dogs had a peaceful week by the pool. It’s right across the street from a lovely winery. Recommend!

Keri’s house was great. Our group was made up of two families, with kids. Having linens and towels made packing so convenient. The kitchen was well equipped for cooking meals for a large group. The house was clean. There’s lots of hiking in the area. Keri was very responsive.

fantastic home for our intended purpose of gathering our family from all over the country.  It rained during our entire stay but all of the available indoor features made it wonderful for everyone.  Very responsive host

We had a wonderful family gathering to celebrate a birthday. The house was big enough so that everyone could find their own space and activities - sleeping in the hammock, reading in the swing, lounging in the hot tub, playing in the pool. The kids loved the games in the basement. Movie night on the big screen was fabulous! This house had everything and we all agreed it was perfect for our group. Close to multiple wineries and hiking trails. Host was very responsive.

description.summary:
NEW! Expanded deck with 7 person hot tub

Peaceful and private log home with sweeping views of the vineyard and ridgeline.  Relax by the pool, prepare gourmet meals in the well-equipped kitchen and on the deck (pellet smoker/grill and blacktop griddle w/ air fryer). 

Expansive living areas flooded with light and a lower lvl rec area with a 100" 4k projector, shuffleboard, skeeball, darts and poker. 

Beds: 2K, 2Q, 2 Futon (36x67), 3 Twin (for kids only)
description.access: The entire house aside from a few locked areas are available to the guests.  The vineyard is accessible by approval only as chemical may have been recently applied. Laborers and/or vineyard manager may be onsite for maintenance but will not impinge on guest areas.
description.notes: Sleeps 8 adults and up to 5 children.  Additional adults must be approved and will incur a surcharge even if there are no children, as additional adults will require furniture to be moved, air beds to be setup, etc.
description.interaction:
In most cases I will be within 30 minutes to an hour away In case a guest requires in person assistance. Otherwise the guests will have full privacy. 

As the house is located on a working vineyard, there may be occasions where laborers or the property manager are on- site. They will remain within the vineyard space.
description.house_rules:
- Only the guests numbered in the original reservation are permitted on the property.  Additional guests (even temporary visitors) must be pre-approved by the property owner. Exterior security cameras may be monitored to enforce this rule and violations could result in cancellation of your stay. 
- Special events are on a case-by-case basis and may incur surcharges.
- No Smoking indoors, cigarette waste receptacles are provided outside. 
- No wet swimsuits or clothes allowed in the upper floors of the house or on ANY furniture.  Please use only the basement bathroom or the exterior entrance to the master bathroom in these cases.
- No food/glass/cigarettes in the hot tub.  Any evidence of unsuitable matter in the hot tub will incur a $500 fee to drain/clean/refill the hot tub. 
- Parties with young children will be provided with hot tub cover locks for safety.  Locks must be in place when the hot tub area is not supervised by adults.
- You are here to party- please have a great time!  The basement recreation area is specifically suited for rowdier activities.  Please reserve the upper living areas for less rambunctious gatherings.  This reduces risk to the guests and the host for damages.
- Pool is generally open from Memorial Day to Labor Day.  Season may be extended if weather permits.
- No glass by the pool, no running or horseplay by the pool. Obviously no peeing in the pool :-). 
- Chemical sprays may have been applied in the vineyard that require a time interval before reentry.  Please ask the property manager if you would like to take a vineyard tour.
-Pets are on a case by case basis. Inquire at booking. 
- Please respect other posted rules and instructions for the use of the hot tub, sauna and other appliances/amenities.  This is for guest safety and enjoyment. 
- Do not hesitate to reach out to the property manager with any questions/concerns/suggestions or to report any issue or accident.  The goal is for you to enjoy your stay to the fullest! As long as you respect the space like you would if it were yours, all parties will be happy.  Accidents can happen regardless of the utmost care and we understand that.  Early reporting of any issues will help minimize damage and expense.  Thank you!

name: Quiet Studio Basement Apartment
title: Sykesville, Maryland

gallery.caption: Brand new toaster over and coffee machine.
I often stand on my front stoop just to enjoy the sunset and the peace it brings.
View from our house! We live across from a beautiful cornfield.
Feel free to enjoy my beautiful deck with a relaxing view of the forest.
Here is the private entrance to your suite.
This is the driveway you can park in to access the back of the house. It is a private entrance for you only.

hosts.about:
BEFORE WE BEGIN, ALL GUESTS ARE REQUIRED TO EMAIL ME A COPY OF HIS OR HER VACCINATION AND BOOSTER CARDS BEFORE YOUR RESERVATION CAN BE CONFIRMED.  

BECAUSE OF THE IMPENDING ISSUES THIS WINTER, WITH COVID AND THE OMICRON VARIANT,  I AM NOT WILLING TO HAVE UNVACCINATED GUESTS STAY.  THANK YOU.

 Hello!  My name is Camilla.  I am originally from Washington DC but have lived all over the world—Spain, England, France, Germany, Okinawa, San Francisco, Seattle—to name a few.  

I have retired from my job as a Proposal Developer with a nationwide medical staffing company.  I earned my BFA at Goddard College at the age of 62--a life-long goal, finally achieved.

I have two children—a son who lives in Houston with his wife and baby daughter, and a daughter who has just become a physician and will be moving to Louisville, Kentucky, to begin her internship with her husband, an IT professional.

I am an avid reader and belong to two book clubs.  I am slowly beginning to enjoy gardening.  I go to an exercise class for old ladies like me, and a yoga class.  Absolutely love music of all kinds, especially blues, rock and Latino.

Twenty-eight years ago we moved to Howard County to raise our family, and we never left.  The countryside is beautiful, peaceful and quiet.  As you can see from my photos, the view from my front door is truly rural Maryland at its best.

Sykesville was just named The Coolest Small Town in America.  It is also one of the safest. The businesses are independently owned.  There are four unique clothing stores, a great book store, and an excellent hair salon.  There are five small restaurants, including a creperie, a sports bar, a higher-end eatery which is a converted train station, a wine bar, and a deli.  We have a farmer’s market every Sunday morning, just off Main Street.   It is a wonderful place to live.

I would love to have you stay with me and experience Sykesville, as I do every day.

Welcome!

recent.comments: Mrs. Camilla is an excellent host and the location is a perfect getaway. Easy to get to, not far from DC, Baltimore, Columbia; the house is situated perfectly to get away from all of the above (or a great spot off I-70 to stop for a night or two as well). She is very friendly and communicative. The house is clean and private, with its own entrance. Absolutely recommend staying here if you are in the area or looking for a peaceful retreat that isn't too far from anywhere!

items.comments: Mrs. Camilla is an excellent host and the location is a perfect getaway. Easy to get to, not far from DC, Baltimore, Columbia; the house is situated perfectly to get away from all of the above (or a great spot off I-70 to stop for a night or two as well). She is very friendly and communicative. The house is clean and private, with its own entrance. Absolutely recommend staying here if you are in the area or looking for a peaceful retreat that isn't too far from anywhere!
Clean and cozy. Would come back next time we’re in Maryland!
Great stay! And a great host!

Camilla was very accommodating. She let me in through the house when I arrived since a bad storm was just letting up so I wouldn't slip on the outside steps. The space was quaint and comfortable and has its own entrance outside. There were snacks, coffee/tea/water, and appliances to heat things up. The bed was super comfortable and I loved the pillows! It was very homey, with places to eat, work, or rest. There was a closet to hang clothes, two suitcase caddies, a heater (if needed), and a dehumidifier (which worked a lot being the summer and after a major storm). I loved that it was super quiet so I could concentrate on working when I needed to, and it was very close to downtown Sykesville and Eldersburg, where I needed to be during my stay. There was separate parking, which was convenient.  This space is in a lovely wooded, quiet location. I would stay at Camilla's again if the need arose for me to stay in the area.  Highly recommend!

The thing that really stood out to me during my very brief stay was the note in the welcome package that said how close Gettysburg was (an hour away!). I left early and spent the whole afternoon in the scorching heat of the many battlefields of Gettysburg. I hadn’t been since I was a sullen teenager and I have been wanting to go back as an adult for years and years. Thank you for noting this, otherwise I wouldn’t have even thought about it!
Good location with wonderful bedding and comfort! Appreciated the snacks and info on the area's attractions and restaurants.

Camilla was fantastic communicator. Her place looks exactly as pictured. Is described accurately and is a good deal. Was 4 mi from a wedding we attended. Would be great if it had a tv. If you haven’t slept in a full size (double) bed- and there are 2 of you (average size)- it’s just not comfortable. I can see being comfortable enough for 1 person, but 2 of us just didn’t sleep well at all. The mattress is just ok- the bedding was spectacular. It was cool and dry in the basement and I loved the white noise provided by the dehumidifier. Charles loved the snacks. The design is kitschy- and cool. An upgraded and larger bed would have made it perfect. I did see it was full size when I booked- but haven’t slept in that size bed in almost 20 years. I read that the bed was an issue for other guests- but you just don’t think it’s going to be a problem….until it is.

description.summary: Welcome to my private studio apartment with a separate entrance and private bath.  There is a mini fridge, microwave, toaster oven, coffee pot, tea, sugar, half and half.  Bottled filtered water. Recently renovated bathroom, fresh towels, wash cloths and soap, shampoo and conditioner, sheets and bedspread.  Iron and ironing board.
description.space: My apartment is decorated in the minimalist style--full-sized bed with linens and breadspread, bedside tables and lamps, plenty of counter space for eating and preparing food.  Mini fridge, toaster oven and microwave.  Snacks, coffee, tea, bottled water, filtered water for coffee.  The bathroom has a large shower, new vanity and toilet, recessed lighting, mid-century flooring and tiles, newly painted--a fun and eclectic style.
description.access:
On some occasions you will need to access my place using the lock box.  Of course I will let you know when that is necessary.  

Open the weather proof cover.  
Push the button labeled C down to clear the previous code. 
Enter the code.  
Push the button with the arrow down and the key pad will open.  
You will find the key there.  
Just snap the key pad back into place, as well as the weather proof cover.  

I will leave an extra key on the counter for your convenience if you don't want to use the lock box every time.                 

You are welcome to share my deck, which overlooks the back of the property.  A lovely place to have morning coffee or a glass of wine in the evening, read a book, enjoy the country air and the beautiful surroundings.  

Please use the driveway to the right of the main driveway and park on the street side of the brick barbecue, which will be on your left.  Go around the deck to the basement steps.  It is well-lit if you arrive at night or return from an activity when it's dark.
description.notes:
There are many fine wineries in the area, in beautiful rural settings, where you can do a tasting or just enjoy a glass or two of local Maryland wine.

(URL HIDDEN)

Historic Harper’s Ferry where abolitionist John Brown led a group of 21 men in a raid on the arsenal, is just under an hour from Sykesville. The town was a crossroads for troops on both sides of the conflict and is full of history for Civil War buffs.  

(URL HIDDEN)

It is also a fantastic place for tubing on the confluence of the Potomac and Shenandoah rivers.

(URL HIDDEN)

Another site for history buffs, is the iconic town of Gettysburg, famous for the Battle of Gettysburg, a turning point in the Civil War, and the inspiration for President Abraham Lincoln's immortal "Gettysburg Address" is approximately an hour from Sykesville. 

(URL HIDDEN)

Frederick, Maryland is a charming city full of history with a wonderful old town section with beautiful row houses, restaurants, bars and shops.  It is located about 20 minutes from Sykesville.

(URL HIDDEN)

Over forty miles of the Appalachian Trail travel across Maryland, with most of the AT following the ridge line of South Mountain. 

 (URL HIDDEN)
description.neighborhood: There is so much to see and do in Sykesville.  You will find my Guidebook when you arrive with links that describe all that Sykesville has to offer, including restaurants, shops, bars, events, attractions, and sports, as well as parks and trails, boating, and wine tastings, among others. We have a brand-new skate board park and a playground.  What a treat to see kids and parents enjoying these facilities.
description.transit: Sykesville is definitely in a rural area, meaning there is no public transportation available.
description.interaction: I'm happy to interact with you as often or as little as you'd like. I'm completely available to communicate with you 24/7 - just text me.

Linda was very responsive and called to check in on us to see if we needed anything.  Great HOST!! Will be back .

My husband, daughter, dog, and I had a wonderful time at this Airbnb! We are moving out of the area in a few days and this was exactly what we needed to get away from all of the chaos.  Linda was so incredibly kind to all of us! We really appreciated the fresh eggs, her homemade cookies, and her handwritten welcome note upon arrival!  The apartment looked just like the pictures, if not better. Super cozy! And the property was amazing.  We loved sitting by the pool, visiting the chickens, and having dinner by the koi pond.  We really did not want to leave!

Inviting home with spacious outdoors. Came to visit family in nearby Vint Hill area, just a short 10min drive. A beautiful space with lots of room for our family of 4 and our pup. Our girls were very comfortable on the pullout couch and bathrooms and kitchen were both generous sizes. Outside was just as nice with spaces to enjoy the peaceful neighborhood. Linda and Rob were so nice and welcoming to us and our children. We got to feed their chickens and fish and take a dip in their refreshing pool. We even got to meet one of their cute pups. We hope to stay again and would definitely recommend to anyone coming to the area!

Linda and her family were wonderful hosts. We enjoyed a peaceful getaway that made us feel like we were at home. The amenities were as described with fresh cookies, fresh eggs and wine was a perk that definitely stood out and was appreciated. There is plenty of space and lots to do. Looking forward to my next "retreat" there!

We loved our stay. Only an hour from the city, this was a perfect getaway. Beautiful roads to take walks down, the pool was amazing. The owners were so nice and even left us wine, fresh chicken eggs, and home cooked chocolate chip cookies. It was so sweet. We will be back again!

This 1-bedroom, 2.5-bathroom Virginia vacation rental makes the perfect home base for seeing the sights of Central Virginia! Take a day to visit local wineries, stroll through Old Town Warrenton, or explore Shenandoah National Park — all just a short drive away. When you return in the evening, relax outside and maximize your fresh air intake, or cozy up on the couch to stream your favorites on the Smart TV.

recent.comments: It was perfect for my getaway. The property was serene and beautiful. I will come again.

items.comments: It was perfect for my getaway. The property was serene and beautiful. I will come again.

PEACEFUL!  This place was everything I need then some. I loved the open floor plan, very clean, very quite, and very secluded. It was a great place for my dogs too! I would definitely recommend the Stoney Cottage! 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟
Amazing time!! Would recommend and come again.
The stay was very peaceful. It was very clean and neat.
The surroundings are beautiful! It is private and very peaceful. The space is adorable and very comfortable. Absolutely loved our stay here!

The cottage was beautiful and perfect for mine and my husband's honeymoon destination. Perfectly midway between Richmond, Front Royal, and D.C. so we were able to do so many things in the cities as well as take a nice drive on Skyline. Tons of cute wildlife to be seen. The firepit was great! If you're looking for a nice secluded cottage this is the place!

It’s a Beautiful and peaceful place and location.
You can hear the cows and birds in the morning.
The drive during the day it’s very nice. At night is very very dark. And although the cottage has great lighting and around it, the surroundings of the cottage are quite dark as well. If you love cottage/cabin in the middle of the wilderness, then this place is 100% for you. My kids were a little nervous at night. But I absolutely loved it! Totally worth it!

description.summary: The Stoney Cottage is located on a 20 acre farm in the middle of beautiful Fauquier County. It provides a unique and peaceful getaway while still offering a lot of local attractions. It is conveniently located to many local attractions such as wineries, breweries, Farmers Markets, The Flying Circus air show, Civil War battlefields and the Shenandoah National Park.
description.space:
Peacefully located in the woods but surrounded by acres of open land, the Cottage has much to offer. Wildlife such as deer, turkeys, squirrels, birds and even an occasional bald eagle call this place home. Cows can be seen grazing the nearby fields. 
The Cottage has an open and spacious floor plan. It has a fully furnished kitchen and a bathroom that offers a walk-in shower. Wi-Fi is provided to allow you to conduct business, check emails or relax and enjoy a Netflix show. The living area has a dining table, two couches and a queen bed with a new memory foam mattress that will be sure to give you a good nights rest. In the morning, enjoy a complimentary cup of coffee or tea. 
If you are looking to get away from the hustle and bustle and yet be close to so much, the Stoney Cottage may be just the right place for you.
description.access: Guest can access the Cottage with a door keypad code that will be given to them in the morning of check in.
description.notes: The Cottage has an outdoor fire ring for your enjoyment. Firewood can be purchased (when available) for an additional fee.
description.interaction: Host can be reached by phone, text or email.

My boyfriend and I stayed at Natalie's beautiful place for a couple of days and it was exactly what we needed! The place was so cozy and welcoming. We never wanted to leave! We cannot wait to be back soon.

One caution: if you arrive after dark, as we did, you might want to call her to get expert instructions on parking and which door to enter the barn.  Enjoy!

This was a wonderful getaway,  beautiful surroundings, great location, and a very charming place

I would definitely stay here again!! 
Loved everything about this place

Thank you for allowing us to experience your beautiful loft
Margaret Flannery

description.summary: Welcome to Windy Hill Loft!  Our cozy and completely private getaway in the heart of Virginia Wine Country.  This is a completely unique stay experience in our Loft built inside our Red Barn!  The views of the Mountains will wow you while enjoying the privacy and tranquility of your room in the treetops.  Within 2 miles of some of the best wineries in the area and only a 15 min. drive into downtown Leesburg, Windy Hill is the perfect place to relax after a fun day in the Country.
description.space: Our barn houses our horses tack, food and other property related supplies.  We are a working farmette so guests may see us tending to our horses or tacking them up to ride, grooming them or working in the pasture.  The Loft, however, has a completely private and separate entrance so guests are not disturbed by the goings on at our property.
description.access: Guests have a clear "LOFT" entrance and can enjoy a dedicated space with 2 adirondack chairs and smokeless firepit.  Guests are welcome to take walks around the property but please be mindful of our other animals ie: cats and 2 very sweet dogs (who are contained by an invisible fence) and away from guests area.
description.notes:
We are a semi-self sustaining property.  We do not have access to sewer/or septic so we have installed a very high end Scandinavian made "incinerating toilet".   For more information please look up:  Cinderella Freedom Incineration Toilet
There is no odor, is connected to power and gas, and it only requires guests to use a filter, sit while using, close the lid and press a button.  That's it!  The instructions are clearly marked and are available in the Loft in multiple places.
Additionally, we have installed a sophisticated irrigation recycling system that utilizes all of the "grey" water from the shower and the sink to irrigate our landscaping beds surrounding the Barn area.
description.neighborhood: Rural Setting
description.transit: Our Property is accessed by a gravel and grass rd. off of the main paved road.  There are marked signs designating where to park.
description.interaction: Guests will receive all instructions via email at various stages of the booking process.
description.house_rules: We have 2 horses that guests are welcome to visit, however, we ask that you please be careful and do not feed  them outside snacks.  Our girls are on special diets!  Also, please do not enter the pasture.

We stayed here for our 4 year anniversary. I cannot say nearly enough good things about our stay. The hosts were responsive but not pushy. The cottage was clean and filled with amenities I didn’t expect but were well appreciated. The animals on site were friendly and truly a highlight of our stay. I fully suggest this Airbnb if you are planning on staying anywhere nearby. Thank you so much for the warm and inviting space!
