Amazing stay! One of the most peaceful locations I have ever stayed at. Not to mention the area is beautiful. The cottage was super clean and cozy. Great weekend!
Lovely space in a beautiful location.  Loved the closeness to the town of Purcellville.  100% would stay again.  Bed was really comfortable. Host was very thorough, welcoming and nice.

We had such a great time! The dogs loved the farm and all the smells, and Claudia was sweet enough to put out water bowls and a toy for them before we arrived. The place was clean and looked exactly like the pictures, and had thoughtful touches like toiletries, snacks, and bottled water. The surrounding area was beautiful, we will definitely be back to visit again!

description.summary: Escape to the country and enjoy a stay in a charming king bed cottage located on a historic 1700s farm with chickens, pigs and cows. This peaceful getaway is just outside the Blue Ridge Mountains and located in the heart of Virginia wine country. Enjoy a variety of wineries, breweries and hikes and visit the town of Purcellville where you can find grocery stores, coffee shops and local restaurants just 10 minutes away. Fast wifi makes it perfect for work from home trips. Bring your pup too!
description.space:
The Greenhouse is a tiny (~280 sq. ft) one level cottage in the countryside with a king size bed, usb table lamps, full bathroom, dining table, ac/heat, sofa, kitchenette (no oven but there is a countertop cooktop for light cooking), fire pit and fast wifi. There is a step down from the front door to enter the cottage. 

This cottage is pet friendly and can accommodate up to 2 small dogs under 30lbs each or one dog up to 50 lbs.  If bringing your pup, they must be added to the reservation. There is a $40 pet fee per stay. Cats are not permitted.

The cottage is on a 25 acre historic farm that is being restored to a working farm. We have Kune Kune pigs, cows, and several chickens. You will hear pigs snorting, cows mooing, chickens singing and our roosters crowing. :) The farm is a beautiful place to walk around! The wifi speed (we are on comcast) is fast and great for a work from home retreat!

We are located near several wedding venues:

Sylvanside Farm: .3 mi (3 min.)
Shadow Creek:     5 mi (9 min.)
The Manor at Airmont: 5.1 mi (11 min.)
Tranquility Farm: 5.3 mi (12 min.)
Bluemont Vineyard: 7.8 mi (16 min.)
description.access: As soon as you enter the farm, you will see a designated parking area to the left. Park at the first gravel parking lot to your left and walk the stone path up to the Greenhouse.
description.notes:
The property is in rural Purcellville and is off a gravel road. It may seem like you’re in the middle of no where when driving out, but it’s just 10 minutes away from town! 

The cottage is located on a historic farm that is slowly being restored back to a working farm. We welcome guests to explore the property and enjoy some time by the creek. We do ask that guest do not enter any buildings as this property is currently undergoing renovation. There is a stone house from 1760 as well as a spring house that we ask guests not to enter as it is currently not up to safety standards.

There is another one bedroom cottage on the property called the Perch. The cottages are nicely spaced apart and have their own private driveway, patio and fire pit.

The cottage is located near several wedding venues, wineries and breweries:
 
Sylvanside Farm .3 mi
Blooming Hill Lavender Farm 1.3 mi
Endhardt Vineyards 4.2 mi
Catoctin Creek Distillery 4.8 mi
Otium Cellars 5.2 mi
Shadow Creek 5 mi
Tranquility Farm 5.3 mi
Whitehall Estate 6.9 mi
Dirt Farm Brewing 7.7 mi
Bluemont Vineyard 7.8 mi
Twin Oaks Tavern Winery 8.6 mi
Bear Chase Brewery 8.8 mi
The Barns at Hamilton Station 9.3mi
description.neighborhood: This beautiful farm is tucked away in the countryside of Western Loudoun but is located only 10 minutes from the town of Purcellville! There is a general store that is just 5 minutes away.  It is a 2 minute drive to Sylvanside Wedding Venue and 5 minutes from Blooming Hill Lavender Farm.  It is also conveniently located to several wineries, breweries and hiking trails.
description.transit: As soon as you enter the farm, you will see a designated parking area to the left that says “Greenhouse Parking.” Park at the first gravel parking lot to your left and walk the stone path up to the Greenhouse.
description.interaction: Throughout your stay, we will be available for any questions. Feel free to message us through AirBnB. You may see us working around the farm and tending to the animals. Please feel free to say hi! :)
description.house_rules:
This is a tiny cottage and can only accommodate up to 2 small dogs under 30 lbs each or 1 dog up to 50 lbs. Cats are not permitted. Please do not allow dogs on the furniture or bed. Dogs must be crated if left alone in the cottage. Please keep dogs on leash when outside and pick up after them.  

There is a ring doorbell outside the front door for security purposes and for check in assistance. Do not tamper or cover the camera.

No extra guests. This is a small cottage and maximum occupancy is 2 guests. Only booked guests allowed on property. 

No smoking in or right outside the cottage. Please properly dispose of cigarettes outside in the ashtray next to the camera. 

This cottage is on a historic property. There are several historical buildings that are not safe to enter. Please do not enter any buildings on the property. 

We are currently restoring this property to a working farm. We have pigs, and chickens on the property. You are more than welcome to visit them, but please do not open any gates and use caution near farm animals. 

Please do not drive on the grass.

Checkout Rule are Simple! :
Turn off lights
Take out trash
Put key back in lockbox

name: Fox Haven Organic Farm's Spring House
title: Middletown, Maryland

gallery.caption: Walk the Red Bud pasture path for serenity
Beautiful even on a cloudy day!
Meander along the creek and listen to the birds
Kitchen with modern conveniences, a handy bathroom and plenty of charm.
Woodstove and a door to the kitchen garden.
A beautiful retreat awaits you at Fox Haven Farms Spring House.  Carefully restored historic farmhouse and acres and acres of trails, forests, and creeks will renew body,mind, and spirit.
Room for 4 in this bedroom - just call it a slumber party!
Tranquil upstairs bedroom with beautiful view.
Plenty of room to gather in front of a cozy fire in winter or stretch out with cool country breezes in summer months.
In case you decide to make a retreat out of your stay, we also have the Big red barn, the Dairy Parlor gathering space, Chestnut house and Fox house
Dairy Parlor - lovely space with warm wood floors, kitchenette

hosts.about: Fox Haven Organic Farm & Learning Center is my passion.  I am happiest when touring young and older folks around the farm, teaching about where our food comes from, healthy farming and gardening that leads to healthy soil, waterways, humans, and critters.  Forests are my playgrounds.  Our young adult children help and that is the best!  Frederick, MD is a favorite place on this planet to eat, walk, talk with shop owners and artists, and attend Quaker Meeting for Worship.  This precious part of Maryland is a wonderful place to visit and live.

recent.comments: We really enjoyed our stay in this rustic farmhouse. It was spacious enough for our large family and was very well situated in a beautiful location. The scenery was stunning!

items.comments: We really enjoyed our stay in this rustic farmhouse. It was spacious enough for our large family and was very well situated in a beautiful location. The scenery was stunning!
beautiful old farmhouse in the country.
Beautiful place, perfect for a quiet weekend.
This farmhouse is a favorite to host my retreats.  It's cozy and love the wood floors and beams.  Very clean with updated appliances.  Hope to be back again soon!

Spring House at Fox Haven was beautiful and peaceful. It was the perfect place for our family reunion! JoAnn is a great hostess to work with.  The house was big, clean, and the perfect place to gather together.

Staying at the Spring House was a lovely experience for my group and I. JoAnn was a wonderful host and gave plenty of insight on activities nearby, places to eat, etc. The farm we stayed on was beautiful and the house was clean and had such an old style farmhouse charm to it. This house was perfect for a group of 12, and there were plenty of rooms for us to have our own space but also come together in the dining room to eat together
Pretty setting and clean house. Lovely stay!

description.summary: Peaceful countryside surrounds you with woods, streams, and pasture. The restored farmhouse has loads of room and porches where you can soak in a sunrise and a sunset. Birders paradise! Harper's Ferry, Frederick, Shepherdstown offer loads of fun and history.  Two other houses, and a re-purposed Dairy Parlor are available for retreats too. Your stay supports farm programs that we offer children and adults from low income communities, people suffering with PTSD, and other life challenges.
description.space:
Spring House is a part of Fox Haven - a historic organic farm and non-profit ecological education center located along the Catoctin Creek in Jefferson, Maryland, within one hour of Washington D.C.  and 15 minutes from the charming town of Frederick, MD.  The restored farmhouse is in a tranquil location, surrounded by fields, forests, and trails.  Wide-planked wooden floors, found treasures from the farmland and creek, beds piled high with handmade quilts, and porches with views that immediately lower your blood pressure and make you sigh, “aah” create a haven for a weekend getaway, family vacation, working retreat, and learning adventure.
- 1 bedroom with queen bed and full sized futon
- 1 bedroom with double bed and 2 twin beds
- 1 bedroom with 3 twin beds
- 1 bedroom with 4 twin beds
- 1 downstairs room with double futon
Full kitchen with dishwasher
Half bath on first floor, 2 full baths and washer/dryer on second floor.
When you want to explore beyond the farm, lovely downtown Frederick offers a variety of shops, award winning restaurants, parks, performing arts theaters, Frederick Keys minor league baseball, and free concerts during the summer months.  Jefferson, I dare say, has one of the best pastry shops within 100 miles.  Let the sweet smell of homemade donuts and cakes guide you!  Harper’s Ferry, Antietam, Sharpsburg, and even Gettysburg are all within a 20-50 minute drive for those who relish civil war history.  For the adventurer in you, take a rafting or tubing trip down the Shenandoah or Potomac Rivers, or head up to Annapolis Rocks for a climb, or even hike a section of the Appalachian Trail – all within 20-30 minutes of the farm.  There are several wineries and ciders within 10-40 minutes of the farm that give tours and tastings regularly, as well as breweries that create some tasty beer.
We take extra care in disinfecting all surfaces and linens when we clean.
description.access: You have use of the entire house.  Beautiful country road to walk or bike on, walking trail, a small kitchen garden await.
description.notes: We teach classes on a variety of topics related to gardening, conservation, wild food foraging, herbs for wellness, and more. You are welcome to register for one during your stay. We offer garden tours and tea tastings, nature walks and beekeeping 101 with a honey tasting to groups of at least 8.  This is dependent upon staff availability.
description.neighborhood: Spring House is surrounded by fields, woods, and streams.  Wildlife abounds! The Catoctin Nature Center, Appalachian Trail, Harper's Ferry, the wonderful town of Frederick with loads  of fine restaurants, shops, galleries, museums, live entertainment is a 15 minute drive away, and Brunswick provides easy access to the C&O canal towpath for bike riding.  So much to do!  Jefferson itself has a delightful diner full of local character, an ice cream and sandwich shop, Hemp's meats (all local and delicious), and the Jefferson pastry shop to fill your belly.
description.transit: The MARC train is available from Washington D.C. and will bring you to Frederick and Brunswick. From there one must call for a cab/Uber/Lyft to take you to Spring House.
description.interaction: Guest will have very little if any contact with the owner. We will be available via cell phone and are close enough to be on call if needed.
description.house_rules: Please leave the house as you found it.  There are no guests allowed other than those registered unless owner gives you permission.  No ATVs or dirt bikes allowed on fields or trails.  Mountain bikes are allowed.  No hunting on the property. No fireworks please, it scares the cows. You may smoke outside and please put cig butts in trash, not on ground. Thanks!

name: Farm Cottage with Romantic Pond and Dock
title: Waterford, Virginia

hosts.about: Reagan and I started Waterford Reservations in 2017 most of the properties we built or renovated ourselves,the majority of the materials used to make our homes is reclaimed or made on My sawmill. Make sure to check out all the listings especially my favorite the DonRea Villa and plan to enjoy all the areas best winery’s, brewery’s, and reastraunts and hiking the area has to offer

recent.comments: This was a really nice place to stay for the week. The host is nice and helpful and the grounds are beautiful. It’s an easy commute to harpers ferry other really cool places to check out.

items.comments: This was a really nice place to stay for the week. The host is nice and helpful and the grounds are beautiful. It’s an easy commute to harpers ferry other really cool places to check out.

We really enjoyed our stay. It was a very pleasant setting. The home had fantastic character. Loved the log cabin feel. It was only about an hour from Gettysburg which was an easy drive to do the things we wanted to do there. The owners were super friendly and made us feel right at home. We will definitely visit again.
Absolutely charming! Would stay here again. Cozy and comfortable.

Beautiful place for tranquility. Beautiful grounds and sweet animals. Took my toddler and she loved waking up and visiting the animals every day especially the turkey and the dogs. Special experience and right in middle of wine country for the adults

This place was the perfect landing spot for me for a few days while visiting Purceville. Raegan responded immediately to my request to book and the cottage was perfect. Easy to get to all the little surrounding areas and was extremely peaceful. It had everything I could need from pots/pans, dishes, toiletries, laundry necessities and more! I will definitely save this hidden gem for any future travels to the area.

Reagan and Donnie were amazing hosts. Very responsive & friendly. We loved the cottage. Beautiful farm with cute dogs, a turkey & horses.  The fresh eggs in the fridge was a nice touch. The cottage was as described. Very clean. We would highly recommend staying here.

This place was amazing. My Wife and I Stayed one night here and it was everything we needed an more. The farm land around the rental is peaceful, and breathtaking. We would definitely stay here again.

description.summary: This original blacksmith's forge located on historic farm property was recently converted to a beautiful cottage. Perfect for a couple or solo traveler this destination is close to wineries/breweries and farm-to-table restaurants.   Comfortable living room and large loft style bedroom are perfect locations to unwind from a day of exploring.  Farm stands are not a far drive - delicious meats at Long Stone Farm and local goat cheese at Georges Mill are just a few of the favorites.
description.space:
The property has a beautiful pond and dock which may be enjoyed by guests.

The cottage sits on a working farm so expect to see farm animals- roosters, chickens, horses, turkeys, tractors etc. and a beautiful cottage with pond access.
description.access: The parking area, small porch, pond and dock. Entire inside of cottage
description.notes:
Three friendly dogs live and roam the property.  If you bring pets they must have no aggression towards other dogs and must be on a leash at all times when outdoors. 

Steep steps lead up to large  loft-style bedroom. 

Please note, like with all properties you might run across normal bugs, bees and spiders etc. 

Electricity and internet cannot be guaranteed if there is a problem with the provider or outage.

This rental is managed by Waterford Reservations LLC, when booking this property all guest acknowledge that any and all disputes, settlements etc will solely be made with Waterford Reservations LLC, Air BNB and no others for any reason.
description.neighborhood: Lovettsville a small german settled town just a short drive from the potomac river is just seconds away by car and bost the areas best local restaurants, farm to table dining, local roadside farm stands of goat cheese, local meats.wheatland springs farm brewery is 5 minutes away as well. Just over short hill mountain is historic harpersferry wv. The cottage is easy to access to the areas wedding venues and wineries. Less than 15 minutes to dozens of wineries and several breweries. Harpersferry West Virginia 22 minutes downtown leesburg is 18 minutes.
description.transit: A jeep with removable top would be our top pick for transportation however any vehicle will do. Uber does service the area and we have a list of private drivers to get you around the area along with a service that offers tours in an authentic land rover
description.interaction: The property owners live next door on the farm, however you will have the upmost privacy for your stay in the beautiful cottage. We can always be available by messenger if needed
description.house_rules: Guest total must match reservation at all times

name: The Cottage @ Red Gate Farm- Horse & Wine Country!
title: Bluemont, Virginia

gallery.caption: Relax and unwind at the foothills of the winery, next to horses, in the gorgeous Virginia countryside.  Private patio with firepit and hammock.
Master bedroom with antique furniture.  DIfferent photographer from different angle.

Kitchen with pasture views.  Microwave, dishwasher, range, refrigerator with ice maker, coffee pot, toaster.  Custom crafted wooden table and bench.  Horses right outside kitchen window!  Often wild turkey also!  Washer and dryer in closet on left.
2 twin beds in second bedroom.  Very large room, with horses right outside your window!
Living room with hand-crafted table made from 200-year old wood.  TV.
2-stall barn available for rental if you bring your horses.  Small turnout with run-in shed also.
Run-in shed area for horses.  (back of stalls)
Outdoor riding ring and gorgeous scenery.  Horses available for riding lessons/trail rides for all ages and abilities.
Overlook of cottage area of the farm, which has horse pasture in front and back yards
Looks up to Bluemont Vineyard and Blue Ridge mountains

hosts.about: My husband and I worked in corporate America for over 15 years until we decided to change our lifestyle.  We now run an equestrian business on our family farm in Virginia wine country.  In addition, we  own and operate 4 Airbnb properties, two cottages on our farm,  our vacation home at Lake Anna, and our vacation home near Park City, Utah.  We enjoy meeting people from all over and sharing our amazing properties with others.

recent.comments: We loved our stay at Red Gate Farm. The cottage was lovely, clean and had everything we needed. The location was so serene and beautiful surrounded by horses and nature. Deers and turkeys walked by the cottage daily. The pool was perfectly heated and so clean. The location is great, a 5 minute drive to the Bluemont general store to get ice cream, 3 minutes to Great Country Farms where the kids spent hours playing and feeding the animal, 3-5 mins to local wineries and breweries. 20 mins away from Purcellville with a quaint downtown and plenty of restaurant options. Highly recommend the cottage at Red Gate Farm.

items.comments: We loved our stay at Red Gate Farm. The cottage was lovely, clean and had everything we needed. The location was so serene and beautiful surrounded by horses and nature. Deers and turkeys walked by the cottage daily. The pool was perfectly heated and so clean. The location is great, a 5 minute drive to the Bluemont general store to get ice cream, 3 minutes to Great Country Farms where the kids spent hours playing and feeding the animal, 3-5 mins to local wineries and breweries. 20 mins away from Purcellville with a quaint downtown and plenty of restaurant options. Highly recommend the cottage at Red Gate Farm.

This is a beautiful place. It’s a cottage right in the middle of a huge horse farm. The cottage is nice except no comfy dining chairs just stools. Christine is prompt with messages and had paper towels sent to us when they were missing. The pool is AMAZING. It is heated, clean, and has an intriguing auto cover build in. We had a blast there for about an hour our first evening and I took the baby back for about 45 mins the next morning. There was a camp going on and we weren’t able to swim for the entire next afternoon, which was disappointing as that was the only other time we could have on our one full day. Returning from dinner our last night we had no power, and it was getting hot. As well as we needed a working fridge and electricity for my breast milk and pump. We also had refrigerated medicine. Electricity was scheduled to come back 12-3am. We couldn’t risk it. Christine thinks we should have and it wasn’t a big deal. I had to fight for a small portion of one night back. 145/840$
Comfortable and clean cottage on a beautiful horse farm, with a lovely large in ground pool, nice patio and hammock area.  Idyllic!

Our stay at Christine's cottage was incredible!  The farm was just beautiful and so peaceful!  There were gorgeous horses out every window!  My kids and I really enjoyed picking berries right next to the cottage and around the farm!  The cottage was updated and clean.  The kitchen had everything we needed for our 9 day stay!  We were even able to make a peach raspberry cobbler with the raspberries we picked on property and the peaches we got at the Great Country Farm nearby.

Christine was a fantastic host!  She was super responsive and took care of anything we needed as well as made amazing local suggestions!  She also made sure we had private time at the beautiful pool area!  My son even went to the horse camp during the day while we were there!  

Thank you, Christine, for such a wonderful, relaxing stay in your lovely cottage!

P.S. If you are traveling to this area, I highly recommend Magnolia's in Purcellville, especially if you have gluten allergies!
Lovely views

We loved our time here! Christine was an amazing host - very responsive and she provided great recommendations! The cottage was bigger than I had expected and had lots of useful kitchenware for cooking. The horses were so friendly and my toddler loved that she got to pet some of them! She also really enjoyed waving to the chickens. The pool was great and perfect for the hot days we visited. The fire pit was also amazing - we used it each night of our stay! The location was near wineries and great restaurants but was so serene. We had a wonderful time and will definitely be back!

This is truly a special place. We loved our time at Red Gate and plan to return. It’s a beautiful property. The pool was wonderful and we loved being so close to Dirt Farm, Bluemont Winery, and Grest Country Farms. You could literally see horses out every window. It was wonderful!

description.summary:
**Pool open May1- Sept 14. PRIVATE 3 hours pool time daily. Plus private patio, grill and fire pit! Horses outside every window! 
The Cottage is located on a 230 acre horse farm.  Red Gate Farm is a full-service, upscale equestrian farm, containing the Cottage, original farm house and 50 horses & ponies. 
Convenient to Middleburg and Purcellville, you are surrounded by mountains, wineries, breweries, and hiking, with horses right at your doorstep.  All in the beautiful town of Bluemont.
description.space:
The driveway to the property welcomes you with a century-old stone wall, rows of aged maples, and horses on both sides.  The long driveway leads you past the old milking parlor and the modern equestrian center, to the Cottage.  The 250 acre property is perfect for walking/hiking and visiting the horses and ponies.  There are many varieties of beautiful trees and flora, including Eastern Hemlock, Roses, Daffodils, Blueberries, Cherry, Fig, Rhododendron, and Boxwood. 
The landscaped pool was nestled into an old bank barn foundation and is included in the price.  You will have time scheduled daily to use the pool exclusively.  ( schedule will be worked out with owner).
Completely renovated in 2019, The Cottage is a 2 bedroom, 2 bath home that sleeps 4 people on the main level. The master bedroom has a queen size bed with en suite, and the  guest room has twin size  beds. The Cottage features custom, yet charming  accents such as granite countertops,  Restoration Hardware deep leather couches,  and crafted furniture and wood trim created from 100-year old onsite barn wood, and locally milled wood for siding.
There is a fire pit and hammock adjacent to the Cottage for your use.  Bring S'mores!
Ideal for a family, 2 couples, or a girls weekend, the Cottage offers stunningly breathtaking views in a country environment with access to equestrian pursuits.  Wineries and breweries can be viewed up the hill in the back yard! 
Please note: parties,  or additional guests allowed. Pets on case by case basis.
description.access: You have access to the cottage, pool (as scheduled) and may wander around property to visit with  horses, but do not enter horse fields or stalls.  The giant hill is a good hike, with spectacular views from the top. You are welcome to enter main barn if you have a riding lesson scheduled.  If you pick fruit, please do not pick more than a snack!  Pets must be leashed at all times and cleaned up after.
description.notes: Great Country Farm is right around the corner.  It’s a fun place for kids with fruit and vegetable picking, hay rides, mini golf and more. They also sell farm fresh produce.  Walking /hiking through the farm or town, and local hiking trails can provide some exercise in a stunning landscape. Bears den is only 5 minutes away, and is a short hike of under 30 minutes with great views from the too. Stop by the Bluemont Country Store and step back into time.  They have candy, groceries, and ice cream.  Even if you are a beginner rider, taking a lesson on horseback is a rewarding activity.   Relax and enjoy, explore, swim, visit.  A welcome vacation in a busy world.
description.neighborhood:
Look up to see the million dollar views of the Bluemont Winery and Dirt Farm Brewery, less than  a mile away.  The Cottage is ideally located near popular tourist destinations and fine restaurants.  There are 20+ wineries/breweries within a 30 minute drive!  We are also located a few minutes away from hiking Bears Den, Ravenwood, and the Appalachian trail.  Award-winning small town Middleburg is a 20 minute gorgeous drive through Virginia's finest fox hunting country. 
The farm houses over 50 horses and ponies, which are available for your use for riding lessons.  Many are beginner friendly.  Or you can bring your own horses and use our private 2 stall barn with run-in shed. (Additional fee all equestrian)
description.transit: You will need a car to navigate to the wineries and local attractions since even our next door neighbors are a drive way!
description.interaction: We are happy to assist you in booking an equestrian lesson on site. Wineries and breweries are everywhere, and we can offer recommendations for our favorites.  Bluemont winery overlooks our farm and has expansive views of the countryside.
description.house_rules:
- Must not enter any horse fields or stalls with horses in them.
- No horse laundry in the washer/dryer in the Cottage.  Please use washer in dryer in barn instead.

name: The Lounge at The Stables of Rolling Ridge

Master bedroom with a King size bed
Living room and the kitchen located up the steps
Wifi is available throughout the apartment
The fireplace is for decoration only! Please do NOT light a fire! Thank you in advance!
The master bedroom; complete with a king sized bed

Head down the spiral staircase & enjoy a walk to the garden pergola!
The screened in porch overlooks the garden pergola and horse fields.
We hope that you are able to enjoy the farm and all of its beauty!
Head down the barn aisle to find your apartment suite
The Lounge door is located on your left and is conveniently marked by a gold plaque.
Once you walk through the Lounge door, continue straight through the door marked "Dressing Room" to enter your apartment!

recent.comments: This is my second 7 day stay at this beautiful farm.  Accommodations are lovely, and the peacefulness and beauty of this horse farm can't be described adequately.  A walk on these stunning acres will bring peace to your soul.  I hope to stay here each time I visit family in the area.  Highly recommend.

items.comments: This is my second 7 day stay at this beautiful farm.  Accommodations are lovely, and the peacefulness and beauty of this horse farm can't be described adequately.  A walk on these stunning acres will bring peace to your soul.  I hope to stay here each time I visit family in the area.  Highly recommend.
Absolutely amazing place to go to get away from the world
we were celebrating our 42 anniversary and enjoyed the setting and the relaxing nature of the premises.

We had a lovely time at Emmi’s place. It’s the perfect spot for a couple looking for a quiet place away from the city. There were several amazing wineries within 30-minute drive. Walking around the property was lovely. The screened porch was also nice to read on. Very clean as well and a perfect little kitchen. Definitely recommend!
We had an amazing time staying in the cottage. It was quiet and had plenty of space to go on beautiful walks in the evenings.

This stay was so amazing!! So unique, peaceful and was true serenity.  The location was convenient and the bri k oven  pizza in town was amazing. 
We cannot wait to return.
The Lounge is perfectly picturesque and very peaceful! It is exactly as described and very clean. Highly recommend!

description.summary: The Lounge at The Stables of Rolling Ridge is a private, quiet, newly renovated apartment in the heart of a small town. Conveniently located on 77-acres of rolling farm land, our family invites you to unwind and relax away from the hustle and bustle of the DMV. The farm offers incredible sunsets, lush gardens with a gorgeous wooden pergola, and plenty of farm friends to keep you company! The Lounge is bright with a modern farmhouse feel and comes with all the essentials to make you feel at home!
description.space:
During your stay guests are allowed access to the apartment only. Reserving this Airbnb does not reserve the use of the property or the right to host weddings and events.

If you would like to book an event please contact us via email (thefarm@rollingridgemd.com) or visit our website (rollingridgemd.com).

We do however, encourage you to take a walk & enjoy the scenery of the farm!
description.access: Guests are welcome to park on the cobblestone spaces along the fence line. Two vehicles are allowed per visit.
description.interaction: Emmi will oversee your trip once you arrive to the property. In order to gain access to the Airbnb guests must meet Emmi upon their arrival to get the key to the apartment. Please let us know when you plan on arriving so Emmi can meet you.

name: Willow’s View
title: Leesburg, Virginia

gallery.caption: Bedroom with sliding oak barn door
Enjoy a cozy fire off the back patio. There's bottle openers under the arm of each chair!
Front door entrance to main room. Bright, open space with vaulted ceiling.
Pergola with string lights off the back patio.
Walnut dining table and living area

Main Room with smart TV and portable speaker. House has high speed Fios internet.

recent.comments: Such a terrific spot. We loved the butterfly garden and the long views out the back. So many butterflies and some hummingbirds visiting the flower garden. 20+ deer to watch in the evenings in the back field. Such a peaceful, quiet place. Inside was wonderful too - designed and laid out very well. Loved the art and all the house plants!

items.comments: Such a terrific spot. We loved the butterfly garden and the long views out the back. So many butterflies and some hummingbirds visiting the flower garden. 20+ deer to watch in the evenings in the back field. Such a peaceful, quiet place. Inside was wonderful too - designed and laid out very well. Loved the art and all the house plants!

This place is a gem. If you want a quiet, serene place to stay, this is it. Everything about it was top notch. Excellent accommodations nustled in a quiet, country setting less than 10 minutes from town. Erin was responsive and helpful. I would recommend her place to anyone. 6 stars!!

Erin is an excellent host ! The house is beautiful, easy to get to and has a great view. The patio is amazing and has a really cool fire pit. I the place is mear and clean with every small detail accounted for. My stay was excellent and I would definitely stay again.

We had a wonderful weekend getaway at Erin's house!   It is in a beautiful and private setting with close proximity to Leesburg and Purcellville.  We found the house and furnishing to be very comfortable and we had everything we needed during our stay.   The A/C units worked great to keep the house temperature nice and cool for summer weather.  We  enjoyed seeing wildlife which included several deer sightings and swans in a nearby pond.   There were also  fireflies that beautifully lit up the field and trees in the evenings.   Highly recommend the house for anyone looking to stay in the area!

Willow's View remains my favorite rental! From the tiniest of details to the beautiful grounds, I always feel at home at Erin's place. I highly recommend it for remote work, especially creative work that benefits from the serene environment.

Erin’s place was beautiful. Nicely furnished, private and peaceful. I only wish we could have stayed longer than just a weekend. If you are looking for a peaceful spot to get away from it all, this is definitely the place!

We had an amazing stay at Erin's place! The location is private and peaceful (be sure to watch a sunrise from the back patio) while still being conveniently close to everything in downtown Leesburg. The home was clean and well-stocked with everything we needed. The bedroom, bed, and linens were all comfortable and clean. Erin is a wonderful host, is very communicative, and even had the house ready for early check-in! We would definitely stay here again!

description.summary: Willow’s View is the perfect place to relax in the country but feel close to it all. Enjoy the surrounding wildlife and beautiful field view off the back patio. Located at the gateway to where all of Loudoun County’s gravel road adventures begin, we are happy to suggest a gravel road ride if desired.
description.space:
Willow’s View sits on property that’s been in our family farm for many generations. All on one level, the space is bright and comfortable with an open floor plan and high ceilings. The house features wood shelving and furniture made from oak, walnut and poplar trees that we have harvested and saw-milled on our property, including a sliding barn door in the master bedroom. 

The kitchen is fully equipped for your stay, with the exception of a dishwasher. Loft space above the office is carpeted and makes for a cozy space. The office comes fully equipped for remote work/learning with high speed Fios internet and a pull-out double size sofa for additional sleeping. Private entrance with ample parking.
description.notes:
We hope you enjoy the back patio space. There is a fire pit but for your own safety we kindly ask that you not collect wood from the property.

Please note that the number of guests must match the reservation at all times day or night. Thank you!
description.neighborhood: Willow’s View is conveniently located 45 mins from Washington, DC and 15 mins from downtown Leesburg and Purcellville. We are a short bike ride or drive to Stone Tower Winery and Willowcroft farm Vineyards.
description.transit: Uber is available if you are interested.
description.interaction: My husband and I live next door with our two kids. We give our guests privacy but should you need anything, please message me.
description.house_rules:
Please treat Willow’s View as if it were your own home. 

No Pets Allowed.

We kindly ask that you not park or drive on the grass.

*Please note: We have a strict limit on how many guests can stay and registered guests only. Maximum 4 guests. The guest count must match the reservation at all times day or night. Violation of this will result in a cancellation and termination of the booking with no refund issued. 

We do not host events or parties of any kind in this space. We are not an event venue and anyone who uses the space for a purpose other than an overnight stay will be asked to leave immediately. Thank you.*

Cottage located immediately to the right of the main house with view of the pool in back
The Cottage House - Entire Cottage House is private to renters. No other apartments or people in the house. Owners live on property in separate house.
Downstairs of Cottage featuring full kitchen, washer, dryer, 1/2 bath, large TV with streaming, couch
Winter Wonderland view of the 30 acre farm
Farm Bank Barn and also one of the seating spaces for the on-farm brewery.
Main drive / entrance to Wheatland Spring Cottage and Manor House
Pool and outdoor fireplace - view from the cottage. Pool is not available for guests to swim. Fire pits available at the brewery (300' away) during the cooler seasons.
View of main house with cottage house immediately to the east
Upstairs of Cottage features a queen size luxurious bed and bed linens and full bath.
View of the pool, outdoor fireplace, and property main house where the owners reside.
View of old sycamore with main house and chicken coop in background
One of the indoor seating spaces at the brewery.
Lunch and Dinner at Wheatland Spring Farm + Brewery Thursday through Sunday

This shows the brewery barns. The small building in the from is the farm Spring House (not the cottage which is for rent). The Cottage House and main Manor House (where the owners live) sit off to the left out of this photo.
We grow our own barley and other grains for our beer.

recent.comments: Enjoyed our anniversary stay in this cute cottage. It was away from the hustles and very relaxing but close enought to everything that we could hope to do.

items.comments: Enjoyed our anniversary stay in this cute cottage. It was away from the hustles and very relaxing but close enought to everything that we could hope to do.
Nice place for a weekend getaway.  Good location and very clean.  Bonnie was very friendly, responsive and helpful.
Very nice place to stay and spend some time away. Close to a number of other local places to see.
Beautiful area, cozy cottage. It was an amazing stay with a lot of great surrounding breweries in the area!

We had a wonderful weekend at Wheatland Spring Farm. The cottage is adorable and very comfortable. Bonnie has taken time and care in the details. We enjoyed walking across the field to their brewery - great beer and food! We sat on the front porch and enjoyed a summer storm and even saw some fireflies just outside the front door. We felt we had all the privacy we needed. A truly memorable place to stay.

A peaceful, comfortable getaway, central to all Loudoun County and the surrounding region has to offer. Location is close to vineyards, distilleries, resorts, hiking, and local and fine dining. A private cottage, perfect getaway for two. Cottage has everything you need to kickback and relax the moment you arrive - you’ll be welcomed to the cottage with fresh ground coffee, chilled water, Netflix, and none other than Nutella. Will recommend and would absolutely visit again. 5 stars!

No complaints about the place- cute, quaint, simple, perfect for two people. Walking to the winery was unique and enjoyable. The area does not have much to do as it seems to be in a rural area. Grocery stores and shops were a ten minute drive away though.

description.summary: The charm of yesterday with the amenities of today. The private cottage house is appointed with a premium queen size bed, 1.5 baths, and a clothes washer and dryer. The full kitchen includes: oven, stove, microwave, full size refrigerator, dishwasher, and cookware. Guests enjoy scenic views of the 30 acre Wheatland Spring property. A romantic getaway or longer term stay. Just a 100 yard walk from our on-farm brewery.
description.space:
Guests enjoy a short 100 yard walk to our farm brewery taproom.
More information on the brewery on our website: wheatlandspring.com
description.notes: *Photo shoots, video recording, and events such as zoom weddings are not permissible without prior permission and associated fees. Contact the owner if you wish to use your stay for anything other than quite and relaxation. No guests (other than those 1-2 adults booking the cottage) are able to join you in the cottage or on the grounds.
description.neighborhood: We are located in rural Loudoun County - just an hour outside of DC. The cottage is located on our 30 acre farm. We are surrounded by other farms and a couple of subdivisions.
description.transit: private parking for the cottage
description.interaction: Most of our guests enjoy their privacy, which we provide. They always have access to me via my cell phone and I’m available to assist on request. They also have access to the on-farm brewery during open hours.
description.house_rules: - Quiet Hours 9pm - 7am

name: Restored 1820 Waterford Village Farm
title: Waterford, Virginia

Commercial stove with 10 burners and 2 ovens
Third floor guest room with double bed
Visit our Corner Store while you're here!

recent.comments: My husband and I have traveled all over the United States and internationally - this is one of the best places we’ve stayed at, hands down. We were nearly in tears when we had to leave! This is a wonderful gathering place for family or friends. It is so serene, tranquil, and beautifully decorated and tended to with lots of TLC. We loved sitting out on the porch, soaking in the outdoor tub/shower, cooking in the incredible kitchen, using fresh herbs and flowers from the garden, visiting the chicken, cats, and sheep… the perfect getaway. Even better, it was so fun to pop over to Sarah’s Corner Store. We ended up buying some items there and will always treasure it! This place is a dream and we will be back.

items.comments: My husband and I have traveled all over the United States and internationally - this is one of the best places we’ve stayed at, hands down. We were nearly in tears when we had to leave! This is a wonderful gathering place for family or friends. It is so serene, tranquil, and beautifully decorated and tended to with lots of TLC. We loved sitting out on the porch, soaking in the outdoor tub/shower, cooking in the incredible kitchen, using fresh herbs and flowers from the garden, visiting the chicken, cats, and sheep… the perfect getaway. Even better, it was so fun to pop over to Sarah’s Corner Store. We ended up buying some items there and will always treasure it! This place is a dream and we will be back.

We had setbacks in our arrival time and Sarah was so responsive and understanding. We felt right at home and at ease. The home and area was absolutely beautiful and we had a wonderful stay. My kids enjoyed the property so much! The garden is amazing and they were playing tag after our outdoor dinner one night. So much character in this house!

Sarah & Matt haben ein wunderschönes Haus und sind beste Gastgeber. Das Haus ist äußerst geschmackvoll eingerichtet und die Küche ist einfach ein Traum.
Das beste jedoch ist, dass wir mit Sarah & Matt neue Freunde gefunden haben.

We stayed one night at Sarah and Matt's beautiful farm. The house is incredible--the restoration and decor show such care and attention to detail--and the farm is like a paradise, with flowers, berries, vegetables, herbs, goats and chickens! My kids adored the goats, and wanted to spend all their time with them. And Sarah and Matt were so patient with my kids following them around asking a million questions. Sarah even let my son help plant cilantro. The house has everything you could need to cook and feel at home. We felt so lucky to get to experience what they've created in the beautiful village of Waterford.
We had to change plans so that only part of our party was able to make it, but the reception they received and the warmth of the setting made for a memorable stay. Loved it!

Sarah and Matt’s place was incredible. Our family of six loved our time there. The house itself is lovely and just hanging out there is an experience. The town of Waterford was quite charming and the setting is the house and town is pure bucolic bliss! Sarah and Matt were gracious and helpful hosts.
Lovely house, beautifully decorated. The little town was charming.

description.summary: We restored this 1820 village farmhouse in 2016. It is situated in the heart of the historic village of Waterford. It has 2 1/2 acres behind, with two barns, a herd of very friendly goats,  chickens, and vegetable, herb and flower gardens. The house backs up to The Phillips Farm, 150 acres of preserved land and public walking trails. Beautiful sunset views from the back porch. The house, a work in progress, was featured in both Country Living and Preservation Magazines.
description.space: The house has a rustic feel. The bathroom (on the second floor) has a great tub for baths and a shower. The sink is very old and beautiful, but shows it's age! There are three bedrooms for guest use - one on the second floor with two twins, another on the second floor with a queen bed, and one on the third floor with a king bed and sitting area.   The bathroom is on the second floor. The house is heated by radiators and we have a wood stove in  the cozy kitchen sitting area. There is no AC in the kitchen - only in the  bedrooms. There is a front and back/side porch and large yard with separate vegetable, herb and flower gardens and a fire pit and chairs. The cooking stove in the kitchen is commercial and has 10 burners and 2 ovens and uses propane. There is also one wood burning fireplace on the first floor in one of the two living rooms. There is a dishwasher and coffee maker in the kitchen, which is fully stocked with pantry items and pots and pans, etc. The tap water is well water that's filtered and tested regularly. The kitchen is the space we live in - it has a dining table and a cozy living room area by the wood stove. There is a great outside shower and bathtub. The chickens love to be around people and the goats love snuggles! For most of the late spring and summer  the goats are out on jobs clearing brush, so won't be around. During the growing season, all produce, herbs, berries and eggs are available for harvest in the garden and chicken coop!
description.access:
Guests are welcome in any area of the house. The back two acres are separated by a fence and gate and guests are welcome to explore and hang out with the goats back there, when they are here. We are in the process of restoring barns and building a greenhouse back there. We are usually working on these projects in the back or on the garden so will be around. We also run the Corner Store in town so are pretty much always in the village should you need anything!

We can only allow 6 guests on the property, unless previously arranged with us. This is very firm.
description.notes:
We are unable to accommodate any wedding related rentals.

We can only allow 6 guests on the property, unless previously arranged. This is very firm.
description.neighborhood: Waterford is a charming village. There are many beautiful old houses and building that have been well-cared for and preserved. We run the Corner Store  in the center of the town, a little shop that sells local and handmade things for the home and garden, beer and wine, coffee and house made croissants. There is a wonderful walking trail that can be accessed  behind the Mill at the end of town. It goes all the way to the dam that used to feed the mill race. There are many farms, vineyards and breweries around the area to explore, as well as a handful of good restaurants, our favorites being Market Table Bistro, Market Burger, Field and Main, The Wine Kitchen and Fireworks Pizza.
description.interaction: We will meet you at the property to show you all the things, and then be available as needed. We will be around the property working in the garden and in the back barns daily. There may occasionally be a gardener (Daniel) working in the garden during the growing season.
description.house_rules:
Please take off shoes before entering the house.

No more than 6 guests allowed on the property.

name: Gorgeous historic stone house with great internet!
title: Middleburg, Virginia

gallery.caption: For additional information please reach out to my site on IG

hosts.about: I'm an interior designer, originally from Belgium, I'm passionate about interiors and great service and hope one day to own a boutique hotel somewhere..I guess this is my attempt on a small scale to run a boutique hotel type service. I hope you enjoy :-)

recent.comments: We had a wonderful relaxing girls getaway weekend! We had a delicious dinner on the gorgeous back porch. We enjoyed having such a peaceful time together and still being close to town and all the wineries for our winery tour! We reserved the lovely carriage house on the property too! Lovely, well cared for home with beautiful furnishings! We would definitely stay here again!

items.comments: We had a wonderful relaxing girls getaway weekend! We had a delicious dinner on the gorgeous back porch. We enjoyed having such a peaceful time together and still being close to town and all the wineries for our winery tour! We reserved the lovely carriage house on the property too! Lovely, well cared for home with beautiful furnishings! We would definitely stay here again!
Well worth the visit!
They did a beautiful job designing the house

We had a wonderful stay at Luc’s over Father’s Day weekend- peaceful, beautiful area surrounded by horse farms. Quiet roads to walk our dogs on and a quick drive into Middleburg for meals and shopping. Absolutely loved the decor and the house was full of amenities.
Beautiful home and a great location!

Our stay at Luc and Natascha’s place was relaxing and very pleasant. Beautiful setting with a great home layout. Central access to a wide range of attractions. Excellent kitchen for preparing meals and using the outdoor grill. We look forward to another visit!
Another terrific stay at this incredible home. Would definitely recommend to those traveling in the Middleburg area.

description.summary: This house sleeps 6 but we have an extra guest cottage available on the property with a separate driveway about 200' from the main house should you need to sleep 8 pending availability. Please reach out to enquire about this before booking, should you need lodging for 8 people as the guest house has a separate listing and may already be booked.
description.space:
Welcome to this beautiful remodeled historic home, bordering Goose Creek, enjoy this peaceful home where you will only hear and see birds and wildlife and an occasional horse or two but only 5 min from downtown Middleburg.

The main house has 3 bedrooms and sleeps 6, two on the upstairs floor that is joined by one large bathroom with separate toilet. On the main floor is another bedroom that has a VERY comfortable pull out couch with a private toilet and has a full bathroom on the lower level. It's a 200 year authentic former "farm "house that has been fully restored, so the layout is not your standard one.  The guest cottage has a separate listing on airbnb (called super cosy cottage on large estate) , but can be rented with the main house so everyone can be together. Hence is why the listing states that it sleeps 8. If you would like to book for 8 people though, I will need to check that the guest house is available during that weekend as it has a separate listing on airbnb.

Being an interior designer from Belgium, I designed  the main house with an eclectic yet rustic feel, that is warm and inviting. It's not what you will find typically in the Middleburg area, as it has a  European flavor, but it has been completely remodeled and offers everything you would need as if you were staying at a boutique hotel with a kitchen. Comfortable bed with feather duvet, hardwood floor, full kitchen including dishwasher and microwave  a rain shower in the bathroom and a big screen TV with comfortable seating in the living room and a historic stone patio.

We also have a few private chefs available for your consideration, if you would like to have a home cooked meal, picnic or be taken care of, culinary wise ,during your entire stay. If you are interested please let me know and I can send you my recommendations.
description.access: The property is set on very private 22 acres, at the end of a gravel road, backed to Goose Creek where you can go for walks for hours, go to the creek, to Middleburg town or the Spa at the Salamandar, all 5' away, or visit some of the best wineries in VA that is starting at 3 miles from our house (Greenhill).
description.notes: Again, if you would like to book for 8 people, let me know so that I can check if the guest house is available. We have only used the best materials during this remodeling and are only interested in people that appreciate a high end home and will treat it with respect. This is NOT  a "hunt cabin".
description.neighborhood: rural country roads with horse farms
description.transit: easy driving.. parking right out front

name: Historic Farmhouse on Brewery Property
title: Mount Airy, Maryland

gallery.caption: Bonus room with sofa and desk

hosts.about:
Hello! My husband and I run Frey’s Brewing Company in Mount Airy, Maryland. We are clean, quiet, and respectful if staying in your home. And we are also AirBNB hosts ourselves and love sharing our historic farmhouse and Brewery with others.

In our daily life, when not working obsessively, we spend much of our time with our kids, hiking the farm, taking care of our many animals and hanging with friends. We travel to escape the busy life of brewery ownership. We love Jim Thorpe, Pennsylvania, New England, and Europe.

My travel style is relaxed mixed with a little on-the-go. I like to get up, get out and explore, find some good food and pack it in early.

recent.comments: Wonderful host, wonderful farm house and surroundings. Felt right at home . Highly recommend!

items.comments: Wonderful host, wonderful farm house and surroundings. Felt right at home . Highly recommend!

What a tremendous place!! Everything was perfectly clean and so many little touches that made our stay even better! Farm fresh eggs and water in the fridge! Multiple chargers available in multiple places. Great TV and adorable and spacious rooms throughout! We will be back many more times!
Kerry made the house very welcoming and provided travel sized items that people might forget to pack. The decor was lovely & comfortable. I highly recommend the farmhouse.

This farmhouse is great!  It's cozy and comfy and is a lot more spacious than the pictures suggest.  The house and surroundings couldn't be more beautiful.  Plus there is a great on-site brewery about 20 paces away!  Plus there are friendly cats who come visit on the porch!  The host, Kerry, was so hospitable and kind, too--she even left fresh eggs for us on the porch!

Great place for a weekend get away! House was very well kept and cozy. Loved interacting with the farm animals that were very close to the Airbnb. Kerry was a great host and was very easy to communicate with.

Kerry was a fantastic, generous host - she was friendly, helpful, and responsive. The house was great and had lots of nice little touches from the host that made it especially great. The location is a little out of the way, which is what we wanted, and is in a beautiful area. We had a great stay!

This was a truly peaceful and lovely place to stay with a comfortable county charm that begged you to slow down and take in the quiet. The house rules were clear with some endearing humor thrown in. Kelly was particularly responsive, proactive, and a great person to chat with. If you are looking for a country setting that soothes all your stress, this is the place to stay.

description.summary:
Enjoy your stay in our 1820’s farmhouse suite nestled in the heart of the rural Frederick County Beer and Wine region of Maryland. Located on the property of Frey's Brewing Company, this 1800's farmhouse offers a peaceful retreat from the daily grind.  Take a stroll down the farm road, enjoy the scenery, stop into the brewery (during public Fri-Sun hours), star gaze, or just relax by the firepit.

**Cat allergy alert** there are four cats on the property in very close proximity to the house.
description.space:
You’ll have full access of the entire ground floor of the farmhouse. The second story is not in use at this time and is unoccupied. Ground floor includes a living room/bedroom combo, a sitting room with desk and extra small bed, a fully-equipped kitchen, kitchen table, as well as a bathroom with stand-up stall shower and a full size washer and dryer. The front porch has seating, there’s a picnic table and firepit available for your use. 

Your stay is located on the grounds of Frey’s Brewing Company - Brewery and full service Cafe, about 70 feet from the house. Frey’s is open to the public Friday 9-9, Saturday 9-9 and Sunday 9-7. Private events may take place during the week. Guests of the brewery are not allowed near the house and typically do not cause much disruption. Please be aware, however, that this is a working brewery and farm during your stay. You are free to visit the tasting room during regular business hours.

 ***Amazon delivers to the porch several time a week, please be aware that we have no control over this. We WILL be around to collect packages and feed the animals on a daily basis.***

Accommodations: TV, Netflix, Keurig (with KCups, creamer, sugar, etc), Fridge, Air Fryer, Dishwasher, Stove, Oven, Dishes, Pots & Pans, Outdoor Firepit, Device chargers (Android and iPhone on both sides of the bed), ample lighting.

Queen Bed: New Saatva mattress, Egyptian Cotton Sheets, Plush Bath Towels, Extra Pillows and Blankets, Toilet Paper, Cleaning Supplies, Paper Towels, Basic Toiletries, Dish Soap, Laundry Soap, Dryer Sheets, Games, Books, and more! All sheets, comforters, throw rugs, throw blankets, table clothes, and sofa covers are laundered before your stay.
description.access:
Farmhouse first floor only. Second floor is not occupied.

Brewery Tasting Room during regular business hours.
Farm road walking trail 
Visit animals with permission and supervision  - as we need to disarm the electric fence and there are certain times of day where farm animals are more docile
Entire front and side yard. Please do not use the back yard.

IMPORTANT TO NOTE ****** This is a working farm and there may be limited access or disturbances during construction, deliveries, hunting season, harvest, or when the shooting range is open. Please contact the host to arrange use of farm beyond the farmhouse and brewery immediate area.
description.notes: We love to share our space and farm with our guests. We pride ourselves in close communication so please don't hesitate to reach out. You will be made aware of any large events at the brewery, and you can follow us on social media if you're curious about what might be going on during your stay. Understand that during business hours there are customers coming and going about 70 feet from the house.

description.transit: You’ll be in the heart of farm country with a myriad of beautiful windy roads to explore. One of our favorite things to do is drive a new road every morning before we start work. There are loads of beautiful farms and houses, cows and horses, and rolling hills to view. There’s easy access to shopping just 16 minutes away in Frederick, and a well-stocked Dollar General is 7 minutes away for your basic needs.
description.interaction: We’re typically nearby either across the street in our home or working in the brewery. We’re available to answer any questions or to show you around so that you can get the best experience out of the farm. Just bear in mind on the weekends we're often very busy working in the brewery. Any requests for tours or interactions with the animals should be requested in advance.
description.house_rules:
Trash can be left in the trashcan
No need to do any extra cleaning, please just tidy your big messes.
Please place dirty dishes in dishwasher. No need to run it.
Please leave sheets on bed, we will take care of it!
Wet towels can be placed in the hamper in bathroom.
Please leave any amazon deliveries on porch
Please text us if you have any issues - we're always available.

name: Urban Oasis I Lg 2bd/1ba I Secluded Parklike Yard
title: Springfield, Virginia

gallery.caption: A twin or queen-sized bed can be added in the living room for groups with more than 4 people.  The memory foam mattress is far more comfortable than any pull-out sofa.
Living room with optional queen-sized bed.

hosts.about: Realtor and real estate investor with a passion for travel.

recent.comments: Excellent host, great location and all the essentials (plus several additional conveniences)  made for a very pleasant experience!  Amy and Owen helped us to quickly feel at home and were very responsive and helpful. The Oasis is just as advertised and we would definitely stay again!

items.comments: Excellent host, great location and all the essentials (plus several additional conveniences)  made for a very pleasant experience!  Amy and Owen helped us to quickly feel at home and were very responsive and helpful. The Oasis is just as advertised and we would definitely stay again!
This place is very beautiful, clean, and so nice. The attention was excellent.

We stayed here for 2.5 months after relocating back to the area while waiting to move in to our new home. The apartment was perfect for our family of three. We have a toddler and the neighborhood was great for walks. Amy’s apartment has everything you could need and she was always very responsive. Would definitely recommend!

We love Amy's place. It is spacious and very clean. It is perfect for our weekend visit to DC, close enough to the city while surrounded by beautiful nature. Amy is also very proactive in communicating instructions to help us easily check in and feel just like home. Highly recommended!
So convenient to Washington DC! Super clean and cute… Kids really enjoyed going down to the creek. All in all, very easy stay! Thanks Amy!
Our stay was pleasant and problem free. Amy’s place was clean, quiet, and spacious.
Very comfortable and clean

description.summary: Welcome to your own quiet oasis in the city.  This 2 bd/1ba basement apartment sits on 2 acres and backs to Accotink Creek and Fairfax County parkland.  Inside, you'd never suspect it's a basement. An abundance of light pours in through its oversized windows.  An open floor plan, huge leather Lay-Z-Boy  sofa, and 65' smart TV make it easy to spend time together.  The primary bdrm has a Tempurpedic mattress, TV, walk-in closet, and bay window.  A W/D is located in the 2nd bdrm's walk-in closet.
description.space:
This approximately 1700 SQFT apartment has it's own private entrance facing the private wooded backyard that is accessed by steps leading down from the driveway.

You enter into the huge open-concept living/dining/kitchen area.  A large desk is tucked to the side of the entryway.  

The living room has a huge u-shaped La-Z-Boy leather couch with plenty of seating.  It faces the wood-burning fireplace and 65' smart TV with access to live TV and your favorite streaming services.  If more than 4 guests, a twin or queen-sized tri-fold memory foam mattress and folding bedframe can be set up in the living room.  Please stipulate in your reservation which bed size is preferred.

The kitchen has it ALL!  It includes a full-size, dual-zone oven with electric cooktop, full-size refrigerator, sink, microwave, Ninja coffeemaker, french press,  coffee, blender, mixer, crock pot, bakeware, spices, oil & vinegar, and plenty of pots, pans, dishes, glasses (wine and water),  and tupperware.  Plates and glasses especially for children and for eating outdoors are also included.  

The handmade solid wood dining table and chairs offer plenty of space for 6 people.

The large primary bedroom is the perfect retreat.  Enjoy a good night's sleep on the king-sized Tempurpedic mattress perched on a beautiful, antique, hand-carved, solid wood frame.  Looking out the large bay window to the tree-lined backyard, you'd never know you were in the middle of the city.  You'll have plenty of space for your clothing in the dresser and oversized walk-in closet.  Lastly, the wall-mounted smart TV pulls out to provide the perfect viewing angle from the bed or sofa.

The cozy second bedroom is located in the house interior and does not have any windows.  However, it is well lit and includes a trundle-bed dresser, and walk-in closet with a washer and dryer.

Finally, outside on the porch, you can kick back at your teak patio table while using your Weber grill.  If you are feeling especially spunky, you can make your way down the path to Accotink Creek.  IMPORTANT, the path down to the creek is steep and slippery after it rains.  The walk takes about 5 minutes.  Please be careful.  Once you make it down,  you can enjoy a short walk, swim, rock scramble, or just relax on one of the giant boulders or small sandy banks.  You can even try your hand at fishing, though we haven't had the best luck actually "catching." 

The Urban Oasis has it all but if you want to venture out, a wide variety of shopping, dining, and entertainment opportunities await.  Additionally, we are located about 10 minutes from the Springfield-Franconia Metro (which offers daily parking for $5) and as little as 20 minutes from the Pentagon and DC.

We are constantly working on updates to the apartment between guests.  Check back to see what's new.  Coming soon... dishwasher, new cabinets, and new paint in the living area and bathroom.

**PETS**
Pets will be approved on a case-by-case basis.  There is a $50/pet/stay fee and an additional $200 refundable pet deposit.  Payment for 2+ pets and pet deposit will be collected after the booking is confirmed through the booking platform.  The deposit will be refunded within 48 hours of checkout if no damages are identified.  No animals with a history of aggression or property destruction are permitted.  Unattended pets must be crated/caged.  Please, no loud pets.

We hope to host you soon!  If you have any questions about the area, don't hesitate to reach out.  Amy is a real estate agent who loves sharing information about her city.
description.access: Guests have private access to the apartment unit and the porch area underneath the upper deck.  The backyard is a shared space but the front yard is for owner use only and is where our dog spends her time when she's outside.
description.notes:
Please note, we have a well-behaved 60 lb dog that is often outside but always supervised.  You can see a picture of her in one of the photos.  She will likely bark when you arrive and is a little timid however she is harmless and very friendly once she gets to know you.  

While we are relatively quiet, this is a basement apartment.  Expect to hear a few footsteps and the occasional dog bark when someone comes to the front door.
description.neighborhood: Small quiet residential neighborhood.  Home is tucked away on a beautiful tree-lined dead-end street.
description.transit: A car is recommended.  The unit comes with 2 reserved driveway parking spaces.

A couch, two large armchairs, and two sitting chairs provide ample room for you and your guests.

The Cedarbank Guest House is a modern log cabin that balances a country escape with contemporary conveniences.

With three parking spaces, a large two-story deck, and almost seven acres of grounds, there's plenty of space to roam.
