Lauded as one of the best wineries on the East Coast, Linden Vineyards is directly across the street from Cedarbank. Check their website for current operating status and reservation requirements.

hosts.about:
I'm a native Californian based in Washington, DC, running a sign language interpreting and realtime captioning firm. I love to travel and try to get back to Europe where I used to live as often as possible, but also enjoy taking mini-vacations within the States. I love the kitchen and exercising my cooking skills whenever I can.

My husband and I call Linden, VA home, where we relax on 20 acres we call Cedarbank. Nestled in a quiet valley in the heart of Northern Virginia’s wine country, Linden is the perfect foil to the hustle and bustle of the big city. 

I'm originally from Los Angeles, and speak English, American Sign Language, French, and Spanish, in order of fluency, and have quite a list of other languages I'm hoping to learn soon!

recent.comments: We had a relaxing stay at Kyle and Cory’s cabin and loved all the thoughtful touches like the hammocks and board games. The cabin was clean and the location was great! The hosts were easy to contact and quick to help when we needed.

items.comments: We had a relaxing stay at Kyle and Cory’s cabin and loved all the thoughtful touches like the hammocks and board games. The cabin was clean and the location was great! The hosts were easy to contact and quick to help when we needed.
Great house and location. Thank you
Amazing place. Husband and me and our dogs really enjoyed the stay. Peaceful surroundings and great suggestions on things to do in the area. We are already planning another visit!
Amazing and beautiful place definitely recommend staying

We absolutely loved our stay at Kyle’s cabin. It was extremely clean and well appointed. We loved the views and attention to detail inside. The cabin was also the perfect center point for the local wineries (Crimson Lane, Linden Vineyards) and restaurants (Hunter’s Head) we visited. Would absolutely return!

This cabin in Linden was a wonderful getaway from the DC metro area. Beautiful scenery and close to the northern entrance of Shenandoah NP. The hosts provided every amenity we needed which was much appreciated. We utilized their recommendations for local food and shops and enjoyed all of them. Thanks for a great stay!

My two friends and I had such a fabulous time for our wine weekend. Valerie Hill & Rappahannock were our two favorites this time around. Chrysalis is about a 40 min drive, but the Margherita pizza, Sarah’s Patio White & the view is the die for. 
The pictures do not do the property and home justice. Kyle & Cory have thought of everything you might need while staying in their home. Forgot a toiletry? They have it! Love fresh ground coffee, but don’t want to bring a coffee grinder? They have one! Along with the coffee, sugar and creamer. The beds were super comfortable. It was a little warm upstairs, but the ceiling fans put out a lot of air, so it makes it comfortable. We didn’t end up using the beds in the basement, but if you’d prefer a cooler temp while sleeping, the basement is for you. I would definitely recommend this as your little home away from home.

description.summary:
Come visit Virginia wine country and nearby Shenandoah National Park in this modern log cabin.

The Cedarbank cabin carries all the conveniences of modern living including updated kitchen and WiFi (see note). Though the grounds are only an hour from Washington DC, Cedarbank feels like a world apart, providing relaxing views and 7 tranquil acres for the perfect rejuvenating country escape.
description.space:
You’ll have access to our peaceful grounds - 7 acres of quiet woodland - with nature at your front step.

The house has 3 bedrooms and 2 full bathrooms, a modern kitchen, dining room, and large living room with stone fireplace.

Outside, you can take advantage of the front patio for al fresco dining, use the grill, or swing in the hammocks. 

The Appalachian Trail crosses our road just 1 mile north, stellar Linden Vineyards is immediately adjacent, and scenic Shenandoah Valley is 15 minutes away.

Dogs are allowed, up to two total per stay. We have cats on the property, so please monitor your dogs while outside.

We welcome children of all ages. The cabin does not have toddler safety measures such as locks on low cabinets or outlet covers, but there is a portable crib provided.
description.access: You’ll have access to our entire house except a locked garage. There is a barn on the property which is also locked. Otherwise, you'll have access to the rest of the property adjacent to the cabin. We live on the property, too, but are just over a ridge. Please make yourself at home!
description.notes:
SOME VERY IMPORTANT NOTES

DRIVEWAY: Our driveway is steep and graveled, and can be difficult for small passenger cars to get up especially during wet, snowy, or icy conditions. We recommend using a 4WD vehicle if possible. We are not responsible for you getting up the driveway, and will not provide refunds if you can’t make it up for any reason, including weather. The country is a wonderful place to relax, but it comes with some challenges, too. 

INTERNET: Our internet connection is VERY slow. Think DSL speeds. We estimate average speeds to be 2-2.5 Mbps. You may not be able to hold a Zoom call or send large files, though email and texting work fine.

GUEST COUNT: No parties, and no additional guests beyond the (up to) 6 guests booked through Airbnb. Guests beyond the confirmed amount will be reported to Airbnb (per our local restrictions).

SECURITY: One outdoor security camera shows who is coming and going, but for your privacy, only the driveway and front door are visible – we can send you a picture from the camera if you'd like.

NOISE: Our tiny valley is very sleepy and quiet. It’s the perfect place to relax and enjoy the calm of the country. We’ll also be your neighbors during your stay. Cedarbank is not a place for parties. Also, because sound travels easily, please no loud conversations after dark and music outside at any time.
description.neighborhood:
Cedarbank is nestled in the Virginia countryside in the middle of Shenandoah wine country. You also have easy access to the Appalachian Trail, the Shenandoah River, Shenandoah National Park, and Front Royal, a quaint country town with shopping and dining options.

The area is incredibly quiet and will afford you a relaxing escape from the hustle and bustle of the city.
description.transit: The town of Linden is just off I-66, about 1 hour and 15 minutes west of Washington, DC. Cedarbank is about 2.5 miles south of Linden, tucked into a pretty valley that's home to Linden Vineyards and several working cattle farms.
description.house_rules: In order to preserve the serene nature of our little valley, we ask the following: No amplified music outside, no outdoor fires or fireworks, please keep outdoor conversation quiet after dark.

name: Quaint cottage in historical town of Paris VA!
title: Paris, Virginia

gallery.caption: Screened in porch off Master Bedroom

hosts.about: Hello! Here’s a little info about myself. I’m 31 years old and have lived in the northern Virginia area my whole life. I moved to my amazing cottage in Paris, VA in April of 2018 and have loved every second of it.   when the Cottage was purchased, it needed a little TLC. While I have been doing small things since I’ve lived there, there is still plenty to do! I love the outdoors; hiking, fishing, and driving my boat. I graduated from Radford University with a degree in Criminal Justice, but resorted to my true love of Construction Management. Ive worked as a carpenter throughout college to help pay the bills, and then worked as a project manager for a large new home cabinet company.  I then translated my skills I learned there into being a project manager for a large residential home builder in the area. I have now been a transportation inspector for a local engineering firm for almost 3 years now, working on very large VDOT road improvement projects. Needless to say, I consider myself to have considerable knowledge of construction, which is why I fell in love with the potential of my cottage! Anyways, I hope you’ve learned a little about me! And I hope you get to enjoy my cottage in the little town of Paris!

recent.comments: Paris is a idyllic little town, and William’s little cottage is so lovely, we had everything we needed and more. If you are considering visiting Paris, I couldn’t recommend this little cottage enough!

items.comments: Paris is a idyllic little town, and William’s little cottage is so lovely, we had everything we needed and more. If you are considering visiting Paris, I couldn’t recommend this little cottage enough!
We had a lovely overnight getaway at William’s place! Definitely recommend! The place is darling and he a generous and responsive host.
Bucolic location, charming historic home, and a very comfortable bed!  Would definitely like to stay again.

William’s place was perfect for us. It was close to the Upperville Horse show so we could come back and forth. The house is very comfortable and had everything we needed. I also enjoyed some nice walks in the neighborhood and the beautiful scenery. We would definitely come back!
Such a beautiful home for a relaxing weekend away. The home was clean, the neighborhood was quiet & peaceful, and the location was convenient to hiking, breweries, and wineries.
Really comfy place near lots of great hiking and vineyards.
William’s quaint cottage in the tiny village of Paris was fabulous. Tons of room for my husband and I in a nicely designed house and a well stocked kitchen. I highly recommend.

description.summary: Welcome to my home! This house was built post civil war era in 1867 in the historical town of Paris, Virginia! With lots of history and character this house still has some of the original exposed beams and hardwood flooring! If you enjoy the outdoors, wineries, breweries, and shopping this is a perfect location for your stay! Minutes from the Appalachian trail, and Sky Meadows park there’s plenty of hiking around. Famous Ashby Inn restaurant just a short walk away and many more amazing places!
description.space:
You’ll be very cozy in this 150 year old home! A town that was originally built with much larger plans was halted once the civil war happened. A very unique neighborhood with almost all the homes built in the 17 and 1800's surrounded by nothing but farm land seems to be frozen in time! This is my personal home, so there will be a few items kept in the home, but out of the way of your stay! :)

Please keep in mind that this area is subject to (sometimes) bad thunderstorms and snow storms that could leave you without power for a few hours and in extreme cases a day or two.  Please understand that this is out of my control.  All I can do is report the outage to the power company ASAP.
description.access: You are able to park in front of the home as well as a driveway that parks 2 cars.
description.notes: Verizon seems to be the only cellular service that works in this location. However I do have a wireless hotspot that works very well if you need to use your phone, computer tablet or stream anything you want on any of my smart TVs (bedroom, living room and upstairs). I also have plenty of DVDs upstairs if you’d like to watch a movie!
description.neighborhood:
Very cozy town, 15 minutes from historic town and shops in Middleburg. 25 minutes from the historic town of Winchester. About 40 minutes drive to skyline drive. 5 minute drive to Sky Meadows State Park and about a 5 minute drive to the Shenandoah River!  Also very close to many hikes on the Appalachian trail!  Dozens of wineries and breweries around, all within a short driving distance.  This is of course Virginia Wine Country.  The Ashby Inn (which is about a 100 yard walk) offers exquisite cuisine, and drink!  And very close to to Upperville for horse events. There is nothing more peaceful than the town of Paris.

I should note that the closet grocery store is about 15 minutes away, and often the Ashby Inn requires reservations (in advance).  Just wanted to note so you're prepared when you get here.
description.transit: This is the best place to walk or ride a bike for pleasure! However, if you plan on going to any stores, a car will be needed to go there, unless you plan on eating at the infamous Ashby Inn!  Please do keep in mind, the Ashby Inn and Tavern is very popular and will need reservations in advance.  Also, the closest grocery store is approximately 15 minutes away in Middleburg.  I do not have any fast food restaurants that are close by.
description.interaction: Please don’t hesitate to message me on Airbnb! If you have any questions or requests feel free to ask!
description.house_rules:
Thanks for staying! No need to take out trash (unless completely full and you need a new bag) and no need to take the sheets off. I will do these things for you:) enjoy your stay!                                                                               
                                                                                    If you used the propane grill outside please double check and make sure you turned off the tank.                                                                     Please wash all dishes and leave to dry in sink.  

Please don’t set AC any cooler than 70 degrees (set back to 76 when you leave)

Please don’t set the heat higher than 72( set back to 66 when you leave).                             

Fireplace is on for the season! Please don’t leave on if you’re not in the room please :)

name: Guest Cottage on Historic Estate & Cattle Farm
title: Berryville, Virginia

gallery.caption: Bathroom. Accessible from kitchen and 1st floor bedroom.
First floor guest room with ensuite access to full bathroom.
Bathroom and living room from kitchen.
Cows and chickens on the farm.
Sunset point is a short walk across the farm.
Front porch overlooks the creek where Cows come for a drink.
Twin beds in the loft bedroom.

recent.comments: This property is even more beautiful in person. Very clean and well-appointed. Surrounded by rolling hills and the night sky. Close to wineries, breweries, hiking and other outdoor recreation. Felt very private - the main house is many yards away. Great hosts and experience!

items.comments: This property is even more beautiful in person. Very clean and well-appointed. Surrounded by rolling hills and the night sky. Close to wineries, breweries, hiking and other outdoor recreation. Felt very private - the main house is many yards away. Great hosts and experience!
Beautiful historical home that has been decorated with class and care. Loved my stay and would come back!

We were able to really relax at Sarah’s guest house on the farm. Beds were comfortable, plenty of homey touches. The house and property are beautiful and peaceful. We loved seeing the cows, a few deer, and a ton of fireflies!
Absolutely adorable. Perfect and serene. The decor was well done telling amazing stories left to the imagination. Thanks for such a cool space for our stay.

FFABULOUS airbnb experience!  Sarah was super responsive and helpful.  The guest cottage is comfortable, well appointed and a great location to hike and explore the area.  It was interesting learning about the farm, the renovations and the cows.  We wished we could’ve stayed longer!
Beautiful cute cottage. Access to amazing trails and hikes. Fabulous host. Just a perfect place for a private getaway!
Quaint Americana!  Experience beautiful farm country in authentic yet comfortable style.

description.summary: Fully restored c.1900 farm house on 190 acre estate, ~1 hr from D.C. Cottage is situated at end of a farm road (past the main house and barns), very private w/ creek and cows right outside. Enjoy walks on the farm, local hikes, breweries & wineries, pick-your-own fruit farms, tubing on the Shenandoah, restaurants, antique shops, and more. 1 queen bdrm and bath on 1st flr, 2nd queen bdrm & loft with twin beds on 2nd flr. wifi, fire pit, small grill. Over 25 only, Max 4 adults. 1 SMALL DOG ONLY.
description.space: Impeccably restored c. 1900 farm house on a working farm and historic estate. Situated on 190 rolling acres, this house is perfect for those craving some time in the country. Enjoy long walks through our paddocks or sit on the front porch and watch the cows come up to the creek for a drink. Feel free to pick your own flowers and vegetables next to the historic barn or take a picnic up to the highest point on the property for a gorgeous sunset.
description.access: Stand alone guest house down a private lane from main estate.
description.notes: 5 min drive to historic downtown Berryville; 3 minutes to Watermelon Park on the Shenandoah River (tubing, fishing, swimming, Kayak rentals); 10 minute drive to the Appalachian Trail and Bear's Den hike. 10 minute drive to Bear Chase Brewery, Dirt Farm Brewery, B-Chord Brewery. 15 minutes to L'Auberge restaurant. Dozens of local pick-your-own farms and local farm stands.
description.neighborhood: Extremely rural, not able to see any neighboring homes.
description.house_rules:
Max 4 adults
Small dogs only. Fenced yard but dogs must be on leash outside of yard at all times.
Not great for small kids, steep staircase to upper bedrooms.

name: RIGHT BY WINE! Horse Country-Pool Table-Hot Tub
title: Delaplane, Virginia

gallery.caption: Outdoor fire pit and hot tub for you to enjoy!
Living room with 65” TV and Direct TV satellite.
Master bathroom. Custom quartz rainfall shower.
Fully stocked kitchen for your cooking needs.
Evenings are beautiful in the yard.
Relax on the patio with privacy.
Living room couch seating for 8 people comfortably. Additional chairs are available in the dining room to seat more if needed.
Basement bathroom with two custom shower heads.
Basement bathroom with two custom shower heads.
Coffee, cream, sugar provided with French press and coffee maker.
Old school Nintendo with dozens of games available in the bunk bed room. Have fun!
Spend the afternoon at Three Fox Vineyard and Brewery or one of the other 14 local vineyards and enjoy the evening on the patio with your favorite samples.
Bring your own briquettes and enjoy the barbecue grill.
Corn hole is available in the basement game closet.
Three Fox is accesible by road or by foot via the creek trail behind the home or along the road.
Enjoy the big sky of stars at night away from the city.
Upstairs bathroom. Full shower and bath tub.
Relax and enjoy nature on Crooked Run.
Walk to Three Fox Vineyard and Brewery on the nature trail.
Three Fox Vineyard and Brewery is right across the creek.
Big Yankee Ames is reported to be buried somewhere on the 7 acres.
Our favorite restaurants are only minutes away.
Far West is located in the very heart of Virginia’s famous wine country.

hosts.about: I love the Smokies and Shenandoah! We (me, husband, & FIVE kids) fell in love with these mountains our first visits in 2014 and 2015. And now we host! We sought to create the perfect cabin and farmhouse experience (BIG views, seclusion, privacy, central location, king suites, hot tubs, fire pits, spacious decks, BIG TVs, open-air showers, intricate details, & more). We look forward to hosting you!

recent.comments: Had an excellent stay at Leora’s home. Would definitely recommend to anyone staying in the area.

items.comments: Had an excellent stay at Leora’s home. Would definitely recommend to anyone staying in the area.

From start to finish Leora was friendly, communicative, and helpful.  The property was the perfect place for our get together, both beautiful and welcoming. Check-in and check-out was simple. Being next to Three Fox Vineyard was an added plus.
          Would definitely go back again.
Thanks Leora!
David

Excellent location for an adult trip to Virginia wine country.  Comfortably fit our four couples with room to spare.  Great patio for relaxing and yard for games.  Kitchen fully equipped for cooking meals and we spent every evening downstairs playing pool.  Three fox vineyard and brewery is fantastic and walkable from the house.
Great house, with lots of fun amenities.  We would definitely stay again.
Perfect place for us for the Upperville Horse Show. Very Comfortable and great location!  Leora was a great host and very responsive to any communication.

Leora’s home is beautiful! Great activities to do and the outdoor patio is something out of a dream. Close to wineries which are so much fun too. She was very communicative with us and very easy to talk with. I recommend this to everyone!
Wonderful time for girls weekend

description.summary:
We invite you to come stay at our newly renovated 1840 farmhouse in Delaplane. WALK TO WINE. It's just down the trail!

Our farmhouse is in the BEST location: Right in the heart of beautiful Virginia Wine Country! Vineyards and breweries galore within 5-15 minutes! Five minutes from Sky Meadows State Park! 25 minutes from Shenandoah National Park! 60 minutes to DC!

Come enjoy a spacious interior & beautiful, relaxing patio with an outdoor fireplace, hot tub & lawn with your friends & family.
description.space:
What to expect when you stay at our home:

AMENITIES: STARLINK INTERNET! Ceiling fans, Dish Satellite TV, board games, outdoor games, pool table, a/c, heater, down comforters, extra pillows, throw blankets, USB outlets in every room.

INDOORS:

Main Level:

*KITCHEN- fully stocked for you to use! Pots, pans, plates, bowls, silverware, drinking glasses, wine glasses, mugs, crock pot, cooking sheets, etc. There is a dishwasher, french door stainless steel refrigerator and freezer, oven, and HUGE pantry for your use. There are also bar stools on the counter bar. 

*BREAKFAST TABLE AREA- Table seats 6, look out the bay windows while you eat or enjoy your morning coffee.

*LIVING ROOM- 55' tv with Dish TV.  Seating includes a sofa, two love seats, single chair, plenty of end tables, coasters, and throw blankets.

*FORMAL DINING ROOM: Twelve foot long table with seating for up to 16.

*LAUNDRY ROOM: Washer and dryer for your use.

*HALF BATH: Toilet and sink.

Upstairs- 

*MASTER SUITE: King bed with green tea infused memory foam mattress, four pillows, flat screen TV with Dish Network, night stands with USB plug lamps, plenty of closet and shelf space. Sitting chair with throw blanket. En-suite bathroom has a walk in shower with rain fall shower head and quartz bench.

*BEDROOM 2: Queen bed with green tea infused memory foam mattress, flat screen TV with Dish Network, night stands, extra USB plugs, a corner closet with plenty of shelves and places to hang clothes.

*BEDROOM 3: Queen bed with green tea infused memory foam mattress, flat screen TV with Dish Network, night stands, extra USB plugs, a closet with plenty of shelves and places to hang clothes.

*BEDROOM 4: TWO TRIPLE BUNK BEDS! Green tea infused memory foam twin mattresses, bean bags, and old school Nintendo. Corner closet with plenty of shelves and places to hang clothes. Each bed on the bunk bed has a weight limit of 150 pounds. DO NOT cram adults into this room or these beds.

*BATHROOM 2: Full bathroom with bath tub, shower, toilet, and vanity.

Basement:

*BEDROOM 5: KIng bed with green tea infused memory foam mattress, TV with Dish Network, sitting chair with throw, huge closet space with shelves and rods for hanging clothes. This bedroom is closed off from the main space with a barn door. PLEASE NOTE- this bedroom does NOT have a locking door.

*BATHROOM 3: Double shower head walk in shower, toilet, sink.

*GAME ROOM: Pool table, refrigerator, counter space, bar table space with several bar stools. TV with Dish Network. Has an exit door to the outside patio.

OUTDOOR SPACE: Giant hand stamped patio with brick fire place (firewood not provided). Charcoal bbq grill (charcoal not provided). Adirondack chairs, bar stools and tables, benches on deck, tree swing, and hammock.
description.notes: Bring firewood, charcoal, and matches!
description.neighborhood:
Please note that the farmhouse sits about 50 yards off a main road, though traffic noise is minimal. The farmhouse and one neighbor have their own turn off away from the main road. There is an active train track about 1/2 mile away that you can sometimes hear.

VINEYARDS/BREWERIES:
Three Fox Vineyards- 2-minute drive or 10-minute walk from the back yard of the property.
RDV Vineyards-1.9 miles
Blue Valley Vineyard and Winery- 2.3 miles
Delaplane Cellars- 2.5 miles
Barrel Oak Winery and Farm Taphouse- 2.7 miles
Valley View Farm- 4.8 miles
Chateau O'Brien- 5.7 miles
Arterra Wines- 5.9 miles
Cobbler Mountain Cider- 7.1 miles
Naked Mountain Winery- 8.4 miles
Philip Carter Winery- 9.6 miles
Linden Vineyards- 13 miles
And many, MANY more!

LOCAL HISTORIC TOWNS:
Markham- 5.9 miles
Paris- 6.4 miles
Marshall- 6.5 miles
Linden-9.8 miles
Middleburg- 15 miles
Front Royal- 18 miles
Warrenton- 18 miles
Bluemont- 19 miles
Berryville- 20 miles
Winchester- 25 miles

THE GREAT OUTDOORS:
Sky Meadows State Park- 7 miles
Shenandoah National Park-18 miles

FOOD:
Burgers- Fosters Grill- Marshall
Pizza- Anthony's Pizza XIV- Marshall
Date Night- Ashby Inn- Paris
Local Fave-Johnny Monarch's- Marshall
One of A Kind- Red Fox Inn- Middleburg
Blue Agave- Marshall
Field & Main- Marshall
Hunter’s Head Tavern- Upperville

Again, this is a rural area. The home is treated on a monthly basis for bugs and critters but mother nature cannot be beat outside. You will come across some!
description.interaction: We are available via the Airbnb app before and during your stay!
description.house_rules:
PLEASE NOTE- The farmhouse is in a rural area. While it's arguably the most beautiful place in the country, there is spotty cell service and no broadband internet. You will have access to satellite WiFi. It works great for phone calls, texting and even FaceTime depending on how many guests are using it. Please turn your phone settings to enable WiFi calling when you arrive and hook up to the WiFi.

CLEAN UP AFTER YOUR DOGS. Do not let your pet on any furniture. Crate your pet when they are left at home. Two dogs MAX. NO cats or other animals of any sort. 

DO NOT load the bunk beds with adults. No more than 150 pounds per bed. Do not let kids use these beds as a toy. Do not open the windows in that room. Keep them locked. They don't have screens. 

Do not move furniture.

When using the outdoor fireplace, do not over stack. Just a few pieces of wood at a time, please. This will ensure longevity of the fireplace so people can enjoy it for years. Hot tub is for adults only!

Please watch children around the creek. It’s not fenced off. It’s usually tame and beautiful and fun to play in, but please take care. 

Do not party. We will find out and you will be told to leave. Don't smoke anything of any kind in the home or on the deck.

Before you leave please start the dishwasher and empty all trash cans. Trash pick up is every Thursday.

name: The Cottage at Stonecroft
title: Bluemont, Virginia

gallery.caption: Relaxing by the firepit watching the horses graze.

hosts.about: Karyn and Daryle fell in love with and have resided here since 2009. The cottage, Stone bank barn and main farmhouse were thoughtfully renovated on this historic property they call Stonecroft. They feel responsible as caretakers of the history and beauty of this farm. Karyn is an avid equestrian and Daryle a passionate outdoorsman. You may see them out and about either exercising their horses or training their bird dogs during your stay.

recent.comments: Cute little house on a horse farm. Be sure to ask the host to meet the horses in the barn. Very quiet, close to a farm and some wineries. Karyn was friendly and responsive.

items.comments: Cute little house on a horse farm. Be sure to ask the host to meet the horses in the barn. Very quiet, close to a farm and some wineries. Karyn was friendly and responsive.
Karyn was very kind and helpful. I would highly recommend staying here.

We lived our stay at Karyn’s farm. 2 min drive to Great Country Farms for their strawberry festival, and to breweries and wineries. The place was spotlesslessly clean and the kitchen and linens were well stocked. Karyn took the time to show our kids the horses and chickens she had on the farm. She answered all of my kids’ questions patiently. The farm was peaceful and we really loved when the dogs would come around to say hi.

Karyn is a delight! Fresh eggs from her adorable chickens. Fresh flowers from her garden. All the little touches that make your stay easy. 
This wasn’t our first stay here, and it won’t be our last! 👍
😎,
Cristine & Barry 
Saratoga Springs, NY

Karyn's little house is so cute. We had a lovely, relaxing, quiet weekend.  Beautiful surrounding and very quiet. Just the sound of the horses at night.  We slept in the front bedroom, so I can say that mattress was very comfortable. Karyn provided a variety of goods in the kitchen.  Snacks, water, bread, fresh eggs. That is really a nice thing, especially when you travel in and don't bring a lot of food. She also provided plenty of towels in the bathroom. All in all, this is just an adorable place to stay. We hope to return!

We absolutely loved our stay at this sweet little cottage. There are several wineries and breweries to enjoy. If you are looking for a place where you can relax and take in the scenery this is the perfect place.

The setting of this house is absolutely gorgeous like something out of a painting with their horses grazing in their lush green pastures. I absolutely loved sitting in the garden eating my breakfast or reading a book overlooking this serene setting. We were very sad to leave. The host family is fabulous as well and let me watch as their horses were having shoes put on.  The small rural villages surrounding Bluemont were very charming and full of civil war history.   I would come back in a heart beat.

description.summary: Nestled at the foot of the Blue Ridge Mountains among beautiful rolling hills, on a working horse farm outside the village of Bluemont. This circa 1902  Cottage will put you in touch with the history of the area, antique shops, wineries/breweries and nearby hiking. 2 bedrooms and bath upstairs; sitting/living room , dining table and full kitchen on main level. Wifi, fire pit and small charcoal grill. Over 21 only. Absolutely no pets/animals. For your safety property has video security system.
description.space:
Cozy early 1900s Cottage decorated with antiques and barn wood furniture.
Please note, low ceilings on the main level in the living areas (if over 6’ 2” will have to duck in some areas).
Amenities provided include farm fresh free range eggs from our chickens, coffee/tea, bread, bottled water and some snacks to get you started. 
Kitchen is fully furnished with essentials for cooking including basic spices, cooking oil and condiments.
Washer and Dryer available on request for stays of 5 or more nights. Some firewood provided for fire pit.
Working Horse Farm - inquire if you desire pasture, stall space (limited) or trailer parking for your equine friend, at additional cost.
description.access: Guests can enjoy the open grounds next to the cottage and a short walk through the woods down to the creek. Parking is on the gravel area beside the cottage.  Please park in front of the log, toward the left end; do not park or drive on the grass.
description.neighborhood:
Close to Bluemont Vineyard, Dirt Farm Brewery and many other vineyards and breweries. 
Appalachian Trail, Bears Den, Sky Meadows State Park, Shenandoah River and tubing all a short drive away.
Bluemont General store provides all basic necessities.
Purcellville or Berryville provide all needed services and restaurants.
description.transit: Dedicated parking for the cottage.
description.interaction: Owner resides on property in main house and is generally available if needed.
description.house_rules:
Absolutely NO smoking is allowed anywhere on the property - this includes vaping, cigars and in ones vehicle.
Please remove shoes when entering the cottage. 
Do not move/rearrange furniture without discussing with host first. 
Only clear beverages in the bedrooms.
No open flames/candles indoors.
This is a working farm - DO NOT enter the barn or any pastures. Do not pet or feed the horses. If you would like to meet them please arrange with Karyn.
Only registered guests permitted to be here - no additional people are allowed on the property. 
Do not throw sticks, balls or toys for the dogs. Please do not feed them.

name: Modern 4 bedroom farmhouse on four scenic acres
title: Markham, Virginia

gallery.caption: Large porch entryway with rocking chairs and tables. Porch faces north to private, hedged lawn.
Japanese maple and shade loving grove along front path.
View from Front porch facing north.
Front lawn with privacy Arborvitae hedge.
Tree lined driveway/ Windy Knoll Lane
Two car garage that faces west.
Large wood front door with windowed arch.
Large Dining room with expandable table
Family Room with streaming capabilities. All windows face south into the back yard and onto the deck
View from Windy Knoll Lane to the south facing facade of the house
Southeast view towards our (thriving?) vegetable garden and lawn.
Back deck with large dining table, grille and small bar top seating. This is a southern exposure.
Back of house facing east. Large cherry tree in the distance. You can eat the cherries if you can out pace the birds.
Facing south in backyard. Large twenty year old Oak tree.

Large southern pasture with nature walk. One lap is equal to 1/4 mile.
This is a view from the southernmost point of the lot, facing north towards the house and neighboring barn.

recent.comments: The Markham house was absolutely gorgeous. It truly felt like we were staying at a peaceful luxury resort in the country, even though my family were just there for an overnight stay on the way back from a vacation.  The beds were super comfortable, everything was pristinely clean, and my kids loved the bedroom upstairs with all of the toys and kids books! My only regret is not being able to stay more than one night here! Honestly the nicest Airbnb we’ve ever stayed at!

items.comments: The Markham house was absolutely gorgeous. It truly felt like we were staying at a peaceful luxury resort in the country, even though my family were just there for an overnight stay on the way back from a vacation.  The beds were super comfortable, everything was pristinely clean, and my kids loved the bedroom upstairs with all of the toys and kids books! My only regret is not being able to stay more than one night here! Honestly the nicest Airbnb we’ve ever stayed at!

We only spent a single night in this gorgeous and wonderful home.  We were taking a break in our travels back home from vacation,  and got  to stay at this peaceful gem. The home is welcoming with a wonderful layout. The beds and pillows were comfortable.  My little girl loved the toys and floor keyboard.  There was so much space for a large family. The hosts really thought of everything.  Well lit space, clear instructions,  and a wonderful view of pasture and hills. Everything worked well, and we would love to come back to stay longer!
Exceptionnel ! Il faudrait une sixième étoile !

Josh is kind, communicative, and went the extra mile to make sure we were taken care of and had a perfect time.  John was also very kind and helpful.  The house had everything we needed to arrive feeling welcomed and comfortable.  What a gorgeous place and location!  So spacious with fun things to do at the house to connect as a family (games, corn hole, a large table to seat 8 for a meal).  It felt grand with high ceilings and the rich wood arch entry ways, that gave it warm character.  We appreciated the art and uplifting messages above bedroom doors and around the house.  The place had everything one would need and then some.  It was so relaxing to enjoy family time with no worries about anything.  The house accommodated 6 of us and not one of us wanted to leave.  It’s something special when teenagers want to stay because the home and property are so beautiful.  We were already talking about planning another vacation at Markham house prior to leaving.  Thank you for a 5+ experience!

Absolutely wonderful home in private setting on beautiful rolling hills.

House was lovely and had everything one would need.

Host was extremely quick and thoughtful with replies, accommodating and gracious.  Would definitely stay again.
We had a great time. The house and it’s surroundings are beautiful and the house is well equipped. Josh is also very friendly and answers any questions promptly.

Beautiful!!! super clean house!!! I really enjoyed how I felt like I was in the country with no one in sight. It was super super relaxing! Tonic for the soul!
I am a super host and I  appreciated how well cleaned the whole house was. Josh was excellent at communicating!!! Great restaurants wineries right down the road.

description.summary:
Welcome to the wonderful Markham House.  It is nestled in the foothills of the Shenandoah Mountains, near RT 66. This modern cottage was carefully designed and has been modernized with many upgrades and conveniences. The space fosters family togetherness, natural serenity, and relaxation indoors and outdoors.  
Take a drive through scenic farmlands to visit any of the many local wineries and vineyards.  Or stay in to watch the sunset bring the landscapes colors to life off the back deck.
description.space: This cottage features an open concept floor plan with a first floor primary. The first floor has one full bathroom and one half bathroom.  Upstairs features a childrens' room, a second primary bedroom and one full bathroom.
description.access: Guests will have access to the main floor and the upstairs as well as the exterior. (The basement is where we keep the cleaning and out of season supplies and decor)

name: Historic Rockdale Private Studio Apartment
title: Shenandoah Junction, West Virginia

gallery.caption: Custom kitchen with sink, electric stove and oven, microwave, fridge, freezer, toaster, and coffee pot.  Fully stocked with utensils, plates, bowels, cups, stainless steel pots, pans, and cookware.
James taking the goats for a walk.

hosts.about:
We are enjoying hosting all our guests through AirBnB. 

All of our listings are totally private. We want you to enjoy your stay with us, so please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you.

recent.comments: Wow! The private studio was absolutely amazing! I cannot say enough good things about it. The stay was peaceful and beautiful. Their farm with goats and family dog Roo is so lovely. The location cannot be beat. Shephard Town is a hip small town with lots of great restaurants 10 minutes away. The location was also about an hour from Berkeley Springs which was also a great time with natural springs to dip in and fun artsy town.

items.comments: Wow! The private studio was absolutely amazing! I cannot say enough good things about it. The stay was peaceful and beautiful. Their farm with goats and family dog Roo is so lovely. The location cannot be beat. Shephard Town is a hip small town with lots of great restaurants 10 minutes away. The location was also about an hour from Berkeley Springs which was also a great time with natural springs to dip in and fun artsy town.
Awesome place was our second time staying there. Well be back next year. Very clean and nice place. Great shower in bathroom.
This was exactly what I needed.  It was clean, quiet, and restful, and I was well protected by a cute pup and some goats.  It was an idyllic countryside setting.  A 10 out of 10!
A Perfect West Virginia stay that feels like home!

Cute and cozy spot in a beautiful location. Highly recommend for an individual or couple looking to escape their city life and find peace in the country. Rural and secluded, just 10 minutes from Shepherdstown and the University with great restaurants and activity. The internet connection is as advertised, basically nonexistent, so definitely not a place for those who needs to work while there, which may be some of the appeal. Gracious and kind hosts.

I had a lovely weekend. The owners were so friendly and kind enough to recommend local activities. The guest suite was spotless and so comfortable; the bed and pillows were divine! I’d love to come back next time I’m in town.

It was the perfect hide away/get away.  Easy to get to things to do and secluded enough to take you away from life's hustle and bustle. Our hosts were very warm and welcoming.         
We can't wait to go back!

description.summary: Private cozy studio apartment. Sunny porch. Custom kitchen. Bathroom with heated floor and huge shower with two shower heads. Washer and Dryer and Roku Smart TV in unit.  On 15 acre tree farm with sweet GOATS, wildlife, and walking paths.
description.space: Queen bed, fully stocked kitchen with pots, pans, utensils. Coffee maker, toaster, microwave, stove, and oven.  Bright bathroom with heated floor and two person shower.
description.access: Guest have exclusive use of the studio apartment with their own separate entrance.
description.notes: Firewood and fire pit is available for guests
description.neighborhood: 10 minutes to Shepherdstown. 15 minutes to Charlestown. 25 minutes to Harpers Ferry.  Close to 81.
description.transit: Car is required.
description.interaction: Minimal interaction unless something is needed.
description.house_rules:
No parties
Please do your own dishes.

name: Cozy Creekside Cabin with a View
title: Round Hill, Virginia

hosts.about: Reagan and I started Waterford Reservations in 2017 most of the properties we built or renovated ourselves,the majority of the materials used to make our homes is reclaimed or made on My sawmill. Make sure to check out all the listings especially my favorite the DonRea Villa and plan to enjoy all the areas best winery’s, brewery’s, and reastraunts and hiking the area has to offer

recent.comments: We loved staying at the Round Hill cabin! The surrounding area was beautiful, and the cabin was super fun, comfortable, and welcoming! Our host, Maggie, was very kind and great to communicate with. Thank you for everything!

items.comments: We loved staying at the Round Hill cabin! The surrounding area was beautiful, and the cabin was super fun, comfortable, and welcoming! Our host, Maggie, was very kind and great to communicate with. Thank you for everything!

We were traveling through the area and therefore did not attempt to book until the day of our stay. Maggie was very responsive, quickly confirming our reservation and even ensuring the property was ready for us for an early check-in! We were traveling with several dogs and we found the property to be very dog friendly. The intended space within the house for the dogs was spacious and the yard allowed them space to walk outside of the vehicle. This was one of the most beautiful homes our family has ever stayed in, with gorgeous rural porch views and a backdrop of peaceful crickets and bullfrogs at night. We enjoyed laying in the hammock and gazing at the stars. The fire pit was a great addition to our night and we found the wood allocation plentiful. The house is spacious and uncluttered with a cozy-modern-cabin vibe; it has an open floor plan with adorable twinkle lights and modern fixtures such as adjustable lighting, fans and modern bathrooms throughout the home! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
It was the best Airbnb place we have visited so far. Very comfortable and felt right at the dream place to stay. It was very neat and tidy. Overall an amazing place to stay with a great host.

I was thrilled to stay at Maggie’s place on short notice, as well as extend my stay a day on short notice. 

I was traveling for work and Maggie made it so I had one less thing to worry about!

The house was beautiful and so were the views. I think I may write a poem about that willow tree some day! 

Looking forward to the next chance I get to stay!

description.summary:
Sycamore Creek Farm Cabin sits nestled on a secluded property that will give you a taste of country life while still being able to enjoy and explore all Western Loudoun County has to offer! Spacious living areas, a large deck, beautiful scenery, a hammock & outdoor fire pit makes the cabin a peaceful place to gather with family and friends. It’s time to relax, reconnect & recharge at Sycamore Creek Farm! 
📍Located 10 minutes away from a plethora of wineries, breweries, and hiking trails!
description.space:
There are open living rooms in both the upstairs and downstairs spaces. 
Kitchens are perfect for hosting and have all you would need to prepare a meal! The upstairs dining table seats 8 while the downstairs seats 6. 
The bedrooms are comfy & cozy! Be assured that you will have a wonderful nights rest! :)
description.access: Entire House
description.notes:
House is located along the woods on a farm with cows and chickens. The house is accessible by rural road about 10 minutes drive to the town of Purcellville. The farm has cows and chickens along with wild animals and bugs, especially brown marmorated stink bugs in the early fall season. Again, there are bugs, pests and animals naturally in the country so expect to find them present on the property, too. 
Internet, electricity and TV cannot be guaranteed in case of technical issues with the provider. Weather is not guaranteed, and please stay away from the creek during or following heavy rain to avoid flooding. The reservation must match no more than the permitted number of guests at any time. Guests are subject to additional large fees and charges if guests do not honor reservation agreement by exceeding total permitted number of guests. Pets are not permitted and guests are subject to additional large fees and charges if they do not honor the reservation agreement by keeping any pets on the property.


This rental is managed by Sycamore Creek Farm LLC. When booking this property, all guests must acknowledge that any and all disputes, settlements, ect. will be made solely with Sycamore Creek Farm LLC or Air BNB. No others may be involved in disputes or settlements for any reason.
description.neighborhood:
The neighborhood is 10 minutes away from grocery stores, breweries, wineries, hiking trails etc. 
The closest dining restaurants are More Better and Tammy’s Diner! 
The owner of the house lives right down the road and if you have any problems during your stay they can come and resolve as soon as possible! Even if it’s something small like having trouble getting a fire started in the fire pit-please don’t hesitate to reach out! :)
description.transit:
The road leading up to the Airbnb in windy so please use caution when arriving and departing! 
There is plenty of parking spaces on the property for guests!
description.interaction: Please feel free to reach out to us if you need something! The owner of the home lives right down down the street and can be there as soon as possible for you! Please reach out via Airbnb or the number we provide you upon checking in
description.house_rules:
PLEASE DO NOT BLOCK THE ROAD OUT FRONT OR ENTRANCE TO THE RED BARN
	Do not feed cattle or enter the cattle field. They are friendly but unpredictable. 
	Do not enter any buildings on the property. We have cameras inside!
	Any pets outside must be leashed unless inside the dog run. 
	Please do not let dogs on hardwood floors upstairs.
	Watch children around the creek. It gets deep especially after rain.
	Wood stove fires are not permitted. 
	Firewood for outdoor fire is in basement shed. Surcharge if over 20 logs per evening used during stay. Yes…we count!!
	Do not open locked rooms. We have sensors!
	Large parties without permission prohibited. 
	After 10pm please no loud music. We love our neighbors!
	Do not swim in the pond.

name: The Country French Cottage at High Meadows Estate
title: Bluemont, Virginia

recent.comments: Beautiful place, nicely decorated, and in a great location. The host was very responsive.

items.comments: Beautiful place, nicely decorated, and in a great location. The host was very responsive.

I truly loved my recent stay at the cottage. It was peaceful and surrounded by the beautiful Virginia scenery. Close to a lot of good restaurants and small towns. Teri was a wonderful host. Would definitely stay again.

Great host--available to answer questions and make recommendations, extremely helpful and approachable.   The property is beautiful and well-maintained and the house is very comfortable and super clean.

The French Cottage was delightful.  Clean, well equipped and great homey touches like a record player and a clawfoot tub that we thoroughly enjoyed. The grounds are just lovely, and we saw fireflies and enjoyed sitting on the porch with coffee in the morning.  Very easy to find and located near many great hiking opportunities.  Would definitely stay again!
Lovely, peaceful spot on gorgeous property. Friendly and responsive hosts. Would stay again!
Really nice place and area, close to many things to do. Responsive host! Would definitely stay again.

Terry’s Airbnb was a fantastic respite from the busy day life. The property is stunning, and it felt like home immediately. I have already recommended it to my friends and would stay here again. Thank you for having us.

description.summary: Come visit the alluring wine country of Bluemont Virginia, and stay in a beautifully appointed country French cottage on the 50 acre circa 1896 High Meadows Estate atop the Blueridge Mountains.  Just 50 minutes west of Washington DC, this stunning country retreat is just 5 minute from the vineyards of Bluemont, the Shenandoah River, the Appalachian Trail, Hiking, Canoeing, Kayaking, Farmers Markets, the the cute villages or Berryville, Harpers Ferry, Luckettes, Middleburg and many more.
description.space: Country french interior, new linens and towels, claw foot tub, antique record player with modern sound system and vynal record collection, books galore, beautiful kitchen and front porch, impeccable interior design, freedom to wander, relax or both.  WiFi available upon request.  Beautiful location and surroundings on largest flat meadow atop the Blueridge Mountains, on a beautiful 50 acre Estate surrounded by stone walls, mature trees, beautiful gardens, chickens and honey bees.
description.access:
This cottage has been completely renovated and decorated within the last month and is in wonderful condition.  The Estate boasts bee hives, beautiful gardens, forest paths and plenty of space and fresh air.  Perfect for a couple or two couples sharing. 

At their own risk, guests welcome to use cottage, gardens, bee hives. Barns and main house are strictly off limits.  Walking distance to Appalachian Trail, and close drive to Village of Bluemont and Watermelon Park on the Shenandoah.
description.notes: The cottage has a full kitchen, guests are welcome to bring whatever food or drinks they desire.  Maximum four sleeping guests, additional day guests permitted only with prior permission of Host.
description.neighborhood: Though only a 2 minute drive from Rte 7, High Meadows is a 50 acre Estate atop the very private and secluded Blueridge Mountains.  You can’t see the neighbors.
description.transit: Car
description.interaction: Keys left in lockbox, host available with prior arrangement.
description.house_rules:
- Guests staying one month or over are responsible for paying electric bill.   

- While walking the property is permitted at renters’ risk, no entry to barns or other structures on the property is permitted for safety purposes.
- No excessive noise, no bonfires without supervision of owner, absolutely no entry to barns or other structures, acknowledges bees on property.

name: Farmhouse Getaway w/fresh eggs
title: Damascus, Maryland

recent.comments: highly recommend! great hosts, great family. thank you!!

items.comments: highly recommend! great hosts, great family. thank you!!

We had a great time at the farm. Jason was there to great us and was very helpful with local directions and community options. Our stay was just what we were looking for, very relaxing and a feel of home.
This was our second time staying here.    Super host, friendly, and easy to communicate with.   It's perfect for our needs.  It's exactly as described.

I stayed at Jason and Nikki’s guest house for four nights just before Easter. Home: it’s a 1950s/1960s 3BR, approx. 1500 sq ft., well built and in very good shape. All clean, uncluttered, good natural light. The bright master bedroom has high comfy bed and lovely view over field towards Jason & Nikki’s house.  Other bedroom is smaller, darker, cooler during a hot day. Third, smallest bedroom is laundry room. Area: at the far end of a new suburban development, there’s a dirt road to the house, from which all you see is sky and gently rolling land. On the bench swing I enjoyed gentle breezes and sweet, clean air. Since it was peak egg-laying season, I had fresh chicken and duck eggs every day! Hosts: Nikki was busy but attentive, and I enjoyed a crafts evening with her eldest. Problems: a brief electricity outage, but Nikki texted as she heard from the local utility and even got the toilet working again! A folding chair from the porch provides a seat with back at the dining table.
Na

This old but clean farmhouse cottage had comfortable beds and kept us toasty warm during an arctic weekend with 3 degree windchill.  Lovely sunshine through the front bedroom windows. We felt very welcome with our two dogs. (If your dogs are runners like ours, they will need to be leashed outside as there is no dog fencing). We wrapped ourselves up and had some lovely & peaceful walks around the farm. The hosts were friendly and responsive.

We booked Jason and Nikki's place at the very last minute (booked early morning and checked in in the afternoon) for a night away from the city. Although it was a brief stay it was exactly what we needed! The AirBnB is far from the main house, enough to feel private, but Nikki was very responsive whenever we needed anything. The house is simple but comfortable, like going home to grandma's house. The real draw was the land - we enjoyed walking around and our pups loved running all over. The kitchen is well stocked with cookware but guests will need to bring their own cooking oil, spices etc. During our stay Nikki let us know that there was family member staying in the basement. We never heard or saw her (the basement has a private entrance). Overall, we would recommend this place to anyone looking for a peaceful, no-frills retreat to the country (especially if you have fur babies that love to run around!)

description.summary: Located less than 1 hour from DC and Baltimore our farm offers a great place to get out and get away. There is no traffic noise nor hustle and bustle here. Come relax in a cozy farmhouse with the ability to explore and enjoy 70 unrestricted acres. Feel free and walk out in the morning and gather fresh eggs for breakfast or fresh vegetables from the garden. High speed WiFi makes this space a great place to work remotely from for the day or week.  This listing does not include the basement.
description.space: Our farm has been in our family for over 100 years. We have 70 unrestricted acres that you can explore and enjoy. If you live in the city and just want to get away or you are passing through from outside the area this farm offers you the ability to get outside and live without having to sacrifice the modern conveniences of our daily lives. Feel free to collect fresh eggs for breakfast or fresh vegetables as a snack or dinner. Cook outside next to a campfire or just enjoy the stream, fields, animals, scenery and quiet life. If you must work make this farm your most favorite work area with beautiful views and high speed WiFi. We are about 2 miles from town with grocery stores, drug stores and many restaurants.  This listing does not include the basement of the house as it is reserved for the use as storage and family members when needed.
description.access: Guests will have access to as much or as little as they would like just as if they were part of the family.
description.notes: This is a working farm with other people around the property. This is a very private and secluded area that will give you the peace and comfort that you are looking for.
description.neighborhood: Our farm is conveniently located less than an hour from DC and Baltimore. Stores and restaurants located within a couple miles. Many other great places are within a short driving distance such as the C and O Canal, Monocacy Battlefield, Gettysburg, many on farm breweries and tons of other outdoor activities.
description.interaction:
I am a fireman in Washington DC and work 7 days a month. We live in another house on
the property so we are always around to be involved as much or as little as you would like.  This is a working farm so there may be people harvesting/planting crops, working with and tending to animals or doing various other farming activities.
description.house_rules: We only have one rule and that is have an amazingly relaxing stay...  Pets are allowed on a case by case basis.  Larger areas of property are available for events. Additional pricing will apply for events.

name: Barn Apartment in VA Wine Country
title: Purcellville, Virginia

gallery.caption: Second bedroom with bed and fold-out sleeper couch
Wake up overlooking the pond and pastures

hosts.about: I love being an airbnb host.  It makes me happy when people experience and appreciate the things I love about living here.

recent.comments: Pam's place was exactly as described.  It is a tremendous bargain.  It has a great outdoor space located next to a vineyard.  Pam could not have been more accommodating.  Communication was great.  I highly recommend this place.

items.comments: Pam's place was exactly as described.  It is a tremendous bargain.  It has a great outdoor space located next to a vineyard.  Pam could not have been more accommodating.  Communication was great.  I highly recommend this place.

If you are looking for a place to get away this is it. There is very little traffic. While sitting at the table you can look out over a small vineyard, see nature, listen to the music of wildlife and relax. There is lots todo not far from where you are staying. Don’t be alarmed at all the “Welcome to…” state signs as you travel. I would come back and stay here again.
The place is very beautiful and very quiet, she is very cordial and is always attentive to answer

We have been staying with Pam at least once a year for the past five years!  We feel like it is our Virginia
home away from home.

We absolutely loved the barn loft apartment that Mrs. Pam hosted! She was always kind, friendly, and super responsive and quick to fix all of our issues! (Routine maintenance on A/C, nothing her fault!) The place is private, easy to access, and was perfect for our month long stay as my husband worked in Leesburg! We loved that it was out in the country but also not far from Purcellville or Charles Town, WV for groceries or places to eat. There are vineyards/winery’s within a few miles! If we are ever back this way, we will definitely be staying again!

Pam's place was just what we needed. It is a newly remodelled barn, with a great kitchen, a cozy couch with movies and two bedrooms. It is located inside the vinyard, so you are actually inside of the country-side itself sorrounded by green and peace. The barn is is far enough from the main house that we only ran into her once and felt as we had all the place for ourselves. Definitely recommend.

Pam's place is quiet and private and surrounded by nature. she's a very friendly and communicative host, should any needs arise.  for me, this cozy apartment was a nice refuge after each day spent visiting with local friends. I hope next time I visit I'll get to try out the various outdoor activities available on the premises

description.summary: Barn apartment in the upper level of a bank barn. Fourteen miles from downtown Leesburg, 5 miles from Harper's Ferry, 1 mile from VA-9 Appalachian trail head.  Close to Harper's Ferry Adventure Center, wineries, breweries, tubing, kayaking, hiking, farms. Full kitchen. Unplugged - no satellite, TV, or Internet.  There is cell signal.  Rate includes 6% Virginia state tax and 7% Loudoun County hotel tax. 1 queen bed, 1 twin, and 1 floor mattress (pull out futon).
description.space: The apartment has a spacious MBR with queen bed and a second bedroom with twin.  There is a loveseat that folds out into basically a mattress on the floor, mostly suitable for kids or young people.  There is no separate dining room - the kitchen has an extra counter with barstools.  The living room is small, with a little couch and two chairs.  It has a TV/DVD player.  Note there is no satellite or cable, you will want to bring movies (there is a small collection in the apartment).  This is an unplugged experience.  We have coyote, bear, hawks, various waterfowl, amphibians, foxes, groundhogs, weasels, raccoons and opossums, although many are shy and rare to see.  There is a great open space for sky viewing, and you may catch us out there sometimes.
description.access: Roam the grounds, light a fire and sit around the campfire ring, relax in the hammock, use the swing, or jump on the trampoline.  If you're lucky you may hear owls or coyotes or a fox in season.  The barn cats will greet you and love any pets you're willing to give.  There are two chairs by the campfire ring, and extra folding chairs in the barn loft.  The apartment is on the upper level of the barn.  The chairs and fire ring are across the driveway from the barn, down a slight hill.
description.notes: The thermostat is in the hallway - feel free to adjust it for comfort.
description.neighborhood:
There are many local attractions and recreation spots within a few minutes drive. Many of them are in the guidebook.  However, the guidebook doesn't let me add events and activities that don't have a physical address, so here are some you might want to know about.
Right here on site, local astrophotographer Andrew Baker conducts sky tours and demonstrates the techniques and equipment he uses to catch the amazing shots on his website.  Contact him to arrange a sky tour here:
https://thebackyardcosmos.wixsite.com/astro/tours
Or on Facebook (you can also see some awesome photos there):
https://www.facebook.com/thebackyardcosmos/

You can fly over the area:
https://balikoutdoors.com/nature-flightseeing

Visit the Mountain Heritage Arts and Crafts festival if you're here one of the two weekends (spring and fall):
http://www.mhacfestival.org/

As a former 4H parent and daughter of a dairy clubber, the Loudoun County Fair has a special place in my heart.  Learn about farming, livestock, and what beef fitting is.  Oh, and maybe go on some rides or see a show. :)
http://loudouncountyfair.com/
description.transit: You can get here by car. That's pretty much it. We've never yet had a guest arrive by helicopter. If that's your preference, there's a decent-sized grass field which might serve as an ersatz heliport. Use at your own risk, though; note there's no aviation fuel available on-site.
description.interaction: I live on the property, in the house above the barn. Let me know if you'd like to meet. I have children--and they love to meet and play with all our guests, but they are especially thrilled to find out when guests are coming with kids.  Feel free to ask me anything you'd like to know about the area.
description.house_rules: We do have our own children, so please enjoy yourself, but do be sensible about causing a commotion late at night.  Turning off outdoor lights when you're in for the night will reduce bugs.  Please don't let our cats in to the apartment - they are not to be trusted!  This is a non-smoking property.

name: The Honey Acres House
title: Boyds, Maryland

recent.comments: I can’t say enough great things about our stay at Honey Acres. My family of three along with our doggo stayed for about two weeks as we waited for our new construction home to be finished. The Honey Acres house turned out to be just what we needed. Peaceful, secluded, clean, and well appointed. There was much to love about our stay, but a few standouts….. we enjoyed cooking and eating outside on the terrace, loved  relaxing in the cozy recliners every morning  for coffee, and couldn’t wait to walk around the grounds every evening with our pup to visit the horses, donkeys, sheep, and alpaca. The horses were so curious about our dog and always came to the fences to say hello. Grocery store and gas station only about 5 min away which was great. Brian and Ann were friendly responsive hosts and we very much hope to stay again in the future.

items.comments: I can’t say enough great things about our stay at Honey Acres. My family of three along with our doggo stayed for about two weeks as we waited for our new construction home to be finished. The Honey Acres house turned out to be just what we needed. Peaceful, secluded, clean, and well appointed. There was much to love about our stay, but a few standouts….. we enjoyed cooking and eating outside on the terrace, loved  relaxing in the cozy recliners every morning  for coffee, and couldn’t wait to walk around the grounds every evening with our pup to visit the horses, donkeys, sheep, and alpaca. The horses were so curious about our dog and always came to the fences to say hello. Grocery store and gas station only about 5 min away which was great. Brian and Ann were friendly responsive hosts and we very much hope to stay again in the future.

This place is amazing! The serene views from all angles of the house are a sight to be seen. A wonderful place for bird and horse lovers. The house was lovely and had more than enough space for a family of 4 plus a dog. It will be difficult to stay in a hotel after this! We will be back!

Honey Acres Farm met and exceeded all expectations! It is not just an amazing home, the majestic trees, friendly horses, mischievous goats and caring staff make for the complete experience. It’s like stepping back in time but with all the modern day luxuries, only if the walls could talk. Thank you for the memories! 
PS- Big fish in the pond!

"Gorgeous" does not do this property justice. It was truly breathtaking. You drive down a driveway lined by oak trees and horse pastures filled with ponies playing with each other. At dusk, hundreds of fireflies came out covering the yard, making it look magical. There is a pond with this amazing little island in the middle. Tons of beautiful birds and landscaping is impeccable.  
You stay in the big house...originally built in 1820!! The kitchen has the herth, and you can literally smell the history! It's the  perfect blend of old and new. The house is like a little maze with all the additions from  the years passed. Super fun!
Ample kitchen supplies for bigger families. Beds are super comfy. Nice linens. I was a wimp and afraid to sleep in the old part of the house the first night, but my goldilocks self got over it...perk, I sampled 2 beds! The room with the skylights has the best bed.
They have a grill, patio seating, fire pit, &porch. We are coming back next year & staying longer.

The house and grounds are amazing!!! Loved the house, horses, grounds and all other accomodations!!!
Rooms, beds all very confortable.
Only tub, no shower, in 1 BR was only drawback. If you like baths, it's a great tub.
Overall this is a great property and would definitely stay here again!!

I am asked to say a few words about our stay.... I just can't say a few.  We have traveled to other states and countries using Airbnb and other rental sites.  We love the home feeling instead of hotels.  Honey Acres is more than home - it is a retreat, an oasis. 

The hosts were above and beyond at every turn.  There was nothing that we could have asked more for.  The house had a plentiful supply of everything and a little extra.  We could have hosted a 20 person dinner party with the supplies in the kitchen and cupboards. The game collection in the Great Room was a perfect compliment to the stunning and large dining table. There were so many places to relax and find respite inside the house. The exterior of the house is simply stunning, like a set from a movie.  We wished we could stay longer to just relax and absorb the serenity. 

The beds were very comfortable, the air conditioning did its job.  The house needs another shower but it is in the future plans.  We hope to return soon!

description.summary: Relax at this large historic farm house with peaceful views of a pond and fields of grazing horses. Enjoy the well lit great room, the cozy living room, or the spacious patio. Watch the geese and herons on the pond, or take a walk around the property for charming views of horses in the fields. Unwind, reconnect and recharge in this magical place minutes away from Windridge Vineyards and Landmade Farm Brewery. Just 45 minutes from downtown DC.
description.neighborhood: Located on 77 acres in the Montgomery County Agriculture Reserve, Honey Acres is a beautiful farm, just minutes away from Windridge Vineyard, Landmade Farm Brewery, Lewis Orchard, and the hiking trails on Seneca Creek.
description.house_rules: Please stay out of horse fields. Contact host if you would like a tour of the barn.

name: Farm Charm with City Style
title: Middleburg, Virginia

gallery.caption: Stunning Gourmet Kitchen with all the amenities to make an amzing meal.  Don't like to cook, we have chef's that can come to you and prepare your perfect meal!
Extra large couch is perfect for reading your favorite book as you relax and enjoy the views.
This beautiful newly rennovated tractor barn has amazing views onto the 66 acer farm.  You can look onto rare mini highlanders as you drink your morning coffee or sip on an evening glass of wine.
This large King bed has a pillow topper and soft cotton sheets.
Built in desk unit for you to do your work from home while you are away...but don't work too hard as we want you to rest and relax.
Sit by the fire and enjoy a good book.
We have a full washer and dryer as well as an industrial icemaker for your use.
We have stunning barn you can go sit in to read a book or have a meal.
Eat, Write, Read all while being inside our gorgous barn.
Have a delicious meal here while enjoying the shade and gorgeous views.
Have a drink under the trees or just come out to read a good book.
we have lots of beautiful nooks where you can sit and enjoy the great outdoors.
Meet Coco and Cash, our insta famous mini highlander cows.
Our 8 kent sheep are absolutly stunning and so fun to watch as they graze.
We have 8 gorgeous Kent Sheep on property that will welcome you as you come and go each day.
We live one mile from the historic Red Fox Inn and the Salamander Resort and Spa!
Our favorite local hang out is the coffee shop that also sells great lunch and breakfast sandwhiches.  Enjou your favorite coffee from Common Grounds.

recent.comments: Gorgeous unit near the heart of Middleburg. The bed was super comfortable and the home is peaceful and serene. Responsive hosts and friendly grounds keeper.

items.comments: Gorgeous unit near the heart of Middleburg. The bed was super comfortable and the home is peaceful and serene. Responsive hosts and friendly grounds keeper.

Far and away the nicest Airbnb I’ve stayed at. I was blown away- as pretty as the pictures are it was even better in person. So quiet, luxurious, peaceful, well equipped and comfortable. I hope to return one day! If you’re on the fence about the price, just do it! It’s like being in an architectural digest photo shoot :-)
This is hands down my fav stay ever.  No detail was overlooked in the design and execution of this lovely property.  The host was lovely.  I cannot wait to stay again.

An absolutely stunning place.  Peaceful and serene with beautiful surroundings (drink coffee outside looking at endless green rolling hills and the cutest mini-cows you can imagine) with sophisticated gorgeous design.

WOW! Stunningly beautiful! Every last detail was 5 ⭐️ - I think even the toilet paper was designer! My husband and I were in the area for a conference of weighty subject matter and Angela’s place was the perfect respite each evening. We rested comfortably and in great style! Our only regret is that we didn’t have more time to just enjoy the grounds. Highly recommend this lovely place 😊
Angela was the nicest host that I have dealt with and her place was impeccable!

Angela’s place is lovely and the location is perfect! The attention to detail she puts into everything - from the coffee maker to the speaker and everything in between - is really exceptional, and makes the place feel so luxurious. The cows, Coco and Cash, are adorable and friendly. We really enjoyed our stay here and would happily come back :)

description.summary: Enjoy the beauty of a gorgeous Middleburg Farm when you stay in this unique barn turned studio apartment!
description.space: The Studio has a pillow top King bed.  The property has walking trails, pastures with our sweet pets and a gorgeous stable turned into boutique lounges.  Guests will have full access of the farm land with the exception of the fenced in yard behind the main house.  There are people living in the main house so please be respectful of their space.  We ask that you do not feed the animals unless you arrange with us to meet you there (please reach out and we will send you a link to our farm experience listing). If it is pre-arranged, we would love to give you an up close experience with our animals to include feeding, petting, brushing and getting a great picture.  However, you are always welcome to admire the animals from outside the pastures. For the safety of our animals, no pets are allowed. All smoking is strictly prohibited.
description.access:
You are welcome to explore the farm, but please do not go into the pastures with the animals.  We do offer farm tours with the ability to feed, pet and get pictures with the animals.  If you are interested in meeting the Mini Highlanders 
and the Kent sheep,  please just reach out through the app and let us know you would like to do that during your stay and we can schedule an interactive experience for a minimal charge.

name: Self-contained apartment on Organic vegetable farm
title: Middleburg, Virginia

hosts.about: Hi! I am Pam and I am a former pro-athlete turned farmer. I own and run a sustainable farm in the foothills of the Blue Ridge mountains, and raise sheep, turkeys, pigs and chickens. I am a mother to Harry and together with my husband Rob, we are passionate about nature, the environment and creating a beautiful world for our children to grow up in.

recent.comments: Lovely place. Cool farm. Beautiful countryside, easy drive into Middleburg which is a quaint town for walking and excellent shopping.

items.comments: Lovely place. Cool farm. Beautiful countryside, easy drive into Middleburg which is a quaint town for walking and excellent shopping.
We had a wonderful, relaxing time.

Great stay—the space was clean and quiet and just like the photos. AC cooled things down quickly. About seven min drive to Middleburg and surround area is beautiful. Host was very easy to communicate with.
Great stay!
Quaint & private getaway, with charming hosts & good communication. Convenient to middleburg & wineries. Highly recommended.
She was personably when I arrived. The place was clean and perfect for the quick overnight stay.
Amazing!

description.summary:
Enjoy a relaxing retreat at a genuine sustainable organic vegetable farm. 

This self-contained apartment is the perfect location for a family get away, or overnight stay whilst visiting the many local wineries and breweries. 

The farm is located just 5 miles from historic Middleburg, right in the middle of hunt country. 

See what life is like on a working farm, with seasonal healthy vegetables growing just steps from the door and farm animals grazing outside your window.
description.interaction: The apartment has a lockbox and key and therefore is self check-in. We live and work on-site so will be around to answer any questions.
