hosts.about:
Hi! We’re Evolve, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.

recent.comments:
This is our second year at Mom’s Bee House, and we enjoyed our time just as much. Are we like to spend a week hiking, visiting wineries and local restaurants, and otherwise just relaxing. They have a huge washer and dryer so we packed have to clothes this time. The dogs love the fenced backyard and we love the deck. 

Make sure you text the Guest Contact, Sarah directly to get the door code beforehand. The link to Guest Contact in Airbnb does not go directly to her. The cell service in the area is extremely spotty. We found it best to pull any information we needed during our outings before we left the house every day.

items.comments:
This is our second year at Mom’s Bee House, and we enjoyed our time just as much. Are we like to spend a week hiking, visiting wineries and local restaurants, and otherwise just relaxing. They have a huge washer and dryer so we packed have to clothes this time. The dogs love the fenced backyard and we love the deck. 

Make sure you text the Guest Contact, Sarah directly to get the door code beforehand. The link to Guest Contact in Airbnb does not go directly to her. The cell service in the area is extremely spotty. We found it best to pull any information we needed during our outings before we left the house every day.
This is a beautiful location and very quiet and private.  Beautiful views and a great place to stay.

Excellent overall stay - comfortable beds and well set up for cooking.    Not entirely private as it is a shared space with the owners.  The horses nearby are kind and peaceful.  There is a cute coffee shop about a five-minute drive away.

My husband and our toddler stayed here for a long weekend and it was lovely. So peaceful and quiet. LOVED enjoying our coffee in the gorgeous sunroom and evenings on the porch watching the sun set. Star gazing around the fire pit at night was also great. Our local host was very responsive and friendly and flexible (kindly let us check in early so our toddler could get down for a nap). Our kiddo LOVED watching the horses in the nearby field and also enjoyed spotting a baby fox by the road near the house. Close to all our favorite spots in Sperryville and the surrounding area and got to check out the cafe and Irish pub in Flint Hill for the first time, both of which were lovely. Highly recommend!!
Had a great stay here!

Just a wonderful experience overall. Very relaxing stay and could not have picked a better location for the calm and privacy we were seeking. Sarah was a great host and gave excellent tips and local referrals. Her communication was great and she accommodated all of our requests.

We spent two nights at Mom's Bee House as part of my wife's birthday weekend.  The house is lovely; although it is out in the country, it is relatively easy to get to many area attractions (wineries, Inn at Little Washington, certain trail heads for hiking); and the hosts were responsive and full of suggestions for additional activities and experiences (we didn't have time to fully take advantage of everything on offer).  We appreciated the fire pit in the back yard, as well as the fenced-in area (our dog particularly enjoyed that).  Highly recommended and would absolutely stay here again.

description.summary: Bring along the whole crew - family and pets - to this 2-bedroom, 1.5-bath environmentally friendly home! Offering a secluded locale in the Blue Ridge Mountain foothills near Flint Hill, this vacation rental features a gas stove, an expansive deck, and an office, perfect for remote work. On a working horse farm with a barn, pasture and trails, this property is ideal for horse and dog lovers! Don't miss out on attractions ranging from vineyards to Shenandoah National Park's trails.

name: Spring House Farm Apartment in Wine Country
title: Purcellville, Virginia

hosts.about: I am a Professional Firefighter for Fairfax County and run a full-time livestock farm in Loudoun County, Virginia.  I'm married and have two school aged children.  My farm efforts have allowed me to raise my children and in a wholesome environment, learning about hard work and a peaceful lifestyle. My children love to help me feed the pigs, chase goats, and rotate fencing for the cattle.  My farm has been decorated with many awards for my efforts and that makes the hard work worth the challenge! You will enjoy our eggs and bacon upon your arrival.

recent.comments: We always feel like we are home at our respite place here! Wonderful quiet surroundings! And Hudson the cat always so sweet! Andy even brought us a  fan since the bedroom overhead was out of order. Looking forward to our next time!

items.comments: We always feel like we are home at our respite place here! Wonderful quiet surroundings! And Hudson the cat always so sweet! Andy even brought us a  fan since the bedroom overhead was out of order. Looking forward to our next time!

The little piggies are so cute and always entertaining.
Recommended.
Amazing stay with plenty of beautiful sites to see
Peaceful location and apartment exactly as displayed in the photographs so no surprises!  Enjoyed the eggs and sausage left for us and the quick response from Andrew as needed.

This is a lovely apartment that is above a working garage on the owner’s farm property. Despite that, the apartment was very quiet and well-maintained. It has everything you need to relax for a few days. There’s no television but the Wi-Fi was consistent and strong enough to stream movies on my laptop. 

Andrew is friendly and eager for his guests to have a peaceful stay with no hassle.

Andrew’s property is in a beautiful quiet and super convenient location, it was the perfect base for a weekend of wine tastings. It had everything thing we needed and we were super grateful for the washer and dryer after a busy few weeks of traveling.

The apartment was exactly as we expected. Andrew happened to be there when we arrived since it is part of a working farm. He greeted us and helped us get settled in, provided some recommendations for local restarants and breweries. The place was clean and comfortable. Very quiet and secluded. Had everything we needed. I caught a respectable large mouth bass in the private pond on the property. Would absolutely stay again.

description.summary: This rental is great for anyone seeking a get away to Loudoun's Wine County and surrounding areas. At the foothills of Short Hill Mountain you will enjoy this space near wineries, historic Harper's Ferry and the Potomac River. Load your bike, kayak, and hiking boots and enjoy all that Western Loudoun has to offer. You’ll love this place with 2 adjacent wineries to the farm & a 3 acre stocked pond, grab a book(no tv)and hit the highway to Western Loudoun and welcome an opportunity for adventure.
description.space: This unique space is located within one of our farm properties and is a second story apartment overlooking our pastures. Typical guests can observe goats and pigs foraging on our property. The property is ideal for those who might want to telework in a peaceful setting, as the internet is dependable.
description.access: Guests can fish on the pond or hike the local area near the property. Some enjoy visiting the local vineyard, next door.
description.notes: Bacon and eggs are typically in the fridge! You may want to grab your favorite food items to bring along, as a grocery store is not nearby.

description.interaction: We are available via phone/message when we are not working on the property. Typically we stop by daily to check animals, work in the attached garage, or combat daily chores!

Karen and the team went above and beyond to make our stay great!
Great place to spend a serene getaway.  Lots of peace mixed with the serenity of farm living.  Would recommend!

Karen and Roy were amazing!  We had such a wonderful stay in the bunkhouse!  The farm tour was a highlight and we were able to watch the fireworks in the distance from the top of Paris Hill. I highly recommend a stay, or at least a drop-in to buy some fabulous Wagyu beef and a tour of the picturesque surroundings. It’s a MUST-SEE!!!
We had an incredible time, cannot recommend this place more! So tranquil and accommodating. The farm was beautiful and we got a great tour!

What a wonderful hidden gem. We loved visiting the cows! It was just a lovely and peaceful spot to stay and still easy to get everywhere we needed to go. The host was extremely responsive and we cannot wait to return.
This place is like a hidden gem. The scenery is beautiful and the host is incredibly accommodating. We all love this cabin and the entire experience!

description.summary:
Celebrate the Holidays at Ovoka Farm with our Wagyu cows! 
Nested in the Blue Ridge & on Winery Trail, our restored 1800's Farm Stay Bunkhouse Cabin awaits as your country retreat Farm Stay. Upon arrival, we'll show you to your Bunkhouse & plan your Private Farm Tour to see our cattle operations and the top of the world from Paris Mountain. Then relax and enjoy your welcome basket. While you're here explore, hike, fish, picnic -- refresh. Kitchen is ready for DIY chef'ing and we got the Beef!
description.space:
The Farm is located on 700 acres in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains and is steeped in Virginia history, predating the Civil War. Although the Farm is the most photographed and painted farm in the County and has been featured in many articles & on garden tours, until now, the home has never offered Farm Tour & Stay.   
The Bunkhouse Cabin offers 3 bedrooms: second floor Master Bdrm with a Queen bed; first floor bdrm with a Queen bed, first floor kid bdrm 2 twin, second floor youth-sized built-in wall bunks (2 twin).  One full bathroom with shower on 2nd floor and powder room on first floor.  
Your private backyard has a firepit and lounge chairs for your to enjoy the incredible sunset views.  Your private pond in your side yard awaits your catch (& release) of a lifetime.   
On your Private Farm Tour, you'll get an inside look at our farm operations,  meet our friendly Wagyu cattle, and 4-wheel to the top of the mountain to talk about the farm's history and our husbandry practices --  of course, all while enjoying the most memorable views of the Piedmont!
description.access:
Gourmet outdoor kitchen with grill and Italian stone pizza oven, full-sized pool, cabana, and bathhouse available for separate charge $100 / day; paid separately.
Enjoy a gourmet Wagyu meal prepared by one of our Resident Chefs in the Manor home.  In addition to touring the stunning home, built in the late 1700's with additions added in the 1800's and renovated in 2014, dine in the main dining room on the 16-person circa mid-1700's dining table with unforgettable views to the sunset while your menu is flawlessly executed.  You will feel comfortable and immersed  in a history few will ever have the opportunity to experience.  (Separate charge starting at $250/person)
description.notes: The Farm is close to Great Meadows for the Gold Cup, restaurants and shopping in Upperville, Marshall, and Middleburg, endless hiking trails, including the Appalachian Trail, and more wineries than you could visit in a week. During your Farm Stay, we can arrange a Private Gourmet Wagyu Dinner with one of our Resident Chefs.  You may never want to leave and we'll count the days 'til your return!   NOTE: Our cabin's Living Room is built to 1800's height, so guests over 6' tall may not be comfortable due to low ceilings. In order to ensure your safety and that of our animals, only the guests on your registered Farm Stay may stay and/or enjoy the amenities on the Farm during your Farm Stay.   Also, as much as we love animals, we ask that our guests leave their pets at home during their stay.  Our dogs, horses, cows can be unpredictable with other animals and we want to keep our guests' pets safe.
description.neighborhood:
- Short walk to Ashby Inn
- 12 miles from Salamander Resort and Market
- Wineries and Vineyards within 5 miles
description.interaction: We're pleased to include with your stay a tour of our farm and a 4-wheel drive up to the top of the mountain to enjoy the views of the Piedmont and see and learn a little about our cattle.
description.house_rules:
When you arrive we'll go over farm rules, but please note that pursuant to Virginia law, we must notify you that:  
Under Virginia law, there is no liability for an injury to or death of a participant in an agritourism activity conducted at this agritourism location if such injury or death results from the inherent risks of the agritourism activity. Inherent risks of agritourism activities include, among others, risks of injury inherent to land, equipment, and animals, as well as the potential for you to act in a negligent manner that may contribute to your injury or death. You are assuming the risk of participating in this agritourism activity.  Chapter 64. Agritourism Activity Liability. § 3.2-6402. Notice required.

name: Idyllic Rural Loudoun Retreat at Bright Skye Farm
title: Lovettsville, Virginia

gallery.caption: The main room features a bed, TV, closet and microwave/refrigerator.
This is one of the hens you will see during your stay!
You might catch a glimpse of the ducks out the window!
The flock love to poke around outside!

1: Guest Suite (above garage)
2: Guest Parking
3: Main House (if you have ?'s)
4: Chicken/Duck Yard
5: Entrance/Exit

hosts.about:
Hey! I'm Brad. I'm originally from northwest Ohio but have been living in Northern Virginia since 2009. 

By day, I'm a mild-mannered supervisor for a rental car company at Dulles Airport but I moonlight as a hobby farmer! My wife, Ely, and I raise chickens for eggs and ducks for fun as well as grow produce in our garden. Combine that with all of the weeding and yard work that comes with a three-acre property we stay pretty busy!

We are also big dog-lovers and have a golden retriever named Lindy and a lab mix named Ellie. They love exploring their yard in the country and taking walks in the neighborhood with us on weekends before it gets too hot!

Lastly, I'm a soccer and baseball nut. You can usually find me glued to my TV if my beloved West Ham United or Detroit Tigers are playing! I'm looking forward to our next trip to Europe to visit some additional soccer 'cathedrals'.

I have lived all over Northern Virginia but I really found happiness in the peace and tranquility of western Loudoun County. There's tons to see and do if I ever had the free time to do it!

recent.comments: Have stayed multiple times and will be back.  Perfect

items.comments: Have stayed multiple times and will be back.  Perfect
Perfect for our overnight stay prior to a wedding the next day.  Clean and comfortable.  Proximity to Flying Ace Farm distillery and brewery is a plus.
This was 2nd stay and it will NOT be my last!

This far exceeded our expectations for our weekend getaway exploring the local area.  From Harper’s Ferry Brewery for lunch and few adult beverages, followed by dinner at a local restaurant recommended by Bradley in a very detailed book located in the immaculate rental, to exploring Harper’s Ferry that evening and then a very peaceful night’s rest before a 9 mile hike before heading home, Bradley’s place gave us a fantastic place to use as a home base for a whirlwind weekend.  We were able to meet the owners and they were very welcoming and friendly.  We adored the chicken and the rooster, Einstein.  We look forward to coming back again when we can spend more time exploring this wonderful area and staying at this beyond perfect rental  that was very clean and so overall perfection.  There is not one negative remark I could say about this rental except I wish we had been there longer.

It was our second time staying at Bright Skyes Farm. Brad is very welcoming and quick to respond. His place is spotless clean and the bed is very comfortable!  Love Flying Ace Brewery which is right down the road and it is conveniently located to all the places we wanted to visit in the area.  We look forward to staying again.
This place is gorgeous! Super cute property and really friendly and helpful owners - would highly recommend

Brad and Ely's place was a great location for biking the C&O Canal Towpath from Point of Rocks. The room was immaculately clean and comfortable. We especially appreciated plenty of places to hang towels and room for toiletries in the bathroom. Brad offered some great local recommendations; we loved Flying Ace Distillery for the drinks and the view, and Root for the tasty burgers. We also loved hanging out while the chickens were roaming! Brad responded quickly to a couple of queries and was super friendly. Thanks a ton for a terrific stay!

description.summary: Perfectly situated away from the hustle of the nation’s capital but nestled right in among scenic parks, historic farms and delicious craft wineries, breweries and distilleries. Enjoy the peaceful grazing of our ducks and chickens just outside your window or the nearby goats, donkeys, horses and cows while you stroll, bike or drive through the neighborhood. Whatever your preference, your stay in Loudoun will be complete with a visit to Bright Skye Farm!
description.neighborhood:
This suite is located in the Taylorstown area of Lovettsville, giving it a true western Loudoun County vibe! We are on a single-lane gravel road but don't worry, the paved streets are close by! All of the properties in this area have minimum acreage requirements so you'll see plenty of horse and cow farms on your drive in, as well as craft beverage makers!

In terms of proximity, it is about:

~ 3 minutes to Flying Ace Brewery/Distillery
~ 5 minutes to Point of Rocks, MD
~ 5 minutes to Lovettsville Town Square
~ 15 minutes to Leesburg, VA
~ 35 minutes to Dulles Airport
~ 1 hour to Tyson's Corner, VA
~ 1.5 hours to downtown DC

We love walking the gravel roads in the area and checking out the neighboring properties with our dogs, but for a proper trail, the C&O Trail across the river in Brunswick, MD is less than 10 minutes by car and the W&OD Trailhead is about 15-20 minutes by car in nearby Purcellville.
description.transit:
With everything so spread out, the easiest and fastest route to everything close by is by car. We offer free parking at the unit for up to two cars and all of the fun places to visit nearby offer free parking.

That said, especially on the warmer weekends, you will be sharing the road with loads of bikers and walkers. The terrain is nicely varied so can provide spirited bike riding or walking options. 

Being that we are in a rural area, there are not any regular public transportation options. There is train service to downtown DC during commuter hours in both Brunswick and Point of Rocks, MD, with the last train going in at 7:55am and leaving DC to return out here at 7:25pm. 

Uber and Lyft do drop off in this area, but it's best to make an appointment ahead of time if you need picked up from here.
description.interaction: We live in the main house adjacent to the suite and at least one of us is usually home. You may see us working outside in the yard or with the birds so feel free to say hello! We're here to make your stay as convenient and comfortable as possible, so shoot us a note on the Airbnb Messenger or ring the door bell and we'll do our best to accommodate!
description.house_rules:
Please be mindful of your noise volume. Quiet time is between 10pm & 7am. 

Only approved guests may visit the property. Please ensure the number of guests on your reservation request is accurate. 

We love the neighborhood as much as you will, but please try to avoid bringing the neighborhood into the unit with you by removing your shoes before walking on the carpet. We will need to request a $100 cleaning fee (via the Resolution Center) if we have to steam-clean the carpet after your stay.

If you wish to use the hammock, you are welcome to open a garage door and pull it outside but please bring it back inside the garage when finished to keep it in good condition for all guests.

Flush only toilet paper. We are on septic here so no paper towels, napkins, feminine hygiene products, M-80's, car keys or anything else that could damage our system.

We are huge animal lovers and would love to allow dogs but we want to keep our animals safe and stress-free so unfortunately no pets will be permitted on premises. There will be a $100 pet fee requested to cover the extra cost of cleaning if a pet's presence is noted.

The space is in a rural, wooded area that features wildlife of all kinds. That said, you might see an occasional insect or small animal (ant, spider, snake, raccoon), particularly in the summer. This might not be great for the nature-phobic. 

No smoking on the property, inside or outside. If we smell or find evidence of smoking, there will be a $100 fee requested.

The guest suite is above a functioning garage and Owner will occasionally need to access the main floor garage area in order to retrieve supplies, carry out maintenance on the property, or to simply use the car parked inside. Owner will always do so only outside of quiet hours, except in emergency situations.

While all electrical and mechanical equipment within the Property are in good working order, Owner cannot guarantee against mechanical failure of electrical service, stopped plumbing, water supply, heating, air conditioning, audio visual equipment, internet access, cable service, or appliances. Guest agrees to report any inoperative equipment or other maintenance problem to Owner immediately. Owner will make every reasonable effort to have repairs done quickly and efficiently. Guest will allow Owner or a person permitted by Owner access to the Property for purposes of repair and inspection. 

Owner is not responsible for any accidents, injuries or illness that occur to any member of the Rental Party or Guest’s visitors while in the Property or on the Property. 

Owner is not responsible for loss of personal belongings or valuables belonging to any member of the Rental Party or any of Guest’s visitors. Guest agrees to assume the risk of any harm arising from use of the Property.

name: Modern, private cottage at Fairview Organic Farm
title: Shenandoah Junction, West Virginia

gallery.caption: Newer construction 2 b/r 1 and 1/2 bath cottage with vaulted ceilings, large screened in porch and small deck with beautiful pasture and Mountain View’s nestled in the Shenandoah Valley on 23 pesticide-free acres.
Beautifully appointed fully equipped kitchen with granite counters, stainless appliances and antique table for 4.
Pull out sofa bed with upgrade mattress. Fully reclining electric leather chair. Electric heat or flame only fireplace. Walk out to deck.
Master bedroom with Mid century Heywood Wakefield bedroom suite. Full size bed with 1000 thread count Egyptian cotton sheets. Double closet.
Spa like master bath with double sinks and granite counters
2nd bedroom has daybed with trundle and small antique desk. Double closet
French doors walk out to screened in porch.
Electric leather recliner and electric fireplace with antique mantle
French doors entrance way to spacious airy light filled cottage with vaulted ceilings
Screened in porch with ceiling fans.
Screened in porch with entrance to fenced yard.
We have a lot of birds. I think the word has gotten out that we don’t spray chemicals on flowers or trees and don’t fertilize our grounds. Organic worms!
Aerial view of farm before cottage was built. Cottage is left of the house out of view of photo
See directions to cottage. This is the out building where u turn left from driveway.
Spring. Flower garden main house. Guests are welcome to walk property to enjoy the gardens.
Views are spectacular in almost every direction
During growing season ask about picking your own, or having us deliver a basket of vegetables - grown without any pesticides or herbicides.

hosts.about:
My husband and I are both fully vaccinated. Hi, I’m Dina, the owner of Fairview Farm. Originally from Canton Connecticut, I moved with my husband to Shenandoah Junction 10 years ago to establish a healthier life style thru organic farming. 

We reside in a historic, 300+ year old home that  is a constant project of love. 

I am also an antique dealer who restores or chalk paints vintage and antique furniture and accessories like the antique mirror you will find in the powder room of the cottage.  My grandfather was an Italian craftsman and furniture maker. I am thankful for the skill he passed on to me. 

I learned how to cook from both my Italian grandmother and my father. Their love of food and everything I learned from them has helped tremendously in creating and maintaining a vegan diet. 

I’m a big animal lover and we always have rescues at the farm. Otherwise you can find me digging in the dirt, tending to the organic veggies or several flower beds around the property.  In the winter, I prefer to hibernate in front of the fireplace with a stack of books, when not cooking. 

Occasionally we are able to find someone to care for the animals and farm and jump in the car or on a plane. Our last trip was a fifteen day cruise thru Asia. I believe travel is an important part of having empathy and compassion for others and it’s the best way to learn about other cultures, geography,  different cuisines and people.

recent.comments: We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay while visiting all of the historic locations!!  The cottage was just like the pictures and stayed nice and cool during the hottest part of the summer.  We will definitely stay again if we are in he area.

items.comments: We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay while visiting all of the historic locations!!  The cottage was just like the pictures and stayed nice and cool during the hottest part of the summer.  We will definitely stay again if we are in he area.
We loved hanging out in the huge screened-in porch, grilling out, and listing to the cows and roosters.
Dina’s property was clean, private, safe, and cozy. I felt right at home!

This was a getaway for my husband and I. It was the respite we had imagined. 

The cottage sits off by itself in the middle of a grassy area that was nicely mowed. The scene is pastoral overlooking farm land. The moment we stepped inside we were delighted with the layout, the furniture, the eclectic decor and the cleanliness. 

The cottage glows with cheerfulness without sacrificing serenity. Every effort has been made to provide for guest needs and comfort. Kitchen drawers were neatly organized with essential and “good equipment”.

We loved sitting on the side porch spotting the many different birds hiding in the huge tree that faces it and watching the sun set.

The cottage is close to Harper’s Ferry and Charles Town. Lots of history. Just 12 minutes away we were able to connect to the C&O Canal to ride bikes.

Dina was quick to respond to any questions. We were exceptionally satisfied with our stay and hope to return.

Dina's place was absolutely adorable and comfy and had so much incredible glassware, decoration, and entertainment!! The surrounding area is gorgeous and a bunch of charming small towns (Berkeley Springs, Shepherdstown, Winchester, Harpers Ferry) are in easy driving distance. If you're lucky, the cows next door will walk up to the fence in the evening!! Definitely come here for a relaxing weekend away.

Dinas' place was more beautiful in 
person.. It is beautifully decorated and has every amenity you could ever want in the kitchen.. It is very peaceful and private but close to all the historical sites we wanted to visit.. When I visit the area again.. I will definitely stay here.  Thanks again for sharing your beautiful place ..
Great stay and great hostess!

description.summary: Discounts for stays of 5 nights or more. Sitting atop a hill on 23 acres at historic Fairview  Organic Farm, Circa 1737, the newish cottage is surrounded by pasture, organic gardens, history & overlooks the Harpers Ferry Gap. We are just a few miles from Charles Town, Harpers Ferry, Shepherdstown, the Hollywood Casino, the Appalachia trail, the Shenandoah & Potomac Rivers, and many historical sites. Enjoy sun rise from the deck and sunsets from the porch.
description.space:
We only accept reservations for long term stays of 4 days or longer. 

All stays 7 days or longer get an automatic 15% discount off our rate. Our monthly rate is more than 25% off our regular rate. Please contact me to inquire. 

Parties of four or less, with a positive review and a completed profile can book automatically. 

Please check out all of our photos to see the cottage and surrounding property during all four seasons. Come let your stress melt away at our little slice of Almost Heaven West Virginia. 

 Historic Harpers Ferry and Shepardstown, are just 8 miles from the cottage and the Hollywood Casino, just 3 miles. The Potomac and Shenandoah rivers are within 10 miles of the cottage as is the entrance to one of many hiking trails thru the Shenandoah Valley. 

The cottage can sleep up to six people, but parties over four will need to send a request to book. 

The property is beautiful dusted or covered in snow and bursts with color in Spring, Summer and Fall. It is a great destination for photographers or anyone who loves the serenity of a rural setting.

Our historic barns, mountain views, gently rolling pastures, and the wildlife, including deer, barn swallows, eagles, blue jays, red cardinals, yellow finches and hummingbirds, ground hogs, red fox, bunnies, and the elusive coyotes that can be heard more than seen all make up Fairview Farm. You will also find:

> a fire pit surrounded by large rocks and chairs for evening marshmallow toasting is just a short walk from the cottage. A stack of wood is provided. 

> the main house and cottage sit back from the street more than 1/4 mile so there is a feeling of seclusion without the isolation. 

> during the 4th of July celebration, there is a fantastic view of the fireworks from the cottage. And there is much more. 

The kitchen is a cook's delight. There is a Keurig, toaster, family size pressure cooker/crock pot and microwave. We've provided a nice set of cookware, and several pieces of Corning Ware that I have collected for years. 

If guests need a small appliance, such as a rice cooker,  ice cream maker, griddle, etc. Please let us know. We have several small appliances that can be brought up to the cottage in just minutes. 

A large gas grill is also provided on the screened in porch. Please let us know in advance if you intend to use it so we can fill the propane tank. 

There is no dishwasher in the cottage.  We provide a drying mat and several wood drying racks.

In keeping with our organic lifestyle, we use as few chemical cleaners as possible in the cottage. We mainly use and provide vinegar or other cleaners without harsh chemicals. Please bring laundry soap if you plan on doing laundry during your stay.

All the doorways, hallways, and the shower were designed to be wheelchair accessible. There is a 1/4 step to enter the porch, the cottage and the shower.

While we do not allow large, unruly parties, we can accommodate families or groups that would like to gather for the holidays at the cottage - with advance approval. We are happy to provide additional pots, pans, serving dishes, a full set of china and tables and seating, as needed. Just let us know.

The cottage is furnished with an eclectic mix of high end contemporary furniture and vintage and antique pieces. My mother's and my taste combined into a space that most of our guests have raved about. 

The cottage will be tastefully decorated for holidays including a decorated tree for Christmas. 

If you, your family or friends are celebrating a birthday, anniversary or holiday we are happy to provide a home baked decorated cake or cookies for an additional fee. You can choose from many flavors, and types including glutton free, dairy free, vegan, or organic, even Keto.

MOST IMPORTANTLY: We welcome everyone! We absolutely do not and will not discriminate based on race, religion, gender, or who you love. We will respect your privacy and only ask you respect our property.

This a functioning small farm, surrounded by farms with all the smells, and noises of livestock and tractors. While the evenings are quiet, and the star filled skies, breathtaking, during planting, growing and harvest season work starts at sun up. 

Please be aware The main 1/4 mile driveway is gravel and the driveway to the cottage is mostly a dirt road with a layer of gravel. We keep them entirely  passable. 
 
Guests are responsible for reading the House Manual on the App. It’s not heavy reading - just a short list of common sense rules for staying at the cottage. 

Check -In Instructions on the app  include step by step photos to help find and enter the cottage. 

A guest without previous reviews or a completed profile will need to send a request to book. A government issued ID like a driver’s license, passport, or DMV issued walking ID are required for Airbnb to confirm your identity. A tip for those without previous reviews: the more info you can give Airbnb to confirm your identity the more comfortable your host will feel. Hosts do not see this information, we can only see that it was provided to Airbnb. 
 
Other Info: we were chosen to be the recipient of the largest tree planting eco project along Elks Run by the Conservation Department of WV Forestry. With the help of volunteers, 150 Native trees have been planted along the creek to help prevent erosion. 

"Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, & narrow-mindedness... Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men & things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one's lifetime.” - Mark Twain
description.access: Guests are welcome to walk the property from historic barns to Elks RunCreek and view the many flower gardens.
description.notes:
CHRISTMAS - the cottage is decorated for Christmas with high-end decorations including a 7’ tree most often dressed in a collection of woodland animal and bird ornaments. Photos of the cottage at Christmas are included in my Airbnb photo album. 
HALLOWEEN & THANKSGIVING - we also decorate for the Fall holidays but not as elaborately as Christmas.
description.neighborhood:
We are located on the main road that runs between Charles Town and Sheperdstown. There are grocery stores (Aldis, Weiss, and a Giant called Martins) CVS, Rite Aid, Sweetfrog, Home Depot, Kohls, a great nail salon, and several restaurants and fast food joints within 3 miles.
All the conveniences of the suburbs, in a rural setting.
The cottage is surrounded by farmland pastures. A working dairy farm is across the street and can be seen from the cottage. The pastures of a beautiful 60 acre farm that once bred black angus,  backs to our property
description.transit: A car is needed to get around.
description.interaction: We live in the original house on the property and are available to answer questions or assist in any way we can, with just a call or text, otherwise we will respect our guests privacy.
description.house_rules:
- The Golden Rule Applies.

- cottage should be left in the same condition it was found upon arrival with the exception of towels and bed linens. 
Used towels go in a pile on the master bath floor.
Do NOT make the beds, so I know which beds were used. 

- No wet or muddy footwear in house

- please do not move or rearrange the furniture or large appliances like the tv or the fridge.

- No eating on white plaid chair in living room. We prefer guests use the kitchen table to eat meals. You  can see the tv from the kitchen table.

- No glasses or coffee mugs in master bath

-The orange carnival glass on open shelves and the vintage glass pitcher sets in the glass front cabinet are for decoration only.

- No candles or open flame for any reason

- The fireplace must be turned off when guests leave the cottage or go to sleep. 

- the leather recliner is electric and must be plugged in to recline. Please pull the sheer curtains away from the outlet to use. 

- We ask guests to be energy conscious and turn off lights when they are not in use. 

- Do not overload the washing machine or dryer. They work best with small loads. Do not wash master bedroom linens. We provide an extra set of sheets but if you need linens washed please let me know

-Please only use the blankets you need. We provide several comfy throws in all rooms

- Please  fold and stack any blankets, quilts, bedspreads, etc. you do not use. 

- cats are allowed on the porch if you want to play with them, but not allowed in the house. Please let them out (of porch) if you hear me calling for them at dusk.

-Lastly, communication is one of the bedrocks of Airbnb. It would not work without it, not just for scheduling but in building trust which is also essential. 
Communication does not end after your booking is confirmed or after you check-in. Communication ends when you have successfully checked-out. 
If you use the app make sure you have notifications turned on your cell phone.

name: Laurel Hill Farm, Pre-Revolutionary War Farmhouse
title: Waterford, Virginia

gallery.caption: Façade on an early spring morning
View into the dining room from the kitchen showing off the original back door and brick walls
Original hand blown glass window, now an interior window. View looking into dining room
View of the rolling hills on the property

recent.comments: Absolutely stunning property with an amazing host. The house has an historic charm with modern finishes which makes it the perfect weekend getaway. Our family especially enjoyed watching the animals on the neighboring farm.

items.comments: Absolutely stunning property with an amazing host. The house has an historic charm with modern finishes which makes it the perfect weekend getaway. Our family especially enjoyed watching the animals on the neighboring farm.
A beautiful house by a working farm! My kids got to see baby chicks and cows. We have a wonderful stay.

My friends and I gathered for a long overdue get-together, and this spot was perfect- an lovely historic house; tons of space for nine; piles of linens; a very well-stocked kitchen; a higher quality range of furnishings; gorgeous outdoor space with an easy-to-use fire pit; and an incredibly responsive host who truly went above and beyond to be helpful. It was easy to get to downtown Leesburg for the restaurants as well as the local vineyards. There are two sets of stairs, one of which creates a small, lowered section of the ceiling in the kitchen, and the house and area has woodburning stoves/fireplaces (not the main kitchen stove of course) which made the house smell of woodsmoke. The coffee machine is a Keurig, and there are also small step downs here and there so it's not a home for anyone with mobility challenges. But we found everything super charming and loved every minute of our stay.

We stayed for a local graduation and the farmhouse was perfect for our needs.  Plenty of space inside and out for all of us.  Our grandchildren aged 1 and 2 loved it- chickens, roosters, cows, turkeys, and even frogs!

The house was very clean and comfortable.  It was also very beautiful.
We loved our stay and would highly recommend it! The house was perfect for our family to stay for our daughter’s wedding weekend. We had everything we needed and a quiet country setting. We loved it!
Absolutely refreshing! A beautiful house in a beautiful area. My favorite!

We had an incredible stay at Greg’s family’s farm and in their lovely home.  We had a constant supply of fresh eggs and numerous interactions between my kids and all the local animals - cows and an abundance of fowl.  We loved the house as it had ample room for our 5 kids to have their own spaces, and it had both modern touches and the feel of a pre-Revolutionary War home. We cooked at the home several days in their excellent kitchen and enjoyed our meals both inside and outside. At night, our girls went star gazing outside with great views of the sky and almost no light noise inhibiting their view. It was a place where we made lifetime memories and we were so thankful to have picked it on Airbnb. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

description.summary: Hidden on its own private lane, this 18th century farmhouse gives guests the chance to experience the past. Laurel Hill Farm was originally settled in 1762 with several additions in the following centuries. The house has been restored and updated to include modern amenities. Among the charming period features are hand blown glass windows, exposed brick walls, original wide board pine floors, all of which are blended seamlessly with modern amenities.
description.space:
Four bedroom, two and one half bathroom whole house rental. Main floor has a full kitchen, a dining room, a formal sitting room two wood stoves and a family room with 4k 55" smart TV. Upstairs there are four bedrooms with six beds, a hall bath with bathtub/shower combo and master bath with large walk in shower. 

Outside there is a back patio with ambiance lighting and patio furniture. Included in the 30+ acre property is a large front yard with outdoor benches and mature shade trees.
description.access:
On its own private drive with plenty of room for parking, directly off of paved Hamilton Station Road. The driveway is gravel. 

Horseback riding lessons available upon request! Rate is $65 per hour lesson (through Stormy Day Farm)
description.notes:
We occasionally rearrange and add furniture, so photos may not reflect the current layout.

Disclaimer:
Guests are charged a fee from Airbnb, along with 6% VA sales tax and 8% county tax.
Cleaning fee is $140 for a two night stay and $175 for stays longer than two nights.

NOTE:
Early check-in fee is $20/hour for up to two hours early check-in. Any check-in before noon is $40 for the two hours between 12-2 plus an increased $30/hour rate for any additional hours. The early check-in option is not guaranteed to be available.
description.neighborhood: Private Lane, house is hidden from neighbors
description.transit: Plenty of parking available
description.interaction: We live just next door so you may see someone feeding animals throughout the day.
description.house_rules:
Equipment and outbuildings are for farm use only
Please do not harass animals
Please be respectful of this historic home

name: Idyllic bedroom in peaceful rural setting
title: Shepherdstown, West Virginia

hosts.about:
I am intrigued by people and their stories. I love to experience the quirky nuances of new places including the local culture unique to an area. I am a proud mom of three adult children who are all making their own way. Whether it’s sipping a beverage and listening to music at a local vineyard or brewery, exploring an antique store in search of treasures, attending the local theatre, participating in church ministry, dining out, spending the day in our nation’s Capitol, or walking on the C&O Canal, you’ll find me up for the challenge. 

My home has been a work-in-progress for almost 30 years and I am continuing to make progress towards that end. Though I am a mortgage banker by day, after hours skills include handyman and woodworking to complete projects. I love sharing my home and it’s peaceful setting.

recent.comments: We loved our stay at Donna’s beautiful home! This is was the perfect spot for our weekend getaway. We felt so at home and Donna was such a kind host! The room we stayed in as well as the whole house is impeccably clean and well organized! It felt so homey and comfortable. Would definitely stay again!

items.comments: We loved our stay at Donna’s beautiful home! This is was the perfect spot for our weekend getaway. We felt so at home and Donna was such a kind host! The room we stayed in as well as the whole house is impeccably clean and well organized! It felt so homey and comfortable. Would definitely stay again!

Donna’s place was a peaceful oasis after 5 days on the bike trail. There were so many lovely details and the bed was the most comfortable we’ve ever slept in. She was very respectful of our privacy but was very responsive to our requests for things like a hose to wash off our bikes. This was a beautiful stop along the way … highly recommend!
Thank you
Very relaxing and peaceful! Will stay again if in area.

Donna’s place was so much  more than we expected. 

One important note; Trust her directions to find the right turn off the road, as the GPS wanted to take us past the turn. Look for the “slowdown kids at play”  green man holding a flag. The drive starts right beside him. 


The setting, the large spacious room and the front porch were constantly inviting us to stay and relax so we did.   Mornings were coffee on the porch with Donna and evening  was wine and cheese while watching sunset.

Since we were staying there  to attend the Contemporary Theater Arts Festival the 5 minute drive from the University and Sheppardstown, made Donna’s place ideally located for us to return and refresh between
shows.

Everything from the sofa and bed , the fridge and microwave and the views from the windows combined to show the care Donna has taken to provide her guest with an amazing and warm home away from home.

We will be making reservations to be with her again whenever we are in that area.
What a wonderful spot. We really enjoyed our stay. So quiet and peaceful.
Lovely room on a peaceful property. The house felt warm and welcoming- I would definitely stay here again!

description.summary:
This spacious 2nd floor bedroom & private bath offer quiet country atmosphere only minutes from historic downtown Shepherdstown.  Enjoy evening beverages or morning coffee on the expansive front porch. If time allows, fit in an old-fashioned game of croquet.

This Federal-style home is located near the Potomac River, C&O Canal, and Antietam Battlefield which allows for biking, fishing, kayaking, and immersion in the history of the area. Discover Shepherdstown boutiques and eateries nearby.
description.space:
The guest rooms are on the 2nd floor of this brick home. Large windows provide pleasant country views.  Comfy queen bed with an optional pull out sofa occupy the space.  The bathroom has standard fixtures. 

There is a TV with access to streaming services. A mini fridge and microwave are conveniently located in the walk-in closet.

Ample parking area.
description.access:
Guests have exclusive use of their bedroom and bathroom. Shared access applies to the front porch. Other areas are restricted.

Guests with an extended stay (7+ days) may use laundry facilities.
description.neighborhood: Rural area. House sits on 12 acres and is surrounded by larger parcels. Enjoy ‘farm’ feel from the view of surrounding properties with livestock. Deer, foxes, turkeys, and owls call this home.
description.transit: Because of the rural setting, Uber and Lyft services are spotty...sometimes available, sometimes not.
description.house_rules:
Please tone it down at night: enjoy your podcast, music, or entertainment but during Quiet hours, don’t share it with other residents. Quiet hours are between 11:00 p.m. and 8:00 a.m. 

Guests who have reserved the space may not have guests without the consent of the owner.

name: Farwell Cottage c.1752 New Renovated Historic Home
title: Hillsboro, Virginia

gallery.caption: Sit on our covered porch and watch the world go by!
Enjoy a walkable historic town with lots of garden views.
Watch the world pass by on our front porch!
Cool off under our porch fan!
Lovely views of sunsets over Short Hill.
California king bed in our primary bathroom.
Relax in our primary bedrooms soaking tub.
Have a dinner party at our eight person table with nearby gas fireplace to set the mood.
View from upper backyard of Short Hill
Hillsborough Vineyards less than a mile away.
This is a view as you approach Hillsboro, the house is tucked between the gap in the hills in town.

hosts.about: Paul and James are so excited to share their newly renovated home with visitors to Western Loudoun!

recent.comments: Paul's Place is charming and comfortable, with vintage character and modern convenience. The beds were wonderful, and bathrooms and kitchens meticulously stocked. Loved the Keurig coffee maker! The spacious home comfortably holds six people; just know there's only one shower (and one tub), but hot water was abundant. The only slight drawback was traffic noise as the house is situated close to a busy road, but Paul thoughtfully provided ear plugs and white noise machines which really helped! Paul is extremely responsive and available for any need. It really is a very special place, one of those unique homes that creates warm and lasting memories.

items.comments: Paul's Place is charming and comfortable, with vintage character and modern convenience. The beds were wonderful, and bathrooms and kitchens meticulously stocked. Loved the Keurig coffee maker! The spacious home comfortably holds six people; just know there's only one shower (and one tub), but hot water was abundant. The only slight drawback was traffic noise as the house is situated close to a busy road, but Paul thoughtfully provided ear plugs and white noise machines which really helped! Paul is extremely responsive and available for any need. It really is a very special place, one of those unique homes that creates warm and lasting memories.
Thanks our stay was amazing, very nice hosts ! Beautiful house nicely decorated. Charming little town. The kids loved the chicken barn.

My family had a lovely stay at Paul's exquisitely maintained 1700's home. The home itself was delightful; always fascinating to stay in a home that old with original wide-plank flooring, massively thick walls, and fireplaces in every room. Paul was on top of his game, responding within minutes to any email question about things to do and must-see locations. Highly recommend!

This was my first experience booking and staying at an airbnb. From requesting to check out, it was easy and stress free. Everything seemed above and beyond with every detail taken care of. I just wish we could have stayed longer to truly enjoy everything.

Our family thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this historic house in Hillsboro.  The Farewell Cottage was extremely clean and nicely decorated. Each room had it own character and charm.  It is obvious that Paul and James put a lot of effort, time and care into their property ensuring their guests would have everything they would possibly need for an enjoyable and memorable stay. During our stay, our family spent time visiting the abundant wineries and breweries within close proximity to Hillsboro.  The scenic drive around Loudoun County is absolutely beautiful! We  highly recommend the Farewell Cottage for a memorable get-away experience.  Thank you Paul and James!
White Plains, MD

We had such an amazing time in this beautiful home. We are a bunch of moms, just hiding from our kids and husbands for the weekend and this house was so peaceful and loaded with thoughtful details, inside and out. Beds were comfortable, the pastries, wine, drinks, coffee/tea, s’mores kit, and fresh eggs were just some of the awesome, included aspects of this house. We WILL for certain return, maybe next time with the husbands.

This home is beautifully restored and James and Paul have thought of everything. The location is perfect for winery hopping and relaxing. Loved having dinner delivered to the house on Friday night as well. Wonderful experience.

description.summary:
This 250 year old stone house comes with old world charm and modern amenities. With complimentary farm fresh eggs, local bottle of wine and fiber high speed WiFi!    

Enjoy one of 3 fireplaces, 8 person dining room, sun room with complimentary coffee and tea, full kitchen.

Take a moment to relax in the claw foot soaking tub.   Or relax by our fire pit and have some fun with our complimentary s'more kit.  

Have a quiet movie night in our living room after  fun day at wineries and breweries!
description.space:
Farwell Cottage is a historic home which has been painstakingly remodeled by the new owner to keep history alive but bring modern conveniences to make a comfortable vacation home. 

Boasting a soaking tub, high speed wifi, writer desk, and large screen tv along with three fire places.  It has everything you and your family need for a nice night in after visiting all the fun wineries and breweries Western Loudoun has to offer.  

When your home go visit your private fire pit with complimentary s’more kit.  Or walk in the large yard and enjoy our breathtaking view of Short Hill.  Pay a visit to our chickens who laid the fresh eggs you are given complimentary upon check-in!
description.access: Guests have access to the entire house (except attic and crawl space).  This includes an outdoor patio, fire pit, gardens, lawn and viewing (no entry) of our chicken pen!
description.notes:
Welcome to Farwell Cottage!  A newly renovated 250 historic home, with all the modern amenities.   Painstakingly renovated to preserve the historic beauty of the space.  This home is ready to welcome families, friends, and all travelers to enjoy all this home and Western Loudoun has to offer. 

Located in the historic Town of Hillsboro, this cottage is perfectly situated to walk the newly installed sidewalks, walk to one of two markets in town and enjoy some great food and gifts.   Or travel just a few minutes away to either of the two wineries or breweries in town limits.  Go watch one of the concerts at the Old Stone School or go to the many other great events going on in town.   

The cottage offers three gas fireplaces (living room, dining room, and library), enjoy a quiet evening relaxing with friends and family.   Spend your time relaxing in the large yard and garden, chilling by our complimentary firepit with s'more kit.  Visit our chicken coop and meet our ladies who produce our awesome eggs you will receive (complimentary when you check in).  Or soak in the oversized clawfoot tub in the primary bathroom, equipped with candles to add that special ambiance, with a glass of wine from our complimentary bottle of local wine.   

The home boasts high speed fiber optic WiFI (complimentary) as well as central air.  All the cooking tools you could need are included in our expansive newly renovated kitchen, with new stove, dishwasher and double sink.   

Sit on the large covered front porch under one our porch fans on our vintage rocking chairs and watch the world go by.

Relax in the sun room and enjoy the view, and while there have some coffee or tea from our complimentary station or a glass of water from our Zero water filter pitcher. 

Each of the three bedrooms is equipped with a white noise machine with night light to help make sure you get the best sleep during your stay!

The house is cleaned with eco-friendly non-harsh chemical cleaners and sanitized in between guests.   

 Toiletry items (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, toothpaste) complimentary.   Toothbrush and razor available upon request.  

**Please note this is a historic home, some floors are uneven and the staircase is steeper than average.**

Amenities that make easy for families to pack up and enjoy:
- high chair
-changing pad
-child dishes
-sippy cups
-baby bath seat
-potty training seat
-baby towels
-child safety lock on cabinet containing cleaning chemicals
- outlet covers
-Board games and puzzles for family fun!
description.neighborhood:
Historic Hillsboro, is a small village nestled in Western Loudoun's wine country.  Steps away from wineries, breweries, and distilleries.   The fun doesn't stop there, mere miles from the Appalachian Trail.   

Well known for great events, the Old Stone School, located in Hillsboro, host concerts, events, even weddings! 

In town there is two markets, one an organic Farm Market, Stoneybrook is a great place to stock up on provisions for your fun visit.    Or stop by Moo Thru a local ice cream shop a favorite of kids and adults alike!
description.transit: Walk our beautiful new sidewalks to our town markets, ice cream or many events throughout the year.  Free parking makes it a breeze to get in and out to all the sites nearby.  Or arrange for a driver with all the local companies offering winery tours.
description.interaction: Welcome cocktails upon request!  We love to meet our guest and share our knowledge of the area.  Or if you’d like privacy enjoy your wine country oasis without any in person interaction we can help ensure you get everything you need.
description.house_rules:
Guests must complete a rental agreement prior to renting. 

No pets

No smoking (Marijuana or tobacco cigarettes, cigars, electronic cigarette or any similar product whose use generates smoke or vapors, also known as vape)

No parties, events, or commercial activity of any kind.

All persons not listed as “Guest” in Rental Agreement are not permitted to stay after the start of quiet hours (10:00 PM EST).

All activity outdoors must cease at the start of quiet hours, to include the fire pit.

All “Guests” under the age of 18 years old must be accompanied by the Primary/Responsible Tenant, who is required to be over the age of 25 years old or older.

Check-in is anytime after 3:00 PM (EST) and check-out by 11:00 AM (EST)
Late check-out (4:00PM) iis available for an additional $75.  Guests staying past Normal Check-Out: 11:00 AM (EST) or Late Check-Out: 4:00 PM (EST) (if permitted and paying for late check-out), will be charged an additional night stay and be required to vacate the premises. 

Self check-in with keypad, self check-out is also with keypad, using code provided. Please follow check-in and check-out procedures.

No bikes allowed inside, except in the sunroom, at no time should bikes be placed on carpet or wood floors.

No outdoor shoes on the wood or carpet.  No spiked heels or shoes with soles that may mark or damage the wood floors.

Use dark towels to remove any makeup ($25 charge if white bath towel is used, $15 charge if white hand or face towel is used).

Please be respectful of the neighbors.  No noise which can be heard from another residence is permitted between 10:00 PM and 8:00 AM.

Gas fireplaces should not be left unattended or on for extended periods of time (2 hours).

No open flame other than from installed gas fireplaces is permitted inside the house, this includes candles.    

Only use provided fire starter logs and wood logs in the fire pit.  Do not move the firepit, use screen top when not adding wood to the fire pit.    Please note the location of the fire extinguisher and fire blanket adjacent to the fire pit.     
Open flame or fire is only permitted inside the provided fire pit.   

All items provided to guests, such as cutlery, dishes, kitchen equipment, bug spray, sun screen, light for fire pit, towels, linens, and other decorative items should not be removed from the property.  Primary/Responsible Guests will be charged for any missing items. 

Items on display such as art, artifacts, or other decorative items should not be changed, altered, moved, or taken from premises.  Any items missing, damaged, or destroyed will be charged to the Primary/Responsible Guest.
  
Do not sit, climb, disturb, damage, or remove the lids to the septic systems.  Follow posted guidelines.   Guests should stay away and ensure all children are monitored and stay away from the area of the septic lids.  

Guests are not permitted in the fenced area around the HVAC equipment. 

Guests should not enter adjacent yards without express permission. 

All locked closets and locked doors should not be tampered with. 

The house is on a sensitive septic system.  Please follow posted guidelines for disposal of items.  
Do not dispose of food, grease, coffee grinds, harsh chemicals, or other waste in the kitchen sink, please dispose of in the trash receptacle.
Do not flush anything other than toilet paper, urine, and feces down the toilets.  For femine products please use provided disposal.   ABSOLUTELY NO USE OF FLUSHABLE WIPES.

name: Horse farm near Manassas Battlefield.
title: Nokesville, Virginia

gallery.caption: No step from breezeway into the suite
Kitchenette (cook top, microwave, fridge, freezer, sink)
Small step up into the tub.
Bedroom - linen closets to left of door

all.name: No stairs or steps to enter

hosts.about: Retired Navy. Retired second time. Civil War reenactor - cavalry. I ride western; wife English.  We love this small farm and have 4 horses (paints); 1 mini donkey; turkeys, chickens; cats; and dogs - large garden. Like having company - entertain often. Motto - "Ride hard - shoot straight". Enjoy cooking - collect bourbon - like to share my "cowboy bar and outdoor kitchen". Active in Prince William County Master Gardener Program.

recent.comments: All went well, was a good place to stay.

items.comments: All went well, was a good place to stay.

For me, with it's proximity to the Jiffy Lube concert venue (10 minutes away), and privacy, this was my ideal stay. It is a cozy mother-in-law suite, perfect for one or two people. Immaculately clean and super cutely decorated, I felt at home immediately.  This was helped by the fact that Jimmie, the ranch owner is so friendly and helpful. Ask for the tour, pet the "divas", the donkey and the dogs, who are all friendly.  There are even a couple of kitties around.  The bed was perfect for me, firm, not hard and lots of pillows.  All in all, charming, cozy and peaceful.  Thanks again to Jimmie and his wife for their hospitality.  I'm sure I'll be back again.  👍😁

I highly recommend Jimmie’s place to anyone looking for a quaint, quiet, and relaxing getaway. We were pleased with the convenience of the location, and the lovely farm was a treat. Jimmie was quick to respond and answer my questions, gave us clear instructions on how to find the property and get checked in. Thank you for being a wonderful host and sharing your farm with us!
We enjoyed our stay at Jimmie's. It was a beautiful farm. The horses were so pretty. Jimmie and his wife were both very warm and welcoming. The space was beautiful and you warm.

I had a great Momcation! Thanks to Jimmie and Jackie... After a day at King’s Spa in Chantilly, VA their place was the icing on my mom’s get away. A nice drive through the countryside away from the hustle and bustle of the city, brought me to their quite and cozy retreat! A little bottle of sparkling wine, fresh tomatoes, and chocolate by the night stand was an unexpected treat! Looking for a safe place to spend a night away from the crowds. I highly suggest Jimmie and Jackie’s.

Jimmie was an outstanding host. He to do took time out of his day to show us around the farm. He was very friendlyand we enjoyed listening to his stories. The suite was perfect for our overnight stay. It was very clean and comfortable.  Even though the property is peaceful and private it's a short car or Uber ride to town.
Such a gem of a place. A great spot in a beautiful section of the country. Jimmie was such a joy to talk with. Highly recommend!!

description.summary: Comfortable accommodations for horses and the people traveling with them. Private suite, private entrance (bedroom, bath, kitchenette) + 2 RV hookups water/electric. 6 stalls - nice paddock turnout. Lighted arena. Close to: Manassas Battlefield (25 mile trail);   Skymeadow State Park (nice trails); several hunt clubs;  VRE which - to METRO; 3 miles to Manassas airport.  Not accepting pets for the time being. Several wineries and breweries within 12 miles - ONLY 6 miles to Jiffy Lube Live.
description.space: Small farm with horses, mini donkey, chickens, dogs, and cats. Horses welcome - small charge. Suite has portable cot suitable for a small child.
description.access: Private suite - private access. bedroom, bath, kitchenette - shared patio and grill. Lighted arena - trails.
description.notes: Many trails close by - many pick-your-own farms and several breweries and wineries near by.
description.neighborhood: This is a farm community - tours available near by of alpaca and llama farms, wineries, distilleries, national and state parks - 6 miles to Jiffy Lube Live. Several wineries, brew, wedding venues within 10 minutes.
description.transit: Convenient to Jiffy Lube Live, Dulles Airport, many local restaurants. Close to I-66 - US 28, 29, and 15. Only 21 miles West of the 495 beltway - 4 miles off I-66, short distance to I-95. Close to VRE which connects to METRO - 10 miles to Manassas airport.
description.interaction: Available to help guests. Enjoy showing guests around the farm - talking about garden (I'm a master gardener); chickens; horses; and living on and caring for a farm.
description.house_rules: Absolutely no entry into fields containing horses. Walking around the farm is allowed. Smoking outside is allowed; butts are to be collected and trashed.

name: Fox Cross Cottage in Virginia Horse & Wine Country
title: The Plains, Virginia

gallery.caption: Newly a built fire-pit to toast marshmallows under the stars.
Walk out from the sunroom to a large deck overlooking the back lawn with propane grill and firepit.
The lawn as viewed from the deck.
View from the west side of the house showing the 19th century stone foundation.
Comfortable living room with wood stove, large flat-screen tv (Dish network), stereo and DVD player.
View as approached from the east.
We are located in the center of Virginia's wine country!
The kitchen is fully equipped and has various coffees, spices, oils and other basics.
The second bedroom upstairs has two twin beds, each with trundle beds beneath.
One of the twin beds (with a trundle beneath) upstairs
The barn (soon to be art studio) in back
Make your own pizza in the little pizza oven out back.
Cottage from the back lawn in January.
Enjoy this 1350 square foot cottage on three acres with its original 19th-century foundation.
The sun room looks out on the deck through French doors and has a heated floor.
The door to the old chicken shed in back.
The back lawn is lovely on a snowy day.
All decked up for Christmas guests!
View out bedroom window. Horse boarding available across the road.
View of the house as approached from the east
One of Rob's large paintings hangs in the dining room.
Up close watching Twilight Polo at Great Meadow in The Plains. Every Saturday all summer long. The Nation's Cup and the Gold Cup are held here each year.
Main floor bedroom with library of over 150 movies
Wood burning stove in the living room
Sometimes the neighbors might stop in for a snack.
A print of one of Rob's watercolors in the living room.
We will provide a high chair, a pack-n-play with sheets, baby monitors, potty chair and a baby gate for those with small children.
Shops in The Plains include coffee shops, gift shops and restaurants.
The award winning Red Truck Bakery in Marshall, two miles west.

One mile down the road is beautifully landscaped, 88 acre Northern Fauquier County Community Park. Trails, picnic shelters, playing fields, playgrounds and lakes abound. You can even go fishing in one of three ponds!
Middleburg Christmas parade every December - only eight miles away via a beautiful country road!
Street view in Marshall, two miles west.
Scenery a mile from the house
Faquier County is a painter's paradise!
Gorgeous landscape in every direction in every season.
Scenic beauty year round in Faquier County for the hiker or painter.
Get a gourmet lunch from a great chef at Johnny Monarchs in Marshall.
Gold Cup festivities in The Plains. Or see the moonlinght polo matches by the carload every weekend during the warmer months.
Happy Creek Coffee and Bikes. Our favorite coffee shop in the world, hands down, in The Plains, Virginia. You can rent a bike or have yours repaired here as well.
Photo from the back lawn. Enjoy Virginia's beautiful sunsets and starry nights.

hosts.about: We, Rob and Lina Liberace, are artists who love to create, play baseball (Rob), antique (Lina) and to renovate old spaces. We love to travel - It helps that Rob teaches art workshops in the US and overseas. We hope that the country house we've lovingly updated and renovated brings others the same joy and relaxation it brings to us. We have tried to provide the same conveniences to our guests that we appreciate (or wish for) when traveling.

recent.comments: If you plan on staying any where close to this home!  I would highly recommend it!!    Safe place with over an acre of land!    Very clean home!    Close to eating and grocery stores!!   The beds slept wonderfully well!!    And the host are super responsive!! All around great host!!!    Definitely definitely recommend this home!!

items.comments: If you plan on staying any where close to this home!  I would highly recommend it!!    Safe place with over an acre of land!    Very clean home!    Close to eating and grocery stores!!   The beds slept wonderfully well!!    And the host are super responsive!! All around great host!!!    Definitely definitely recommend this home!!
Wonderful place in a great location. My family had a great stay and hope to be back!
Rob and Lina are great people and their place is really cozy

We spent a relaxing week at this lovely home. From the moment we checked in until the point we drove away everything was perfect. This house feels like a home with thoughtful decor, including amazing art from the talented hosts, and a well-appointed kitchen. The grounds are also very well cared for and a great space for sitting out with a book on a sunny day. The hosts were helpful and responsive if needed and provided several resources to help make the most of the local area.

One of my favorite stays in years!  The house was perfect.  Comfortable and quiet.  The kitchen was outfitted with everything I needed.  The backyard is spectacular.  Lina and Rob are excellent hosts.  Rob’s art is absolutely amazing and makes the place feel even more special.  If you are looking for a place to relax and enjoy nature…this is it.

My Husband and I went to Virginia to be with family for christmas and we found this Airbnb that looked so charming and inviting surrounded with beautiful grounds.  Rob & Lena's
home is like being in your own home. Very clean and they were very attentive to make sure everything was perfect for our stay.  We will be back again some day and definitely will recommend Rob & Lena's Place!
Mike & Debbie

"Wow!"...  That's what most of our guests said when they walked into this AirBnB for the first time.  Every room is a set-piece of carefully-curated beauty (from an earlier, more civilized age).  Books everywhere, and really good ones at that.  An entertainment center bursting with classic DVD movies.  A very functional, modern kitchen and two more than adequate bathrooms provides 21st-Century comforts in a setting that can only be described as "transformative".

As a bonus, we got one full day of rain with zero leaks, but the most amazing sounds coming from the tin roofs of this glorious house, whilst watching a family of deer playing outside in the back yard.  Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful...

description.summary: This beautifully furnished cottage on three acres is in the heart of Hunt Country and  Appalachian foothills. We are near the picturesque village of The Plains, VA., eight miles south of Middleburg and 50 miles west of DC. Renovated thoughtfully, it retains its charm and 19th century stone foundation. The fully equipped kitchen and dining room have an open plan while the sunroom opens to a large deck overlooking the expansive lawn. Please read our reviews and plan your perfect getaway!
description.space: We have T-Mobile high speed internet at 25-50 meg per second. The base is located near the sunroom. The password is in our guidebook, on our website, and on the bulletin board in the main floor bedroom
description.access: You will have the entire house and, of course, the deck and the large lawn along with the use of the grill and fire pit. The basement is to be used for laundry purposes only and is off-limits to children. The barn will be available soon for artists to use as a studio. Although we provide sleeping for eight, we recommend no more than six adults, since the cottage rooms could feel tight if everyone is gathered in one room (especially when the deck cannot be used due to weather). Please note that pricing is for two and extras are $20 per person per night).
description.notes:
Our base price is listed above, but we do charge $20 per person per night for additional guests after the first two. Children under 2 are free. We are not too far from the road so we expect that children and dogs will be watched. 

The kitchen cupboards have some staples and spices, oils, etc. In the refrigerator, you'll find condiments, salad dressings, etc. Feel free to use something if you need it and leave unopened items if you'd like. In the bathroom medicine cabinets you will find some necessities, so if you need a bandaid or a tums or ibuprofen, you won't need to run to the store for that little thing you forgot. 

Please note that we do have a security camera covering the driveway and a bit of the yard since the property is not our primary residence and is not always occupied. Also, we ask the person who books to first agree to our house rules since, in booking, they agree to them. We do not prohibit alcohol, but we ask that groups who are coming to binge drink and party heavily to please book elsewhere.

We have high speed internet, about 250 movies, two DVD players, and satellite tv (in the living room).

In the very back south-east corner of the property, in the woods down in a ditch is an area where people used to put glass and metal. Although it is hard to get to, please be aware and stay clear.
description.neighborhood:
The location of the property is ideal for hiking (close to the Appalachian Trail), biking, and horseback riding. Artists will appreciate the rolling hills, historic architecture and miles of old stone fences. Enjoy the many surrounding wineries (you can use Uber if needed), antiquing, orchards and farm-to-table dining establishments nearby, or pack a picnic basket (yes, we have two available at the house) and enjoy "Twilight Polo" every Saturday evening throughout the summer in The Plains at Great Meadow where the VA Cup steeplechases are held annually. Enjoy the farmer's market in The Plains each Sunday spring to fall. Horse (self) boarding and horseback riding lessons are possible across the street at Madcap Farm. Fishing, ice skating, pavilions, walking/biking paths, and sports fields are all available literally a minute down the road at Northern Fauquier County Community Park. History buffs will enjoy seeing Civil War battlefields in the area. For spa ladies, the Salamander Resort is about ten miles to the north.
The area has an interesting assortment of country folks and, well... very wealthy country folks! You'll find artists, farmers, and even a few celebrities. Horses neighing or roosters crowing in the distance will remind you that it is time to relax and take in the country air.
description.transit: You will need a car since we are in the country. However, two small towns are within two miles in each direction and two larger towns are within 10 miles. Washington DC is 50 miles to our east. This is a world-class biking area, so you may want to bring your bike and helmet! We are told Uber is easily available if you prefer not to drive.
description.interaction: We may not always be there to greet you, but we are always a text or phone call away! It is best to contact us by our cell phones - in house manual or on our website, foxcrosscottage.com.
description.house_rules:
Upon booking, guests agree to the Fox Cross Cottage house Agreement:

The rental party shall consist of the Guest (person booking the house) and only those persons listed in airbnb/Vrbo. 

CHECK-IN 3pm (or after), CHECK-OUT is by 11am (unless otherwise offered by the Homeowner).

By renting, the Rental Party agrees to abide by the following rules:

1. CONSIDERATION FOR PROPERTY: Guests shall treat the property and furnishings respectfully. Damages or missing items will be considered before returning the security deposit. 
2. UNAUTHORIZED GUESTS: Guests are limited to the Rental Party only. Extra beds disturbed (beyond number in party) may result in extra persons fees. Any extra overnight guests or day guests must be cleared by Homeowner.
3. LIABILITY: Small gatherings (such as family gatherings) will be permitted if cleared by homeowner; The Guest 
assumes responsibility and liability for all individuals on the property during his/her stay.
4. TOILETS:  We are on septic, so absolutely no flushing of foreign objects: wipes (even flushable wipes), sanitary items, etc.
5. SMOKING: No smoking in the house. 
6. PARKING: Drive only on the driveway if possible. If necessary to pull around or park on the grass, use the far side of the driveway (not near the house or over sidewalk stones).
7. WOODSTOVE: Guests will keep the woodstove door shut once lit. No cooking in the woodstove.
8. BASEMENT: For laundry purposes only, please. No children allowed in basement unattended.
9. MONTHLY GUESTS will take their garbage/recycling to the Marshall Collection Site two minutes down the road.
10. CHECKOUT: Guests will please return all items to their original places, clean spills/messes, and  lock windows/doors.

PETS: We are happy to accept well-behaved/potty trained and low-shedding dogs and must approve of any pets before arrival. We have a two-dog maximum and reserve the right to reject any pet for any reason. We assume no liability for any animal brought to the property and recommend keeping dogs on-leash outside since the house is not far from the road. Dogs may sit on the soft furniture but we ask that Guests lay a towel down (we can provide extras) or use the dog bed provided. If extra cleaning is required after the visit, it may reflect on the Guest's review/deposit. We ask that dogs be crated if left alone in the house (we can provide a medium-sized crate). Well-behaved dogs may be left in the sunroom using the baby gate in the doorway. Waste should be carried to the fence, tree line, or compost pile (not left on the lawn).

CANCELLATION and SECURITY DEPOSIT information is listed on the Airbnb platform. Please note that we have two security cameras outside since Fox Cross Cottage is not our primary residence.

Thank you for choosing Fox Cross Cottage!

name: Paradise Farm—Near Harpers Ferry
title: Knoxville, Maryland

gallery.caption: Our front yard in the Fall
Our front yard in the fall

all.name: No stairs or steps to enter

recent.comments: We had a wonderful stay!  We really enjoyed seeing the animals and would definitely come back.

items.comments: We had a wonderful stay!  We really enjoyed seeing the animals and would definitely come back.

Paradise Farm is a perfect and lovely stay! A favorite moment included drinking my morning tea on the balcony while my kids and I watched the horses being fed - priceless. The house has everything you need, is in such a beautiful location, and is close to so many things (Harper’s Ferry, hiking, tubing). Barbara provided some awesome snacks and things for breakfast, particularly helpful with our kids. We hope to stay again!
