Great stay! The farm is great!  We love the kitties and the trail. The location was perfect for our one day getaway. The apt was super clean and had more than we needed. Lost do nice touches. Barbara was a great host

Exception lots of outdoor activities and it felt like home Barbara greeted us when we arrived and we had a wonderful experience at her home and look forward to coming again in the future for a longer stay

We had the most amazing and wonderful experience! The apartment is lovely and staying on the farm was just what we needed! The place was very spacious, modern, and comfortable. 
We live in DC, and so we booked this place for our kids (ages 5 and 17 months) to get some fresh air and to be outside. My kids adored looking at the animals. Within an hour of getting there, my five year old had made friends with a couple cats and was just sitting peacefully playing with them in the yard. She would have spent the entire weekend just doing that!
Barb is just so sweet and makes this stay extra special! She and Scott raise exotic birds. During our time there they had emus, rheas and nenes!  There is a trail around the farm so you can see some of the animals that aren’t near the yard too. 
My daughter asked me multiple times why we were only staying two nights and couldn’t we just move there?
Simply could not be any better!

I stayed at the Paradise Farm for one night while visiting Harper's Ferry and had a wonderful time. Barbara's place is quaint with adorable country-style decor. There were numerous touches that made the stay extra special. It was abundantly clear that Barbara is a conscientious host who goes above and beyond to make her guests' stay more comfortable and convenient. I especially loved all the animals and the short hike around the property. It was a lovely way to start the morning. Barbara also had excellent recommendations of local attractions and things to do. I cannot recommend this place enough! I would absolutely stay again. My only regret is not having more time to spend there to explore!
This place is amazing. Pure paradise. If you love animals then this is a must stay. We will definitely be back.

description.summary:
If you love animals and the country this is the place for you! Come visit our "paradise." Horses, cows, goats, donkey and a range of feathered exotics are right out your front door. 

Short drive to the Potomac river, C&O Canal, Harpers Ferry National Historic Park, Antietam Battlefield, Appalachian Trail, Shepherdstown, WV. 

Outfitters nearby offer rafting, kayaking/canoeing, tubing, ziplines. 
Vineyards all around.

Hosts live in attached house and are nearby if needed.
description.space:
Country home set in the mountains of Western Maryland. Only 1.25 hours from DC and Baltimore. Animal lovers will be in paradise. Close to major historical parks, recreation, and wine country.

House has all the comforts of home. Full-sized fridge, microwave and single induction hot plate, HD T.V. in living room and T.V. in bed room. Stereo. Dining area. Private porch. (Please note: no full-sized oven.)
description.access: House is attached to our house but with separate entrance.
description.notes:
Please know that this is a farm. If you love animals, you will love it here. 
Before booking: Be aware that animals can be noisy (crowing especially in the morning). Note too that wifi can be spotty on our farm and because it's satellite it doesn't allow for streaming or a lot of data usage.
description.neighborhood:
***Alert: Road closure at river starting March 20 through Fall 2023*** A detour will be in place that adds 12 miles to/from Harpers Ferry. We regret the inconvenience. 

Rural setting. Mountains just outside the door. 5 minute drive to the river and the C&O canal. Biking, hiking, fishing. Near Harpers Ferry and Antietam. Nearby Shepherdstown has shopping and restaurants.
description.transit: Parking on site.
description.interaction: Always available to answer questions or help out. We're here if you need us but we won't be in your way.
description.house_rules: Please do not feed the animals without asking. They are on special diets and should not have treats or extra food.

name: The Cuckoo Chalet
title: Harpers Ferry, West Virginia

gallery.caption: Relax insideThe Cuckoo Chalet, where time slows down...
Relaxing back decks and a comfy hammock
Our cozy living room with a TV and bluetooth jukebox
Dining Room with A/C unit and a view into the woods.
Our electric fireplace heats so nicely
Upstairs master bedroom (Queen) with Balcony and A/C unit
What we call "The Kid's Room" with 2 twin trundle beds and an extra queen mattress for lounging or sleeping
Relax, use the gas grill and eat on the deck overlooking the lake.
Relax, use the gas grill and eat on the deck overlooking the lake.
Access Road to the Cuckoo Chalet

recent.comments:
We have stayed at the Cuckoo Chalet before.  This time we stayed for four weeks to be near our daughter nearby, with her three young boys.

The Cuckoo Chalet is a wonderful sanctuary in the woods.  It truly has the feel of being in the mountains in Europe.

I can't say enough about how helpful the host, Janet is.

items.comments:
We have stayed at the Cuckoo Chalet before.  This time we stayed for four weeks to be near our daughter nearby, with her three young boys.

The Cuckoo Chalet is a wonderful sanctuary in the woods.  It truly has the feel of being in the mountains in Europe.

I can't say enough about how helpful the host, Janet is.

One of the best stocked AirBNBs we have visited. The house had everything we needed for our 4 night stay. The host was pro-active and reached out before our stay. She followed up with a message about ripe berries on the property. I would recommend this location for anyone looking to stay in this area.
Great stay! Plenty of room to accommodate 7 adults.  Pool table and foosball table were great additions!  Well stocked and well organized home! Very happy with our stay.
The cabin was perfect for our family. Was close to everything. Lots of games to play in the evening. Loved watching the deer come out every morning and evening. Very relaxing.

Comfortable, rustic chalet in the woods.  Private, but still close to Harpers Ferry and Antietam battlefields.  Everything was as expected with one exception - no soap of any kind in the showers.  Otherwise all was great.

This place is absolutely adorable and quirky. Super cute and thematic. It fits very well in the woods and provided a great space for a relaxing weekend getaway. The outdoor spaces are wonderful! 💗 Just know that anything that happens inside the house can be heard by everybody inside the house 🙈
Charming and well kept chalet for a peaceful getaway.  Lovely decks and screened-in porch.  Kitchen has what you need to really cook.  My friends and I return here for retreats.

description.summary:
The Cuckoo Chalet is our happy place and a labor of love. We purchased the chalet as a broken-down foreclosure and spent two years bringing it back to life. Come and stay "just up the mountain" from historic Harper's Ferry National Park.

Enjoy two bedrooms with queen beds and a third bedroom with two twin trundle beds and an extra queen mattress. Grill on the deck, roast s'mores at the fire pit, watch for deer, hike nearby trails, hang out playing pool or just read a good book in the hammock.
description.space: See more on The Cuckoo Chalet online at the 'book of faces'.
description.access: For now, there is no access to the laundry room. We hope to eventually have a wall so we can separate the laundry from the garage and allow access. Please excuse the wait.
description.notes:
Allergy Alert: When we visit the chalet, we bring our cat.

There are deer outside and so you should prepare against ticks - wear hats and bug spray.
description.neighborhood:
The Cuckoo Chalet is "just up the mountain" from historic Harper's Ferry National Park and very close to the Shenandoah and Potomac Rivers. Our family loves to spend time at nearby River Riders (riverriders.com) for tubing, kayaking, canoeing, paddle-boarding, white-water rafting, high adventure rope courses and zip-lining. There is also a pocket of the Shenandoah River nearby, which we refer to as our swimming hole. Use at your own risk.

The Cuckoo Chalet is very close to Virginia wine country with countless vineyards and even near several distilleries. Bring a picnic to Breaux Vineyards on a weekend and feel like you are in Napa! Or visit local distilleries for a moonshine tasting! There is horseback riding, antiquing and flea markets, as well as are quaint farmer's markets, fresh fruit and vegetable stands and roadside barbecue wagons.

The Cuckoo Chalet is less than a mile from the Appalachian Trail and four miles from the C&O Canal. It is a short drive to Hollywood Casino and Slots which also features horse-racing and big name entertainment. We love the hometown feel of the Old Opera House in Charlestown for a weekend night out. The Chalet is also just a short ride to charming Shepardstown with cute shops and restaurants. If you are headed to Antietam Battlefield, remember to stop at the amazing Nutter's Ice Cream Parlor in Sharpsburg.

There are plenty of shopping and basic restaurant choices in nearby Ranson, just a ten-minute ride away.
description.house_rules:
The Cuckoo Chalet has an outdoor camera security system. Please do not attempt to bring any pets or extra guests who have not been registered, unless you want to lose your security deposit.

Please remove your shoes in the cabin.

If you use the fire pit, please pour water on it when you are finished to make sure the fire has been put out.

Please follow check-out procedures listed on bulletin board in main hallway.

name: Gate House cottage
title: Middleburg, Virginia

gallery.caption: Gate Cottage is a charming mini house with Living room, gas fireplace, Dining Room, breakfast room with bedroom and bath upstairs. The breakfast rooms features lovely views
Gate House cottage welcomes you to Middleburg, part of local history.  Your own private country place.

The Pot House was built 1768 by James Leith and became a small commercial center . The Gate House is the very charming 1 BR 1 Bath that is part of the property.  It oozes charm has everything you could want for a relaxing getaway.
Another view of the Living Area, the couch pulls out to a single futon.  As of this writing the fireplace is decorative only.

Gate House kitchen has two burner stove, refrigerator, microwave,  toaster oven, big sink, French press coffee maker, grinder, lots of cooking equipment, plates, etc.     Breakfast room and out door porch overlooks the garden/pasture.
The queen bedroom is super charming, but warning for those over 6'2" as ceilings are low and the bed is built onto a platform with book shelves on either side.
Fully renovated (2016) marble Bath with pedestal sink, tub with shower,  large sitting area, pretty view. Nice dressing area and Washer/Dryer.
The breakfast room has terra-cotta tile floors, original windows from 1800s, and lovely view of the property and hills. There is a side door to go out to the porch.
The outdoor porch is perfect for morning coffee, a lie in the sun or just working outside. Glorious view of pasture
A short walk from the gate Cottage is a lovely place to have a drink in the evening and look at the Virginia countryside
This is the view of the Fields from the bedroom window upstairs

hosts.about: I am a realtor in Washington DC and the Mom of three adult children, and two step children. My husband Gordon and I love gardening, cooking, and enjoying both our city and country lives. We have traveled the world, happily we stumbled on this historic property and are having a dream come true experience. We are enchanted by the Virginia countryside and the people we have met. This Middleburg home is truly a heavenly place.

recent.comments: My husband, small dog and I stayed for two weeks to try a new setting in a new area.  We wanted it to be comfortable and feel like home - while still feeling special and away.  The Gate House hit the mark!  The surroundings are stunning with deer, rabbits, birds and fox seen daily.  The owners were in-and-out of the main house but we had great privacy the way it is all situated.  They could not have  been nicer and even loaned my husband a guitar to play while we visited since he had left his at home.  The house is as described and as seen in the photos.  Lots to do nearby - restaurants, wineries, hiking and more that we could have gotten into.  We had a lovely time!

items.comments: My husband, small dog and I stayed for two weeks to try a new setting in a new area.  We wanted it to be comfortable and feel like home - while still feeling special and away.  The Gate House hit the mark!  The surroundings are stunning with deer, rabbits, birds and fox seen daily.  The owners were in-and-out of the main house but we had great privacy the way it is all situated.  They could not have  been nicer and even loaned my husband a guitar to play while we visited since he had left his at home.  The house is as described and as seen in the photos.  Lots to do nearby - restaurants, wineries, hiking and more that we could have gotten into.  We had a lovely time!
Beautiful setting! Owner allowed us to bring our cat. He loved watching the wildlife, especially the birds. Sunny eating area, we looked up and deer were grazing just off the deck.

We can’t wait to come back and stay at Connie’s place. It was an incredible escape for us to have during our wedding weekend in Middleburg and made for the most peaceful place to return to after all of the festivities. It will always hold a special place in our hearts! Connie was a super helpful host and has the most lovely homes and grounds. So grateful that she shared them with us!  Can’t wait to come back soon.
Wonderful, peaceful cottage. Perfect for a weekend getaway! Looking forward to returning :)

Another wonderful stay— thank you Connie and Gordon. This place is pure magic. We’ve been booking consistently for five years now and never cease to have an outstanding time, every visit. Perfect spot to unplug. Lots of early morning walks, picnics, books/puzzles, stargazing, etc. We love it here. Thanks again!
Great peaceful getaway. Gorgeous property and area. Great for disconnecting.
Cottage is in a beautiful spot in Middleburg! Wonderful views from the upstairs bedroom. Would highly recommend.

description.summary: The Gate House is a charming two story house with living room, dining room for 6, small den, kitchen, breakfast area and porch on the first floor.  Upstairs is a bedroom with a slanted roofline and built in Queen sized bed, an ample closet/dressing area and pretty marble bath with tub/shower, pedestal sink, pretty view of the countryside.  Doorway openings are about 6' 6"  There is a private parking space for this house.
description.space: The Gate House is part of a larger property called The Pot House which was built in 1768 to produce bricks for local homes like Huntlands, Farmers Delight and the Foxcroft School.  Renovated in 2016 this place oozes charm, and has its own magical quality for rest, conversation, exploration.  The house is set at the entrance to a property has 11 acres, the Main house is 1000 feet away. You will feel very private, the porch has a pretty view of country side.  We have 3 tenants that live further down the road and there is a barn.  You are welcome to walk around the paddocks, take your bike on a ride on the many country roads, or drive into Middleburg for a meal, Farmers market, or wine country exploration.  There is as much or as little to do as you want.
description.access: Patio,  paddock walk
description.notes: We do not have a Television, because we come out to “unplug”. We read, bike, go for walks, cook. Etc. There is excellent WiFi if you want to stream movies or your favorite show. There are lots of books, magazines and games.
description.neighborhood: Pot House corner is about 4 miles from Middleburg (north of town), across the road from the Foxcroft School and next door to Huntlands.  The area is known for rolling hills, stone walls and very picturesque countryside.  There is very little evidence of "modern life" which makes it all the more beautiful.  Purceville is 10 minutes further north, the Plains, Upperville and Marshall are 10-20 minutes to the south.
description.transit: You will need a car as the Pot House/Gate House is 4 miles from Middleburg.  This is a great area to ride bikes.
description.interaction: Sometimes we will be next door at our home the Historic Pot House (you can find that on Airbnb too) other times, it might be rented. We live in Washington DC so about an hour away, and we have people close by who can be helpful if there is an emergency.
description.house_rules:
Please leave house as you found it, and sign our guest book. Clean kitchen is appreciated. 

Leave used towels in bath.  Please bag  your trash and recycling 

Please enjoy yourself and the beauty around you.

name: Modern & Private Apartment over Detached Garage
title: Nokesville, Virginia

gallery.caption: View of the apartment. There is an occupied main house on the property but the apartment offers plenty of space and a private entrance.
Bedroom. The farm in the background grows Tulips and Sunflowers in the Spring and Summer
Kitchenette area with cooktop, microwave, fridge and Ninja oven.
View of kitchenette and eating area.
Beautiful sunsets most evenings. Our 5 beehives are also shown here.
Watch the sunrise from the deck
One of three docks on the property
Feel free to try your hand as fishing on the ponds. Fishing poles are available for you to use.
View of the ponds from the deck
Plenty of bird activity to watch
Hard to get privacy around here
Tulips (Spring) and Sunflowers (Summer) attraction within walking distance
Flower farm within walking distance of apt!
Flowers in bloom around our farm
If eggs are available, we are happy to provide some from our girls!
Some of our flock enjoying a snack! We have a variety of chicken breeds to enjoy.
Let us know if you want to say hello to our Nigerian Dwarf Goats- Paul, Prue, and Mary.
Our firepit overlooking the ponds is peaceful for a morning cup of coffee or roasting some marshmallows in the evening.
Thank you for coming to our airbnb!

hosts.about: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to check out our airbnb! We moved to Nokesville, Virginia after my husband Brendan left the Navy. We love to garden, train our Weimaraner Ellie, and take care of our chickens, bees, and goats. We are working on transforming our property into our dream home and we hope y'all can enjoy it too.

recent.comments: Megan’s location was excellent.  Clean—my first requirement.  It was perfectly spotless.  It had a very new fresh feel to it.  My wife absolutely loved it.  New beautiful carpet was delightful throughout.  A/C was very quiet and super effective.  Place was peaceful.  Communication was super fast, friendly, and helpful.  Apartment was tastefully decorated and appointed without feeling cluttered.  It was delightful, restful, and perfect.  Would come back in a heartbeat.  One of the best AirBnBs we’ve had, and we’ve had some really good one.

items.comments: Megan’s location was excellent.  Clean—my first requirement.  It was perfectly spotless.  It had a very new fresh feel to it.  My wife absolutely loved it.  New beautiful carpet was delightful throughout.  A/C was very quiet and super effective.  Place was peaceful.  Communication was super fast, friendly, and helpful.  Apartment was tastefully decorated and appointed without feeling cluttered.  It was delightful, restful, and perfect.  Would come back in a heartbeat.  One of the best AirBnBs we’ve had, and we’ve had some really good one.
Megan is a great host.  The accommodations are excellent and the property is beautiful.  Good communications and recommendations throughout.  We especially enjoyed some eggs from her chickens.

We were very satisfied. Megan was very responsive and provided great recommendations. The directions for finding the place were on point.  We relaxed after walking Arlington and Manassas. Perfect setting and very comfortable, clean place.  We felt right at home.

This stay was great! The space was clean and comfortable and the land was beautiful for an afternoon walk. There is plenty to do in the area and the host was more than helpful when needed yet respected our privacy. I would be likely to recommend this to a friend.

We had a wonderful stay in the Virginia countryside. The home was spotlessly clean and very comfortable. We loved walking around the property and seeing the pond with waterlilies, bluebirds, and fireflies in the evening. Megan even left fresh eggs from their chickens in the fridge for us.

Megan was a great host.  She was very responsive to our needs, including providing us with farm fresh eggs from the chickens on the property. When we asked if there was a fire pit, she made sure there was, including beautiful Adirondack chairs and wood.  She even recommended a bakery because it was my boyfriend's birthday.  The location and space are beautiful.  It is very close to Jiffy Lube Concert center in Bristow, VA - where we were attending a concert.

The stay in Nokesville was perfect! It was super peaceful and just what we needed for the weekend!
My nephews fished in the pond on the property and enjoyed their time.

description.summary: A rare find! Modern Apartment over a detached garage on a 13 acre farm. Enjoy a stroll around the property, fishing, and birdwatching during your stay.
description.space: The property contains two main structures, the main house and the detached garage with the apartment. The apartment and house share a common driveway with the apartment being located across the driveway from the main house.  The main house will feel like a close neighbor. The apartment has it's own entrance on the second floor. Follow the wooden stairs up to the deck for access. The deck faces East towards the pond and offers great sunrise views.
description.access: You will have the space over the garage and concrete pad in front of the garage but access to the garage below is not included. We stay in the main house and ask that you keep out of the attached dog yard. Please feel free to walk around the property. If you'd like to collect eggs from the chicken coop, please let us know first. We also have beehives on the property as well and ask that you keep your distance. We will try to stay out of the way but do have to take care of the property so you may see us around. If we need to mow the lawn or use the lower level of the garage while you are upstairs, we will try to provide advance notice so that we do not interrupt your stay.
description.house_rules:
No unregistered guests or visitors allowed on the property without approval.
Please don’t eat or drink in the bedroom. 
Please remove shoes when inside.
Please take care of the furnishings. You are responsible for damages that exceed the security deposit. 
Please don’t rearrange the furniture.
No illegal substances allowed on the premises.

name: Hereford Grove Farm
title: Middletown, Maryland

gallery.caption: Kitchen has separate entrance to back patio
Washer and dryer in kitchen area
Full upstairs bath with tub and shower

recent.comments: We found this nearby farmhouse on Airbnb, I rented it for a week to host friends. What a fantastic find! The farmhouse's charm and cleanliness impressed us all. The farm itself is a picturesque haven with abundant flowers and a serene pond, creating an enchanting atmosphere. My friends were in awe of the beauty around them. A truly amazing retreat that showcases the best of nature, while close by to historic places like Harpers Ferry, Frederick, Washington DC etc.

items.comments: We found this nearby farmhouse on Airbnb, I rented it for a week to host friends. What a fantastic find! The farmhouse's charm and cleanliness impressed us all. The farm itself is a picturesque haven with abundant flowers and a serene pond, creating an enchanting atmosphere. My friends were in awe of the beauty around them. A truly amazing retreat that showcases the best of nature, while close by to historic places like Harpers Ferry, Frederick, Washington DC etc.
What a wonderful place to stay…my only complaint was that we didn’t spend enough time there! Gorgeous sunsets, great areas to chat and the outdoor area was great for walks.

We visited with our son, daughter-in-law and two young grandsons. Ken and Marian’s home was perfect for all of us! Super clean space, nice sunroom, gorgeous scenery, but most of all wonderful, helpful communication. 
We loved watching the cows and deer and listening to the owls. The farm is rural and yet only six minutes from town. We appreciated the restaurant suggestions. 
Would stay again in a heartbeat!
Me and my friends loved this place. It is such a great getaway from city life, complete with stunning views and that old fashioned charm. 10/10 would stay again!

We loved staying at Ken's country retreat! We needed a pet-friendly place to host my family reuniting in the Frederick area. Downtown was 15-20 minutes away. There was a lovely park and creek a couple of minutes down the road. the property itself was clean, homey, and spacious.

I have family in the area and definitely plan on staying again! Thank you for a wonderful visit.

Could not have asked for a better location or more quaint environment to spend our time in Maryland! The amenities were amazing; just everything you would expect in a beautiful farmhouse in Middletown!
Stayed here for the Hood College commencement.  The house was impeccably clean and maintained, in a beautiful and peaceful setting.  I'd definitely stay here again.

description.summary: Come enjoy a spectacular 128 acre farm setting with breathtaking views and guaranteed tranquility.  The pastoral setting includes beautiful barns, a spring- fed pond and nearby grazing cattle.  Watch the sunset from the front porch overlooking the beautiful Middletown Valley.  The spacious farm house is welcoming, lending itself to memorable family time or a place to work with no distractions.  Large kitchen includes a brand new stove/oven and sink - fully equipped for all your cooking needs.
description.space:
The farm house includes three bedrooms - 2 queen rooms and 1 room with twin beds.  Half bath downstairs and full bath with tub and shower upstairs.  First floor includes an all season sunroom with TV, living room, a separate office space with desk, chair and printer, dining room, and eat in kitchen.

We love your pets and the farm is a great setting for them. In addition to the per stay pet fee, there is an additional $50 per pet if you bring more than one.
description.access: Large outdoor parking space.
description.notes: Enjoy nearby historic Frederick, MD with many great restaurants and breweries.  Civil War history buffs will want to explore Antietam National Battlefield only 25 minutes from the farm house.  Visitors can experience the Catoctin Mountain Park and hike the Chimney Rock and Wolf Rock trails, as well as Cunningham Falls State Park in nearby Thurmont, MD.
description.interaction: Our host team will be available to you 24/7.  Please do not hesitate to reach out.

name: Chestnut House at Fox Haven Farm
title: Jefferson, Maryland

gallery.caption: A front porch too good to pass up!  So much more awaits inside.....
Everyone can get around this table to enjoy food, drink, and merriment.
Double oven, woodstove - can we say cozy!
This room has big bay window and fireplace - those are original beams. Just magical!
Original exposed beams make you feel like you are living in the early 19th century, but you have central air.
A cozy bedroom with desk, double bed (not in this photo) and a great place to write and retreat.
double sinks make life so much easier in the morning!
This room is great for yoga - move the chairs and space for 4-6 or more to do your morning salutations.
queen bed and twin bed, with comfy chairs and desk
5 twin beds in beautiful log wall room
plenty of shade from this lovely tree
relax on the hillside and watch the clouds go by
dusk is a magical time on the farm
Big Red barn, Dairy Parlor both offer space for reunions and gatherings - no weddings though, due to zoning regs
inside dairy parlor offers a lot of space; yoga practitioners love it

hosts.about: Fox Haven Organic Farm & Learning Center is my passion.  I am happiest when touring young and older folks around the farm, teaching about where our food comes from, healthy farming and gardening that leads to healthy soil, waterways, humans, and critters.  Forests are my playgrounds.  Our young adult children help and that is the best!  Frederick, MD is a favorite place on this planet to eat, walk, talk with shop owners and artists, and attend Quaker Meeting for Worship.  This precious part of Maryland is a wonderful place to visit and live.

recent.comments:
My stay at the Chestnut House at Fox Haven Farms was terrific. 

The house is in great condition and well furnished.  The farm is a pleasant and relaxing place to be. JoAnn and the rest of the staff there seemed very kind.  I couldn’t have asked for anything more.

It was a great stay and highly recommend this unique accommodation to anyone thinking about it.

items.comments:
My stay at the Chestnut House at Fox Haven Farms was terrific. 

The house is in great condition and well furnished.  The farm is a pleasant and relaxing place to be. JoAnn and the rest of the staff there seemed very kind.  I couldn’t have asked for anything more.

It was a great stay and highly recommend this unique accommodation to anyone thinking about it.

The Chestnut house was a wonderful getaway for my family. We got to see some amazing wildlife (fox, deer, turkey buzzards & all kinds of birds). The house had amazing books and activities as well! Jefferson is a wonderful little town and accessible to many day trips!

Chestnut House in Fox Haven Farm is one of the most unique houses I've ever been to. This spacious and cozy house is equipped with everything you could possibly need and is located in a peaceful and beautiful area. It's the perfect place for relaxation and mental reboot. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a comfortable and tranquil getaway.
very nice house, loved the old timey feel... ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

my family has been staying here for..7 years? We missed the covid years, and this was our first time back, and it was like coming home. There are no "live, laugh, love" messages in wine mom font here. It is loveably lived in, and you're more likely to actually live and laugh and learn about agroecology here. It is close to so many things you never heard of (Weverton Cliffs, the silver cup-a 100 year old abbitoir turned into a restaurant, a great nature center where your kids can feel what corn snakes feel like, breweries and coffee shops in old churches, and all of this is not to mention whatever you discover on the farm). Fox Haven has become the place my kids will think of when they think of getting away in their youth. It is a place with spirit, and we love it.
Four adults and two young kids had a good time here. Plenty of plaything made kids happy. Peaceful and cozy. Town Jefferson is adorable.

We went to Jefferson for the Fall Chestnut Roast Festival.  The festival was at Fox Haven Farm within a very easy  walk from Chestnut House.

The house itself is very roomy and comfortable.  We didn’t prepare meals this trip but the kitchen would be a perfect place to make a Thanksgiving meal.

description.summary: Beautiful countryside vistas, nature-lover's paradise,  feels like you are far away, yet the fine food and art of Frederick are only a 15 minute drive up the road.  Hikes, Harper's Ferry, Ski Liberty, or just the quiet of our bucolic setting await.  It can be a part of a larger retreat when combined with 2 other houses on the farm, and a restored Dairy Parlor. However, we can not hold weddings due to county zoning. We can have rehearsal dinners and other events though.  You can join a class too.
description.space: Chestnut House is a part of Fox Haven - a historic organic farm and non-profit ecological education center located along the Catoctin Creek in Jefferson, Maryland, within one hour of Washington D.C. and Baltimore, and 15 minutes from the charming town of Frederick, MD.  Chestnut House is a restored early 19th century farmhouse cradled by beautiful rolling hills on a gravel country road. A creek gurgles in the front yard, woods loaded with birds, and a chestnut orchard are on the other three sides of the house.  A big red barn - no animals -  and re-purposed dairy parlor also sit on the property.  The house has a large kitchen with double oven, lots of counter space, and a big farm kitchen table for all to share.  There are two large rooms downstairs, bay window and fireplace, the other with plenty of space to stretch out for some yoga and board games.  The front porch is wide and lovely, a perfect place to relax and enjoy the peace.  Walking trails and the country road provide breathtaking views, birds of all sorts, and the Catoctin Creek is home to big blue herons, eagles, beaver, and plenty of rich plant life - a feast for the senses!  Antiques, civil war history, rock climbing, canoeing along the Potomac or Shenandoah Rivers, minor league baseball, art studios, outlet shopping, mountain biking and so much more are all within 15-20 minutes of the house. Plenty of wineries, cideries, and distilleries are within 10-30 minutes away. The farm office is inside the house, so the phone will ring occasionally, thought we try to turn the ringer off when guests are here. If we are holding classes out in the barn, you will see other folks around.  Check in with us to see what is happening the weekend of your stay. You might want to join in the fun. Your stay supports farm programs that we offer children and adults from low income communities, people suffering with PTSD, and other life challenges.
description.access: You have use of the entire house.  Country gravel roads to walk, woods and streams to explore, a big porch where you can relax and observe nature, are all accessible to guests.
description.notes: We are a retreat center and occasionally offer experiences: wild food forage, garden tour. & tea tasting, herb classes, tree grafting classes, beekeeping 101 and honey tasting, etc...that you can join.  You can arrange in advance for a group of 8 or more to have your own class dependent on staff availability.
description.neighborhood: Chestnut House sits along a gravel country road surrounded by fields, woods, and streams.  There are a few houses up the road, but you are unlikely to see many people - mostly wildlife.  Places to eat within a 5 minute drive include Ingram's Diner, an ice cream and sandwich cafe, Jefferson Pastry Shop, and Watsons chicken carry out.  There is a small grocery in town, but a Safeway in Middletown or the Common Market and other grocery stores are in Frederick and will offer more options.  The Appalachian Trail is a short drive (15-20 minutes) and offers great hiking and rock climbing.  Bicyclists love it out here! Harper's Ferry is about a 15-20 minute drive and there's plenty of history, whitewater rafting and tubing, and quaint shops and flea markets to explore.  Frederick offers an abundance of restaurants, art galleries, shops, live entertainment, museums, parks, and a triple A baseball team to watch.  Brunswick is a great place to hop on the C&O bike path, grab some coffee and a homemade meal at Beans in the Belfry.  There are many artists in the Middletown Valley, as well as historic sites to explore.
description.transit: The metrorail system offers the MARC train from Washington D.C. and Reagan National airport to Frederick and Brunswick. One must take a cab from there to Chestnut House.  Sometimes you can catch a shuttle from Dulles airport to Frederick where you then take a cab to Chestnut House.
description.interaction: The owner has very little interaction with the guests. Basically a welcome and then you are on your own. However, we are a working farm and occasionally have outdoor classes that meet in the barn or Dairy Parlor.  We are always available by phone and are nearby if needed.
description.house_rules: We ask that guests leave the house and grounds clean; dishes put in dishwasher and run, all towels and sheets put in laundry room, trash and recycling in cans when you leave.  There is no smoking.  We ask that guests follow the directions if you want to use the woodstove and/or fire place - we leave directions at the house. Please do not try to adjust heat/central air register.  Ideally, the less plastic used the better. The water is good filtered well water.  You are welcome to have more people sleep on the couches or floor, just indicate how many folks will stay at the house when signing up.

name: Whole Garage Apartment with Blue Ridge Views
title: Round Hill, Virginia

recent.comments: My husband and I have stayed at multiple Airbnb’s over the years, and Cindy’s apartment is our favorite! Beautifully decorated and welcoming. Snacks and coffee were provided. We cannot wait to come back!

items.comments: My husband and I have stayed at multiple Airbnb’s over the years, and Cindy’s apartment is our favorite! Beautifully decorated and welcoming. Snacks and coffee were provided. We cannot wait to come back!

Beautiful! Much larger than it shows in the pictures. Cindy supplied fresh eggs, soda, water along with plentiful snacks. The purpose of our trip was to tour many wineries and the location was great! The apartment was spotless and the bed was very comfortable. We would definitely recommend Cindy's place to all and we will be returning.

The picturescdid not do the apt. justice. It is so spacious and beautifully appointed. There were so many thoughtful extras provided by Cindy. This apt. is comfortable and we had a relaxing weekend, while enjoying local destinations.

Cindy's place is absolutely perfect. Beautifully decorated, well equipped, high quality linens, comfortable bed, spacious. Very near the charming towns of Round Hill and Purcellville, Virginia, at the foot of the Blue Ridge. Cindy will leave a list of recommended restaurants and other places of interest. When we go back to the area, we will definitely be back.

We absolutely loved our stay at this adorable apartment!  The place is stunning and the location could not be better.  We were blown away by the farm fresh eggs that were waiting on us as well as all the other special touches of Cindy's place.  You will not find a better option while visiting NOVA.

There are not enough words to express how amazing this apartment is, which doesn't  feel like an apartment at all. It's so tastefully decorated, clean, relaxing and so comfortable. They definitely thought of every little thing for the apartment. Having a stocked refrigerator, coffee, snacks and all the necessities was so nice and thoughtful. This place has everything you need! My Mother and I enjoyed this place so much and will definitely be back to visit. It's very easy to find and centrally located to many wineries. 
Thank you for your wonderful communications,  ease of access, local recommendations and for being an amazing host. It was the perfect weekend for our Mother-Daughter get-a-way ~ Jackie

We had such a wonderful stay. It was so peaceful and serene. Cindy was very responsive and super helpful. She provided such clear instructions,  that we didn’t have any questions. This was just what my husband and I needed to spend some time away. Everything is just as described and did not disappoint. We are already planning our next trip back and wouldn’t dream of staying any place else!

description.summary: The spacious 1600 sq ft private apartment over a 4 bay garage is brand new with construction just completed in July 2021.   It's located at the base of the Blue Ridge Mountains and boasts pastoral and mountain views.  Bluemont Vineyard, Dirt Farm Brewery, Bear Chase Brewery, B Chord Brewery,  Williams Gap Vineyard, and Snickers Gap Christmas Tree Farm are all within 5 minutes. Middleburg, Purcelleville, Leesburg, Harpers Ferry, The Appalachian Trail and Shenandoah River are also nearby.
description.space:
There is one bedroom with a king size bed, large bathroom, smart TV and private balcony.  The living area has a queen sized sleeper sofa, smart tv, electric fireplace.  A full size kitchen with dishwasher, range, built in microwave, refrigerator, washer and dryer.   Central heat and air. Wifi is available but can be spotty at times.  Cell phones work well.  There are two Smart TV's which can be connected to your laptop, game system, Fire TV etc.  There is no cable TV.  Garage parking is available for up to two vehicles and there is an EV charger also available. 

We are dog lovers and welcome your dog. Cats are not allowed. There is a $35 per stay pet fee. If you have more than one dog you wish to bring please make that request when inquiring about the apartment. Your dog must be kept off of furniture and beds. If left alone in the apartment please crate your dog. (Crates are not provided. Please bring your own). Your dog needs to be kept on leash and picked up after. The majority of vineyards and breweries in the area allow pets. 

We live on the property and are available for questions or assistance.
description.interaction: We live on the property and are available for questions and assistance.
description.house_rules:
The reservation must match the first count with no exception. Children are counted as guests. 

Guests do not have access to the Main house and surrounding grounds. Please respect our privacy and don’t wander  the grounds of the main house. 

Please note no parties or additional guests allowed.

The check-in and out was extremely smooth, beds are absolutely comfortable and the property is just picture perfect. Had a wonderful time and we sure created memories at that place. Although my kids didn't want to leave but we shall return. Thank you M. Ginny.

The check-in and out was extremely smooth, beds are absolutely comfortable and the property is just picture perfect. Had a wonderful time and we sure created memories at that place. Beautiful unique home. We loved the gorgeous surroundings.  The rooms were large and extremely clean. One thing to be prepared there is no shower, it was a tub with spray attachment.  For those that may have difficulty getting in and out of an old fashioned high tub it mighy be a challenge.  The views were serene. The Native American influence was all through the home and truly an experience.
Wonderful location! We hope to make this location an annual destination!
Wonderful place!

Lovely place nestled in a quiet rural area! Useful amenities and pleasant environment. Snacks upon arrival were a nice touch. Well written directions and easy access made check in and out a breeze!

Water pressure in shower/tub was low and remained low even after the host tried to fix. She was very responsive to my complaint. Additionally, shower head is not mounted making it difficult to shower. 

WiFi is slow but that’s not why you’re staying here! Ultimately, it was a great value and a pleasant stay. Thanks Ginny!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!  The instructions were clear, and very easy to follow.  The place was clean and very comfortable, everything we needed was provided.  The house is lovely, it has been thoughtfully restored and decorated with many unique and beautiful items.  The furniture was comfortable, especially the bed, we felt right at home.  The grounds are private and are exceptionally beautiful this spring, but the place is a perfect getaway for us any time of the year, we will definitely stay there again!

description.summary:

description.space: Rooms are very spacious and will have two closets each to store belongings. Both bedrooms are located on the second floor. You will share a bath area with shower and clawfoot tub. The lower level is the main living area with a native theme design. A small gazebo offers a peaceful and relaxing area with views of spring fed lake and grounds. Take a walk and enjoy many art treasures throughout the property, wild life, and several private picnic areas.
description.access: Private parking area and easy access at rear door. Front door of the guest house and manor house is guarded by a large friendly Great Pyranese named Boomer (friendly to other dogs) Boomers area is pet fenced from 10 ft in front of guest house to include flat are atop hill and around manor house.
description.notes: Special evening wildlife tour is available upon request if available at no extra charge.
description.neighborhood: Private and Scenic

hosts.about: European interior designer and world traveller living in the DC metro area. I spent my life traveling and have now settled in the countryside. I enjoy gardening, antiquing, and spending time with my family.

recent.comments: Alina was a gracious host with a beautiful home and a large deck providing pretty views and nice gardens.  We got to watch deer playing in the side area one morning.  There were plenty of amenities including a regular drip coffee maker with coffee, plenty of towels/pillows, shampoo/conditioner and bar soap (no shower gel), a nice working gas grill, a huge dining room table, kitchen table, and an extremely well-stocked kitchen.  The beds were comfortable and the sheets were soft.  The master bedroom was expansive.  Just a note, closets are not available so hanging up clothes is very limited.  We already had plans for the weekend so did not ask for recommendations although it sounds like Alina was ready to assist.  Alina was very attentive, called beforehand to provide instructions, and thanked us after departing.  It’s a wonderful and comfortable house that we would be more than happy to stay at again.

There were plenty of amenities including a regular drip coffee maker with coffee, plenty of towels/pillows, shampoo/conditioner and bar soap (no shower gel), a nice working gas grill, a huge dining room table, kitchen table, and an extremely well-stocked kitchen.  The beds were comfortable and the sheets were soft.  The master bedroom was expansive.  Just a note, closets are not available so hanging up clothes is very limited.  We already had plans for the weekend so did not ask for recommendations although it sounds like Alina was ready to assist.  Alina was very attentive, called beforehand to provide instructions, and thanked us after departing.  It’s a wonderful and comfortable house that we would be more than happy to stay at again.
the group had a great time here! perfect weekend get away.

Alina is a warm, welcoming host!   Her French-inspired, modern home sits on a thriving hydrangea farm in Virginia's peaceful horse and wine country.  We (four couples) celebrated a "cousins birthday weekend" - we arrived on Friday and never left the property until we checked out on Monday.  The kitchen is abundantly equipped to accommodate large meals (we cooked for 8), but several wonderful restaurants are close by.   The bedrooms are chic, bathrooms are comfortable, and the living areas are perfect for movie nights, reading, or board games.  We spent mornings outside on the large decks, in the garden, on the sitting porch.  Pack a bottle of wine and settle in ... Alina's 'Hydrangea Farm' is a sensational escape to the good life.
We loved our stay.  The house has so much character and was super comfortable!  Definitely recommend staying here.

Alina was a wonderful host, we went to purceville for my nephews wedding, our first time in Virginia and we were so pleasantly surprised how beautiful the state is, we really enjoyed our morning coffee outside on the deck watching the deer run free. We loved our stay in your beautiful home, thank you for allowing people to use your home.
Thanks again 
Peggy
Everything was perfect.

Alina was a very responsive and accommodating host.  She called ahead of our stay to give us check-in instructions and everything was where she said it would be.  We felt very much at home bringing in packages and watering her new spring sprouts.

The bedrooms are very tastefully decorated and she provided shampoo, soap, more than enough towels and pillows.  The only complaint in the sleeping areas was all the closets are locked and there is no place to hang clothes.  Over the door hooks could be used while still locking personal items.

The living spaces and kitchen were huge and beautiful.  Dining room table sat 14 for dinner.  The deck off the kitchen is convenient and welcoming with a fire pit and outdoor furniture.  

The property was worth the value if only for the 5 bedrooms and 4 baths!  But it is a warm home with office space and 3 coffee makers!

description.summary:
Luxury farmhouse professionally decorated by interior designer that offers a glimpse into peaceful farm living. The property offers 3 acres and is surrounded by a working cow and horse farm. Come escape and enjoy your coffee on the wraparound porch or a glass of wine on the deck overlooking the vibrant sunset. There is also a "secret garden" with a fountain for the instagram lover. The interior boasts an open layout with antiques and artwork.
For best pricing please book early.
description.space:
In the heart of Virginia wine and horse country with multiple wineries less than 5 miles away. 
Very close to exceptional wineries (10-15 min drive), antiquing (10 min), Appalachian trail (15 min), beautiful bike trails, shopping (20 min - Leesburg Premium Outlets), restaurants (10 minutes), casino (30 min drive - CharlesTown Races and Slots) and the historic Harpers Ferry (30 min drive)

Wineries include; Bluemont Vineyard, Stone Tower Wineries, Hillsborough Winery and many more... 
Antique shops include; Vintage magnolia, Victorias Past Tyme, The Old Lucketts store and many more... 
Great Restaurants - Magnolia at the Mill (10 min), Red Fox Inn (15 min), The Inn at Little Washington (60 min drive - ranked amongst the top boutique restaurants in the US)

The Space
This farm home is a cozy environmentally friendly house situated on a wildlife sanctuary that's viewed as farm home and beautiful family escape getaway. The home is fully furnished with a clean country feel and surrounded by working horse and cow farms . As a farm experience, you’ll have a potential opportunity depending on your season to pick your own vegetables from your own backyard; tomatoes, cucumbers, zucchinis, etc. Fresh farm eggs are also available for purchase at the farm next door.
If you love to garden let us know! We can include you in some gardening activities while you vacation to fully experience the farm life! 

The Bedrooms Include; 
#1 Master Bedroom (King Size Bed)
#2 Guest Bedroom (Queen Size Bed)
#3 Guest Bedroom (Full Size Bed)
#4 Guest Bedroom (Queen Size Bed) 
#5 Guest Bedroom (Queen Size Bed)
All bedrooms have high end organic cotton sheets, and hypoallergenic pillows.

The fully equipped kitchen includes dual ovens, refrigerator/freezer, toaster, air fryer, microwave, coffee machines for espresso and regular coffee and all the essentials.

The living room has a big screen TV, huge fireplace and comfortable seating.

There is plenty of parking space available in the drive away (fit up to 4 cars)
description.access: Guests have access to the entire home excluding the garage and the basement.
description.notes:
The house is located in a very quaint neighborhood and we don’t allow parties. Quiet time after 10 pm.
Due to Covid-19 we are taking extreme precautions before and after your stay and kindly ask you not to wear your shoes inside the house. We may charge you additional cleaning fee if shoes are worn in the house.
Please make sure your entire group reeds the house rules under House Manual and know and agree with them. We are very strict and don’t deviate from them.
description.neighborhood:
A charming country gravel road leads you to the property which offers you a private escape. Surrounded by a meticulously landscaped gardens and two working farms you'll be able to experience the country life like a local.

Located in the heart of Philomont, a historical area within Loudoun county. The gravel road leads to a hundred year old General Store and is a nice morning walk. Downtown Purcellville is a 10 minute drive and has 3 supermarkets.

One hour from Washington, DC.
description.transit: There is no public transportation nearby. Uber/Lyft is available however they are not as quick and reliable as in the city.
description.interaction: Available via text for any questions you may have.
description.house_rules:
This is a private residence, not a venue. The house is suitable for quiet getaways only. No parties! We don’t accommodate weddings. Maximum of 8 guests and 4 cars.
Valid photo ID required .Quiet time after 10 pm.( No music, loud noice or traffic in and out of the driveway after quiet time.)                                   No shoes inside the house.                    
For your safety and our peace of mind the property outside is under 24/7  surveillance.   Please read the entire list of house rules under House Manual. We strongly recommend that you encourage everyone in your group to read them and agree prior to arrival and know what to expect.

name: #2 Cottage in Loudoun Co. (Upper of 2 units)w/Pond
title: Purcellville, Virginia

gallery.caption: Loudoun Country Country Cottage on 12 beautiful acres with a fully stocked pond!

The 100 year old corn crib, barn, and silo on our beautiful acreage hint at our recent agricultural heritage. Trees of different species, shapes, and sizes and our gorgeous pond mean you may never even want to or need to leave our property!
Our 100-year-old Corn Crib, Old Silo, and Stable Barn remind us of our recent past!
Barn and Silo - 100 years old and standing strong!
Our gorgeous pond has been stocked with Large and Smallmouth bass, Hybrid Blue Gill,  Yellow Perch, Crappie,  Blue Catfish, Carp, Bullhead Minnows.
Our gorgeous pond has been stocked with Large and Smallmouth bass, Hybrid Blue Gill,  Yellow Perch, Crappie,  Blue Catfish, Carp, Bullhead Minnows.
Beautiful, pond-view, firepit area for carefully monitored and responsible campfires. Have a beer and a s'more as you relax to the sound of frogs serenading you!
Natural Tree and Rock Formations dot the property around you!
Entrance to 2nd Bathroom and brand new Appliances
Laundry Room with Full Size Washer and Dryer

hosts.about: I used to be an urban hipster, but then I got old. Now I still play one once in a while, but now I spend a lot of time farming. Our farm (just west of the city proper) is actually a nonprofit whose mission is to provide employment and a welcoming community to adults with developmental and/or intellectual disabilities.

recent.comments: Greg was a delightful host and the facility was just what we needed (simple and clean). It is centrally located to lots of great restaurants, shops and wineries. If we end up back in the area we would gladly stay here again!

items.comments: Greg was a delightful host and the facility was just what we needed (simple and clean). It is centrally located to lots of great restaurants, shops and wineries. If we end up back in the area we would gladly stay here again!
Greg was a great and responsive host and his cottage was very peaceful and the surroundings were quite beautiful! Highly recommended!!!
Beautiful property.
Fantastic host as always, great communication, clean, quiet, welcoming space for our guests. Thank you!
Greg provides an ideal location for us to house some guest instructors on a regular basis. Fantastic communication, reasonable rates, clean and very quiet. Highly recommend!

we stayed for 8 days in this large and clean apartment. It was quiet, comfortable and being able to walk around the pond was nice.  

The full kitchen had everything we needed to cook our own meals.  

internet was quite fast and reliable, and with a smart tv.  Video conf for work was successful.  

On top of all the host , Greg, was easy to work with and accommodating.

Greg is a fantastic host! We book his location for our visiting instructors when they work at our location, and we know we don’t have to be concerned with them being taken care of at this location. Great communication, good value, peaceful property, fantastic hosts!

description.summary: Adorable 2 bedroom/ 2 bathroom upper cottage is the Best of Loudoun County for Wineries, Breweries, Antiquing, Hiking, Fishing (starting in our very own, well-stocked, pond directly on our 12-acre property). We're minutes from wineries, breweries, antiques, cultural & historical attractions, Mountain and/or Road Biking, Civil War Battlefields,  and so much more! Not to mention our gorgeous 12-acre parcel of land with a huge pond that's stocked with all kinds of fish you can catch and release.
description.interaction: We live in a house on the same 12-acre property but we respect our guest's privacy. We are available to help or offer suggestions when needed, but happy to leave our guests alone for the entire duration of their stay!
description.house_rules: Up to 4 guests will have the run of the upper cottage apartment only - which is a 2 bedroom 2 full bathroom self-contained apartment at the top of the stairs with newly renovated Kitchen and Baths and a vaulted Living Room / Kitchen ceiling.

name: Potomac Overlook Farms: 4 BR, 10 Acre River Estate
title: Leesburg, Virginia

gallery.caption: 10 Acre Estate Home on the Potomac River.
Bright and open Living Room with views of the river.
Formal Dining Room with 2 high chairs available.

The Oak Suite is located on the First Floor of the Main House. This King Suite has a cozy gas fire place and bay windows that look out into the front yard. The room has a closet, Roku TV and shares a Jacuzzi bathroom with the main floor.
Oak Suite and Main Level Bath.
Main level bath, shared with Oak Suite.
Welcome! We utilize QR codes for WiFi and our GuideBook.
Fully stocked Bar area for Happy Hour- just bring your wine, beer and spirits.
Office Center with printer and basic supplies.
Open concept Living Room and Kitchen.
Rear deck off kitchen with propane grill and utensils.
Rear Deck off Living Room- perfect for relaxing while enjoying the river and nature.
River Birch Suite with king-sized bed.
River Birch Suite en suite bathroom contains two separate sinks, shower, Jacuzzi tub, separate toilet room and plenty of storage space.
Upper Level Loft with, perfect for hanging out.

The Dogwood Suite is an Upper Level room that sleeps 6 with 2 full size beds and 2 twin beds. There is an attached full bath and full size closet. This room shares a Jack and Jill closet with the Maple Suite.
Game Room located on lower level.

Maple Suite is a light filled, corner suite on the Upper Level. Relax in a Queen Size bed with views of the Potomac River. The room is equipped with a Roku TV, private bathroom and a cot should you need to sleep an additional guest.

hosts.about: We are a family of four that loves hosting, exploring and is always on the go. Amber prides herself in cleanliness and attention to detail while Charles makes sure everyone has FUN! But no matter what, as your host and hostess, we are always here to make sure you enjoy your stay. If there is anything you need from "what to do in the area" to I love "chai tea for breakfast", our goal is to make your stay as relaxing, comfortable and enjoyable as possible.

recent.comments: They were so nice and caring for their communication and fixing our problems.

items.comments: They were so nice and caring for their communication and fixing our problems.

We had a great stay at Charles and Amber’s property. The house looks just as it appears in the listing. There are many amenities, including an amazing game room that my children loved, and a fully stocked kitchen. There were a few minor issues that arose during our stay, as they do with houses, and the hosts were extremely responsive and friendly in offering advice and solutions. The location, along the Potomac, is fantastic. We wanted a quiet, rural getaway and that’s exactly what we found.
Great place to stay! Would’ve been nice if the ice maker was working.

We had a great time at Charles & Amber’s home.  The location was beautiful; we loved being right on the river and seeing deer grazing every morning.  There were lots of outdoor activities that the kids and adults enjoyed.  The home’s interior offered many different spaces to gather and relax.  We particularly appreciated the  large dining room.  The basement game/media rooms as well as the hot tub were highlights for the entire group.
Awesome place!
We had an amazing time! Everything was gorgeous and cozy. My only complaint is that my legs hurt by the end of the weekend from walking up the hill from the river too many times.
The House are Really amazing !! Charlie and Amber are helpful, fast response, and serving us really well. Definitely will come back for the next trip !!

description.summary: Looking for a place to get away from it all, relax and reconnect with the ones you love? We invite you to stay with us at Potomac Overlook Farms. The property is 10 peaceful acres directly on the Potomac River. Rich in wildlife, greenery, amenities and fresh air, you’ll find this to be Your Best Stay. Potomac Overlook Farms is centrally located to parks, historic small towns, wineries, breweries, farm stores and plenty of pastoral views.
description.space:
The Estate is a Smart Home Stay, programmed to make your stay as convenient as possible. The Main House contains a Game Room, Projector Screen Movie Room, beautiful Dining Room, an Indoor Bar, a lower level Kitchenette, an outdoor Hot Tub and a light-filled, open concept Main Level. The expansive decks outfitted with grills, propane fire pits and cozy chairs allow you to soak in the fresh air and river views.You’ll find a shed full of outdoor games, an assortment of kayaks available for use during your stay, as well as a sport court for basketball, pickle ball, racquet ball and frisbee golf. Potomac Overlook Farms is truly a vacation destination designed to bring you closer to the ones you love.

Please also be advised that the Guest House may be rented to a separate party, who will not have access to the Main House you rent. Shared spaces include the parking area and grounds activities. This is ONLY a possibility during November, December, January, February, March and April. All other times of year, the entire property is occupied by only your group.
description.access:
You will have access to the entire property during your stay, except the following: 
- Two closed off bedrooms in the lower level. 
- Lawn shed. 
- Guest house (unless added to the reservation). 
- Garage. 
- Locked closet in the Upper Level.

Please also be advised that the Guest House may be rented to a separate party, who will not have access to the Main House you rent. Shared spaces include the parking area and grounds activities. This is ONLY a possibility during November through April. All other times of year, the entire property is occupied by only your group.

description.neighborhood: Potomac Overlook Farms is north of Leesburg, VA in a small town called Lucketts. You can stay with us and spend your days visiting Maryland, West Virginia and Virginia; or, you can not even leave! We are centrally located to parks, historic small towns, wineries, breweries, farm stores and plenty of pastoral views. We are less than 60 miles from Washington, D.C. and 65 miles from Baltimore, MD- close enough for a day trip, but far enough to feel like you’ve escaped.
description.transit: We are located in a rural part of Loudoun County, which will require a car to get to most places. We are just a few miles from the MARC train, which goes to D.C. The nearest D.C. Metro system stop is in Reston, VA. If you're looking for a great bike ride, drive a couple miles over the bridge to Point of Rocks and drop onto the C&O Canal towpath. The path spans 184 miles from D.C. to Cumberland, MD.
description.interaction:
While we do not live on the property, we are easy to reach through AirBnb, text or voice. Anything you need, we're here! Please note that property staff may be around for periodic maintenance. Feel free to let staff know if you need anything while they're on site.

Please also be advised that the Guest House may be rented to a separate party, who will not have access to the Main House you rent. Shared spaces include the parking area and grounds activities. This is ONLY a possibility during November, December, January, February, March and April. All other times of year, the entire property is occupied by only your group.

Please notify us of any damages that occur.
Please notify us of any visitors besides the reservation party. 
Guests must send driving directions to all members of the reservation party, as GPS is not always accurate. 
No hunting or discharge of firearms is allowed on the property at any time. 
Smoking is allowed in designated outdoor areas. Evidence of smoking inside will incur a fee. Please dispose of smoking litter or a clean up fee will be required.

hosts.about: I'm a 48 year old, fit, positive mental attitude, kind of guy.  You'll find me low key, low stress, easy to work with, and down to Earth.  I enjoy documentaries, Clint Eastwood westerns, running, and biking.  Please do not hesitate to contact me with questions or concerns.  Thanks!

recent.comments: It was a fantastic stay! The host is amazing. I will say that the walls are VERY thin and it took us by surprise (you can hear EVERYTHING) but the place is absolutely gorgeous and worth a stay!

items.comments: It was a fantastic stay! The host is amazing. I will say that the walls are VERY thin and it took us by surprise (you can hear EVERYTHING) but the place is absolutely gorgeous and worth a stay!

Joe was a very gracious host. He went above and beyond with Airbnb to deliver an exceptional experience. The property was stunning, especially around dusk and dawn. Joe and his team continuously improved the property without interfering with the overall peacefulness. Everything you need will already be there. Would stay again.

The TLC that has gone into the conversion of this beautiful, mid-1800's historic manor to a country inn is commendable.  It's filled with period antiques and decor along with the necessary modern touches.  Visiting Gayfield is a rare opportunity to stay in a home that has been much-loved by the few families who have lived here.  The view from every window is stunning and you can really step back in time, imagining the bustling activity that took place on this farm.  If you are a history seeker, you couldn't find a better spot than here to do your research from the 17th century to the present.  Visit the Heritage Frederick Museum, the Maryland Room at the C. Burr Artz Library, and the Monacacy Visitor's Center, just to name a few amazing resource spots, where you will be welcomed as I was.
Joe's place was exactly what we'd hoped for...an old historical house in a lovely farm setting, close to the historical sites we wanted to see. Joe was responsive and available.

This is an amazing place to stay.  The house is decorated true to its history. 

There are several different rooms to choose from and each one is unique.  

Joe was an excellent host and very responsive.

A wonderful way to feel the historical vibes of Frederick while exploring the area!  

100% recommend!
Great place to stay!

description.summary: Welcome to the Farmers Suite on the 3rd floor of the Manor House!  The Farmer's Suite is very private, situated with a bedroom with a full size bed, a comfortable sofa bed in the great room and affords views in three directions of the farm.  With modern heating and air conditioning, an adorable claw-foot tub/shower, and a kitchenette with appliances the Suite is comfortable and charming.  There are headroom limitations so this Suite is not for the super tall!
description.access:
Upon entering the front door of the Manor House you'll find a large foyer.  All guests have shared access to the Common Area, Greenhouse, and Common Area full Kitchen (with range/oven) on the 1st floor as shown in the pictures.  Please do not disturb the fish in the greenhouse, and remember the area is shared so please clean up after use.  

There are multiple Suites in the home, but each is separate and secure.  

There is an 850 yard long path down to the large Monocacy River which borders the East edge of the farm.  There is about 1500 ft of river frontage, but it's not really possible to manicure the river bank so you'll need to work your way down to the water as if you were in the wild if you'd like to fish or launch a kayak.

Currently several animals from D&D's Petting Zoo and Pony Rides are boarded at the farm and include ponies, a zebra, a miniature donkey, goats and other such critters.  The animals are very friendly!

In support of the global effort to conserve energy resources utilizing reasonable practices, we use a maximum heating setting of 71 degrees and a minimum cooling setting of 72 degrees.
description.notes:
The Manor House at Gayfield was originally built in 1850 by the Jarboe family, and currently sits upon 144 acres of farmland in Central Frederick County.  The farm has had three owners, currently owned by the Bartlett family and before them the Morans and the Jarboes.  Thomas Jarboe served as a County Commissioner in the 1800's and William "Bill" Moran was a world-famous knifesmith.

The Jarboe family commissioned a major addition in 1895 when the Northwest turret, 4 rooms on the Southeast side, and the stone water tower were added. So the Jarboe family had 'running' water in the 1800's, which was rare at the time.

Although the house has been modified over the last nearly 200 years , all of the wood floors throughout the house date from 1850 and in some rooms 1895, and nearly all of the woodwork dates to the same periods.

description.summary: Enjoy your stay in this charming historic city of Hamilton located in western Loudoun county. Hamilton is surrounded by scenic hills and great vineyards and wineries. W&OD trail is within 5 minutes walk to our house, and it is a 45 mile long paved trail for walking, running and cycling. Also, don't forget to treat yourself to a nice seafood dish at Lowry's Crab Shack or a burgher, steak or a pizza at the Hamilton Station Gastropub.
description.space: You have your private bedroom attached to bathroom. Room is in the second floor takes around 15 steps to get into your room.
description.access: Guest can use the designated area in the kitchen.
description.notes:
You won’t share your bathroom with other people in the house. I have 2 permanent tenants and they have their own bedrooms and bathrooms.

We actually gets water from our own well in the backyard. That’s why the water (mainly hot water) is a bit pale color. It’s due to the iron in the well water. We have a water treatment filter installed in the basement to reduce the iron in the water. There is nothing wrong with the water except for the discoloration.
description.neighborhood:
W & OD trail on Ivandale Road just after the overpass bridge. 

Crooked Run Orchard, which is a small family owned farm is 5 minutes away. The Barns,  at Hamilton Station Vineyards is a family owned and operated winery housed on a refurbished dairy farm.

Guests can park on the drive way which has ample parking space. Park and Ride lot is only 3 miles away and the buses go to Washington DC  as well as to the nearest metro station (Silver Line Metrorail - Ashburn metro station)
Nearest town, Purcellville is only 2 miles and Leesburg is around 10 miles away from our house.

The sun came out the next morning, and we loved the goats and mini-horses, also the tropical plants in the atrium of the house.  instructions were clear and easy to follow. The historic house is beautiful and the farm and it's on is peaceful.  The room was nicely decorated with ample space. description.summary: Welcome to the Scientist's Suite! With modern heating and air conditioning, vintage full bath, and an original drain-board sink with kitchenette appliances, the Suite is comfortable and efficient.  This was the bedroom of Roscoe Bartlett, PhD, a former researcher and medical school professor.

name: Battlefield Cottage-A secluded escape to Country
title: Berryville, Virginia

gallery.caption: Summer view of vegetables from the fire pit area.

hosts.about:
The most important thing in my life is family - 
my wife Annie, my kids and grandkids. After that comes this farm. This farm holds so many fond memories and life experiences for generations of Cassidys. I love being outside, whether it's outdoor recreation, raising cattle, or working in the vegetable garden. There is nothing better than taking home-grown food out of the garden and whipping up an amazing meal for family and friends.  Yes, I do love to cook!  

It may sound like I never leave the farm, but my wife and I love to travel whether its halibut fishing in Alaska, horse-back trips in Montana, sitting on the beach in Grand Cayman, or taking the grandkids to Disney World.

I have spent a lifetime growing things, and  connecting with nature. One of my great joys is to share some of that knowlege and experience with other folks.

recent.comments: A very nice/quite place with a beautiful view of the Blue Ridge in Virginia wine country, the hosts were great, and I had a wonderful time visting the area! An all 5-Star rating - Enjoy!

items.comments: A very nice/quite place with a beautiful view of the Blue Ridge in Virginia wine country, the hosts were great, and I had a wonderful time visting the area! An all 5-Star rating - Enjoy!
great clean place and very peaceful.  host is nice and responsive

Mike was a terrific host, and this home is located in an amazing place. My husband and I were here from August-April and loved it. Mike was super accommodating with everything, we couldn’t of been more appreciative!

This stay is exactly as described. Peaceful location with excellent host. Mike was very quick to respond when we had a couple of minor Internet issues and he had some great recommendations for the area.
Just spent 2 months here for a new job.  Mike is great and the property is very private.  Just what I needed to escape the craziness of a new job!!

The Battlefield Cottage is a great place to enjoy nature and a quiet retreat from a busy world. Mike was always responsive to any need right away. I appreciated  that he took the time to tell about the history on and surrounding his property. I hope to return again!
Great place to stay, I was here as a travel nurse and enjoyed it so much,  peaceful and quiet. I’ll definitely be back just to visit!!

description.summary: Quaint country apartment on 110 acre vegetable and cattle farm, in the heart of Northern Virginia wine country. Imagine, stepping out your door, picking fresh veges and cooking your own Farm to Table Meal. Secluded with fantastic views of the Blue Ridge mountains. Big discounts for longer stays.
description.space: Lovely 1200 square foot 1 bedroom apartment above a three car detatched garage. Has a private locked entrance. Quiet and secluded, a great place to escape and relax. Lawn chairs and a fire pit for somores, or just gazing at the incredible night sky. Close to some great wineries and craft breweries.
description.access: You will have the whole apartment and surrounding grounds to yourself. There is a fire ring near apartment so feel free to sit around a fire and roast marshmallows or enjoy a glass of wine. Or just sit outside and gaze at the stars!
description.notes: The unit comes with strong wi-fi but does not have a tv. Watch the wildlife, and enjoy nature.
description.neighborhood: The apartment is located in an idyllic setting with beautiful views all around us.  We are close to great biking, hiking, rafting, tubing, fishing, outdoor festivals and concerts, antique shops, vineyards, local microbreweries, historic civil war sites, pick-your-own fruit and vegetable farms and much, much more. We are approximately a 50-minute drive to Shenandoah National Park, Skyline Drive, and Luray Caverns and about a 20-minute drive to the scenic and historic Harper's Ferry. Don't be surprised to see lots of wildlife like deer, wild turkey, eagles, herons, and many other species of birds.
description.transit: You will pass sections of the beautiful Shenandoah river to get in and out of our property. Our farm is accessed via two miles of gravel road so please don't think you have taken a wrong turn when the road becomes gravel.  It is an excellent road and driveway and is accessible for any type of car.  Plenty of parking.
description.interaction: Need us, we are close by; don't need us, you may not even see us.  We are friendly and like sharing information about the local area but we are not pesky (i.e., intrusive).
