description.summary:
The listing is for a room in a restored pre civil war farmhouse on Crickenwood Farm.  Guest rooms are in the main farmhouse and share the common areas of the kitchen, library, living room and great room.  Vaccination for Covid19 is required.

This is a small working farm with cows and horses.  There is plenty of parking. There are several friendly dogs on the property.  The farm is about an hour from Baltimore, MD, Washington, DC, Harpers Ferry, WV and Gettysburg, PA.  Frederick, MD is 20 mins.
description.space:
Victorian Room: Bedroom with Full size bed with memory foam mattress overlooking the driveway in the historic part of the farmhouse.  Has an electric fireplace and room darkening drapes.  This room is about 30' from the two shared bathrooms. Accommodates two. A cot can be added. 

Each room has a folder with brochures, maps and instructions for using the wireless internet. Each room has a microwave, small refrigerator and a safe. TV streaming services and movies can be viewed in the Kitchen, Library or indoor theater in the Great Room.
description.access:
Guests are welcome to share the Indoor theater in the Great Room, the library, kitchen, wrap around porches and patio.  Guests are expected to clean up after themselves in the common areas. 

To use RV parking make requests in advance. We only have one 30 amp outlet. 

For guests to entertain friends in the common areas, especially the kitchen or BBQ, please ask permission in advance so there are no conflicts. 

The laundry is available for guest use with the condition you are considerate of others using the washer/dryer and don't handle their laundry in a manner you wouldn't want someone else to handle yours. Also there is a clothesline off the side porch. 

The pool is a stock tank pool and just for cooling off and relaxing. It's only 2' deep and 12' across.  We open it up when we can and close it when we decide it's too cool.
description.notes: Please no people with bad allergies or afraid of friendly dogs.
description.neighborhood:
This is a historic working farm in a transitional suburban area with cows, horses and a stocked pond.  The location is peaceful.  We are about an hour from Washington, DC, Baltimore, MD  Antietam, MD, and Gettysburg, PA.   Harper's Ferry, WV is about 45 minutes away.  

The Maryland historic towns of Frederick, New Market and Mt. Airy are a few miles from us respectively  West and East on the Old National Pike. 

For more sophisticated dining and shopping Frederick, MD is about 20 minutes to the historic downtown.  Frederick is home to the Civil War Medical Museum, the Monocacy Battlefield and the famous "Clustered spires" of downtown Frederick.  

For current local events go to the Frederick County Tourism website.  Substitute "." for the space in the following:  visitfrederick org.  This should take you to links for local parks, historical locations, breweries, wineries, shopping, art galleries, and entertainment.
description.transit: There is no public  transportation.  The nearest DC Metro stop is 20 miles in Shady Grove, MD.
description.interaction: Hosts are present at the initial night of the guest's stay and usually during the entire stay.  We tend to leave guests to themselves unless they request us to do otherwise.  Most people have told us they are coming to the country for some peace and quiet and to get away from it all.  We respect their opportunity to do that.
description.house_rules:
CHECK IN
We only accept guests that are fully vaccinated and boosted for Covid-19. Check in is noon to 8 PM. If you will be later please let us know so we can make special arrangements.  It is difficult for strangers to find us in the dark in the country.  Each room has a safe in the closet.  Ask a host for the the combination. If you need a desk we have portable laptop tables in each room and if you need more space there are areas in the common rooms that can be made available.  There should be a folder in your room with information for guests on amenities in the area and maps. Please sign into the guest book with your name, date of stay, an email or snail mail address and phone number found at the mail box on the coffee -tea sideboard.  We can then contact you if items are left behind.  We cannot get this information  from AirBnB if you leave something behind. Please let us know if you will be expecting mail delivery.  

OTHER
Streaming TV is available from the TV in the kitchen, library and indoor theater in the Great Room.  Directions for the indoor theater operation are provided upon request.  Please request assistance from your host if you wish a wood-burning fire. You will be responsible for supervising it while it is lit. If you can't find something you need or something is broken or not working please let us know. If we don't know it's broke we can't fix it. We only accept dogs certified under Title III of the ADA as Service Animals. 
 
SMOKING
Smoking is permitted outside on the covered porches or under the commercial high velocity hood in the kitchen in bad weather.  There is no smoking in guest rooms or common areas of the house.

SAFETY
You are responsible for your safety and the safety of any children or animals in your care. Children must be supervised at all times by an adult.  Farms are dangerous.  There are barns, farm animals, streams and a deep pond.  Wandering in the fields and fishing in the pond is permitted at your own risk.  Fishing is catch and release.  If you are afraid of animals or allergic to them please don't come here.

FOOD
Coffee and tea are available in the upstairs hallway on the credenza near the mailboxes.  Continental Breakfast is provided as self serve in the kitchen.  Label any foods you store in the refrigerator in the kitchen for your personal use with your name.  You are welcome to cook in the kitchen if you clean up after yourself.  Feel free to use the condiments, staples, herbs and spices found in the kitchen if you cook unless they are marked by a guest for their use only.

DEPARTURE
Check out is at 10 AM.  Make sure we have contact information for you in case you leave anything.  Upon leaving please strip the bed of sheets and with your used towels, place the used linens outside of the door of your room or in the laundry room.  Leave decorative shams, quilts and coverlets in place.  Return the keys to a hook on the mailbox or a fee will be charged to change the locks of $100.

VIOLATIONS
The hosts, at their discretion, are not required to provide any warning or second chance for violations of any policy. The GUEST agrees to indemnify, hold harmless, and defend Patrick & Norma Staley and Crickenwood Farm, their agents and employees from any and all liability, claims, losses, costs, expenses and damages whether direct or indirect (including reasonable attorney fees) arising out of or relating to any claim for personal injury or property damage caused by themselves, their children or animals.

recent.comments: very convenient location to the place I was working so it made coming and going fairly easy. remove the renovation being done this week it would have been perfect but I was forewarned they were having work done so I gladly accepted the circumstances. I'd recommend the place to anyone working or visiting the area.

items.comments: very convenient location to the place I was working so it made coming and going fairly easy. remove the renovation being done this week it would have been perfect but I was forewarned they were having work done so I gladly accepted the circumstances. I'd recommend the place to anyone working or visiting the area.
I loved staying at Norma and Patrick’s.    They were friendly, the surroundings were beautiful and most of all I felt comfortable.  And loved the dogs!  I left feeling so destressed from city life.
I stayed here last year and liked it so much I came back this year. I always feel right at home. The amenities and attention to detail are perfect. I'll definitely be back.
Norma and Patrick were lovely hosts, and their dogs were sweet as could be.  Their property is lovely; I wish I'd had better weather and more time to enjoy it.
Norma and Patrick were very good hosts during my stay on their house. They were very flexible, and I  felt secure in their place. A very nice place to relax, unwin and recharge.

I absolutely loved my stay with Norma and Patrick! The farmhouse has a peaceful and serene atmosphere. The house has beautifully decorated interiors, and the room was exactly as described. I had an amazing view. The dogs are very friendly, and I loved interacting with the farm animals, especially the horses. 

Norma and Patrick went above and beyond as hosts. They were very friendly, considerate and accommodating while giving me the space I needed as a guest. The were flexible and understanding when I had to change my move in time last minute. Patrick expanded on farm life with clear interest, and patiently engaged with my many questions about the animals and the general area. Norma very graciously offered me a warm jacket on a particularly windy day, as I was walking outside to sit by the pond. 

I am definitely returning to stay here. Norma and Patrick--thank you for making me feel at home during my stay!
Great place to stay while traveling for work. Great amenities and quiet location is perfect for getting a good nights sleep. Washer and dryer are very nice and their kitchen is amazing.

description.summary:
The listing is for a room in a restored pre civil war farmhouse on Crickenwood Farm.  Guest rooms are in the main farmhouse and share the common areas of the kitchen, library, living room and great room. 

This is a small working farm with cows and horses.  There is plenty of parking. There are several friendly dogs on the property.  The farm is about an hour from Baltimore, MD, Washington, DC, Harpers Ferry, WV and Gettysburg, PA.  Frederick, MD is 20 mins.
description.space:
Quilt Room: Bedroom with antique full size bed in the historic part of the house that overlooks the bank barn with room darkening drapes and electric fireplace. It's adjacent to the two shared baths. Accommodates two.

Each room has a folder with brochures, maps and instructions for using the wireless internet. Each room has a microwave, small refrigerator and a safe. TV streaming services and movies can be viewed in the Kitchen, Library or indoor theater in the Great Room.  There are a couple of workspaces in the shared rooms. 

We are 35 miles to either Baltimore or Washington DC.  North are Gettysburg, PA, Antietam, MD, and Frederick, MD.  The farm is a couple of miles from New Market, MD.   See the website for Frederick tourism for "what-to-see-and-do"  and links to local parks, historical locations, breweries, wineries, shopping, art galleries, and entertainment. There is no public transportation.
description.access:
Guests are welcome to share the Indoor theater in the Great Room, the library, kitchen, wrap around porches and patio. There are a couple of workspaces in the shared rooms. Guests are expected to clean up after themselves in the common areas. 

To use RV parking make requests in advance. We only have one 30 amp outlet. 

For guests to entertain friends in the common areas, especially the kitchen or BBQ, please ask permission in advance so there are no conflicts. 

The laundry is available for guest use with the condition you are considerate of others using the washer/dryer and don't handle their laundry in a manner you wouldn't want someone else to handle yours. Also there is a clothesline off the side porch. 

The pool is a stock tank pool and just for cooling off and relaxing. It's only 2' deep and 12' across.  We open it up when we can and close it when we decide it's too cool.
description.notes: Please no people with bad allergies or afraid of friendly dogs.
description.neighborhood:
This is a historic working farm in a transitional suburban area with cows, horses and a stocked pond.  The location is peaceful.  We are about an hour from Washington, DC, Baltimore, MD  Antietam, MD, and Gettysburg, PA.   Harper's Ferry, WV is about 45 minutes away.  

The Maryland historic towns of Frederick, New Market and Mt. Airy are a few miles from us respectively  West and East on the Old National Pike. 

For more sophisticated dining and shopping Frederick, MD is about 20 minutes to the historic downtown.  Frederick is home to the Civil War Medical Museum, the Monocacy Battlefield and the famous "Clustered spires" of downtown Frederick.  

For current local events go to the Frederick County Tourism website.  Substitute "." for the space in the following:  visitfrederick org.  This should take you to links for local parks, historical locations, breweries, wineries, shopping, art galleries, and entertainment.
description.transit: There is no public  transportation.  The nearest DC Metro stop is 20 miles in Shady Grove, MD. Uber is available.
description.interaction: Hosts are present at the initial night of the guest's stay and usually during the entire stay.  We tend to leave guests to themselves unless they request us to do otherwise.  Most people have told us they are coming to the country for some peace and quiet and to get away from it all.  We respect their opportunity to do that.
description.house_rules:
CHECK IN
We only accept guests that are vaccinated for Covid-19. Check in is usually noon to 8 PM. If you will be later please let us know so we can make special arrangements.  It is difficult for strangers to find us in the dark in the country.  Each room has a safe in the closet.  Ask a host for the the combination. If you need a desk we have portable laptop tables in each room. If you want something more substantial there are desk areas in the common rooms that can be made available.  There should be a folder in your room with information for guests on amenities in the area and maps. Please sign into the guest book with your name, date of stay, an email or snail mail address and phone number found at the mail box on the coffee -tea sideboard.  We can then contact you if items are left behind.  We cannot get this information  from AirBnB if you leave something behind. Please let us know if you will be expecting mail delivery.  

OTHER
Streaming TV is available from the TV in the kitchen, library and indoor theater in the Great Room.  Directions for the indoor theater operation are provided upon request.  Please request assistance from your host if you wish a wood-burning fire. You will be responsible for supervising it while it is lit. If you can't find something you need or something is broken or not working please let us know. If we don't know it's broken we can't fix it. We only accept dogs certified under Title III of the ADA as Service Animals. 
 
SMOKING
Smoking is permitted outside on the covered porches or under the commercial high velocity hood in the kitchen in bad weather.  There is no smoking in guest rooms or common areas of the house.

SAFETY
You are responsible for your safety and the safety of any children or animals in your care. Children must be supervised at all times by an adult.  Farms are dangerous.  There are barns, farm animals, streams and a deep pond.  Wandering in the fields and fishing in the pond is permitted at your own risk.  Fishing is catch and release.  If you are afraid of animals or allergic to them please don't come here.

FOOD
Coffee and tea are available in the upstairs hallway on the credenza near the mailboxes and in the kitchen.  Continental Breakfast is provided as self serve in the kitchen.  Label any foods you store in the refrigerator in the kitchen for your personal use with your name.  You are welcome to cook in the kitchen if you clean up after yourself.  Feel free to use the condiments, staples, herbs and spices found in the kitchen if you cook unless they are marked by another guest for their use only.

DEPARTURE
Check out is at 10 AM.  Make sure we have contact information for you in case you leave anything.  Upon leaving please strip the bed of sheets and with your used towels, place the used linens outside of the door of your room or in the laundry room.  Leave decorative shams, quilts and coverlets in place.  Return the keys to a hook on the mailbox or a fee will be charged to change the locks of $100.

VIOLATIONS
The hosts, at their discretion, are not required to provide any warning or second chance for violations of any policy. The GUEST agrees to indemnify, hold harmless, and defend Patrick & Norma Staley and Crickenwood Farm, their agents and employees from any and all liability, claims, losses, costs, expenses and damages whether direct or indirect (including reasonable attorney fees) arising out of or relating to any claim for personal injury or property damage caused by themselves, their children or animals.

name: Zion Springs in Loudoun - Monroe Suite
title: Hamilton, Virginia

hosts.about: I love to live life to the fullest and I experience that by sharing life with others. I have a wonderful family, dear friends, am blessed to visit with new guests each week, and teach the neatest bunch of young people violin and piano. I love to travel to Europe every few years if possible, camp, read a new Jan Karon book, or teach my friends how to make a new basket. You will see around our home that gardening is one of my favorite things to do!

recent.comments: Such a beautiful location, lots of greenery and outdoor space to explore. The room was very clean and comfortable. Everything looked new. It was very nice to have access to the Green Room and the snacks and drinks provided. It looks like it is a beautiful venue for events, too. We hope we can go back another time for a longer stay!

items.comments: Such a beautiful location, lots of greenery and outdoor space to explore. The room was very clean and comfortable. Everything looked new. It was very nice to have access to the Green Room and the snacks and drinks provided. It looks like it is a beautiful venue for events, too. We hope we can go back another time for a longer stay!

I can not say enough positive about my experience with Zion.  First communication was amazing, even with our craziness coming up for a short stay,  location was absolutely beautiful, room was fantastic, I felt like I was in a cabin and truly enjoyed this aspect of the room.  We did not partake in the breakfast, but it was available and sounded amazing.  I will without a doubt stay here again when we return.  As a former resident of the area, I had no idea this existed and it is definitely a gem. Again I can not say enough positive.
Great. Pretty. Comfortable. Convenient. And super nice folks

What a beautiful place to stay in Hamilton! The Monroe suite was perfect for 2 people and the Green Room was well supplied with snacks and drinks. Chris was very friendly and accommodating, and the room was equipped with everything we needed. We cant wait to book another stay at Zion Springs!
Very clean and simple accommodations, beautiful property with easy check-in.

description.summary: You'll enjoy your time at this cheerful rural getaway. The Monroe Suite offers a generous sitting room with a futon sleeper sofa, a separate bedroom with queen size bed and adjoining bathroom. Adirondack rockers on the patio allow you to relax and rock away the quiet country evening or the Green Room is just steps away. A common area, the Green Room has comfortable seating, a 72" TV, Keurig coffee bar, microwave and small refrigerator. A continental breakfast is available here during your stay.

name: Seaton Place House
title: Delaplane, Virginia

recent.comments:
Our Go-To Place! We love spending time in the Middleburg area and are so fortunate to have discovered this lovely cottage. The property is secluded but provides  easy access to to the charming nearby towns of Middleburg and Marshall.  

Set on a 60 acre farm, its the perfect place to get away from it all. Its a joy to visit the owner’s goats, horses and sheep. Great walkability on the farm itself and on nearby country roads. 

Randy and Catherine are friendly and accessible.  We adore them!

items.comments:
Our Go-To Place! We love spending time in the Middleburg area and are so fortunate to have discovered this lovely cottage. The property is secluded but provides  easy access to to the charming nearby towns of Middleburg and Marshall.  

Set on a 60 acre farm, its the perfect place to get away from it all. Its a joy to visit the owner’s goats, horses and sheep. Great walkability on the farm itself and on nearby country roads. 

Randy and Catherine are friendly and accessible.  We adore them!
Another great stay!
Loved it so much that we extended our stay!

OUR HOME AWAY FROM HOME!

This is our third stay at Seaton Place Cottage and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The farm is one of Loudon County’s secret jewels. The grounds are beautifully maintained as is the three-bedroom cottage. The horses, goats, sheep and chickens add to the charm of this quiet and relaxing property. 

Randy and Catherine are gracious and welcoming. Truly lovely people. ❤️

We look forward to our next visit!
The cottage was better than we could have ever imagined.

Super host! Beautiful spacious cottage just inside the private gates of a  beautiful very quiet farm property. Scenic views and all the amenities! Excellent communication from Randy in regards to any and all information  or possible questions or possible needs. Highly recommended and super friendly very private! We so enjoyed our stay!
Thank you!

Our family had a wonderful time at the farm with the animals and the beautiful surroundings.  Randall and Catherine were fantastic hosts that provided great local recommendations and showed us around their fantastic farm.  We would recommend this home for anyone looking to get away to the peaceful hunt country.

description.summary: Located on the 60 acre Seaton Place Farm, circa 1840, this 2019 renovated 3 bedroom and 2 bath cottage is one of a kind.  Sophisticated, but cozy. Charming, but informal.  It is for those who are captivated by nature yet close to hunt and horse country, vineyards and the antique shops of Middleburg.  The property boasts a stocked pond, abundant wildlife and three artificial golf greens for par 3 golf.  Enjoy taking long walks down Carr Lane past the adjacent 2000 acres of protected pastureland.
description.space: The guest house has a fully equipped kitchen and  an outdoor fire pit equipped with a grill.  It uses wood or charcoal.  Serve your outdoor meals on a quaint wooden picnic table.  Take advantage of the property by strolling down to the pond and casting a line.  Use of the par 3 golf course is limited and is at an additional charge.  Please feel free to bring your dogs for an additional $75 per stay.  No cats.  Dog rules include a) limit of 2,  b) dogs to be walked on a leash, c) no barking at the cows or wildlife, and 4) pets are not permitted on the beds or furniture.  An extra pet cleaning fee of $150 will be assessed if there is evidence of pets on the furniture or beds. For more information on Seaton Place Farm reviews and a glimpse of farm life, follow us on social media @seatonplacefarm on instagrm.
description.access: Guest access the property through a security gate. Codes will be supplied upon acceptance of the reservation.
description.notes:
We have a six stall horse barn with a wash stall and turnout paddocks. For equestrians this facility is available at an additional rental fee. Feel free to inquire with the host. 

There is no smoking in the Guest house and parties are prohibited. If there is evidence of smoking indoors a $250 cleaning fee in addition to the normal per stay one will be assessed.
description.neighborhood: Delaplane is in the center of an extraordinary selection of award winning vineyards and wine tasting venues.  It is also 5 minutes from Upperville where you will find the Hunters Head Tavern, a quaint pub, and the Blue Water Kitchen, an epicurean oasis for fine food and wine. Upperville hosts the oldest horse show in the nation which is attended by top equestrians from around the United States and Europe.  The property is a 20 minute drive to Middleburg where you will find a bucolic town bustling with restaurants, apparel shops, houses of worship, and fine antique stores.
description.interaction: Guests have complete privacy and have keyless entry to the guest house. The owners live on the farm in the manor house and are available to answer any questions about your stay or suggest interesting destinations nearby. For more information on Seaton Place Farm reviews and a glimpse of farm life, follow us on social media @seatonplacefarm on instagrm.
description.house_rules:
No cats
Check-out by 11:00 AM

name: Retreat to horse country!
title: Middleburg, Virginia

recent.comments: Very cozy and spacious  one bedroom , two baths , well decorated . Two friendly golden retrievers always greeting us upon arrival . Amazing atmosphere . I really recommend this place .

items.comments: Very cozy and spacious  one bedroom , two baths , well decorated . Two friendly golden retrievers always greeting us upon arrival . Amazing atmosphere . I really recommend this place .
Triffany was a great host with a beautiful and well appointed basement apartment.  Access is via a separate entrance which made for easy and private use.  Hope we have the opportunity to stay again.

All I can say is WOW! Be prepared for a  presidential suite luxury hotel vibe. If you are a clean freak like myself that is the very first thing that stood out. This property is pristine. Just immaculately clean and well kept. There was so much care put into the beautiful decor and lovely personal touches like the oil painting of the owners beautiful golden retrievers whom you will no doubt meet during your stay. The house was stocked with essentials, toiletries, snacks. etc. We enjoyed the gas fireplace while hanging out in the living area. The bed was like a cloud with the softest sheets! Tiffany has done an excellent job. She was communicating the entire time ensuring that we had everything we needed. We met her dad, Bob who greeted us.  He was so friendly and gave us a great restaurant recommendation. Overall 10 out 10 and we would not only book again but will recommend to others coming to the area.
Lovely place and Tiffany and her father were very helpful. Felt at home and enjoyed the area including downtown Middleburg!

We had a terrific stay at Tiffany’s place! It was super cute—exactly as photographed—and quite large and comfortable (best bed ever!). She was very responsive to a handful of questions we had and check-in/out was seamless. Our baby loved meeting Spotify, the farm’s pony!

A couple notes for anyone looking to stay: dogs on property will definitely greet you (very friendly, but in case of allergies), no curtains in the bedroom as it’s English-basement style (important if you’re light-sensitive), HVAC controls are outside the unit (Tiffany very helpful in getting adjusted).
Awesome location , just minutes from Downtown Middleburg.  The accommodations are first-rate, it felt like home.

Beautiful, tastefully furnished apartment, wonderful host - leverything about our stay was exceptional. I’ve never been in a basement apartment that was so comfortable, with so much natural light pouring in! Tiffany’s 3 sweet dogs chilling out around the property were very friendly and great companions for our dog. If you’re looking for a quiet place to completely relax and unwind in quintessential horse country,  close to great restaurants and lovely little towns, I highly recommend Tiffany’s place.

description.summary: Enjoy your visit all while staying in a private country setting complete with a swimming pool, gardens creating a resort like feel. This beautiful family farm includes an English style apartment with large windows, gas fireplace, 1.5 bathrooms, 1 large bedroom with king size bed, plenty of room for an extra sleeping space. Open concept living space. Access to the pool a large, outdoor seating and dinning. Minutes to vineyards, Salamander, Goodstone and Upperville. 2 stalls and paddock available

name: Springs Store Cottage walk to creeks edge  winery
title: Lovettsville, Virginia

hosts.about: Reagan and I started Waterford Reservations in 2017 most of the properties we built or renovated ourselves,the majority of the materials used to make our homes is reclaimed or made on My sawmill. Make sure to check out all the listings especially my favorite the DonRea Villa and plan to enjoy all the areas best winery’s, brewery’s, and reastraunts and hiking the area has to offer

recent.comments: The cottage was unique and historic while also being very clean and comfortable.  It was a terrific launch spot to explore the beautiful country roads and towns in Loudon County, say good morning to the cows, and visit some of the wineries and breweries in the area.  Hosts were very easy to communicate with and helped with recommendations to make our trip enjoyable.

items.comments: The cottage was unique and historic while also being very clean and comfortable.  It was a terrific launch spot to explore the beautiful country roads and towns in Loudon County, say good morning to the cows, and visit some of the wineries and breweries in the area.  Hosts were very easy to communicate with and helped with recommendations to make our trip enjoyable.
Great experience
Fantastic stay! Can’t recommend enough!

The cottage was beautiful and exactly what we expected. It was a fun trip back to my hometown where I grew up. Reagan and Donnie were so responsive, helpful and kind. Getting in the house was so easy and they were accommodating to our last minute addition (the dog). We would definitely rent from them again.
Quiet and peaceful. Perfect location for us.
Had a great time! Very quiet and peaceful stay.

This was a perfect little cottage for a get-away! It was quaint, super clean, and only a short drive to Harper's Ferry, where we wanted to hike. It was also close to several local wineries and breweries. 
The hosts were very accommodating:)

description.summary: Perfectly restored historic Springs Store Cottage is a perfect location for a  couples get-a-way.  Within walking distance to a popular local winery, and close drive to several breweries and  farm-to-table restaurants, hiking trails and cool shops this private house, with detailed custom wood-work, king size bed and cozy interior, is sure to impress. So whether you are visiting for a wedding, exploring wine country or in need of a quiet setting, we invite you to enjoy!
description.space: Enjoy our beautiful cottage while exploring some of the areas best wineries, breweries, restaurants and hiking within only 5-15 minutes from cottage.   While at the cottage we recommend relaxing on the sofa, taking a stroll up Furnace Mountain Road or down to Creeks Edge Winery,  sitting at the beautiful outdoor fire pit, drinking coffee watching the country road from the front porch, relaxing and reading a book in outdoor hammock.
description.access: along with the house  the entire property to yours The property is a small corner parcel at the edge of a tiny village next to the woods.
description.notes:
On a well, well is new! if you’re staying for more than several weeks you will need to notify us if pressure drops, easy for us to change the water filter to keep the pressure up:) Near the woods, there are animals, bugs, and prone to  brown marmorated stink bug in the early fall season.
Internet, Electricity, Tv, Road Conditions, Snow, Ice ect cannot be guaranteed if there is a problem with the provider. The reservation must match the amount of guest at any time. Pets must be on reservation as well 

This rental is managed by Waterford Reservations LLC, when booking this property all guest acknowledge that any and all disputes, settlements ect will soley be made with Waterford Reservations LLC, Air BNB and no others for any reason.

Please note the staircase is very narrow and steep leading to bedroom and the water at cottage has a sulfury smell due to natural mountain minerals
description.neighborhood: Lovettsville which has several great restraunts and a great coffee house.
description.transit: Short drive down rural roads to everything you will need
description.interaction: We like to make guests stay as private as possible,  when needed please reach out to us we are always available through the app during your stay!
description.house_rules: Please Read the house manual located on the desk before contacting the host. Upon departure rinse all dishes, Put all trash in the cans located outside. bedding will be washed by the host. Additional Guest not authorized by the host will result in immediate removal of everyone with no refund. Additional fees for not following the house manual are determined soley by the host in the resolution center.

name: Blue Mountain Log Cabin
title: Linden, Virginia

gallery.caption: Open deck for relaxing and grilling.
Two levels of porches for relaxing
Lower front porch (have added lighting since picture was taken)
Space for dinner outside and a fire
Master bedroom with queen size bed
Loft bedroom with king size bed
Relaxing walks on the private road
View from front of house. Large yard with woodland backdrop.
View at Fox Meadow winery (minutes from the cabin)
Photo taken from back deck. So much wildlife to experience!

hosts.about: Rebekah and I were looking to buy our first home when we found this cabin. With an adventurous spirit and the hope of creating wonderful memories, we took a chance and went all in. This place has been such a blessing to us - the peaceful walks down to the creek,  the amazing neighbors, the stunning wildlife, splitting wood in the summer, cozy fires in the winter, ahhh... We have put so much work and love into the cabin over the years - we restored the logs, renovated the kitchen and loft, and much more.  We hope you too will have the opportunity to create your own memories and enjoy the peace and quiet away from all the noise! Let us know if you have any questions!

recent.comments: Kevin and Rebekah’s cabin was beautiful and cozy, and the surrounding forest could not be more peaceful! It was an ideal spot for a quick getaway. Kevin was easy to communicate with and extremely accommodating! I only wish we could have stayed a little longer- Linden’s gorgeous wineries and views is unbeatable!

items.comments: Kevin and Rebekah’s cabin was beautiful and cozy, and the surrounding forest could not be more peaceful! It was an ideal spot for a quick getaway. Kevin was easy to communicate with and extremely accommodating! I only wish we could have stayed a little longer- Linden’s gorgeous wineries and views is unbeatable!
Kevin and Rebekah were great hosts! The place was amazing and the nature all around was beautiful. I had a great time spending my weekend there. Very beautiful house I hope I get to see once again.
The pictures didn’t do justice to the amazing house. The house was clean, warm, private and secluded - just what we were looking for.  We hope to stay there again next year.

Kevin & Rebekah were amazing hosts and very responsive. Their cabin was absolutely adorable, and the decor was perfect. Short walk to the Appalachian Trail. Beautiful scenery. We will be back!!!! Loved our stay. Comfortable and homey.

Beautiful spot in the middle of the Virginia mountains. 
Perfect location to explore the northern parts of Shenandoah and nearby towns.
Very spacious and welcoming cabin

We loved our stay at the cabin. We felt right at home. I loved how responsive our hosts were and available for comment. Their place was clean, beautiful and the pictures don’t do it justice. We would definitely come again. I recommended to everyone that wants a confortable, luxurious place to stay in the mountains.
We had a great stay in this adorable house! With the charm of of an older house and very clean and comfy! The area was also beautiful with fun little wineries around to visit!

description.summary:
*A perfect escape, close to home! Perfect family getaway!* Endearing log cabin, perfect for anyone looking to getaway. Nestled on five, beautiful acres of land just minutes walk from the Appalachian Trail and creek; and just minutes drive from nearest winery.
Rustic, authentic, Appalachian style log cabin with vaulted ceilings, loft, pot belly wood stove, and three quaint bedrooms.
description.space:
Master (queen) bedroom has own bathroom with large claw foot tub and separate shower. Second bedroom (king) is a huge inviting loft with bright skylights and sliding barn door for privacy. Third bedroom (twin) is simple, but cozy. Kitchen has everything you need for your stay including pots, pans, utensils, coffee maker, toaster, and more. Back deck overlooks open acre of gently sloping land. 

You will want to see this place in every season: Spring brings stunning colors from Forsythia, Red Buds, wild Lillies, and the native mountain flower, Trillium. Experience the dense mountain fog and the nearby peaceful streams and creeks! Our cabin is surrounded by beautiful, enormous poplar trees full of character and shade to complement the cool mountain breeze. Summers on the mountain are an escape from the hot city and are noticeably cooler as you drive up the mountain. Find a hammock and let yourself relax. Winters offer unusual snowfall compared to the bottom of the mountain. In the winter you can watch the sunrise through the trees from the deck or just let the amber light shine through the cabin windows and make a warm cup of coffee, tea, or hot cocoa, bring your favorite book and get cozy next to the pot belly wood stove!
description.access: Entire cabin and 5+ acres of outdoor space.
description.notes: We have increased our cleaning regimen during these uncertain times. We are taking extra care to disinfect frequently touched surfaces between reservations in addition to thorough cleaning of all bedrooms, bathrooms, kitchen, and living spaces. Linens are washed in hot water.
description.neighborhood: Fox Meadow is conveniently only a few miles away and offers a stunning view from their open deck or tasting room. Chester Gap will exceed your expectations with a great selection of wine, cozy tasting room, friendly atmosphere, and unparalleled view of the gap in Front Royal. Front Royal Brewery offers great food, live music, and of course, great beer inspired by the local community flavor. Stop on your way up the mountain at The Giving Tree and pick up some last minute items; fresh bread, wine, local produce, milk and eggs. Locals rave about The Apple House. Visit Shenandoah National Park, less than a half hour away. Explore the nearby caverns or Shenandoah River by kayak, just 20 minutes away. Take in the views from Skyline Drive within a beautiful 30 minute drive from the property. There is so much more to see and do. Book with us and come see what this charming area has to offer!
description.transit: A vehicle is a must. We are located on top of Blue Mountain in a quiet, secluded, community tucked away in the woods. Road conditions can vary depending on the weather. We recommend bringing all groceries that you will need/want for your stay, as the nearest store is a 20 minute drive from the cabin and once you arrive,  you just won't want to leave!  We believe that this is one of the many appeals to this lovely destination; peace and quiet. Enjoy!
description.interaction: We are available by phone, text, or email and if needed can be accessible in person most times.
description.house_rules: Absolutely no pets on the furniture or beds!

name: The Lodge Room at Mt. Mama Meadows Homestead
title: Harpers Ferry, West Virginia

gallery.caption: Our homestead sign from the road.
We have 2 airbnb's on the property.  The other also accommodates 2 adults and is not pet friendly.
Front view of the Lodge Room.
Front of the entire house. The Lodge room is the addition on the left.
Front of the entire house with snow.
The Lodge room is the addition to the left.  Our other Airbnb is the space above the garage (far right, back).
The Lodge room is the addition on the left.
Front porch corner.  Lodge room is on the far end.  Front yard/orchard in progress.
Your zero contact check- in door.
Private front porch with rockers and table.
TV powered by Netflix and Hulu.
Comfy queen sized bed. Nightstand lamps are wireless charger equipped.
Complimentary wine bar for guests over 21. Dresser if you'd like to unpack and stay a while!

Well appointed kitchenette.  Single burner induction cooktop, 4 qt crock pot, convection oven/airfryer, Keurig with coffee pods, microwave, 10 cu. ft. fridge/freezer combo, 6 qt Insta pot, and cooking blender.
Keurig with complimentary coffee. 10 cu ft. fridge/ freezer combo.  Microwave and convection oven/air fryer that will hold a Digiorno pizza
Well appointed kitchenette. Plates, cups, bowls, storage containers, strainer, knives,  utensils,  oil, salt & pepper, dishwashing detergent, paper towels, and drying mat
Utensils and roasting sticks for the firepit.
Inside of fridge. Real freezer on top.
6 qt Instant Pot (cookbook included) with steamer basket insert, Instant cooking blender, and grill tools located in the cabinet.

2.3 cu. ft. LG compact all in one front load washer and dryer combo.  Throw it in before you head out for the days adventures and it will be done when you get back! Seventh Generation free & clear detergent provided.

recent.comments: Wonderful stay! Beautiful, well-equipped space. Loved the surroundings! Would love to stay here again.

items.comments: Wonderful stay! Beautiful, well-equipped space. Loved the surroundings! Would love to stay here again.
Absolutely fabulous home on the most beautiful, well kept farm! Clean, peaceful, and lots of adorable animals to play with (the kitties were especially fun). Can’t wait to visit again!

This place is perfect. Beautiful homestead with lots of animals. We were provided complimentary wine, fresh eggs, and ground coffee. You get treats for all the animals and are allowed to visit and feed them. Two cute cats hung out with us on the porch which we used to grill out and eat while watching the sun set. 

Short drive to things to do in harpers ferry and around. 

We will 100% be returning.

Can’t say enough good things about this stay! The farm is beautiful and feeding the animals treats is a blast. Marla has included so many thoughtful touches in an already amazing space. The stay is comfortable, private, and has everything you need. Plus it’s very close to Harper’s Ferry and Shepherdstown. By far our favorite place we’ve stayed.
We had yet another wonderful, peaceful stay at Marla’s place. It was just what we needed for the weekend to relax and unwind. We plan on returning whenever we need a getaway!

We had an amazing time at Marla and Tim's Airbnb! The accommodations were very comfortable and had everything we needed for a good stay. The hosts are very friendly, responsive, and generous (we got to enjoy some wine and fresh eggs from their farm). It was also great meeting all the farm animals!

I will be thinking about this vacation for a long time!Marla's homestead is beautiful, peaceful, and so fun. I loved waking up every morning and going out to greet all the animals. I became fast friends with the cats (Willow and Freya) and absolutely fell in love with them!

Marla was such a sweetheart. She was so easy to communicate with. She had great recommendations in a guidebook in the suite, too!

I loved our room. It stayed cool with the extra window AC unit despite the summer heat, and we had literally everything we needed over the course of our stay right there. The grill outside was awesome to have, and the instant pot saved us!

Everything was clean and the whole space made us feel at home instantly. There was so much to do in the area and we had such a wonderful time. We're already planning our trip back in the fall!

description.summary: This listing is adults only.  Mt. Mama Meadows Homestead is our own slice of “almost Heaven”. We're located in Harpers Ferry, a small historic town in Jefferson County, West Virginia, in the lower Shenandoah Valley. Whether you are coming to check out the surrounding Blue Ridge Mountains, hike the Appalachian Trail, raft the Potomac or Shenandoah rivers, delve into the rich Civil War history of the area, or just relax on the homestead, there is no shortage of things to do.
description.space:
This listing is adults only. NO GUEST ANIMALS PERMITTED. This is a working homestead and biosecurity is a great concern. 

Think studio apartment located on a real homestead!   There is high speed wifi to accommodate remote working or school. When you arrive, there is 1 dedicated, paved parking spot.  Don't worry if bringing 2 vehicles, there is plenty of room, it's just not paved.

The space is 1 large, lodge style, studio apartment room with a private bathroom.  It's attached to our main house and separated by a single, dead bolted door internally.  The entrance is private and equipped with a keyless entry. We have white noise machines on both sides of the single door that attaches us. 

It is furnished with a café style, 2-seater table, small couch, dresser, and 2 nightstands - each with a wireless charging equipped lamp.  There is a well appointed kitchenette and outdoor propane grill.  The complimentary wine bar is best enjoyed while spending the evening under the stars, relaxing on your private deck, or around your private, real wood fire pit. Retire for the night to the comfy, queen size bed. There is a complimentary coffee and tea bar, stocked with  locally roasted coffee. In the morning, enjoy a cuppa while watching the animals roam the fields from your private deck or look out over the front yard while rocking on your private front porch.   

You may walk around the homestead and interact with many of the animals at your leisure.  Please use caution! All fenced in areas contain electric fencing and it is always HOT. Treats for all of the animals are provided in labeled containers in your room.  Please do not feed the  animals any treats outside of the ones provided because they have very specific diets. 

This is a working homestead. While we try to stay quiet, sometimes nature has other plans. Also, we mostly free range our chickens and rooster (weather permitting) so be mindful of their location.  Our roos job is to protect his flock and he does it well.

Our homestead is ever growing and changing as we have only owned it since October 31, 2019. 

Be mindful that we are located in the country and have UV treated well water.  Please be conservative with your water use.  While we have installed a brand new pump and extra large pressure tank, the main house and 2 airbnb's each have their own hot water tanks and water pressure may vary from time to time as the whole homestead runs off a single well that can only pump so many gallons per minute.  Pressure is adequate but if super high pressure showers is something you require, you may want to book elsewhere.

Please note that aside from the Lodge Room and our main home, we also have a 2nd Airbnb on the homestead, the "Homestead Hideaway" .  There is plenty of room on our 13.6 acre homestead and outside areas are situated to be very private.

Not responsible for power loss.

While we do our best to keep them away in conjunction with our local pest control company, we can not control nature, and the home is older so we do experience seasonal bugs like everyone else.

Our homestead is ever growing and changing as we have only owned it since October 31, 2019.  

We can not guarantee what animals will or won't be here at the time of your visit.
description.notes: This listing is adults only (18+). NO GUEST ANIMALS PERMITTED. This is a working homestead and biosecurity is a great concern.
description.neighborhood:
Our place is close to Historic Harpers Ferry National Park, Shepherdstown, and Antietam. With wineries galore, the Shenandoah and Potomac rivers, the Appalachian Trail system, Hollywood casino, art and culture, restaurants and dining all within a short drive, there is never a shortage of things to do.

You may hear and see animals of all types, both domestic & wild. Deer are everywhere so be careful when driving. We have a fair amount of birds including lots of songbirds, owls, hawks and even resident bald eagles. We are off the main road just a bit so the side roads do get a little dicey in the winter.  Please check local weather before traveling.
description.transit: A car is required. Public transportation is non-existent in this area.  Uber and Lyft do come out here but it takes forever.  Great restaurants are just 10 minutes away.  Bring your bicycles for riding on rural roads & the C&O Canal NHP towpath.  The only thing within walking distance is our little town market, Bakerton Market. You can walk or jog on the rural roads, just be careful to do so facing traffic.
description.interaction: The hosts live  in the main house, which is separated by a dead bolted door internally. The Airbnb unit has a separate entrance with keyless entry opening out to the front yard and parking. The hosts work full-time but are available for any needed repairs, local knowledge/suggestions, or assistance in making your stay more comfortable.
description.house_rules:
*This listing is only for adults (18+). 

*No guest animals.  This is a working homestead and biosecurity is a great concern.


House Tips

*If you have any issues during your stay, please contact us using the Airbnb app. We do not have cell service at work.

*Quiet hours are 11 PM to 6 AM Sun.-Thur.;12 Midnight-6 AM Fri. & Sat.

*Regardless of how sweet and convincing they are, the cats are not permitted in the rooms.

*No smoking or vaping in the dwelling.  If you are using candles or incense ceremoniously, do not leave them unattended while burning. 

*Registered guests only; no parties or events.

*No shoes in the dwelling. Please place on tray by front door.

*Please turn off all inside lights when not in the dwelling.

*The television is sourced by wi-fi. Amazon Prime and Netflix are available for your viewing pleasure. 

*The lodge room front porch and side deck is your private space.  

*The provided propane grill may be used on the deck. DO NOT move it from its current location. BBQ tools are in the kitchen. DO NOT LEAVE IT UNATTENDED WHILE IN USE!

*Wood and firestarter for the fire pit are located on your front porch. All flames must be extinguished when done (use the water pitcher from the kitchen to do so). DO NOT LEAVE IT UNATTENDED WHILE IN USE!

*We have well water and a septic system.  Do not flush tampons or condoms.

* The tap water is potable. Be mindful that we are in the country and have UV treated well water. Please be conservative with your water use. While we have installed a brand-new pump and extra-large pressure tank, the main house and 2 Airbnb’s each have their own hot water tanks and water pressure may vary from time to time as the whole farm runs off a single well that can only pump so many gallons per minute. 

*The wine is ONLY for guests 21 and over and is complimentary. Please drink responsibly.

Homestead Tips

*You may walk around the homestead and interact with the animals at your leisure and at your own risk. Areas you are not permitted are posted with DO NOT ENTER signs.

*BEWARE that we do have a free-range rooster-his job is to protect his girls and he does.

* MAKE SURE TO LEAVE ALL GATES EXACTLY AS YOU FOUND THEM. If open, leave open; closed, leave closed.

*DO NOT chase or try to pick up any animals-wild or domestic. 

*CAUTION! All fenced in areas contain electric perimeter fencing and it is always HOT. The animals will not come close to it.  It is best to go in the fields with them.

*Treats for all the animals are provided in labeled containers in your room. 

*Please do not feed the animals any treats outside of the ones provided because they have very specific diets. 

Check Out

*Check out time is 11am firm.

*All dishes and kitchen items must be cleaned, dried, and put away.

*If you moved items during your stay, return them to their original spot.

*No need to strip beds.

*Leave used towels/washcloths in the shower.

*Please gather trash in the rooms and place in trash cans-we will take it out.

Set in a very rural countryside location perfectly timed between DC, Baltimore, Frederick and Annapolis...all the places the family wished to visit while staying. We looked forward to relaxing in the tranquil Damascus setting after each day of sightseeing and travel. Looking forward to staying again when we return in the future!!
Best host ever, kind and helpful. The house, the place, and location are the best.

A true home away from home.  The cottage had everything we needed.  Five stars all the way around.  The only aspect that could be improved is the wireless network, as for some reason it would unpredictably lose connectivity.  Because the wireless network was unreliable, a personal hotspot was used through a cellular connection.  Overall very pleased with the cottage and will stay there again whenever possible.

This was a perfect Airbnb experience. The "cottage" is a beautiful three-bedroom, 2.5 bath attached unit, in the same style and details as the main house. It has high ceilings, excellent light, and lovely views. The  experience is fully private.  Even though the host's family lives in the main house, we were completely unaware of any of their living activities.

Olivia provided detailed directions and check-in instructions, and when we arrived there was additional information about the house itself.  She was also flexible about rescheduling part of our trip shortly after we had booked it.

I would recommend this house to anyone.  It would make a fantastic romantic getaway, but it was also great for our family group.  While the property feels very remote, the nearest town is about a 7 minute drive.

It’s hard to imagine such a pastoral view. 
Rolling hills, horses grazing and amazing sunsets. Olivia made it very easy  for check in and communication. Every thing was as stated on the website. I would highly recommend staying here when visiting MD or just for a quiet peaceful get away.

The setting was gorgeous! Such a peaceful retreat. The house was bigger than we expected, high ceilings and spacious rooms that were tastefully decorated. The kitchen was stocked with everything we needed in order to cook our meals, the beds were comfortable, and everything was in pristine condition. Olivia and her family were sweet, friendly, and helpful. The large yard was perfect for my kids to run off some energy, and we all enjoyed petting the beautiful horses. 10 stars out of 5.

description.summary: Large, sparkling-clean, light-filled cottage with peaceful views of grazing horses, swaying pastures and mountains all around.  Oversized dine-in kitchen and gathering room allow for reconnection.  Clean linens, comfortable beds and quiet, allow for great rest. Unwind, reconnect and recharge in this magical place minutes away from the hustle and bustle of Damascus and 45 minutes from downtown DC.
description.space:
This cottage is perfect for a couple or family that wants a complete retreat, two couples that want to share a private weekend, or two families that want rooming options for adults and kids with lots of outdoor space to run and play.

The cottage is a completely separate dwelling that is connected via one LOCKED inside doorway to the main house.  The cottage has its own entrance, front porch, back patio, but it does share the driveway, parking and the 27 acres of barn and pasture with the main house.

MAIN FLOOR:
-The cottage has its own entrance with a private front porch.  The front door opens to a large living room full of windows overlooking the pastures and mountains from all directions.  
-The large open eat-in kitchen is fully appointed with all the cooking utensils you need and plenty of space to make your next amazing meal.  The farm dining table seats up to 8 people.  
-Adjacent to the kitchen is the TV room, with a large 40inch internet-connected TV and cozy nook whose double glass doors open up to a dining deck.  
-The Master Bedroom is down the hall with its luxurious en suite bath and four poster queen pillow-top bed.
- A half bath and full laundry room round out the main floor.

SECOND FLOOR:
-Up a flight of stairs are the remaining two bedrooms and full bath.
-The first bedroom has a full four poster bed, antique dresser and closet.
-The second bedroom has twin bunk beds, full bed with a twin trundle, dresser and closet.
description.access: Guests have parking access on the property and can freely walk around the property - visiting the horses and barn as long as they take caution to remain on the other side of the fence from the horses and not open any gates.
description.notes: The family in the main house has three kids.  While the cottage is completely apart from the main house, you may see the kids outside or hear them playing.  Please note that for the comfort and allergy needs of all our guests we do not allow pets.
description.neighborhood:
This is farm country!  We are surrounded by soy and corn fields and friendly warm working people, where trucks outnumber cars.

The beauty of this place is that while you feel so removed and remote, in a few minutes drive you can get to two grocery stores (Weiss and Safeway), Starbucks, restaurants, fast food, not to mention 20-minutes to Frederick, Sugar Loaf Mountain, Comus, Mount Airy, breweries, cideries, orchards and pick-your-own farms galore!
description.interaction: Hi.  I live next door so I am available for any needs you may have during your stay but will not interfere with your stay unless requested. Need a different size pan?  Ran out of salt? Need an extra pillow? Need help with the thermostat?  Not a problem!
description.house_rules:
- No parties allowed on premises. 
- Prior permission required to park more than 3 cars on property.
- We kindly request that shoes be taken off while inside the house.

items.comments: The house was absolutely amazing!!!! Perfect for our girls weekend!!!! Kristiane was sweet & easy to work with!
Beautiful farm and great outdoor living. Everything was a breeze. Would stay again!

Kristiane was so easy to work with and the property was absolutely stunning. My in-laws and I had a great time around the pool and enjoying Middleburg nearby. Would definitely recommend the property to anyone!

Kristiane’s house was beautiful and super clean. She was the best host. Kristiane was waiting for us at the check-in which was very personable. Kristiane gave us the personal tour and we really appreciated her kindness. We will certainly do this again! Thank you!

From start to finish our stay at Kristiane's home  was impeccable.  

Not only the house and its surroundings are beyond GORGEOUS.  Her immediate response, warmth and attention for every little detail made us feel at comfortable and at home.  

I highly recommend her place to anyone who is looking to have a true luxury experience and we can not wait to be back!

We booked this property to host a 1920s murder mystery dinner for my wife’s 50th birthday and I cannot imagine a better experience or location! Kristiane was extremely easy to work with, flexible, responsive, and accommodating. I cannot even begin to do justice for the property itself, it is simply amazing and breathtaking. My wife felt the setting and event was so perfect that I should not waste time trying to plan another birthday as I couldn’t possibly top this one.

Thank you Kristiane!
It was a longer term stay than typical. I couldn’t have ask for more. Exquisite.

description.summary: Forget your worries in this spacious and serene equestrian estate. Historic White Oaks Farm dates back to the 1800s and offers a glimpse into the famed Middleburg mystique, where the Kennedy’s spent their weekends riding horses and foxhunting. Create your own memories in the resort-like setting, fully equipped with an outdoor kitchen, stunning pool, cabana, outdoor dining areas, hiking trails and lush gardens. Enjoy views out every window of grazing horses and majestic 100-year old oak trees.
description.space:
This historic horse farm is centrally located and is under 10 minutes to Goodstone Inn, the Salamander Resort and Spa and charming downtown Middleburg. The surrounding areas offer fine dining, wineries, breweries, antiquing, hiking, steeplechase racing, and exciting polo matches. This location, with it’s paved road and nearby connecting dirt roads, is a cyclist’s paradise. Now offering high-speed Starlink internet! 

Mountville Road is situated in an ideal corridor offering easy access to Middleburg and Leesburg and is only 35 min to Washington Dulles International Airport. You can hop on the Dulles Toll Road and be to Georgetown in under an hour. Yet, you are just minutes away from the charming towns that dot the countryside, including Unison, Bluemont, Airmont, Aldie, Upperville and beyond. 

The second you enter the gates of White Oaks, you feel transported back to a more peaceful and carefree time. As you approach the main home, you will pass the courtyard horse stables. The original stone house dates back to the 1800s and an addition created a large, modern and open kitchen with a formal dining room, formal living room, and spacious theater room with a large wine cellar.  

The kitchen opens up onto an outdoor covered patio with a large dining table and chairs overlooking the expansive gardens and stone walls. From there, you can enjoy access to the attached sun room, complete with ceiling fans, stone walls, and a comfortable lounging sectional. The sunroom’s doors open out to the back lawns and pool as well as into the formal indoor dining room, which boasts a wood-burning fireplace. 

The living room opens onto the back patio and offers views into the front and back gardens with towering oak trees. This Restoration Hardware room is equipped with a gas fireplace, setting a perfect tone for morning coffee or cozy evenings. 

The library has views of the horse paddocks and front gardens and faces the front walkways and front door and offers a small couch, desk, flatscreen TV, and wood-burning fireplace. 

Attached to the library is a large office and gym space offering a mudroom, a half bath and another side entrance door. There are two staircases leading upstairs, where you will find the spacious master suite with attached bath, a separate large Roman spa tub and shower, a lounge room, and the laundry room.

Upstairs there are also four guest bedrooms that share two fully renovated bathrooms between them. Two bedrooms offer stunning views of the pool and gardens, and the other two bedrooms offer sweeping views of the scenic front horse pastures and lawns.

You may have as much or as little interaction with the horses onsite as you would like. There are plenty of opportunities for horse petting and carrot-feeding.
description.access: Guests will have full access to estate, to include main house, pool, gardens, outdoor spaces, outdoor kitchen cabana, hiking trails.
description.notes: The property is a working horse farm and you should expect too see horses in the distance being exercised and turned in and out between the barn and the surrounding paddocks.
description.neighborhood: The gated estate is located on a beautiful and scenic country road offering easy access to downtown Middleburg, Purcellville, Aldie and Leesburg. It’s a mere 5 minutes to Goodstone Inn and 10 minutes to Salamander Resort and Spa.
description.transit: You will need a car to get around and there are limited Uber drivers in the area.
description.interaction: I’ll be staying offsite but nearby to help with any concerns.

recent.comments: This place is such a great experience.

items.comments: This place is such a great experience.
Great camp site with a view. The wine is awesome as well. I will be planning another trip soon.

Great host in Max.  Were able to get a wine tasting that was great.  Then he led us to a nice private camp site with flat spots, a picnic table and a fire ring.  He also went and got us wood and brought it back so we could have a fire.

Wine tasting upon arrival was my favorite. This place is so dog friendly my pups could contain themselves. We arrived right at 2pm so we were able to pick which campsite we wanted.
