name: Opequon Barndominium-River access-Farm animals
title: Martinsburg, West Virginia

recent.comments: We loved it. The farm animals gave us so much joy. Melinda and her husband are great people. If we visit my parents in Dec we plan to come back and stay again.

items.comments: We loved it. The farm animals gave us so much joy. Melinda and her husband are great people. If we visit my parents in Dec we plan to come back and stay again.

myself and two friends had a lovely weekend at Melinda's place!  she was very responsive and helpful.  we loved hanging with the goats at the beach!!  it's a really relaxing peaceful getaway and I highly recommend it!

We loved staying in the Barndominium. It is a nice amount of space and very cozy, with pine paneled walls, a well equipped kitchen, and a very comfortable bed. The vistas of field and farm were so nice - sitting on the patio one afternoon we saw a doe and her fawn leaping across the field in front of us. We walked down the mowed path to the creek (with all three goats following us) and enjoyed swimming in the creek and hanging out with the goats on the pebbled beach. Melinda was terrific whenever we had any questions, gave us tips on what to see in town, and also gave us maximum privacy, which was exactly what we wanted. Perhaps the best part of all (for my civil war buff husband) was the stellar location, which is within easy drives of Shepherdstown, Antietam, Harper's Ferry, and Winchester, all of which we visited. A great place to stay in the country!

An absolutely beautiful place to getaway. Melinda's home and property was peaceful, relaxing and exactly what I needed. The animals were all friendly and fun to watch roam. I can't say enough great things. If you need a break from the daily grind you need to spend a few nights here for some much needed r&r

Had a fantastic time, my first trip to West Virginia!  Ari, my daughter, loved the farm animals especially the goats.  She still can't stop talking about them days later.

Andrew
Excelente!

Had a great weekend! Spent some time at the creek, had a fire, and just got away for a weekend. The goats love getting pet which was great, and watching the horses and cows in the fields was very pleasant as well.

description.summary: Get away but stay within three miles from town at our quaint Barndominium that rests on a 60 acre working farm at a dead end road. Enjoy a short walk to the Opequon creek with swimming beach. Less than a mile to Route 9 Bike path.  Pet cows, horses,  and goats while you grill, sit by the fire pit, and enjoy a beautiful sunset on the 1500 sq foot patio.  Sleeps up to 4 adults with a Queen Bed and confy queen size sleeper sofa.  Let Country Roads take you home to this WV Gem in  Berkeley Co, WV.
description.space: One main room with kitchen, dining, and sofa with queen sleeper.   One Bathroom with shower and laundry.  One bedroom with Queen bed.  Approximately 500 square feet. The Bardominium is  private and Owners live on the property in a separate dwelling. Fire pit available for use, with firewood  for purchase. Please let me know in advance. Property is on well/septic. Water from the tap tastes great and is safe to drink. Please only flush TP.
description.access: Private yoga available.  Contact host for availability.  Bring your bicycles, Kayaks and fishing gear (fishing license needed in WV). Barndominium is .75 miles from Rt. 9 Bike Trail Access and 100 yards from the Opequon Creek.  You can paddle upstream from this location so no shuttle is needed. No Internet/wifi or cable! However there is a DVD player with DVD's and screen mirroring on the TV. Fire wood available for purchase. Message Host. Cell phones also work well. Contact host for same day check-in.
description.notes: Will consider traveling professionals on a longer stay basis. There is no Wi-Fi/internet or cable; however, Cell phones work well.  There is also a DVD player with DVD's. Private yoga available. Please contact host for price and availability.  The TV will also mirror your cell phone. Who needs Wi-Fi when you have the Opequon Creek, a bike path, walking trails, fire pit, cows, goats, stars, sunsets, etc!
description.neighborhood: Feels secluded yet 10 minutes from three grocery stores and numerous restaurants.  Hanging out in and around the creek and walking the paths are a must!
description.transit: 4 Parking Spots.  Do not block Tractor Bay.  Gravel Driveway and Parking area.  May need 4WD if it snows.
description.interaction: Contact through airbnb, text, calls, or Facebook messenger Melinda Phares Sherman

name: Fox House at Fox Haven Organic Farm
title: Jefferson, Maryland

gallery.caption: Pretty yard with shade trees and places to picnic and play.
Dining area with sturdy antique oak chairs.
The den has a beautiful view of South Mountain. Cozy woodstove too.  Sofa bed.
Full kitchen with modern appliances and gorgeous view.
Bedroom w/twin beds and great view.
Bedroom w/twin beds.  All rooms have closets.
views as you walk the country road
take a stroll to ease your mind, or a take a run
View from the den - that's South Mountain range.
Front walk to house includes a ramp - door is wide enough for wheel chair
our Community Garden within walking distance
entrance to our community garden and learning center part of the farm
Winter brings its own beauty to the farm
4 twin beds in finished basement bedroom
Fall on Poffenberger Road is lovely.
third full bathroom in finished basement
View of South Mountain from deck
This is the entrance to our retreat and learning center/farm
Dairy Parlor - great place to do yoga if you want to hold a retreat

hosts.about: Fox Haven Organic Farm & Learning Center is my passion.  I am happiest when touring young and older folks around the farm, teaching about where our food comes from, healthy farming and gardening that leads to healthy soil, waterways, humans, and critters.  Forests are my playgrounds.  Our young adult children help and that is the best!  Frederick, MD is a favorite place on this planet to eat, walk, talk with shop owners and artists, and attend Quaker Meeting for Worship.  This precious part of Maryland is a wonderful place to visit and live.

recent.comments: We had a wonderful stay at Fox Haven farm. My coworkers and I stayed for a week while working on a project nearby and the surrounding land and trails woven through it were such a peaceful landing pad to come home to after a long day’s work. The Fox house has a homey, comfy feel and it was lovely to have a fire pit and grill to have summer evening cookouts. Would absolutely recommend visiting and staying here!

items.comments: We had a wonderful stay at Fox Haven farm. My coworkers and I stayed for a week while working on a project nearby and the surrounding land and trails woven through it were such a peaceful landing pad to come home to after a long day’s work. The Fox house has a homey, comfy feel and it was lovely to have a fire pit and grill to have summer evening cookouts. Would absolutely recommend visiting and staying here!

We had a wonderful time. The house allowed us to sit together at meals and while relaxing indoors or outside. We were able to visit HarpersFerry, Frederick City, and New Market, as well as enjoy the peaceful woods around Fox House. We ate out a couple nights, cooked in several meals, had delicious ice cream at the Little Red Barn and Pizza delivered from Wings and Pizza Shack. The accommodations were very comfortable for our group of 8 ladies.
Our group had a wonderful time at Fox Haven.  Really amazing place.  We were able to walk around the property.  Saw our 1st fireflies of the season.  Comfortable, spacious house.  I hope to return.
Great stay, exactly what our group was looking for

Joanne was flexible in meeting the needs of our group. We were thrilled to be able to participate in the tea tasting offered at the farm. Many of our group members commented on the idyllic scenery and mentioned it was a nice short getaway that supported their goals for relaxation.

Just perfect for my small group women’s yoga retreat!! Very spacious - basement and deck were both large enough for the 6 of us to do yoga. Awesome that there are no tvs, so we could digitally detox easily. Very serene setting.
Wecome back here every year. we love this place.

description.summary: Lovely views of South Mountain and our farm from huge back deck. Perfect for overnight retreats, a family or friends getaway, or even day long business retreats. Country road, creek, bird songs, peace.  Appalachian Trail, Harper's Ferry, C&O bike bath, Catoctin Nature Center, Greenbrier Lake, Rivers, galleries, shops, antiques, and restaurants of Frederick, and more are within 15-20 minutes of the farm.
description.space: Location, location! Fox House sits at the head of a beautiful organic farm with woodlands, fields, and creeks.  Appalachian Trail, Harper's Ferry, Catoctin Nature Center, and the C&O canal towpath for biking are all within a 15 minute drive.  The small town of Jefferson offers some of the best homemade pastries around, and Hemps is a full service butcher shop selling only local meats.  The charming city of Frederick, with shops, galleries, antiques, and divine restaurants, free concerts on the green is also within a 15 minute drive.  Wineries, cideries, and distilleries are within a 10-30 minute drive. Rural, town, and rivers = perfect getaway.  We teach classes on a variety of topics related to gardening, conservation, wild food foraging, herbs for wellness, and more. You are welcome to register for one during your stay. We offer garden tours and tea tastings, nature walks and beekeeping 101 with a honey tasting to groups of at least 8.  This is dependent upon staff availability.  We have 2 other farm houses and a restored Dairy Parlor available for larger retreats.  Your stay supports farm programs that we offer children and adults from low income communities, people suffering with PTSD, and other life challenges.
description.access: The house is entirely yours to enjoy. There are trails on the farm and a beautiful gravel road where Catoctin and Lewis creeks flow where you can walk/bike. Strolls along the gravel road along the Catoctin creek, birding, and just relaxing away from electronic and work distractions are what folks enjoy most about Fox Haven Organic Farm.
description.notes: There is a ping pong table in the basement, some games, a fire ring, and a small outdoor sauna for your use.  Guests are welcome to join in any programs that are happening on the farm during your stay - wild food walks, garden talks, cooking classes, yoga, bird walks.  Once you book, you can go to our website and explore.  If you have a group of 8 or more and staff are available, we can craft an experience for you.
description.neighborhood: Beautiful and safe, with friendly neighbors.  The small town of Jefferson has a homemade pastry shop, Hemp's Meats butcher shop, Little Red Barn Cafe & Ice Cream, Watson's Chicken Carry-out, Jefferson Diner, Gas station, and small town grocer.  Frederick city has art galleries, antiques, restaurants, shops, a fun music scene, minor league baseball team, and beautiful parks.  Brunswick town has C&O towpath for walking and biking, the potomac river access for boating and fishing, and Beans in the Belfry for tasty food and fun music performances.  Plenty of wineries, distilleries, and cideries abound.
description.transit: There is no public transportation, but you can order cabs, Uber, or Lyft.  You can take the train to Frederick or Brunswick from Washington D.C. and then take a cab to the farm.
description.interaction: We are available when needed.
description.house_rules: If you'd like to have a party, we have a party space on the farm. If it is available, JoAnn will work with you on details. No smoking inside the house.  If you smoke outside of the house you must pick up the butts and throw them in the trash.  We are an organic farm practicing environmental stewardship. We have tasty filtered well water so we prefer that folks do not bring plastic water bottles to the house.  Noise levels must be low after 10:00 p.m. on weekends and 9:00 p.m. on weekdays.  Basically, we ask that people respect the land, the house and its contents, and the neighbors.

name: The Cottage at Tiny Hidden Ridge
title: Knoxville, Maryland

gallery.caption:
Road closed March 20 - Sept
Drive along a scenic detour, and walk 2 miles to visit historic Harpers Ferry.

Road closed March 20 - Sept
Drive along a scenic detour, and walk 2 miles to visit historic Harpers Ferry.

hosts.about: I am a freelance videographer and photographer. I love everything outdoors from skiing and hiking to camping and biking. I live on 5-acres with my Husband, Shawn. We are always planning our next adventure.

recent.comments: Great location for hiking to Harper's Ferry and Maryland Heights. The animals were adorable too!

items.comments: Great location for hiking to Harper's Ferry and Maryland Heights. The animals were adorable too!
We were so very happy here!!! Even better than in the photos--kitchenette well stocked and adorable decor. Will definitely return : )
A nice and quiet spot with a lot of privacy. Great for watching storms roll in . Would love to come back

I enjoyed this cottage very much. It was comfortable and so cute. It was just what I needed, to unplug and enjoy nature and simplicity for a bit. The goats, chickens and cats were fun. I’ll do this again.

We enjoyed this quirky cabin which had everything we needed for a quick overnight    
Appreciated that it was dog friendly.   
Thanks Tara

One of my favorite Airbnb's I've ever stayed at. Peaceful, quiet, easy access to hiking trails and Harper's Ferry and all it has to offer, and most importantly a completely delightful host. I'll definitely be going back, hopefully sooner rather than later.

We stayed at this cottage with our two dogs and it was absolutely amazing! I always worry about finding locations but the description for this one couldn’t have been better - the directions and pictures provided were up-to-date and easy to follow. There was more than a few times where we stepped outside and said “wow it’s so quiet out here and peaceful” it was shocking to find a place that seemed so off the grid, yet close to many attractions, restaurants, etc. This was our first time trying out Airbnb and we are definitely hooked now thanks to Tara and Shawn! Great place to stay and would definitely stay again! Thank you both!

description.summary:
This cozy cottage has a primitive glamping feel with no running water and minimal comforts. It’s not for everyone so read the description closely to make sure it fits your needs. With the comforts of ac, heat and electricity contrasted with the simple living of no running water, a camp stove for cooking, a hand pump camp shower, a composting toilet and no tv or internet makes this the perfect place to relax and unwind. 
We are two miles from Harpers Ferry and near the trail to Maryland Heights.
description.space:
The cottage is small, cozy and all yours to use during your stay. We have two other rentals on the property and each feels like it’s own private retreat.
There is no tv, internet, or running water to the cottage. There is a primitive camp shower, a camp stove, and a composting toilet.
description.access: Guests have access to the entire cottage. Some of the outdoor space is shared with other guests.
description.neighborhood:
UPDATE: Starting March 20th there is a road closure on Sandy Hook Road with a scenic detour. Plan on an extra 15 minutes to get here unless you’re coming in from the west (Hagerstown, Shepherdstown). On the upside it means there are no cars on the portion of the road between us and the C&O canal, making hiking to Harpers Ferry or biking to the C&O canal more enjoyable. This road is expected to be closed until Sept/Oct 2023

We are two miles from Harpers Ferry by way of the footbridge over the river. We are between mile post 61 and 62 on the c&o canal. Lots of hiking and biking opportunities. The closest town is Brunswick, MD about 15 minutes by car where you can shop for groceries, grab a bite to eat, or use the internet at the local library.
description.transit: You will need a car or bike to get around unless you love walking. Harpers Ferry train station is two miles away. Grocery stores and eateries are also two to seven miles away.
description.interaction: We are available if you need us, otherwise we give you your space.
description.house_rules: No smoking anywhere on the property

name: Hazgrov in Virginia Horse & Wine Country
title: Linden, Virginia

recent.comments: The most beautiful surroundings ever. Erin was a thoughtful, responsive host and has created a wonderfully relaxing and comfortable environment.

items.comments: The most beautiful surroundings ever. Erin was a thoughtful, responsive host and has created a wonderfully relaxing and comfortable environment.
I almost didn’t want to write a review because I’d love to gatekeep this place, but it’s just too good! Great and gorgeous location, perfect for hiking and wineries.
Beautiful location. It was a nice quite place with a wonderful host.

A wonderful getaway from the city! So very quiet, spacious, and charming. Close to great wineries, beach, Appalachian Trail, Shenandoah, and so much more. We would definitely come back! The host has great local recommendations and was very welcoming.
This place is in a beautiful peaceful location. I only wish that I could have stayed longer.
This place is spacious, clean and very quiet. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

We had a nice stay in Linden.  This Airbnb is rustic.  Has what you need but nothing glamorous or over the top.  We were just in town for a weekend and it was perfect for us.

Pros- literally right on an AT trailhead and a couple other trailheads as well.

Close to local wineries and centrally located to all the cute little towns we visited while we were there.

Cons-  You can hear the upstairs guests walk and talk.

description.summary: Beautiful southern home facing 4000 acre wildlife preserve. The Shenandoah National Park and Skyline Drive are 5 minute drive away. There are endless trails right outside the front door. Vineyards are open and the season is now Summer and perfect for hiking and camping. Eclectic dining in nearby Orlean, Flint Hill and Front Royal. A very remote and peaceful setting to get away and out to the countryside for a little while.
description.space: Home is a ranch style estate located approx 5 min driving distance from the entrance to Skyline Drive and Shenandoah National Park. Space is divided into two separate guest suites with separate entrances and lockbox entry. Only one suite is rented at a time. Vineyards include Naked Mountain Winery , Linden Vineyards , Fox Meadow Winery , Chateau O'Brien... We hope you come stay with us ! Extended stays are welcome.
description.access: Park on property
description.notes: Guests welcome to bring their dog and are able to operate out of this location for hunting / camping. Adjacent public parking has space for RV and/ trailer.
description.neighborhood: Hazgrov is located in the Blue Ridge Mountains
description.transit: The appalachian trail and hunting preserve is within walking distance of the house and horse trails are about a 5 minute drive. Property has direct Wifi
description.interaction: Owner is around to answer any questions or message me through airbnb

name: The Milkhouse on Horse Farm in Wine Country!
title: Bluemont, Virginia

gallery.caption: Red Gate Farm is a 230 acre horse farm.  Riding lessons are available during your stay!
washer / dryer in side entrance.  Front porch faces million dollar barn!
Adorable renovated milking parlor with amazing view of horses right from windows and porch!
2 person bar table and counter for eating.  Beautiful barn door to bathroom.
kitchen (also facing horse fields!) Kitchen has oven, full size refrigerator, microwave, coffeee maker, and sink.  Kitchen cookware and dinnerware included (including spices!).
flagstone floor and  barn doors add to the charm of the cottage.
private pool time can be arranged each day (up to 3 hours)
Pool on property is a just a short walk.
The milk house is located in the middle of the farm.  The barns and riding arenas can be seen in lower left corner of photo (front of cottage) , and horse fields to the right ( back of cottage).

hosts.about: My husband and I worked in corporate America for over 15 years until we decided to change our lifestyle.  We now run an equestrian business on our family farm in Virginia wine country.  In addition, we  own and operate 4 Airbnb properties, two cottages on our farm,  our vacation home at Lake Anna, and our vacation home near Park City, Utah.  We enjoy meeting people from all over and sharing our amazing properties with others.

recent.comments: There are not enough words to describe how beautiful and peaceful my stay was.  I was on a very stressful 2 week business trip.  "Coming home" to the MilkHouse at Red Gate Farm each evening was more relaxing and therapeutic than I could have imagined.  I will be back!

items.comments: There are not enough words to describe how beautiful and peaceful my stay was.  I was on a very stressful 2 week business trip.  "Coming home" to the MilkHouse at Red Gate Farm each evening was more relaxing and therapeutic than I could have imagined.  I will be back!

What a great spot for the area. Christine was very proactive in offering information about both the facilities and the local area. Hearing and seeing the horses throughout the day/night was very pleasant. Would go back!

The Milkhouse was amazing, quiet, and cozy.  It is surrounded by great wineries and restaurants. Blue Mont vineyard was our favorite and just so happened to be the closest. What a view

We used the pool on the property. Although it was not exclusive to the Milkhouse, it felt like it was. It's large, inviting, and absolutely sparkling. We played our music and had a few drinks, it was the highlight of our trip. 

10/10 I would recommend and return. This being our first trip to an Airbnb, our next trip will have tough time living up to the standard set by this property and host.

The milkhouse is a great studio located in a beautiful equestrian farm in Bluemont,Virginia. The back of the house has a lovely porch facing the pasture with beautiful and docile horses. The farm is located in a green and calm area, and even though it can be  busy with horseback riding lessons and equestrian competitions it did not interfere with a peaceful stay. Also the property has a great heated pool surrounded a beautiful garden that was perfect for this extreme hot weekend.
I am happy that I found a place to relax just 1 1/2 hours from Maryland with a perfect host. 
Also, on the same road you can find a vineyard and brewery next to each other, and good restaurants just 10 minutes away.

This cottage was exactly what I needed ~ privacy but on the most amazing working horse farm! Christine and her staff welcomed me and were so kind during my stay! I will definitely consider returning to the Red Gate Farm!

The Milk House at Red Gate Farm was relaxing and bucolic. If you're a horse lover, it's paradise with lots of horses to meet and greet. The setting is a cottage, high on a hill, with large pastures off the front porch and the barn/training arena further up the hill behind the house. There is lots of activity to observe on an active horse farm and training facility. The best part was relaxing on the porch,  watching the horses, birds and wildlife come and go against a backdrop of rolling green hills and blue skies. Definitely check ou the Country Store, they made grab and go sandwiches for a picnic!

We went here for our one year wedding anniversary for a weekend  getaway and did not want to leave! The place is a dream and surrounded by beautiful breweries and wineries, not to mention having horses and beautiful views out your back door.  Absolutely recommend and we will be back! Christine and the entire complex were amazing, super friendly, and very helpful.

description.summary: Fully renovated milking parlor on a 230 acre horse farm. Beautiful views of horses only a few yards away, mountains & winery.  Charming studio cottage with flagstone floors, modern conveniences, and porch overlooking horse pastures. Hiking on property and nearby.  Option to take riding lessons for additional cost. Less than a mile drive to Dirt Farm Brewery, Bluemont Winery, and Great Country Farms (kids!).  10+ wineries/breweries/cideries within 10 miles!  Private Pool time Up to 3 hours daily.
description.space: Efficiency renovated milking parlor with stunning views of horses from every window! Back porch is lovely. Flagstone floor and barn doors add to the charm of this adorable cottage. The farm is 230 acres; great for hiking up the big hill to see the view!  Private pool on the property can be booked for up to three hours per day. We have another Airbnb on the property, the Cottage, as well as ourselves that also book time in the pool.
description.access: You will need a car to stay here if you would like to go out to the wineries and breweries. All of our neighbors are a drive away! There are two parking spaces at the milk house.
description.notes: No parties or additional guests during your stay.  No pets.
description.neighborhood: The neighborhood consists of farms including wineries, breweries, other horse farms, vegetable/fruit  farms. We highly recommend bluemont winery, dirt Farm brewery, great country farms (which has fruit and vegetable picking, animals for the kids, miniature golf, bouncing pillow and more!), Bear Chase brewery, and the Bluemont country store. The store has great ice cream as well as candy and essentials. It’s like stepping back in time. We are also close to the Appalachian Trail. Bear’s Den is a favorite hike that Most people can complete. The view from the top overlooks the Blue Ridge Valley  and is absolutely stunning.
description.transit: You will need a car but all of the wineries, breweries, parks, have free accessible parking places.
description.interaction: I have a very good response time with Messages. I live on the property in the main house. I will provide you with any recommendations for wineries, breweries, kid friendly activities, and restaurants!

Entrance to Silo Bedroom and Silo Loft with separate bathroom and mini-kitchen

hosts.about: Hello, I love to travel and host via airbnb. I work in DC and co-own a small farm in Virginia that operates under sustainable and regenerative management practices.

recent.comments: This place is so unique! Pictures and descriptions match exactly, and there was plenty of space to spread out. The surrounding land is so peaceful and we would love to come back to visit again!

items.comments: This place is so unique! Pictures and descriptions match exactly, and there was plenty of space to spread out. The surrounding land is so peaceful and we would love to come back to visit again!

We had a beautiful stay at this house! Such a unique layout with pretty views all around. I loved the silo and the 2nd floor patio. 

Very easy check in and check out process. Thanks for the awesome stay!!!
Great stay, nice place.  Our toddler loved the cows.  The farm tour with Mike was the highlight of our stay!

We had a great time at Geoff, Erik, Pat, and Chas's home.  We found it to be as described, with plenty of sleeping space for our crew of six.  The kitchen and family room areas provided enough space for us to unwind and relax, and the bedrooms were spacious with comfortable beds and pillows.  The rural setting was peaceful, with beautiful views of the surrounding areas.

We did encounter one small issue while there, but the owners were VERY responsive and had our problem solved within 15 minutes.  We were very impressed but their quick reply to our messages (via the Airbnb app), and arrival on site to resolve the problem.  One of the best Airbnb experiences we've had in this regard!

Overall, an excellent stay at this home.  Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a rural setting and comfortable home.
Want peace and quiet in a very unique home but close to Walgreens and a quaint town ? This is it! Super clean and we relaxed within minutes of arriving.  Favorite bedroom was the silo !
We had a beautiful stay, everything was clean and easy to find. The kitchen was well-stocked and the bedrooms were perfect.

The place was quiet and pristine. We saw deers roaming around and cows are  behind the fence right beside the grass field. The sunset was gorgeous seen from the second floor deck. We had a great time staying here!

description.summary: This beautiful house is the culmination of eight friends’ vision for a more ecological, communal and artistic future. For three years, we worked with a leading firm in sustainable architecture to design and build this house. Set at the apex of a 33-acre Grassfed cattle farm, this 4 bedroom, 3 loft, 2.5 bath dwelling is ideal for family get-togethers and intimate reunions with old friends. Many Blue Ridge Mountain sunsets have been celebrated from the balcony.
description.space:
As the realization of a life project, we take great pride in this house and the surrounding lands, and will provide guides to the grounds, local produce from the farm (when available) and recommendations for activities unavailable to the casual traveler. Please check the Guidebook section of our Airbnb page for some initial suggestions of activities in the area.

House specifics: 
 
- 5 queen beds placed across 4 independent bedrooms (one en suite) and 3 lofts. 

- 1 full bathroom, 1 bathroom with a hybrid “ship-shower”, and 1 half bathroom in the silo, as well as an outdoor shower.

- The light-filled, state-of-the-art, open kitchen features a picture window overlooking the rolling Virginia hills, a gas stove, and modern appliances (refrigerator, microwave, etc.). The space just calls out to passionate cooks. In line with our focus on a small building footprint, the refrigerator and stove are modest.  We are happy to recommend the best farms in the area for local produce and a list of more traditional grocers in the area.

- Heating and cooling is conducted in individual units in each room, the most efficient available today. Each bedroom can be modified according to individual guest's comfort, but please keep all units on the same general mode (heat, A/C, or fan, etc). 

- In the "Great Room" upstairs, there is a functioning fireplace, ideal for cold nights.  

- The house does have WIFI, though it can be inconsistent. If you are planning to need streaming video or a solid connection to work remotely please let us know in advance and we can double check the internet status.  There is usually solid 4G/5G coverage, especially for Verizon and AT&T customers.  

- There is a record player and CD player (with Aux connection) for music.

- Pets are allowed, just give us a heads up if you would like to bring one as there are ticks and poison ivy in the pasture areas. We keep a section of the main pasture mowed as a yard, which should have less risk of ivy or ticks, and is a great spot for yard games (we have croquet and frisbees in the silo).

Please note, THIS IS A WORKING FARM, THERE MAY BE SOME BUGS AND DIRT. (And cell phones work fine but we do not have WiFi.) We clean the house after each guest visit and mow the yard every 2-3 weeks, but our primary goal is not to replicate a hotel experience. Our focus has been on designing a functional, creative, and inspiring space where we can also host artist residencies and sustainable agriculture operations.
description.access: Guests are able to access the entire home, though we may keep one room locked with personal belongings from time to time.
description.notes: Please note that a Virginia sales/occupancy tax of 5.3% will be added to the price.
description.neighborhood:
The farmhouse is part of a larger 33 acre farm purchased by the owners in 2013.  The farm includes a cabin with a pre-civil war leather shop that has been converted to an artist's studio. Be ready to explore the land considered some of the most beautiful in Virginia!  Adjacent to the famous Rapidan River and at the foot of historic Clark's Mountain, there are many fun outdoor activities to be found. Local wildlife includes deer, foxes, groundhogs, coyotes, and a once-spotted black bear. It's a great bird habitat for amateur ornithologists (with bald eagle, red-tail hawk, spotted owl, and blue heron sightings amongst others!). 13 acres of the property are in a conservation program to support native habitat and restore the Rapidan river (part of the Chesapeake Bay watershed). 

Getting there and around:
- The farm is 80 miles / 90 minute drive from DC and it's suburbs, 45 minutes from Charlottesville.  It’s 10 minutes from Orange and its quaint old town, replete with grocery stores, antique shops and local dining options.

- It's a perfect base to explore Virginia's unique historical heritage: Montpelier (20 minutes away), Monticello and UVA (45 minutes away), or central Virginia's best winemaker: Barboursville Vineyards (25 minutes away). There is also plenty opportunities to hike, bike and get moving outdoors. 

- Closest towns are Orange (10 min drive) and Culpeper (25 min drive) for grocery shopping and restaurants.
description.transit: The closest public transit option is the Culpeper Amtrak. Culpeper also has rental cars and the odd taxi, but your best bet is bringing your own vehicle. The gravel driveway can get a bit slick in snow or rain, so please exercise caution as needed.

There’s a nice front porch and back deck to sit on and enjoy the quiet. We had a great time. This house is close to all the attractions. Super easy to get everywhere. I recommend this house and if we ever go back to the area we all agreed we would rent this house again.

recent.comments: Don and Kathy were amazing hosts from the moment we arrived. They were both very helpful and friendly with the most gorgeous property to make your stay extra special! The horses were I N C R E D I B L E, there was a playground area our daughter absolutely loved, the rooms were very spacious, and there are so many family friendly activities to do all within a 20 minute drive! Thanks for a relaxing and fun stay Don & Kathy and keep up the great work!

description.summary:
PLEASE NOTE THIS ON THE 2ND FLOOR. 
The farmhouse has a  private wing that sleeps 4-6 depending if some are children. It includes 2 bedrooms and a large bathroom w/ separated door into the bathtub and toilet area.  

Nookside Stables operates a full-care horse boarding operation on the 47 acre property so there are 30+ horses to see and enjoy. Hersheypark, Sight & Sound Theater are all within 20 min. The Nook Sports complex & the Lancaster Junction rails-to-trails border our farm.
description.space: Our farm is back in a long lane. The parking and entrance is at the circle driveway. Park,l and come up the sidewalk and ring the doorbell at the main entrance. Don and/or Kathy (or sometimes her parents) will greet you at the door and take you up the large spiral staircase to your private Nookside Farmhouse Suite. Two very large bedrooms with vaulted ceilings & dormers and a private large 2 room bathroom. The coffee bar comes with mini-microwave, Keurig coffee maker and a mini-fridge.
description.access: Guests are welcome to explore the farm using the walking paths that lead to the horse pastures and we have easy access to the Lancaster Junction rails-to-trails. For those of you in for a tournament at the Nook Sports complex, guests have the option of avoiding the parking hassles and can walk the the 1/2 mile trail from our house to the site.
description.notes: PLEASE NOTE THIS ON THE 2ND FLOOR. It is a great view but you will have steps.
description.neighborhood: The charming town of Landisville is within walking distance with 2 quaint small-town restaurants, a pharmacy, a pizza shop, and 2 parks. And the rails-to-trails walking & biking trail starts at our farm. It is shaded & very well maintained. Or enjoy the beauty of the horses at Nookside Stables!
description.transit: Bring your bikes, walk, call Uber or drive your own vehicle to the local sites.
description.interaction: Interaction with guests can be as minimal as desired or as much as guests desire as long as it does not slow-down Farmer Don's farm chores and Kathy's office & household chores :-)

hosts.about:
Hello there!

We are Timmy & Chris! Welcome to our AirBnB Page! Thank you for stopping by! 

Points to Consider Before Booking with us:

First & Foremost, please be aware that We, your Hosts, are both fully vaccinated. In addition, we follow Airbnb's enhanced cleaning protocol, which was developed with expert guidance. Here are a few highlights:

*We sanitize high-touch surfaces, down to the doorknob.
*We use cleaners and disinfectants approved by global health agencies, and we wear protective gear to help prevent cross-contamination.
*We clean each room using extensive cleaning checklists.
*We provide extra cleaning supplies, so you can clean as you stay.
*We comply with local laws, including any additional safety or cleaning guidelines.
*In addition, we also leave the Unit empty for a minimum of 3 days between bookings to allow ample time for the unit to be cleaned and sanitized between bookings.  

We do have 4 Units listed on this site.  2 of these 4 Units are offline at this time to help maintain social distancing.  We only allow 1 Unit to be booked at any given time. Our current protocol for when 1 of the 2 Units are booked is to take the 2nd Unit offline.  If two units were to be booked consecutively, we will make adjustments accordingly in order to maintain the recommended social distancing guidelines.

Additionally...
*One Reservation per Rental Unit at a time.
*Rental Charge for Mom's Retreat & the Beach House Bungalow is by the Guest. Max 2 Guests.  
*Rental Charge for Peak View is by the Unit. Additional charges apply for 3rd Guest. Max 3 Guests.
*Rental Charge for Lake View is by the Unit. Max 2 Guests.
*Shared Bath is detached & a short walk from all Units.
Mom's Retreat-50 paces/30 sec walk.
Peak View-75 paces/30 sec walk.
Beach House Bungalow-150 paces/1 1/2 min walk.
Lake View Retreat-300 paces/3 min walk.
*Perfect place for Hikers, Bikers, or Skiiers.  
*If unsteady on your feet please note this property has uneven terrain, graveled walkways & stepping stone paths.
*No Smoking or Vaping. This is a Smoke Free Property.
*No Photography w/out pre-approval.  
*No Pets.
*No Weapons.
*No Hunting. 
*No Fishing.
*No Swimming.
*No Boating.

Chris & I hope you take a moment to check out our offerings & plan to stay with us at our beautiful property! Our serene and scenic surroundings will instantly bring you peace and an appreciation for "taking it easy!"

We take great pride in our surroundings, and do our best to enjoy it every day! Especially, with our Furbabies, Sophia Rose & Ashton Duval, our 4 year old brother & sister Yorkies Babies, & our good ole' boy, Zeke, our 12 year old Beagle!

Chris & I have an appreciation for beautiful places, like Key West & Palm Springs. Virginia is not exactly in a tropical locale, but we have done our best to bring the best of these two beautiful places here to Virginia, as you can see from our photos! 

We believe very highly in the official Key West Motto, "One Human Family"! So much so, that it is our adoptive Motto on life too! "All People Are Created Equal Members Of One Human Family". What's not to like about that?!  :)

We hope you will plan to stay with us for a spell, while you take in all of the beauty that is the Shenandoah Valley of Virginia! From Massanutten's Four Seasons Resort, to the gorgeous Blue Ridge Parkway/Skyline Drive! There is much for you to enjoy! You will also want to check-out places like The Luray Caverns, many local Wineries & Homes of Former Presidents, and all else in between! There is just so much to see, eat & do within minutes to an hour from our location!

Test this theory out, by checking us out! Remember, it only takes one click to check in, so get to it, won't you?!  :)  We hope to see you here soon!

Thank you for your time! Take Care & Travel Safe!
Timmy & Chris

recent.comments: This was my third visit here and it did not disappoint. Timmy & Chris' communication, cleanliness, and helpfulness were on point as usual. I was able to use Lakeview Retreat as a safe haven and base for our family adventures in McGayesville, Shenandoah, and Luray. Thank you so much!!!

description.summary:
Welcome to "Lake View Retreat", a Glamour Camping Experience great for Hikers, Bikers & Skiers!

Review our *SPECIAL NOTICES* below PRIOR to booking:

*(1) Reservation per cottage (2 Guests).
*Shared Bath is detached & approx 135 paces/1 min short walk from Lake View Retreat
*Property has uneven terrain & graveled walkways (Slow/steady walking)

*No Weapons/Hunting/Fishing
