description.space:
THE SPACE:

Lake View Retreat is currently blocked out, but it can be made available upon request. Just ask...

Points to Consider Before Booking with us:

First & Foremost, please be aware that We, your Hosts, are both fully vaccinated. In addition, we follow Airbnb's enhanced cleaning protocol, which was developed with expert guidance. Here are a few highlights:

We sanitize high-touch surfaces, down to the doorknob
We use cleaners and disinfectants approved by global health agencies, and we wear protective gear to help prevent cross-contamination
we clean each room using extensive cleaning checklists
we provide extra cleaning supplies, so you can clean as you stay
We comply with local laws, including any additional safety or cleaning guidelines

In addition, we also leave the Unit empty for a minimum of 3 days between bookings to allow ample time for the unit to be cleaned and sanitized between bookings.  

We do have 4 Units listed on this site.  2 of these 4 Units are offline at this time to help maintain social distancing.  We only allow 1 Unit to be booked at any given time. Our current protocol for when 1 of the 2 Units are booked is to take the 2nd Unit offline.  If two units were to be booked consecutively, we will make adjustments accordingly in order to maintain the recommended social distancing guidelines.

On another important note, we do understand, and we are familiar with, the AirBnB Guidelines, as they relate to Emotional Support Animals (ESA).

Unfortunately, with Guests being in a shared space, an ESA Animal would create a health and safety hazard, as we have 4 dogs on site that are not at all friendly with other animals. Although our pets are very much people friendly, they are super protective of their space when it comes to other animals. In addition, our Units are very small and not set up to handle animals, be they categorized as pets, or as (ESA) Emotional Support Animals.

Lastly, during the winter season when there is snow/ice on the roads, a 4x4, or an elevated AWD or FWD vehicle, such as a Subaru Outback or similar style vehicle, is strongly recommended to get in and out of our location. Feel free to ask about the road conditions before booking.

With that shared, we are just beginning to get into the Skiing Season, & Hiking Season is around the corner!  It's a great time to come stay a spell and check out local scenery, such as Massanutten Resort; the Appalachian Trail/ Blue Ridge Parkway; local wineries; area festivals, and so on. Please see our Guidebook for places to visit while in the area. Make some weekend getaway plans today, won't you?

By completing your booking, you agree to abide by and follow the House Rules, and are confirming you have  read the *EXPANDED SPECIAL NOTICES* below:

*One (1) Reservation per Cottage (2 Guests).
     -Maximum Guest Count for Peak View Cottage is (2) Adults (One (1)Double/Full Sized Bed).
     -Adjust the number of Guests in the drop down menu. (Knowing the number of Adult Guests for your Reservation allows us to plan accordingly for your stay.)

*Minimum 2-Night Stay is Required.

*Strict Cancellation Policy:
     -Full refund for cancellations made within 48 hours of booking, if the check-in date is at least 14 days away. 50% refund for cancellations made at least 7 days before check-in. No refunds for cancellations made within 7 days of check-in.

*Shared Bath is detached & approximately 135 paces/1 minute short walk from Lake View Retreat. This space is kept clean & sterilized, especially with the Coronavirus, & because it is cold & flu season in general.

*Our Property has uneven terrain & graveled walkways (Slow and steady balanced walking is needed on ALL paths or step stones.  Those with balance concerns, or whom are unstable on their feet will seriously need to traverse outside locations with extreme care and caution.  Straying off of established walkways is highly discouraged.)

*No Smoking/Vaping/Tobacco Products/Illegal Drugs (Inside or outside, or while within our property gates)  This includes NO use of Candles or Incense, or any other flame and/or smoke producing products that are to be used within this Cottage, or throughout the property.

*No Photography throughout our Property w/out prior approval (verbal approval is fine, please just ask us FIRST!) As this is a Private Property, we wish to maintain our spaces for the enjoyment of all, so please keep all pictures that are taken for your personal use only.  We do not authorize pictures taken for commercial publication or Social Media, without our written consent.

*No Pets (We DO have Dogs and Cats on-site, so please be aware - interactions will be minimal and kept to outside shared spaces only. Occasional barking may be experienced if we are offsite... Please contact us if the pets become an issue during your stay, and we will correct the situations immediately.)

*No Weapons, Hunting or Fishing.

*No Swimming or Boating.

*No Unauthorized Parties (Unless you are visiting for a pre-arranged Birthday Gathering, or a Wedding, or any other pre-scheduled similar social event).

*Keeping your safety and ours in mind, we have security cameras throughout the property monitoring exterior areas only.  This meets our insurance expectations, and ensures your's and our property is kept secure.

*MONDAY-FRIDAY CHECK-INS ARE AFTER 6PM (Unless other arrangements have been agreed to). We are able to be more flexible on Saturday & Sunday check-ins. Just ask and we will try to accommodate your request, within reason.

*Daily Rates for Peak View Cottage are as stated on the AirBnB Booking Page.

*Only the detached bathroom & common areas (BBQ, Firepit, Picnic Spots) are shared spaces.

*Our Property is not suitable for children under 12 due to water (Pond/Creek) throughout the property, and the need to walk slowly and carefully throughout our given graveled and landscaped walkways.  If children are included as your Guests, Adult(s) and/or Guardians MUST AGREE to accompany their Child Guests AT ALL TIMES while on the property!  Running & horseplay are prohibited. For example, if gravel is picked up and thrown about, resulting in property damage to structures or cars, (this becomes a serious issue with younger stayers), then their Guardians shall be held liable for the resulting damages incurred.

*ONLY GUESTS have approved access onto our property. Your reservation grant's you usage of your reserved Cottage and access to the shared bathroom space.  Any additional day Guests will require our prior approval- and in some instances, if repeated or excessive stays are expected, additional fees will apply.

*Keep Host Address Private! For Host Privacy & Security, as well as that of Future Guests, the sharing of Host's Physical Address with ANY outside party or entity is Strictly Prohibited.

We request Guests provide us with these three (3) notifications on the day of arrival to allow us, the Hosts, to plan for our day. 

*DAY OF ARRIVAL:
     -1st notice is when departing your location for our location. 
     -2nd notice is when you are 30 minutes from arriving. 
     -3rd & last notice is when you are 5 minutes from arriving.

*Upon receiving the last notice, we will ready ourselves to meet you in the parking lot. We'll show you your parking spot, give you a brief tour of the Cottage & shared detached bathroom, and highlight some House Rules. For additional information, please see the House Manual.

*Lake View Retreat is one of four Cottages we have available.

*The Cottages share a detached bathroom. This space is kept clean & sterilized, especially with the Coronavirus, & because it is cold & flu season in general. 


*Here are links to all four of them:
     -https://airbnb.com/h/peak-view-cottage 
     -https://airbnb.com/h/lake-view-retreat 
     -https://airbnb.com/h/beach-house-bungalow
     -https://airbnb.com/h/moms-retreat  

Thank You for your interest and your possible visit with us!
description.access:
GUEST ACCESS:

*You, as our Guest, will have access to your Cottage, the shared detached Bathroom, Parking Area, BBQ area, and views of the beach and pond areas from grey stoned walkways and picnic tables at the BBQ & Beach area. 

*Guests are not permitted to bring anyone onto our Private Property at any time, unless we have provided pre-authorization for you to do so.  Access to the Cottage & detached shared bathroom is strictly for paying Guests only. 

*Only one AirBnB reservation permitted per Cottage at any one time. (No one else can rent or share this Cottage until your reservation ends and you have concluded your stay with us.)
description.notes:
OTHER  THINGS TO NOTE:

*Check in and Check out should be done in person so we can share the details of your stay with us.

*We are located on a 1.2 mile graveled drive (5 MPH or slower to protect wildlife and children at play), and within 5 minutes of Route 33 and Resort Drive, between Elkton and Harrisonburg.

*Parking is within walking distance of your Cottage (50-100+ feet), depending on Cottage chosen.

*You should have your own means of transportation while visiting, or plan to use Lyft or Uber.

*Our Furnished Cottage(s) includes a Double/Full Sized Bed, Towels & Linens, a Space Heater, Air Conditioner, a Microwave Oven, a Refrigerator, a Vacuum Cleaner, Lighting, Clothing Rack w/Hangers, as well as Seating, Electric Use, High-Speed Wireless Internet is available throughout the property, 32" Roku capable TV with DVD/Blue Ray, TV Tray, Outdoor BBQ, detached shared Bathroom/Sink/Shower (located within a short walk from Lake View Retreat) & use of Electric, Water, Sewer, & Propane. Weekly safety checks will be carried out to ensure that all systems are operating at peak operating efficiency.

KEEPING SAFETY IN MIND:

*Single front side door, double deck door, windows all around, fire extinguisher, smoke detector, in addition to expectations of no flames or burning inside of the Cottage, (No Cooking aside from Microwave, No Cigarettes, No Candles, No Incense, and so on.), routine safety checks.

WHEN YOU ARE NOT HOME:

*Windows (and Blinds) and Exterior Doors should remain locked and closed.  Depending upon the season, Heat and/or AC should be set to keep the space moderately warm or cool.  Please also turn off all lighting and secondary appliances.  If you are away for most of the day, please be sure to empty interior garbage can into garbage can outside the front side door. Ensure refrigerator is tightly closed and food containers are secured.

WHEN YOU ARE HOME:

*Please keep all windows and doors closed to retain heat/cool & keep insects out of the Unit.  If using our furniture, such as the red folding chair or folding table outside on the deck, please return these items back to their original location each evening.  When using the outdoor grill and picnic table, please be sure to clean and wipe down after each use.

*There is a breaker box in Lake View Retreat.  Keep heat/AC on one circuit.  Other electrical can be shared on the other circuit.  This will ensure that your stay is comfortable without any heating and cooling concerns.

IRREGULAR ISSUES:

*Please be sure to report any irregular issues immediately so that these can be addressed as soon as possible. For example, if a storm rolls in, and excessive rain and wind is creating property damage, please text us! If you experience a loss of power in your Cottage, please contact us - no matter what time of day or night, it is so that we can get this resolved for you.

*We are in a very rural setting, where nature is at its finest.  Please enjoy the wildlife we have, and travel to and from the property safely.  Rabbits, birds, frogs, squirrels, deer, and all in between reside here.  The pond is stocked with Koi and Goldfish.  Please tread lightly throughout the property, and remember to pick up and tend to any items that you bring with you.  If you find any trash, please help us with maintaining the property. 

Thank You!
description.neighborhood:
THE NEIGHBORHOOD-OVERVIEW:

*Our Private Property is within 2-minutes of Massanutten Resort, and 20-minutes of the Blueridge Parkway.  We are graveled drive. Our Property is the last House on our Lane, with a main entrance that has Large White Vinyl Gates, which are typically left open when we have Guests. If Gates are closed, please contact us for assistance.
description.transit:
GETTING AROUND:

*You should have your own transportation, as there is no available public transportation where we are located, or plan to use Lyft or Uber.
description.interaction:
GUEST INTERACTION:

*We (Timmy and Chris) shall be available throughout your stay via Cell Phone Contact, and in person, on occasion.  Contact Information & Property Address will be shard with you upon completing your AirBnB Booking.
description.house_rules:
ADDITIONAL RULES:

*One (1) Reservation per Cottage (2 Guests). 
     -Maximum Guest Count for Lake View Retreat is (2) Adults (One (1) Double/Full Bed).
     -Adjust the number of Guests in the drop down menu. (Knowing the number of Adult Guests for your Reservation allows us to plan accordingly for your stay.)

*Minimum 2-Night Stay is Required.

*Strict Cancellation Policy:
     -Full refund for cancellations made within 48 hours of booking, if the check-in date is at least 14 days away. 50% refund for cancellations made at least 7 days before check-in. No refunds for cancellations made within 7 days of check-in

*Shared Bath is detached & approximately 135 paces/1 minute short walk from Lake View Retreat.

*Our Property has uneven terrain & graveled walkways (Slow and steady balanced walking is needed on ALL paths or step stones.  Those with balance concerns, or whom are unstable on their feet will seriously need to traverse outside locations with extreme care and caution.  Straying off of established walkways is highly discouraged.)

*No Smoking/Vaping/Tobacco Products/Illegal Drugs (Inside or outside, or while within our property gates)  This includes NO use of Candles or Incense, or any other flame and/or smoke producing products that are to be used within this Cottage, or throughout the property.

*NO DIGITAL PICTURES and/or VIDEO and/or any other photographic and/or audio recordings of our property or buildings is/are to be taken or put onto the internet without our SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE and/or PERMISSION to do so (verbal approval is fine, please just ask us FIRST!)  Virginia has strict laws regarding published internet content and responsible behavior: 

"If any person, with the intent to coerce, intimidate, or harass any person, shall use a computer or computer network to communicate obscene, vulgar, profane, lewd, lascivious, or indecent language, or make any suggestion or proposal of an obscene nature, or threaten any illegal or immoral act, he shall be guilty of a Class 1 misdemeanor."

*As this is a Private Property, we wish to maintain our spaces for the enjoyment of all, so please keep all pictures that are taken for your personal use only.  We do not authorize pictures taken for commercial publication or Social Media, without our written consent.

*No Pets (We DO have Dogs and Cats on-site, so please be aware - interactions will be minimal and kept to outside shared spaces only. Occasional barking may be experienced if we are offsite... Please contact us if the pets become an issue during your stay, and we will correct the situations immediately.)

*No Weapons, Hunting or Fishing.

*No Swimming or Boating.

*No Unauthorized Parties (Unless you are visiting for a pre-arranged Birthday Gathering, or a Wedding, or any other pre-scheduled similar social event).

*ONLY GUESTS have approved access onto our property. Your reservation grant's you usage of your reserved Cottage and access to the shared bathroom space.  Any additional day Guests will require our prior approval- and in some instances, if repeated or excessive stays are expected, additional fees will apply.

*The furnishings in each cottage are our personal property, please take care of these items. ONLY individual persons should sleep or be on top bunk bed at any given time.
*We will supply you with some basic items you may use, as needed, for your stay, such as:
     -Bath Towels, Hand Towels, Wash Clothes
     -Shampoo & Soap
     -Toilet Paper & Tissues
     -First Aid Kit
     -5 Gallon Bottled Water Fountain with Hot/Cold Dispenser
     -Antibacterial Wipes
     -BBQ Utensils
     -Paper Plates, Cups, Napkins & Plastic Ware

*Please share any issues or concerns with us so that these can be addressed as soon as possible.  Any damages are to be reported as soon as possible so that they too can be repaired quickly. We do frequently service the bathroom, and your help in keeping the bathroom sink, shower, toilet & mirror tidy for others is appreciated. For example, be sure you have rinsed out the sink after use. Wipe dry the top of the sink using the supplied was cloth. Keep the shower rinsed, and remove any hair strands you may have left behind. Lastly, ensure the toilet is properly flushed after use.

*Walk-thru BEFORE & sometimes, AFTER your stay.
*Your stay is priced for only the number of Guests being paid for at the time of booking.  If additional Guests are hosted for any period of time, additional cleanup will be required for their stay by us.  Additional fees will apply under those conditions.  This practice is NOT encouraged.

*Our Cleaning Fee is for cleaning the Cottage & shared bathroom space, cleaning of Towels and Linens, supplying basics such as Kleenex Tissues, Cleaning Wipes, Toilet Paper, Water Bottles, and so on. This FEE is NOT to be used as an excuse to leave your Rental Unit or the shared bathroom space a mess. Please leave your areas as clean, or cleaner, than you found them, if at all possible. Thank You.

*If your Rental Unit is left excessively messy upon your departure, the cleaning and servicing time shall be charged against your Security/Damage Deposit at the rate of $25/Hour. Any damaged or broken items will also be charged against your Security/Damage Deposit at a replacement cost price.

*When moving throughout our property, you are asked to walk gently with minimal impact.  Excessive impact may require additional cleaning fees if areas are not cleaned up by you.  Please simply plan to clean up after your visit. Thank you for your help to leave the area clean for our next Guest.

*Prior to Check-out, please follow the Check-out list provided to you upon Check-in.

*If any settings have been changed during your stay, please reset those to the original settings.  Such as turning down the refrigerator or AC.  Refrigerator should be set to Medium Cool, and AC / Heat should be set to an Economy Setting.

*Please help us to help you to enjoy your stay with us... Be careful, travel safely, relax, and enjoy your nature filled Glamour Camping experience. 

Thank You

name: Inglewood Cottage-  farm retreat & outdoor space
title: Lancaster, Pennsylvania

gallery.caption: Welcome to the Inglewood Cottage - a cozy home tucked into the edge of a 22 acre farmstead
Enter in to a space to call your own
Exterior updates in the spring of 2021
White columns bring a feel of European country home to the farm
If possible, we try to have a local treat available for you upon arrival.
The door opens up onto the deck for summertime eating and dining.
The kitchen is fully stocked with all your basic cooking and baking needs. There is a full size stove and refrigerator.
Whether you're wanting to do some cooking or just enjoy a cup of coffee, we have what you need during your time here.
We love the small local businesses, and support them through some of the work of local artisans, such as this candle from Aimee Weaver Designs.
Table for four, with extra folding chairs in the closet

Enter in through the front door into the living space. There is an electric fireplace which gives the option of heat as well as ambiance, along with a TV with Netflix, Amazon prime, Hulu, and your favorites.
Fireplace area that gives both heat and cozy.
Lovely picture window in the master bedroom, looking down into the woods

Wildflower Room:
Second bedroom has two twin beds
Sit on the front porch and enjoy your morning cup of coffee or tea
Fire pit with four chairs, and firewood provided

You may make a visit to the Pygmy goats during your stay at the cottage. They are behind an enclosure most of the time due to eating everything in sight if they escape, but they love when you say hello!
At the Inglewood Farm, we have Pygmy goats, babydoll sheep, Angus cows, and you may even meet the family dog.
You may get to see kids during your stay. If you’ve never seen any goats before, you’re in for one of the cutest things in your life. :)
During a winter snow, this is the wonderland you’ll drive past to get to the cottage.
If you’re lucky enough to be at the cottage when it snows, it’s absolutely magical.
The newest addition to the Inglewood Farm includes two female alpacas!
The two alpacas will most likely be standing near the fence, waiting to say hello, if they see you walking nearby.
Conway, our babydoll sheep, loves to say hello, and he always looks like he is smiling.
The animals are kept behind fences for their own safety and for yours, but the goats love when you say hello!

hosts.about:
We are a husband + wife team, with roots in both Pennsylvania and Georgia, now making our home in Lancaster County, PA. We formerly had a business remodeling and renovating older houses, adding many homes to our portfolio over the years. 

What began as a dream for a lifestyle change for our family turned into reality when we bought 22 acres and a property that needed a lot of love, and moved from downtown to a country home. We then channeled our love of renovation into Airbnb’s, remodeling the two we currently have on and bordering our property, and loving to give our guests a unique and memorable experience. 

We travel often as a family of 7 and try to make our own Airbnb’s as beautiful as they practical, as we like it to be for our own travel. Bon voyage!

recent.comments: We had an amazing time here! The cottage is adorable and very comfortable. The amazing views and supercute animals were the icing on the cake. Clarita is an excellent host - everything was above our wildest expectations. We hope to be back again!

items.comments: We had an amazing time here! The cottage is adorable and very comfortable. The amazing views and supercute animals were the icing on the cake. Clarita is an excellent host - everything was above our wildest expectations. We hope to be back again!

Wonderful stay at an idyllic farm setting. So peaceful and beautiful. Everything is beautifully designed but still feels homey and comfortable. Lots to do in area for family. Clarita was super friendly and responsive and thought of every detail. Our son particularly loved Old Windmill Farm, a working Amish farm where they let you interact/ bottle fed the baby animals- pigs, bunnies, goats, chickens, calves and even saw a 1 week old colt.  The farm stay was nothing short of amazing, our second time here. Highly recommend.

Enjoyed our stay in this peaceful place. Host thought of everything a guest could possibly need. Many thoughtful touches for guests of all ages throughout the cottage. The cottage was stocked with board games, books, a few toys for kids, toiletries, and all kinds of pantry items one might need. There was even a basket with supplies for s’mores! We appreciated the thought and care the host put into making it feel like home.
This is seriously one of our favorite stays ever. The property was silent except for the friendly farm animals. We found to to be very kid friendly and our 2yo loved saying hi to the animals!

If you're looking for peace and tranquility while being able to appreciate beautiful scenery, this is for you. Some take weekends to go do activities and some take weekends to decompress. This beautiful cottage allowed me to do both. I would recommend this to any and everyone out there. My experience was second to none.
We loved the  accommodations, so stylish and peaceful.  Could have spent more time there. Something new to see every day. Would highly recommend.

Beautiful cottage on a farm. Upon request, Ben and his toddler spent time showing us around and helping us feed the animals and search for chicken eggs. Maisey the farm dog was fun as well as Lazarus,  the extra friendly lamb. I would recommend this farm stay for children or a couple looking to relax. Also close to a Dutch Wonderland and family friendly farm activities.

description.summary:
Welcome to the Inglewood Farm! 

Inspired by Old European design, this gives  you a luxury stay in a sweet cottage. Tucked in a peaceful wooded corner  on our 20-acre 1700’s farmstead, you can visit the animals, see the rhythm of our family farm life, and enjoy being in nature. 

Located 3 miles south of Lancaster, we are 15-20 minutes within major attractions including Sight & Sound Theatre, Amish Country, Strasburg, and Lititz.
description.space:
The 480 square foot, 2-bedroom with a cozy cottage feel is darling and welcoming and you may not even want to leave the indoor space or the deck right off the kitchen. The space is styled and decorated with items from quality stores such as Crate & Barrel, West Elm, as well as uniquely sourced antiques. 

The kitchen is fully stocked with anything you might need to cook a meal (bring your own food!) and we provide everything you want for a comfortable and special night getaway. We provide a Nepresso machine as well as a French press and Chemex to ensure all our coffee lovers will be satisfied. 

Bedroom #1 is has a queen bed with luxury bedding, as well as a huge picture window overlooking the woods behind the cottage, creating a look into nature from your bed which is a most beautiful experience. The draperies do close fully for when you want your privacy. The closet holds comfortable bathrobes to enjoy during your stay. There is a luggage rack for your use as well. 

Bedroom #2 is what we call our Wildflower room, and holds two twin beds with a cozy and airy feel. A luggage rack provides a space for your belongings. 

The living room holds a cozy sofa as well as two arm chairs, and throw blankets for your use. The high speed internet allows you to access the TV in the living room with Netflix, Amazon Prime Video, or many more of your favorite online TV shows and movies. 

But if you enjoy the outdoors, you are free to wander the acres of woods with our trails, sit by the creek, and enjoy the peaceful nature setting. There is a large deck with a table and chairs  for 4, and gas grill as well as a separate campfire spot with 4 Adirondack chairs, fire pit - the perfect place to make s’mores and hot chocolate. Basically it’s like glamping in style - a luxury small-space cottage with all your needs and wants but giving you the opportunity to be in nature as you wish. 

Self-check in after 4pm.

It’s the perfect location for a getaway while still being close to almost anything you’d like to do in the city if you want to be out and about. We are within 15 minutes of wonderful nature preserves with great hiking trails, or you can enjoy the indoor space with access to Netflix and Amazon Prime video. You also have the option to work remotely with our high speed internet.

** no more than four children, including children**

** no pets are allowed, no exceptions. Failure to follow the no-pet policy will result in a $300/day penalty.

** we are in the country and do our best to give a clean space (some guests have said it’s the cleanest space they’ve ever stayed in).  However, due to being in the country please realize there are some bugs and small insects that we don’t have control over, due to farms nearby
description.notes: There are various animals on the farm, and we hope they will only add delight to your stay. We have Angus beef cows, Pygmy goats, Southdown Babydoll sheep, alpacas, and in the warmer weather possibly other animals as well!
description.neighborhood:
We are located 3 miles south of the charming Lancaster city, which has the oldest on-going market in the nation (definitely a place to visit on Tuesday, Friday, or Saturday during your stay). There are wonderful food options, some of the best coffee shops in the nation, and unique shopping experiences with Tanger Outlets 15 minuets away. 

We are also within 15 minutes of some wonderful nature trails and preserves, if being in nature is something you are looking forward to. 

If you’re coming for Amish country, we are 15 minutes from the main attractions you will want to visit. Strasburg is also a darling destination spot with antiques and an old fashioned ice cream shop, and we are 15 minutes from there.
description.transit: There is parking for your personal vehicle, and Uber and Lyft are available also.
description.interaction: We are available by text at all times for anything you might need, but give you the space to have a private getaway.
description.house_rules: You are not expected to clean the cottage space, but we do ask that you wash up the dishes you used during your stay and put the dirty sheets (sheets only; no comforters please) into the washer before you leave. Thank you!

name: Serenity Airstream at Apple Blossom Farm HT Extra$
title: Orrtanna, Pennsylvania

gallery.caption: Airstream is located in the yellow circle on the photo

hosts.about:
Hi, I started using airbnb back in October of 2014 in the form of a host. We now have a 6 bedroom home with a heated in door pool, a cottage, a cabin, a farmhouse that sleeps 14 and our newest house that opened May 26 2017!  
  I grew up in South Carolina on Hilton Head Island.  I left at 17 and traveled extensively finally to spend a lot of time in South Beach and New York City.  Being in the fashion industry for over 20 years I have stayed at amazing hotels and have been fortunate enough to meet and work with designers from all over the word.  I have incorporated both a passion for real estate and hospitality to share with travelers from all over with our cabins.  They might be rustic rentals in the country but they are loaded with any and every luxury one could want.  I love interacting with all our guests and help any way I can to make their stay 100% enjoyable.  

My family and I live on a retired apple orchard ten miles out of Gettysburg.  I have a love for healthy food and a healthy lifestyle.  My work and family keep me extremely busy along with a ton of pets indoor and outdoor.  We love to make the use of all 30 acres.  

Hopefully we will start using airbnb places in our upcoming travel!

recent.comments: We had such a fun time at the Airstream! The area was beautiful and it was a bonus to be near the farm animals. The property was very clean upon arrival and we were able to find everything we needed with ease. The area is great for touring historical Gettysburg locations and memorabilia. Lots of good food close by too! Would recommend this to anyone looking for a quick getaway.

items.comments: We had such a fun time at the Airstream! The area was beautiful and it was a bonus to be near the farm animals. The property was very clean upon arrival and we were able to find everything we needed with ease. The area is great for touring historical Gettysburg locations and memorabilia. Lots of good food close by too! Would recommend this to anyone looking for a quick getaway.
What am amazing weekend. The place was better than described and totally suited our needs for a weekend get away. We cant wait to come back
we had an amazing stay and if we go back to Gettysburg we will definitely stay here again.
If you want privacy and tranquility this is the place for you!  My husband and I spent 2 nights here and we loved it!.  Everything was as she described.   Thank you for having us!

We loved our stay at Elizabeth’s place! The airstream was very cute & had everything we needed for a weekend stay. The location was ideal being so close to downtown Gettysburg. Definitely would recommend this stay!

We really loved our stay at the Airstream! The thought and attention to detail exceeded our expectations. The surrounding farm and property is so beautiful. We really enjoyed the horses and little donkey on site. Gettysburg is only a quick 15 minute drive, which made this location ideal for everything we wanted to see! Elizabeth was very informative and gave us all the information we would need for a seamless stay. The airstream is very well kept, and extremely clean. We will definitely be back! Thank you for being such a great host!

The Airstream is the perfect combination of nature and convenience. Close enough to Gettysburg to enjoy restaurants and attractions, but far enough away to relax and unwind after a day of sightseeing. The camper is beautifully renovated with all the comforts of home. Not to mention, immaculately clean. Every detail was well thought out - including the provided robes and slippers which I wish I had found sooner. We didn't do much cooking but the kitchen had all that you would need to cook for two. Wish our stay had been longer and that the weather was a little better so we could have enjoyed the outdoor area more. Despite the rain, we still enjoyed the hot tub.

If we are ever back in the Gettysburg area, we will be sure to stay again.

description.summary:
Enjoy a unique and fun vacation in an Airstream. Since 1931 Airstream has enjoyed the undeniable distinction of being the finest! Now it's your turn to enjoy a great vacation in a timeless American Icon. Hot tub is an extra fee

Hot tub is an extra fee the price breakdown can be found in the listing description.

2 guest max
Infants with 2 guests are a $25 fee for our rentals
description.space:
We've removed all the hassles. . .your coach await. Just arrive and your vacation begins. Our modern Airstream invites you inside with the flair of modern design. It's perfect for couples, and weekend escapists.

Entering into the pristine Airstream you are greeted by an expansive sofa and sitting area with flat screen TV, dinette table and the trademark of  light from its expansive windows.

Serenity Airstream sleeps up to 2 -- private master suite. The fully equipped kitchen features a range, refrigerator, convection oven and plenty of storage. We've included all the dishes, utensils, and cookware you will ever need to cook vacation gourmet meals. There is even a Keurig coffee maker ready for your enjoyment.

The private bath has a separate shower and the entire coach is fully air-conditioned and heated.

Enjoy the outdoors, the views, and the breezes, complete with table and chairs. We've included a propane grill and fire pit.

This is not roughing it...600 thread count linens, Egyptian cotton bath sheets, and all the comforts of a fine boutique hotel.

Our setting for your adventure is on our private 30 acres of a retired apple orchard nestled back in a private clearing.  This means that at certain times of the year there will be stink bugs as they are an agricultural pest.  They are completely harmless and we do spray for them.

Let us know if you would like the hot tub as it is an extra fee.  See the last few pics that show the hot is just outside the airstream and completely private under a gazebo on the patio. The hot tub is separate from the airstream. That being said if something mechanically happens with the hot tub we will refund you your hot tub fee but it does not affect your rental

Cost.  
1 night $50 flat fee
2 nights $125 flat fee
3-5 nights $150 flat fee
6-8 nights $175 flat fee
9-11 nights $200 flat fee

2 guest max
Infants with 2 guests are a $25 fee for our rentals
description.access: Parking in designated parking spots in front of privacy wall.
description.notes:
If you would like the hot tub it is an extra fee
HT Cost.  
2 nights $125 flat fee
3-5 nights $150 flat fee
6-8 nights $175 flat fee
9-11 nights $200 flat fee

This is a camper with a black water holding tank that will need to emptied as needed.   The Airstream comes equipped with an iPad mini where you will find instructional videos on how to empty and refill the holding tank.  The property manager before arrival empties and refills the tank.  

There will be a dozen eggs organic freshly laid eggs in the rental and if you would like them its $5 a dozen.  These are provided by our 14 year old son

Airbnb has dissolved there email alias they provide to hosts.  Our company emails out the arrival guide, departure guide, and rental agreement via Docusign.   If you request to book this rental you must provide us with an email address.

Security camera facing parking lot only
description.interaction: Your hosts are there to help, but never intrude. Hospitality is our business and our 5 star rating prove our dedication to our guests. Enjoy an exceptional vacation in a special setting. Book now as we have limited availability.
description.house_rules:
Must be over 25 to book

Must take out trash, clean and replace dishes prior to check out

Hot Tub is an extra fee

Rental agreement must be signed before arrival

2 guest Max, we do allow infants however there is a $25 fee sent out as a payment request

name: Tranquil Cottage in C'ville, sleeps 5
title: Charlottesville, Virginia

gallery.caption: True industrial farmhouse custom-made architecture in this brand new tiny house of 900 square feet..all yours!
This tiny house is flooded with light, a pallet walled loft and comfortable brand new beds.
It's May on the farm where the fields are dotted with first cut  hay~ they are an awesome photo backdrop!!
First floor queen bed room, burlap curtains replace a door
New Scandinavian inspired custom kitchen. Our local craftsman hand forged the shelving brackets... We decided to upgrade the oven to a Cuisinart induction and a Cuisinart large fry/baking oven.
Hand made pallet wall in a lofted bed room with two X-long new beds covered in hypoallergenic comforters
In the winter we have 180degree view of the Blue Ridge Mountains. This is taken from a walk up behind the house. You can walk up the dirt road to the left of the property to this viewing spot.
Your own fire pit… great for morning coffee and stargazing
Merlin and Ruby are waiting for you to visit!
Expansive views of the Blue Ridge Mountains include a spectacular sunset - note the time and pull up a chair.
Fall foliage from in front of the cottage.
Amazing views of the Blue Ridge Mountains.
Vintage pie cabinet is our game and puzzle cabinet~ got llamas?
Our newest family member! Miss Pippa
The bathroom has local soapstone counters and step in shower
Hand made shelving brackets and soapstone back splash

Super gorgeous sunsets...every evening.
We have a western sky, expansive and full of twinkling stars because we have low light pollution.
Walk our country roads without getting in the car!
Merlin and Ruby in the summer morning sunshine
The morning fog begins to lift. We sit amongst 200 acres of beautiful VA countryside yet only a few miles away are vineyards and UVA. This is the front field.
Merlin, Ruby and a few of the Girls.
The soapstone slab sourced from an old plantation nearby
Another beautiful sunset from the front field.

hosts.about:
We are a friendly family of five plus a few beautiful animals. We live on a Farm-Estate over looking the Blue Ridge Mountains. We love where we live and would love to share our slice of heaven with everyone. All are welcome to relax and have fun. 
We enjoy traveling and visited many interesting places...we enjoy learning the culture through art and food, opting for local homes instead of hotels.
Originally from up north, we now have a motto: "We weren't born here, but got here as soon as we could!" We love Virginia!!

recent.comments: Peaceful break from the corporate hustle. Beautiful sunsets, picturesque country side walks, and welcoming farm animals

items.comments: Peaceful break from the corporate hustle. Beautiful sunsets, picturesque country side walks, and welcoming farm animals

We had an awesome stay at Cynthia’s, again! This was my second time staying, and both experiences were fantastic. The surroundings couldn’t be more beautiful and relaxing. The cottage windows all look out into lovely pollinator gardens, and the puppies are delightful co-hosts. We also had a very clear view of the peak of the Perseid meteor shower; the farm is perfectly remote (but only 20 mins from downtown cville) for stargazing. Hope to stay again soon!

Absolutely loved our stay at Tranquil Cottage. Beautifully designed and such a comfortable & peaceful place to stay on our family adventure. Our daughter completely fell in love with the dogs and horses.  Really convenient location for Charlottesville and for the local vineyards. Huge thanks to Cynthia & Chuck for being so accommodating and sharing their wonderful cottage. Truly the best hosts!
The place was absolutely lovely. Great location so convenient to restaurants and shopping. The bed was very comfortable and the farm is so peaceful.
My stay at Cynthia’s cottage was the perfect peaceful get away. Surrounded by beautiful nature. Cynthia was extremely responsive and friendly throughout the whole process, it was greatly appreciated!

This little house was so wonderful, it was clean, roomy/cozy, beautifully decorated and very homey; perfect for my best friend and I’s girls weekend. It’s far enough away from the city to enjoy the land and beautiful rolling hills but close enough to get to everything fun. I highly recommend this and would certainly book this again in the future.

This is the second time I boarded at the lovely cottage, bringing a different set of friends - moms in need of retreat. 

We loved staying at Cynthia’s cottage because of the purposeful spaces it provided which promoted meaningful conversations (not to mention rest & relaxation). You can bring out your dinner and sit by the fire and chat the night away under the starry sky. You can stroll down the road to where Fosters Branch starts for a morning meditation. You can sit on the day bed and watch a movie. You can watch the sunset or sunrise and let the sound of the birds & crickets heal your mind & body. 
We also loved how downtown is only 15-20mins away (oh so many cute shops there were!). 

All that to say, I cannot recommend this place enough and planning to sneak away with my husband next time ;) Cynthia was very responsive, kind and reliable & we are grateful for this time of retreat.

description.summary: Tranquil Cottage is an adorable home with breathtaking sunset and Blue Ridge mountain views unlike anywhere in the Charlottesville area. We are 5 miles from downtown and minutes to some of the best vineyards and restaurants in the Piedmont. Enjoy comfortable beds, well equipped kitchen, a fire pit and Adirondack chairs. Walk our country roads, feed the horses,  enjoy the views of the mountains. We welcome all people, base price is for 2 people  so sorry no pets or children under 12 for safety.
description.space:
Tranquil Estate is a very special place where the big sky meets the Blue Ridge mountains. We moved here because Charlottesville is small city that has farm to table values and a countryside which makes you feel like you’re on vacation. 
The decor is industrial farmhouse and all of the amenities are new; including the beds! We will leave a few necessities in the kitchen like coffee, tea, salt seasonings and olive oil. There is a Keurig and a drip coffee maker with coffee pods. There is a new cuisinart induction cooktop and a new cuisinart fryer, toaster, and baking oven. There are two mini-splits which are set at 70 in the summer and winter unless you request it changed which is not a problem. There is a window AC unit you can control along with ceiling fans and stationary fans. Let us know if you are too warm or cold so we can make you comfortable!
We have a huge 10+ acre field with horses and cows over the fence. It is a very peaceful property. There is a large table to work on - perhaps write that novel sitting in the back of your head. The property also is the perfect place to paint en plein air. Bring wood, paper and marshmallows for the fire pit!
Sorry, pets are not allowed. Base price covers two people.
description.access: You’ll have the cottage to yourself and there are tall evergreens separating the view between houses so it is private. Since it is a small farm you may see me out and about as I take care of the property and animals. We are mindful that you are here to rest and relax and always do our best to accommodate guests needs. The dogs are in and out all day but if you prefer not to see them just say so and we will do our best to keep them inside. Their names are Foster the Basset Hound, and Pippa our young Corgi
description.notes:
Horses: Merlin the Percheron/Thoroughbred has been my horse for more than 15 years. Ruby the paint horse is 7 years old. Both are sweethearts and very beautiful unless it is muddy...ugh. Sometimes they are in a paddock up close to the cottage which is really fun for our guests. They are kept in an electric fence but love a visit. They enjoy real food like apples and carrots and hold your hand FLAT when giving them these treats.
Fire Pit Stuff:  Bring wood and paper for your fire pit and the MARSHMALLOWS!!! If you forget something just ask- we probably have it!

First time Airbnb users need to know that being a part of the Airbnb family is super unique. We have traveled the world this way. We welcome new people when we see them enjoying our property. When we travel,  our hosts are those who share their restaurants and “must see and do” information not found on line.Meeting new people is what Airbnb is all about- not just staying at a place- you’re staying in a part of a home. We think that’s so cool. 
We look forward to hosting you at our beautiful estate.
Cynthia and Chuck
description.neighborhood:
The cottage is in an area of old barns, rolling hills, dirt roads, newborn calves, and friendly people who wave when they go by. It's 5 miles to Downtown Charlottesville for all kinds of cultural activities, the UVA campus, and wonderful restaurants. Barboursville, Merry Hill, Horton, Castle Hill Cidery, Pipen Hill, Glass House Vineyards make us a great spot to enjoy a good glass a vino amd cider. 
The Shenandoah Mountains are outside your window and 40 minutes to a trail head- not to mention kayaking the Rivanna River down the road.
description.transit: We do have Lyft and Uber service. Let us know when they’re coming or better yet meet them at the gate- they go so fast and don’t know about the animals. Thank you!
description.interaction: We are available if you need us. Otherwise enjoy your privacy.
description.house_rules:
- Have Fun!
-But absolutely no smoking or vaping at all...there will be a fine...sorry to be a buzz kill...

- Small gatherings are fine,  just run it by me first-especially for graduation and parents weekend. We understand wanting to gather together with your family.
- Overall, please leave the cottage as you’ve found it. 
- We request for cleanliness purposes please remove your shoes. Walking through the grass etc brings in all kinds of farmyard animal dirt. 
Thank you!

gallery.caption: Living room. With queen size sleeper sofa.
The Loft.  Front door on ground level. Once you enter the foyer you will go upstairs to the main 2nd floor.
Foyer as you enter the ground level front door.  Stairwell  leading to the Loft apartment.
2nd Floor main level as go up the stairs.
French doors opening onto the balcony.
Full Kitchen. Microwave, coffee maker, dishwasher, stove/oven. All full size.
Made bedroom. Separated from the open loft by a half wall.
upper loft bedroom with two twin beds.
view from balcony of the loft bedroom.
stairwell leading back down to the entrance.

hosts.about: I am a music teacher in a local elementary school.  I have two boys.  As a family we love mountain biking, hiking and just being outdoors. We look forward to hosting guests in our newly built space.  We enjoy the opportunity to share our beautiful surroundings with others. As travelers we are always on the lookout for new outdoor experiences and adventures!

recent.comments: Short overnight stay, but was great!

items.comments: Short overnight stay, but was great!
Na

Linda's place was very comfortable and stylish! It was perfect for our family get-away to Charlottesville! Having horses and chickens nearby was lots of fun. The loft is super cute. The space is nicely decorated and comfortable. We were a family of 5 and all fit well!

Recommended!

Thank you so much for hosting us for our bestie’s bachelorette trip! Your place was so welcoming and perfect for our getaway weekend. We loved the company of your horses and the scenic views from your barn. We enjoyed exploring multiple wineries and trying new restaurants in the area. We look forward to visiting again so soon!
A lovely place to stay in a beautiful and peaceful countryside setting.  Very nice furnishings and touches throughout.  The kind of place that lowers your pulse and lets you relax!
We had a wonderful stay at Linda's place.
Beautiful, relaxing, comfortable space! Amazing natural light and pretty views

description.summary: Our place is a newly constructed barn loft in our 1960's barn.  Enjoy beautiful views of the surrounding countryside from large windows and a private balcony. The barn is surrounded by our horse pastures and neighboring fields.  Self check in with the key lockbox.  This loft is separate from the main house where we live.  Private parking and entrance for our guests directly outside of barn loft (this is separate from the main house driveway).
description.space: One bedroom with queen bed (semi-private with a half wall).  Spiral staircase leads up to a loft with two twin beds, easily adapted to queen if desired.  Large open living space with full kitchen.  One full bath.  Laundry closet with washer/dryer.
description.access: The entire loft is yours.  The field across the road from us is our neighbor's property, as well as any land outside of the  black fence. Our property is surrounded by the black fence.
description.neighborhood:
Our neighborhood is a private road with several large properties on it, great for walks or runs.
Just 3 miles down the road is a large park, Darden Towe park, that offers extensive walking/biking trails.  These trails run along the Rivanna River and connect to many trails throughout the city of Charlottesville.  There are several river access points for kayaks, canoes, and paddleboards.  Just past the park is convenient shopping for groceries, coffee shops and several restaurants.  The loft is 4.3 miles to Charlottesville Downtown mall and 5.6 miles to the University of Virginia grounds.  There are also several vineyards within a 10 mile radius.
description.interaction: We live in the main house on the property.  We are available if needed for any questions, etc.  Otherwise, we want to provide a peaceful, private stay for our guests.  The lower level of the barn is used by us, but has a completely separate entrance. We have a few hens and one gray cat (stays outside).  In the summer we keep our horses in our adjoining fields.
description.house_rules: Please do not use glitter. Please do not tape or hang decorations on walls. Quiet time after 11pm.
