hosts.about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

recent.comments: We loved this house !  Was more than we expected.  The owners thought of everything.  The house was very clean and well stocked.

items.comments: We loved this house !  Was more than we expected.  The owners thought of everything.  The house was very clean and well stocked.
Great place to stay , recommended
Had a great time with friends! House is beautiful!

We love this home so much, we already placed a reservation for five months from now!  Calm, peaceful, relaxing, and homey.  Well stocked with all essentials and many non-essentials.  Highly recommended!
It was the best trip I’ve taken in a long time!
Overall a really nice place, had all the amenities mentioned and was very private and beautiful.
Cabin was perfect for our group. We hope to go back!

description.space:
The Last Cast Welcome to your home away from home in the beautiful countryside of Virginia along Lake Anna. This spacious and modern cabin has more than enough room for your group or large family to vacation comfortably. The deck faces west so that the gorgeous sunsets can be enjoyed at your leisure, or even in the hot tub. Spend your days on the white sand beach sunbathing, or on the lake boating, kayaking, paddleboarding, fishing, and every other waterfront sport you can think of. Tour the town and find the Chancellorsville Battlefield and Visitor Center, wineries, mini-golf, and Lake Anna State Park. Inside you'll find a bright interior simply filled with natural light, the completely wooden interior and stone fireplace a stunning sight to behold. The open floor plan promotes togetherness, so no conversation will be missed here. Gather around the two-story fireplace to have a movie night on the large TV, or just share stories and make memories. Prepare grand meals and lake picnic snacks in the spacious kitchen, equipped with stainless steel appliances. This gorgeous cabin boasts six beds, each comfortable and roomy bedroom with space for personal effects. The main bedroom has a lovely en suite bathroom with a double-sink vanity, a soaking tub, and a luxurious walk-in shower. Make memories in the game room where you'll find dozens of board games and puzzles, a foosball table, and a shuffleboard table. At the end of the day, roast marshmallows and tell ghost stories at the firepit and watch the stars come out to dot the sky. THINGS TO KNOW For little guests, a crib and Pack N Play are provided. This property is managed by Vacasa Virginia LLC. 2 dog(s) are welcome in this home. No other animals are allowed without specific Vacasa approval.
Parking notes: There is free parking for 4 vehicles.
Damage waiver: The total cost of your reservation for this Property includes a damage waiver fee which covers you for up to $3,000 of accidental damage to the Property or its contents (such as furniture, fixtures, and appliances) as long as you report the incident to the host prior to checking out. More information can be found from the "Additional rules" on the checkout page. Due to local laws or HOA requirements, guests must be at least 25 years of age to book. Guests under 25 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian for the duration of the reservation.
description.house_rules:
By booking this reservation, you agree to the additional policies, terms, and conditions below.

UNIT SPECIFIC TERMS

- Due to local laws or HOA requirements, guests must be at least 25 years of age to book. Guests under 25 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian for the duration of the reservation.
- 2 dog(s) are welcome in this home. No other animals are allowed without specific Vacasa approval.
- The property shall not be used by more than the number of adults and children listed in your reservation.
- All guests shall abide by Vacasa’s good neighbor policy and shall not engage in illegal activity. Quiet hours are from 10 p.m. to 8 a.m.
- If early check-in is available for your reservation, you will be notified by 9am on the morning of your arrival by email. Late check-out is offered whenever possible for a small fee.
- No smoking of any kind is permitted anywhere on the premises.
- No commercial photography or filming is permitted on the property. Tents or other structures may not be erected.
- Renter is liable for any damage to the property and agrees to accept charges to the card on file should damage occur during occupancy.
- Due to local laws, regulations, or Homeowner Association rules, guests may be required to agree to additional terms of service. A signed paper contract is required to be completed and returned to Vacasa.
 - Property Specific terms: 

DAMAGE WAIVER

The total cost of your reservation for this Property includes a damage waiver fee (USD) with the following costs, plus tax if applicable:
0 bedrooms: $60 for stays 1-3 nights, $15 per night for stays 4+ nights.
1 bedrooms: $60 for stays 1-3 nights, $15 per night for stays 4+ nights.
2 bedrooms: $80 for stays 1-3 nights, $20 per night for stays 4+ nights.
3 bedrooms: $100 for stays 1-3 nights, $25 per night for stays 4+ nights.
4 bedrooms: $100 for stays 1-3 nights, $25 per night for stays 4+ nights.
5 bedrooms: $120 for stays 1-3 nights, $30 per night for stays 4+ nights.
6 bedrooms: $120 for stays 1-3 nights, $30 per night for stays 4+ nights.
7 bedrooms: $140 for stays 1-3 nights, $35 per night for stays 4+ nights.
8 bedrooms: $140 for stays 1-3 nights, $35 per night for stays 4+ nights.

The Damage Waiver covers you for up to $3,000 of accidental damage to the Property or its contents (such as furniture, fixtures, and appliances) as long as you report the incident to Vacasa prior to checking out. The Damage Waiver fee eliminates the need for a traditional security deposit.

How to Report Damage
Please report accidental damage as soon as it occurs so we can assess and minimize the extent of the damages. 

Damage Waiver Additional Terms and Conditions
The Damage Waiver only covers damage that occurs during the authorized rental period and that Renter or an authorized guest reports PRIOR TO CHECK OUT.
The Damage Waiver does not cover intentional damage or damage caused by smoking, pets or other animals brought onto the Property, or criminal activity.
The Damage Waiver does not cover damage to any structure other than the Property covered by your confirmed, non-fraudulent reservation.
Renter is responsible for any accidental damage that exceeds $3,000. Damages for covered claims in excess of $3,000 or for uncovered claims will be charged to the Renters credit card.
The Damage Waiver program is provided and administered by Vacasa and is not an insurance policy. The Damage Waiver does not provide liability coverage and does not cover vehicles or guest personal items.


ADDITIONAL TERMS FOR VACASA ACCOMMODATIONS

These Additional Terms for Vacasa Accommodations, including any applicable Unit-Specific Terms (as defined below) (collectively, the “Vacasa Terms”), apply to your Airbnb booking of the vacation rental property specified in a confirmed reservation (the “Property”). In case of any conflict between the Vacasa Terms and the Airbnb Terms of Service (“Airbnb Terms”) that apply to your reservation, the Airbnb Terms will control.

These Vacasa Terms are between: (1) Vacasa (“Vacasa,” “we,” or “us”), acting for itself and for the owner of the Property (“Owner”), and (2) the person who is the responsible renter of the Property (collectively “Renter” or “you”). You acknowledge that you have read and understand, and agree to be bound by, all terms, conditions, and policies in these Vacasa Terms.

Certain jurisdictions, resorts, and specific homes require renters to agree to additional terms and conditions (“Unit-Specific Terms”). If any provision of the Unit-Specific Terms differs from the general provisions of the Vacasa Terms, the provision of the Unit-Specific Terms will control.

Vacasa operates using different legal entities in different geographical regions. As used in these Vacasa Terms, the term “Vacasa” means the entity specified in the Unit-Specific Terms, if any. If no entity is specified in the Unit-Specific Terms, then:
·   If the Property is located in the United States or Mexico, Vacasa means Vacasa LLC.
·   If Property is located in Europe (meaning one of the countries of the European Union or Switzerland), Vacasa means Vacasa Europe AG.
·   If the Property is located in Canada, Vacasa means Vacasa Canada ULC.
·   If the Property is located in South Africa, Vacasa means Vacasa South Africa (PTY) Ltd.
·   If the Property is located in one of the following countries in Latin America or the Caribbean, then Vacasa means:
            o   In Belize: Vacasa Belize Ltd.
            o   In Chile: Vacation Rental SpA
            o   In Colombia: Vacasa Colombia S.A.S.
            o   In Costa Rica: Vacasa del Pacífico Central de Costa Rica Ltda
            o   In the Dominican Republic: Vacasa, S.A.S.
            o   In Honduras: Vacasa Honduras S. DE R.L.
            o   In Nicaragua: Vacasa Nicaragua S.R.L y CÍA LTDA
            o   In Uruguay: Vacasa Uruguay, S.R.L.


POLICIES AND ADDITIONAL TERMS

A. Minimum Age. The “Minimum Age” to rent the Property is the age specified in any Unit-Specific Terms. If no age is specified in the Unit-Specific Terms, the Minimum Age is 21 years of age (or the minimum age required by law in the jurisdiction where the Property is located, if different). You agree to provide us with proof of age upon request. A parent or legal guardian must accompany all guests who are under the Minimum Age for the entire duration of the rental.

B. Maximum Occupancy.  The number of people present at the Property may not exceed the maximum posted occupancy.

C. Good Neighbor Policy.  Because the Property is a privately owned home, all Occupants must comply with this good neighbor policy:
-   Please treat the Property with the same care you would use with your own residence and leave it in the same condition it was in when you arrived.
-   To prevent theft of or damage to furnishings or your personal property, you agree to close and lock doors and windows when you are not present at the Property and upon check-out.
-   You and other Occupants agree to conduct yourselves throughout your stay in a manner that is respectful of and not disruptive to neighbors, traffic flow, or the community and that will not prompt complaints to Vacasa from police, neighbors, or neighborhood or homeowner associations.
-   Noise audible outside the Property is prohibited between 10 p.m. and 8 a.m.
-   You and other Occupants agree to abide by all applicable parking restrictions and limitations.

D. No Smoking.  No smoking is permitted at the Property (including porches, decks or outdoor areas) at any time.

E. No Permanent Residence. You agree that your use of the Property is on a temporary and transient basis only; that you may not use the Property as a permanent residence; and that your permanent residence is and will remain elsewhere than at the Property.

F. Animals.  We accept assistance animals in line with Airbnb's Nondiscrimination Policy. No other animals or pets of any kind are permitted at the Property except as specifically authorized in your reservation. You also agree that we cannot and do not guarantee that no animals have been in the Property prior to your use or that the Property is free of animal or pet allergens, even if the Property listing states that pets are prohibited or includes a similar description.

G. Events; Commercial Photography; Structures; Charcoal Grills. Parties and other events are prohibited at the Property. Commercial photography and filming are also prohibited at the Property without our express written permission. (If approved, applicable occupancy limits and other rules under Airbnb's Party and Events Policy will apply, and additional conditions and fees may apply.) No tents or other structures may be erected on the property. The use of charcoal grills is prohibited.

H. Criminal Activity Prohibited. Use of the Property for any criminal activity is prohibited and may result in fines, prosecution, and/or your immediate removal from the Property. This prohibition extends to use of the Property’s internet service, if any, for criminal activity, including but not limited to unlawful downloads of copyrighted material, including movies, music, software, or other material. We may cooperate with any investigation of alleged criminal activity that occurred at the Property during your stay.

I. Consequences of Breach; Charges for Damage. Any failure by you or any other Occupants to comply with any of the terms, conditions, or policies above is a breach of these Vacasa Terms and may result in a forfeiture of your rights to rent the Property, up to and including immediate removal from the Property without refund and with or without the assistance of law enforcement. Vacasa may terminate your occupancy of the Property for breach, and if you are notified of such termination you agree to leave the Property immediately. In addition, subject to Airbnb’s damage claim policies, you are responsible for (1) any damage or loss that occurs at the Property during your stay; (2) a charge of up to $1,000 for violations of the pet policy, including for bringing more pets or different types of pets than specifically authorized; (3) an additional cleaning fee of up to $500 (or the actual cost of cleaning services, if greater) for violations of any of the guest policies above (other than the pet policy) or for excessive cleaning required by the acts or omissions of any Occupant during your stay; and (4) any fines issued by police, other government officials or agencies, utility providers, and/or homeowner associations for violation of any law, ordinance, or rule during your stay, and any damages (which may exceed the amount of fines) that result from the violation. If any unauthorized download of copyrighted material via the Property’s Internet service occurs during the period of your stay, you agree that we may obtain and share your contact information with the internet service provider or any other party we believe, for any reason, has enforcement rights.

J. Early Check-In/Late Check-Out.  Early check-in or late check-out may be available; additional charges may apply. If you do not vacate by check-out time (or late check-out time as agreed by Vacasa), you authorize us to charge a late departure fee of up to one night’s rental and we may remove all Occupants and their personal property from the Property.

K. Maintenance or Housekeeping Issues; Property Conditions. The Property is provided as is, and we are not responsible for the inoperability or unavailability of any amenities. You agree to contact Vacasa, using the contact information provided in your confirmation email, as soon as you notice any maintenance or housekeeping problem, or any potentially hazardous condition, at the Property, or if any incident occurs at the Property that is related to such a problem or condition. You further agree to give Vacasa a reasonable amount of time to respond to your report and to cooperate with Vacasa’s efforts to address the concern or provide a remedy. We will take reasonable and appropriate steps to remedy any reported problem as soon as practicable. We may enter the Property at your invitation to remedy any problem you report, at reasonable times and with reasonable notice to inspect, maintain, or repair the Property, and to address any situation that we reasonably deem an emergency that threatens persons or property. You acknowledge that if the Property has access to amenities that are shared with other properties, such as a shared pool, hot tub, parking lot, or fitness center, that the availability and condition of those amenities is outside Vacasa’s control.

L. Choice of Law; Jurisdiction and Venue; Dispute Resolution.

L.1. Choice of Law. Unless otherwise specified in any Unit-Specific Terms or if a different choice of law is required by the law of the jurisdiction in which the Property is located: If the Property is outside Europe, these Vacasa Terms shall be governed by laws of the State of Oregon, U.S.A, without regard to its conflict-of-law provisions. If the Property is in Europe, these Vacasa Terms shall be governed by the laws of Switzerland, without regard to its conflict-of-law provisions.

L.2. Dispute Resolution and Arbitration Agreement: United States. If (a) your claim against Vacasa relates in any way to a reservation for or stay at a Property located in the United States, or (b) you bring any other claim against Vacasa in the United States (to the extent permitted by these Vacasa Terms or the Airbnb Terms) (any such dispute, claim, or controversy under either (a) or (b) a “US Claim”), then you agree to resolve the US Claim as follows:

a. Agreement to Arbitrate. You and Vacasa mutually agree that any US Claim will be settled by binding arbitration rather than in court, such arbitration to be conducted by the American Arbitration Association (“AAA”) under its Consumer Arbitration Rules, or such other AAA arbitration rules that the AAA decides to be applicable to a specific dispute, that are in effect as of the time of service of an arbitration demand. Payment of filing, administration and arbitrator fees will be governed by the AAA's rules. To begin an arbitration, a party must send a letter to the other party requesting arbitration and describing the claim. If Vacasa requests arbitration, it will send the letter to your most recent email or physical address in Vacasa’s records. If you request arbitration, you must send the letter to Vacasa’s registered agent in the state in which the Property you reserved or stayed at is located, or if the dispute does not involve a reservation for or stay at a specific property, to Vacasa’s registered agent in the state of Oregon.

b. Place of Arbitration. The arbitration shall take place in the county in which the Property is located, or in Portland, Oregon, if the dispute does not involve a reservation for or stay at a specific property, or in such other location as you and Vacasa may mutually agree.

c. Exceptions to Arbitration Requirement. As the only exceptions to the agreement to submit all US Claims to binding arbitration as provided herein, Vacasa and Renter both retain the right to pursue: (1) in small claims court in the county in which the Property is located (or if the dispute does not involve a reservation for a specific property, the small claims court for Multnomah County, Oregon), any claim that is within that court’s jurisdiction, and the parties consent to the personal jurisdiction and venue of such court; and (2) a suit in any court with jurisdiction to enjoin (whether by temporary, preliminary, or permanent injunctive relief) infringement or other misuse of intellectual property rights.

L.3. Dispute Resolution: Outside the United States.
Europe: If you are a resident of Europe and your claim relates in any way to a reservation for or stay at a Property located in Europe, you and Vacasa consent to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of the courts in Zurich or Zug, Switzerland. If applicable law prohibits exclusive jurisdiction over your claim in Switzerland, then you and Vacasa agree to the non-exclusive jurisdiction and venue of the courts in Zurich or Zug, Switzerland, or your jurisdiction of residence.
Outside Europe: If your claim relates in any way to a reservation for or stay at a Property located outside of Europe or the United States, you and Vacasa agree to bring any action in the courts of the country in which the Property is located, or in such other location and forum as you and Vacasa may mutually agree.

L.4. Class Action and Jury Trial Waiver. You and Vacasa agree that any dispute resolution proceedings will be conducted only on an individual basis and not in a class, consolidated or representative action. If for any reason a claim proceeds in court rather than in arbitration, you and Vacasa waive any right to a jury trial.

M. Limitation of Liability. TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, IN NO CASE SHALL THE OWNER OF THE PROPERTY OR VACASA, NOR THEIR AFFILIATES, NOR THEIR RESPECTIVE OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, EMPLOYEES, AGENTS, OR OWNERS, BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, SPECIAL, OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES, OR FOR ANY DAMAGES FOR PERSONAL OR BODILY INJURY, EMOTIONAL DISTRESS, OR DAMAGE TO PROPERTY, ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH YOUR STAY AT THE PROPERTY. THIS LIMITATION APPLIES TO ALL CLAIMS FOR DAMAGES WHETHER BASED ON A THEORY OF WARRANTY, CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING ORDINARY NEGLIGENCE), STRICT LIABILITY, OR OTHERWISE, EVEN IF VACASA HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE AND EVEN IF THE  LIMITED REMEDY SET FORTH HEREIN IS FOUND TO HAVE FAILED OF ITS ESSENTIAL PURPOSE.

N. Indemnity. You agree to hold harmless and indemnify Vacasa and Owner, and their respective affiliates, for and from all claims for property damage, personal injury, or monetary loss resulting from your actions or omissions, and the actions or omissions of other Occupants, during or relating to your stay.

O. Substitution of Property. On rare occasions, due to ownership changes, properties being removed from rental use, or a need for extensive repairs or maintenance, the Property may not be available for rental on the dates of your reservation and Vacasa may have to cancel your booking. In this unlikely event, rebooking shall be subject to the Airbnb Terms for booking modifications.

P. Assignment. Vacasa may assign these Terms or any of its rights, or delegate any of its duties under these Terms, at any time without your consent.

name: Retreat-POOL*TumnusHouse*Hot Tub*SNP*Foliage*PIGS*
title: Stanardsville, Virginia

gallery.caption: Summer at Tumnus House means that the house is in the cool shade for part of the day.
The heart pine farm table can seat 6-8 people and the kitchen island a bit more intimate and comfortably in the cushy bar stools can seat 4 people.
The screen porch is a lovely gathering place. The two benches can convert into tables for your outside dining pleasure.

The primary bedroom has a king bed and futon chair that converts into a single bed. The room fills with glorious morning sun so we have provided blackout curtains you can close if you want to sleep in.
A short private drive to Tumnus House parking area which accommodates several vehicles.
The clean, pure water comes from a deep mountain well. Bring your own water bottles and take some home.
We provide several DVDs or you can bring your own! The TV is not connected to internet.
The open living room futon couch converts into a double bed. Under the table are various games for your entertainment.
Our wood burning Elmira stove is decorative only. Our insurance does not allow guests to use the stove.
Fresh baked goods made to order with advance notice, sourdough (pictured) takes 48 hours to make. Check our Cair Paravel Farmstead website for details.
Tumnus House has a drip coffee maker with a reusable filter. We provide coffee for our guests.
The lovely decorative arch on the farm table is filled with found natural treasures...take one/leave one.
A bread/bagel toaster and a smaller toaster over are available for your use.
Various pots and pans as well as a blender are stored beneath the kitchen island.

Tumnus House has a dishwasher. Please rinse dishes before placing them in the dishwasher. Stovetop pots and pans as well as knives should be hand washed. The is a container of Barkeepers Friend under the sink for scrubbing the more difficult dishes.

A variety of our own farm raised non - GMO meats are a available to enjoy during your stay or to take home with you. You can find out about our Farmstead Products on our Cair Paravel Farmstead website.
Beautiful eggs are available daily from our happy hens.
A broad  two mile nature trail encircles the open areas of the farm and dips into the woods.
Private charcoal grill just steps outside the door. Briquettes for sale on site.
Seasonal Guided Farm Tours booked through the Cair Paravel Farmstead website. The DIY tour is available to all guests year round.
Our heritage pigs are fed on wild forage, kitchen scraps, and non - GMO feed, and produce top notch bacon and sausage.
Guided Farm Tours include hands-on experience with our animals.
The 8 person Bullfrog spa is a quick walk from Tumnus. Amazing for star gazing at night!
The seasonal* salt swimming pool and year round hot tub are adjacent to Tumnus House and shared by guests and residents. *The pool is open Memorial Day to Labor Day.
Seasonal pool, open to all guests

hosts.about:
Whitt is a retired executive Chef who has worked in all types of hospitality environments for 35 years. Martha, is a retired educator. Managing a small country Inn and restaurant for 12 of those years has given us ample experience to create and manage our unique Yurt as well as our other lodgings. My family and I are in process of creating a self supporting and sustainable farm homestead and lodgings and we offer welcome to one and all. In addition to our enterprises we are grateful stewards of nearly 60 acres of spectacular mountain land, most of which is as undisturbed as possible with an easily accessible nature trail winding throughout  the property. As a working farm we also have a multitude of gentle critters and an abundance of home grown foods.
    Whitt grew up in Hawaii and knows well about relaxing and enjoying life and all it has to offer, and believe we have created a place where everyone can share in the same.

   Martha grew up in Bethesda, a suburb just outside of DC and spent every possible moment at Cair Paravel. Now retired from teaching and educational administration I spend my days at the farm or volunteering the the Virginia Master Naturalists.

Other folks you may see on the farm are Madi, Grant, Mark and Ruth. Madi and Grant (photo with goats) work with the animals and gardens. Mark is the master of the trails and you may see Ruth running.

Join us!

recent.comments: We had a wonderful stay with our kiddo in August. We wanted some nature time and nature time we received! We absolutely loved the farm (feeding the pigs our compost was a highlight), and the pool, and it was just so beautiful and peaceful there. The hosts were wonderfully helpful and we really had an all around excellent time. Very grateful to have found this spot and would love to come back.

items.comments: We had a wonderful stay with our kiddo in August. We wanted some nature time and nature time we received! We absolutely loved the farm (feeding the pigs our compost was a highlight), and the pool, and it was just so beautiful and peaceful there. The hosts were wonderfully helpful and we really had an all around excellent time. Very grateful to have found this spot and would love to come back.

I was so excited when I booked my trip and was looking forward to a farm experience. As our trip drew near, many amenities were not available. It may very well have been bad timing but farm tours were not available, the farm food to order that we were looking forward to was not on the site. There’s a huge tub in the unit, but there was a water shortage so there were instructions not to fill up. 

Some of these were understandable, but overall we drastically changed our plans to spend time off property. We were looking forward to at least doing a self guided farm tour, but were told on site that our leashed dogs would cause an issue with livestock guard dogs. No mention of this in the listing. We communicated that we were going to do a farm tour and they knew we had dogs, but didn’t say a thing until we pulled up to walk around. 

There are also a lot of rules that are restrictive for a person on vacation!  It felt more incumbent upon me to be a good guest than for them to be good hosts
Lovely spot. We had so much fun. The pool was delightful!
Very quiet/peaceful spot. House was very clean and the beds were comfortable. Kids has a great time swimming in the pool and hot tub.
We had a lovely time! Wonderful hosts and a unique spot.
Our third time renting Tumnus House and the Yurt for a family getaway. Such a magical place. Thank you!

Whitt, Martha, and Madi’s place is absolutely fantastic. They met us in person after we arrived, answered all our questions, learned about what we’re looking for and gave tons of local recommendations. Our toddler loved feeding the pigs :). It’s very drivable to Shenandoah and just stunningly beautiful everywhere. It is a few miles up a steep mountain road, totally picturesque, pretty well packed gravel. They helped us a few times when things came up… We loved it and hope to stay here again :).

description.summary: Lounge in chairs on the spacious screened in porch, stroll on the woods walk, enjoy nature & a bit of Appalachia at Tumnus. 10 minute hike to Shenandoah National Park Back Country. Full kitchen. Explore our 58 acres on numerous walking trails. It's easy to visit historical sites such as Monticello or Caverns. Enjoy the shared seasonal salt water pool and year round outdoor hot tub. Private & self contained. Click on "See more" or Cair Paravel Farmstead FB/the web to see all we have to offer.
description.space:
Although there are 2 private suites listed this is not a shared space. Only the members of your group will be in Tumnus House when you rent it.

LOCATION:
+ nearly 2000 feet up in the Blue Ridge Mountains
+ last leg of the drive is 1.3 mile steep, narrow gravel road 
+ mountain woodlands

SIZE: 
+1,100 square feet
+two private suites w/ full bath

PRIMARY BEDROOM
+King Bed (can sleep 3)
+2 Antique Wooden Nightstands with drawers and lamps
+Charging Dock/Player Station
+Dresser (bedding for the single futon is in the dresser)
+Futon Chair with Footstool (sleeps 1)
+Floor lamp

PRIMARY BEDROOM BATH
+Corner Tub with Shower: the large tub is subject to fill restrictions during times of drought or low water alerts. The hot tub by the pool is open year round. 
+Non Skid Bath Mat for Tub
+Foot stool (attached to floor for safety)
+Grab Bar
+Pedestal Sink
+Sink side shelf with hair drier, body wash, shampoo & conditioner
+Bench
+Commode 
+Bidet w/i commode
+Towel set up (for each reserved guest we provide 1 beach towel, 1 bath towel, 1 hand towel, 1 washcloth)
+Towel Hooks
+Bath mats on Floor
+Waste Basket

SECOND BEDROOM
+Queen Bed (can sleep 2)
+2 Antique Wooden nightstands with lamps, one with a drawer
+Dresser (bedding for the full futon in the living room is stored in the dresser)
+Charging Dock/Player Station
+High Back Wing Chair

SECOND BEDROOM BATH
+Tub and Shower Combination
+Non Skid Bath Mat for Tub
+Bathroom Sink and Vanity
+Hair drier, body wash, shampoo & conditioner
+Towel set up (for each reserved guest we provide 1 beach towel, 1 bath towel, 1 hand towel, 1 washcloth)
+Commode
+Bath mats on Floor
+Towel hooks
+Grab bar
+Waste Basket

KITCHEN
+A Propane gas range and oven
+Full size refrigerator with large lower drawer freezer
+Microwave
+Double Stainless steel sink, dish rack
+Dishwasher
+Soap for hand washing dishes and dishwasher provided
+Coffee Maker- fresh ground, organic, free trade coffee is provided & coffee filters
+Cuisinart Stainless Steel Pots and Pans
+Set of Chicago Knives
+Cooking tools, dishes, glasses, 
+Olive oil, vinegar and basic spices provided 
+Kitchen Island
+4 Stools
+Coffee/Tea Cabinet- also cloth napkins

LIVING ROOM
+WiFi Router
+Toaster
+Full futon (can sleep 2)
+Magazine Table with Games stored underneath
+Side table with Books and Barn Set
+HD TV/DVD
+Shelf with DVDs and Books
+Antique Clore Rocker
+Floor Lamp
+Antique Wood Cookstove (ornamental only)

DINING AREA
+Antique Heart Pine Farm Table
+6 Wooden Dining Chairs (more provided for groups larger than 6)
+Floor Lamp
+Overhead lighting
We ask that you eat at the table or outside. Eating throughout Tumnus House scatters crumbs and attracts insects. No food or drinks are allowed in the bedrooms.

CLOSET In THE HALL BY SECOND BEDROOM
+First Aid Kit
+Electrical Panel
+Vacuum, mop, broom, dust pan
+Bucket
+Rags
+Cleaning Supplies
+Additional Toilet paper and Paper Towels

CLOSET by KITCHEN
+Washer/Dryer
+The door is kept locked for safety. Ask for key.
+Ask about unscented laundry soap if you wish to use the laundry.
+Line drying on the screen porch.

SCREEN PORCH
+Overhead wrought iron candelabra and ceiling fan
+2 Benches that convert into picnic tables
+ 1950's Butterfly Chairs

CELL PHONE
+We have Verizon which works well. Guests have reported various levels of coverage for other providers.

Tumnus House is friendly to those with mobility issues, including a ramp onto decking, and ramp into main room. 

OUTSIDE:
+ Charcoal grill- charcoal  available for purchase on website 
+ Fire Pit Please ask about the availability of the fire pit. If it is too windy or dry we will 'close' the fire pit due to the possibility of sparks causing a forest fire.

SMALL CHILDREN: Please note that though child-friendly the Tumnus House is not child proof. We provide a child safety kit which parents may use and return at the end of the stay- socket protector, corner protectors.... A Pack'nPlay set up and Heaven's Bliss Baby portable safety harness are available to those who do not want to haul their infant/toddler sleeping /changing set up for an additional charge. Please ask about the safety measures (no charge) and rental of the infant/toddler equipment and we will send you additional information.

WATER:
Our water is supplied from two deep wells  and is clear, pure mountain water which is amazing, right from the tap. A full pitcher of filtered water will be ready for you in the fridge. You do NOT need to bring bottled water.

 Please use water conservation practices at all times.

RATES:
+The posted standard rate is $185 a night double occupancy. 
+Additional guests are $30 per person a night. 
+Weekends we have a two night minimum. 
+Maximum occupancy 8 persons. (This includes infants and children under the age of 2)
+Rates may vary dependent upon season, holidays, and/or special events.
+ For more information about our rates, please contact us.

+NO SMOKING/VAPING PERMITTED ANYWHERE on the property
+Registered Airbnb Guests only. NO Visitors or guests of guests.
+NO parties.
+NO Hair Dying- additional $50.00 clean-up fee will be charged
+NO drones

WIFI is available at Tumnus House. The router is located in the common room. 

* We have a wonderful puppy on property. A brown golden doodle named Saoirse. She sometimes come to visit at the pool and Airbnb rentals. She is incredibly sweet and would love to have pets during your stay. * 

For more information about our farm keep up with us ...friend us at ....Cair Paravel Farm.

POOL and HOT TUB
A short walk from Tumnus House will bring you to a seasonal salt water swimming pool (Memorial Day - Labor Day) and year-round hot tub that is shared by all Cair Paravel Farm residents and guests. The area is surrounded by a high tensile fence with latching and chained gates. In the interest of safety we ask that the gates remained closed and latched at all times. There is no lifeguard on duty so swimming and tubbing is at your own risk. No running, diving, food or glass in the enclosure. 

HOT TUB: 
Do not add anything to the water in the hot tub  such as oils and herbs. They will cloud the water and clog the filters. We then have to empty the tub, clean it and restart it which takes a day. If you turn down the heat please return the temperature to 103 F. when you leave the tub.

NATURE TRAIL
A well  marked trail (moderate) encircles the open pastures and woods around Cair Paravel. We are located close to Shenandoah National Park and you may encounter wildlife similar to that in the park. Trail maps for these areas are provided. Please realize that the wildlife can be dangerous and consult the Shenandoah National Park's website for further detailed information.

COMMUNICATION:
We love to greet our guests when they arrive and show them around Tumnus as well as provide suggestions for local hikes, activities, and dining. We send our confirmed guests a link to our website. Farmstead Products and other information is located at the website. We communicate with our guests through the Airbnb Message Center.

FARMHOUSE:
The Cair Paravel Farmhouse is just a short walk down the mountain though since we are an operating farm we are frequently out and about. Guests can send a message through the Message Center and we will respond as soon as we are able.

ACTIVITIES:
There are many area attractions and activities- hiking in the Shenandoah National Park, visiting Monticello or Montpelier, following the Monticello Wine Trail or the Brew Ridge Trail, and checking out the work of Virginia Artisans in the local shop: Noon Whistle Pottery. We are close to both Charlottesville and Harrisonburg. We are in a relatively 'remote' location so plan on a drive time of thirty minutes or more. For other activities and attractions check out the Guidebook we send to our registered guests. Approximate travel times generated by mapping services are listed in the Sightseeing section. SNP back country is a 5-10 minute walk from the farm entrance.

HIKING GUIDES:
If you are considering hiking take a look at Hiking Upward. The site has great maps and descriptions of the trails as wells as a great rating system.

AIRPORT:
The nearest airport is the Charlottesville-Albemarle Airport. Rental cars are available at the airport. To reach the farm is an easy half hour drive. A rural transportation service, the Greene County Transit, operates Monday through Saturday.

FARM:
Cair Paravel is a sustainable farm practicing permaculture and applies biodynamic practices to our gardening and animal husbandry. We pasture raise our  critters, supplementing their diet with Sunrise Farms soy-free non-GMO feed. The hogs and lambs are processed by a USDA inspected abattoir. We send our registered guests a Farm a link to our website prior to their arrival. Additional local sources for farm raised food are listed in the Guidebook. We provide a self-guided Farm Tour for our registered guests. Guided hands-on Farm Tours are available April-October. More information and reservation information is on the website.

POOL and HOT TUB
A short walk from Tumnus House will bring you to a seasonal salt water swimming pool (Memorial Day through Labor Day) and year-round hot tub that is shared by all Cair Paravel Farm residents and guests. We send our confirmed guests a link to our website where you can find information about:

description.house_rules:
SHORT VERSION
Non-smokers only. No smoking or vaping on property
No parties, registered guests only, no third party rentals

We are on a mountain and surrounded by open land and forests. There are wild animals and insects. Please use care and caution. Consult the Shenandoah National Park Safety Guidelines for additional information.

DURING YOUR VISIT
Please remove your footwear upon entering the house.
Children must be under adult supervision at all times.
Please use the compost and recycling containers.
Blankets, quilts, pots and pans are to be used only inside the building.
Do not enter the pastures, barn or farming areas without a member of the Cair Paravel Farm Family.

POOL and HOT TUB
No lifeguard on duty. Use at your own risk.
No food or glass is allowed in the area.
Please put away any materials you have used.
Pool and Hot Tub close at 10:00 PM
No outdoor amplified music.
Children must be under adult supervision at all times.

PRIVACY and QUIET
Farm Quiet time 10:00 PM- 8:00 AM
Please respect the privacy of our neighbors and other guests on the property. 
No drones or surveillance tools allowed. We are a No Fly Zone. 

CHECK OUT
Consult the Check-out guidelines in the House Manual for specifics. Clean all dishes and areas you have used. Put away the clean dishes. Place used linens and towels in the tub. 
Check-out is at 11:00 AM at the main farmhouse. You can pay for any products you may have purchased with (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN), credit card, cash, or check.

PROBLEMS: Please contact us immediately if you encounter any problems with the yurt, have an accident, or damage anything. We will do our best to resolve the issue but we really need to know about it immediately in order to do so.

LONG VERSION
In order to maintain insurance our insurance company requires an Assumption of Risk – Release of Liability & Indemnification Agreement as specified in the agreement below. We apologize in advance for length and wordiness.

SHORT TERM RENTAL AGREEMENT  

This short-term rental agreement is between Cair Paravel Enterprises, LLC (hereafter “Cair Paravel”), the landlord, and the Primary Guest specified in the Airbnb reservation request (hereafter referred to as “Primary Guest”).

By making this Airbnb reservation the Primary Guest accepts this short term rental agreement.

The dates of this agreement are the reservation dates. Incorporated by reference into this short term rental agreement is the accommodation address and owner information in the House Manual in this Airbnb listing.

Check-in date: Per Airbnb reservation 
Check-in time: 3:00 PM - 6:00 PM EST

Check-out date: Per Airbnb reservation 
Check-out time: 11:00 AM EST

Assumption of Risk – Release of Liability & Indemnification Agreement:
By signing this Agreement, you are aware of and assume the risk for yourself, any children, and for all guests or invitees during your stay at Cair Paravel. Cair Paravel is not responsible for any accidents caused by Guest and all individuals in Guest’s party. You also agree to indemnify and hold harmless Cair Paravel from any and all liability resulting from harm or injury caused by Guest and all individuals in Guest’s party using Cair Paravel’s pool and/or spa and equipment.
By completing the Airbnb reservation the Primary Guest acknowledges and agrees to comply with this agreement.

Additionally, Primary Guest shall comply with the following requests and/or instructions:


LODGING CONDITION/DAMAGE: Primary Guest is responsible for ensuring that the accommodation is maintained in a good, clean, and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. Primary Guest shall be liable for any damages caused by his or her own acts and omissions (including without limitation failure to timely vacate the accommodation) and also for the acts and omissions of any individuals that Primary Guest invites or otherwise allows into the accommodation.
- The Guests shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above normal wear and tear.

DOGS: Dog dogs allow with approval prior to arrival. Pet fee applies. You are liable for any dog(s) damage to the unit. We take before and after photos for all bookings with pets. Dog must be leashed while walking around the property. Please pick up all poop that is not in woods. 

ADDITIONAL GUESTS: People other than those listed in the Airbnb reservation may not visit or stay overnight in or on the property. Any other person in or on the property is the sole responsibility of the Primary Guest. The Guests shall not sublet the property.

APPLIANCES: Only use appliances for their intended uses. Guests are advised that the property may contain a gas stove and cook top, gas heating, gas grill, and other gas powered items and will seek help from Cair Paravel if the proper operation of such items is not fully understood.

DEFECTS/DAMAGE: Immediately notify the landlord of any defects or dangerous conditions in and about the premises of which the Guests becomes aware.

ACCIDENT/ILLNESS: Cair Paravel is not responsible for any accidents, injuries or illness that occurs while on the premises or in its facilities. Cair Paravel is not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the guests. It is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premise.

PEACE AND QUIET: Guests and landlord are entitled to quiet enjoyment of the premises. Guests will not create a nuisance by annoying, disturbing, inconveniencing, or interfering with the quiet enjoyment and peace and quiet of landlord or any other nearby residents and guests.

NATURE TRAIL: Disclaimer: Although every effort has been made to present accurate details of trail conditions, due to changes by man and nature we expressly disclaim any legal responsibility for the conditions of any trail. Hikers assume the risks inherent in this outdoor activity and must respect the legal and safety guidelines for a safe visit. Good judgment, common sense, proper gear and clothing, and careful planning should prevent any mishaps on the nature trail. If you encounter ant wildlife move away from it. Do not try to feed, pet, capture or kill it.

FARM ANIMALS: Do not enter the barn or fenced areas without a member Cair Paravel Farm. Children must be accompanied by and under the direct supervision of an adult, not a Cair Paravel employee, at all times. Be aware that all fences may be electrified and produce a great shock. We are very concerned with the safety of our guests and animals. It is important for us to maintain the integrity and health of our flocks and herds. We have Great Pyrenees guard dogs in the pastures with our animals. They would like to be pets, but are working dogs and as such will protect the “herd” as much as necessary. The other livestock are not pets. Although they are domesticated there are risks that are inherent with any interaction with livestock. Our apiary is located in the middle pasture within the perimeter electrified pasture fence close to the solar array at the main farmhouse in a separate enclosure. Please do not disturb them or get in their flight path. If you have allergies please remember to bring materials that have been prescribed for you by your physician. 

FIREPLACE: The fireplace is a non-vented propane gas log fired firebox.  Please do not throw any paper or other combustible materials in the fireplace.   Fireplaces are turned off from Mid- April to early October; they are not operational during this time of the year.

FIREPIT/CHIMERA: Some accommodations have an area for an open fire. Burn only dry seasoned wood. Keep fires small and controlled.  Do NOT bring in wood to the farmstead or collect it from the surrounding area. Do NOT use gasoline, kerosene, diesel fuel, lighter fluid or alcohol to light or relight fires. If you are inexperienced in lighting and maintaining an outdoor fire ask Cair Paravel for assistance. No outdoor fires during restricted time, dry weather with fire danger, and windy days. Use in accordance with all applicable local, state and national codes. Extinguish all fire and coals prior to leaving the open flame. Never leave open flame unattended.

WATER AND SEPTIC: Cair Paravel is on a well and septic systems.  During a drought, please be judicious of your water use.  Make certain the dishwasher is full or do the dishes by hand. The septic system is very effective; however, it will clog up if improper material is flushed.  DO NOT FLUSH anything other than toilet paper.  No feminine products should be flushed at anytime.  If it is found that feminine products have been flushed and clog the septic system, you could be charged damages of up to $500.

ACCESS: Mountain roads can be curvy and steep. Gravel drives are well maintained; however, we highly recommend four wheel drive and/or chains during the snow months. We do not refund due to road conditions. We follow the AirBnB weather exemption clauses.
WEATHER CONDITIONS: We have found that wunderground provides a fairly reliable weather forecast for our area. The zip code is 22973. There you can also find historical weather records if you are wondering what kind of weather is usual for the time you will be visiting. 
STORM POLICY/ROAD CONDITIONS: No refunds will be given for storms. If your vacation is during the winter months, please come prepared to drive in snow and/or ice to reach your rental property. We recommend all wheel or 4-wheel drive vehicles. We do not refund due to road conditions. We do not provide towing or roadside assistance.
UP TO DATE ROAD CONDITIONS: The Virginia Department of Transportation maintains a Road Conditions Table at 511 VA
WINTER CONDITIONS: Guests are notified that this home is in a mountain location where winter conditions may apply. Walkways, driveways, sidewalks, stairs, trails, etc… may be slippery due to ice and snow. These areas may be slippery even when they do not appear to be. It is advised that caution be used. Please step carefully on all outdoor surfaces. It is further advised that shoes be removed upon entering the home as wet or icy soles can cause slippery conditions on tile or wood floors inside the home. 

INSPECTION- The Owner has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Guests violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Guests waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental period. The Guests shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement. The Guests shall leave the premises in a ready to rent condition at the expiration of the rental agreement, defined by the Owner as being immediately habitable by the next guests. Guests shall pay for maintenance and repairs should the premises be left in a lesser condition.

POOL/SPA SAFETY

You are responsible for the safety of yourself, your children (if any), and all guests in your party.
Guest acknowledges that the safety of all adults and children depends on the Guest. The Cair Paravel’s pool is fenced or gated and there is no alarm on any entrance to the pool area. The gates should remain latched or chained at all times. *NOTE: There is to be NO Glassware allowed in or near the pool and spa. Do not put any scents, oils or additives in the hot tub. If you do use additives the hot tub will have to be drained and the filters replaced. You will be charged for the time the hot tub is unavailable as well as for the labor and materials needed to make the tub operational as well.

SUPERVISION: Your attentive supervision is absolutely required to avoid risk of serious injury and/or death. Pools and spas are serious safety risks and hazards – including injury and death – if not used with attentive care and caution.

CHILD SAFETY: Children who are not toilet trained may not use the pool or spa/hot tub unless they are wearing swim diapers. Never leave a child unsupervised near a pool, not even for a second. During social gatherings at or near the pool, appoint a designated adult to protect young children from pool accidents. Children must be watched closely while swimming. Do not use floatation devices as a substitute for supervision. Toys can entice young children into the pool area. When not in use, clear the pool area of all toys.

CHEMICALS: You hereby agree and accept the pool and spa contain necessary chemicals that can cause skin rashes, harm or discoloration of swimwear. Guest and all individuals in Guest’s party including guests and invitees agree they use the pool and spa completely at their own risk.

There is NO LIFEGUARD on duty at any time. There is absolutely NO diving allowed- even in the deeper areas. (Diving into shallow water can cause serious injury, paralysis or even death.) There is also NO running near or around the pool or spa areas. 

SPA: Please avoid immersion in the spa for prolonged periods of time. According to APSP “No young child should be allowed in a hot tub until they can stand on the bottom and have their head remain completely out of the water. Children who are big enough to be in a hot tub should not use it for more than five minutes at a time, especially at the maximum temperature of 104 degrees.” DO NOT STAND ON THE HOT TUB COVERS.  Hot tub covers are for insulation purposes and are not designed to support a person or persons.  They will break and you may be charged for replacement. Remember when not using the hot tub, leave cover on so hot tub will stay warm. If you adjust the temperature of the spa/hot tub return it to 102 degrees when you leave.

ALCOHOL USE IN POOL AND SPA: Consuming alcoholic beverages and/or drugs and use of the pool or spa can be dangerous and cause serious health risks. Also, excessive drinking in or near the pool and/or spa may result in behavior that may cause serious physical accidents.

name: Adorable Cottages on Sheep Farm in Free Union
title: Free Union, Virginia

gallery.caption: Our sheep grazing by our tiny office.
Second cottage office with 2 additional futons.
2nd cottage/office with two futons for additional guests.
Resident Babydoll sheep, Eddie and Teddy.
View of the Blue Ridge Mountains from the house.
View of the Blue Ridge Mountains from the house.
Our trail in the woods on our property.
Nearby country road (2 min away). A perfect place to bike, run, hike, or play in the creek.
Sugar Hollow swimming hole (20 mi n away). We can provide transportation, water and a packed lunch for a small fee. Or just venture out on your own.
Sample breakfast: pastel de nata and seasonal fruits. Served with coffee or tea.
Sample breakfast: mushroom and cheese omlette served with seasonal fruits and coffee or tea.

hosts.about: I like to go outside everyday no matter the weather.  Raising livestock requires you to be outside everyday in the snow, rain, heat and sunshine. I've learned to appreciate all the exciting sensations  of nature even if it means that I shiver a little.

recent.comments: We had a great time at Chi's cottages! The two units were very quaint and well-kept. The property was gorgeous, and Chi was a great host. She cooked us two delicious breakfasts with homegrown fruits, and she left us some food to feed the sheep.  The stay was very comfortable and the views were amazing. Highly recommend.

items.comments: We had a great time at Chi's cottages! The two units were very quaint and well-kept. The property was gorgeous, and Chi was a great host. She cooked us two delicious breakfasts with homegrown fruits, and she left us some food to feed the sheep.  The stay was very comfortable and the views were amazing. Highly recommend.

My friends and I couldn’t stop talking about how much we adored the property and host after checking out and mentioned the possibility revisiting for different season! 

We wish we could’ve stayed longer to take advantage of the surrounding areas because there appears to be plenty of nature-y activities.

Definitely a great place to decompress from city life and meet charming dogs and sheep!

This was such a fun experience and stay. The animals were very cute and the views were lovely. Chi was an excellent host, we highly recommend taking advantage of her food offerings, as everything we tried was delicious.

Chi was such a gracious host. The forrest farm was so peaceful. We had so much fun spending time with the sheep, chicken and bunnies. Chi brought a delicious homemade breakfast to our cottage in the morning. Great local recommendations to a nearby winery. Thank you for your time preparing breakfast and showing us the animals.

This farm stay is a lovely countryside getaway nestled in the foothills of the Shenandoah. Seeing sheep grazing in the field with those mountains in the background was truly a beautiful sight to wake up to.

Chi and her husband were gracious hosts with a deep knowledge of the area, and lots of good recommendations on places to visit. Hiking at Moormans River was definitely a highlight!

Finally, I would be remiss not to mention the delicious breakfast. Underneath her humble and unassuming airs, Chi is a master chef. I would come back again for that breakfast alone.

Thanks for a great stay!

description.summary:
Enjoy the breathtaking views of the Blue Ridge Mountains on this 26 acre Olde English Babydoll Sheep farm right from your window.  Our farm is a haven of peace and serenity in a secluded but centrally located area just 18 miles northwest of Charlottesville.

Wake up to delicious farm fresh eggs and pastries from our eco-friendly farm. Take adorable pictures of sheep grazing on rolling hills. Hike our private trail. Breathe in the fresh mountain airs.  Sleep in. Slow down. Relax.
description.space:
This listing comes with two sweet cottages that can accommodate up to four guests. Children and infants are always welcome.  Let us know in advance if you need a crib set up.

The first cottage has a double bed and full bath. There are west facing and east facing windows so you can celebrate and enjoy both the sunset and sunrise each day from the comfort of your bed. You can draw the curtains if  you prefer to sleep in.

There is a small cupboard which has protein bars, chips, cookies and a cooler of cold drinks, and yogurt. There is also a small dresser.

Please note that the bathroom is connected to a septic system which contains living organisms that digest and process waste. Do not put harsh chemicals, antibacterial soaps, or grease down the drain or toilet. Do not flush paper towels, sanitary products, etc, basically anything that isn't toilet paper.

Across the driveway is the second cottage which can be used as a remote workspace or office. There are two single futons in this cottage to accommodate additional guests.  We love the large floor to ceiling picture window which reveals our meditation pond and the Blue Ridge Mountains in the distance.

Both cottages are light-filled with beautiful views of rolling hills, and mountains. 

This is a working farm. We live and work on this farm. While we respect your privacy, you may see us working outside, and our animals grazing in the fields, and by the cottages. Our focus has been designing a creative, inspiring, and functional space for our guests, while maintaining a sustainable agricultural operation.

We have a zipline and treehouse in the woods. Zipline use is at your own risk.

There is no kitchen. We will provide a  farm breakfast on request free of charge.

description.neighborhood:
Free Union is a census-designated place (CDP) in Albemarle County, Virginia, United States, ten miles north-northwest of Charlottesville. It is a very small hamlet entirely rural in character. 

The village was originally referred to as Nicksville after a free slave blacksmith named Nick, who opened a blacksmith's shop there in the early 19th century. When a post office was established in 1847, it was given the name of Free Union to avoid confusion with Nixville, another post office in the county. The name was taken from that of the Free Union Church, which had been built in 1837 and is still operating as the Free Union Baptist Church. The church was "free" in that all races were welcome to worship there, and it was a "union" of four denominations of Christianity, none of which could have afforded a church of their own at that time.

description.summary: Dutch Country Acres
description.space:
Overview:

Dutch Country Acres is located in beautiful Lancaster County, PA. It is a charmingly remodeled farmhouse that sleeps 16, complete with a mother-in-law suite. You'll love being close to all the food and shopping that Lancaster county offers, yet having the option of spending quiet days in at our sparkling clean and tastefully decorated rental that provides a calm and relaxing atmosphere.

We have a fully equipped kitchen, dining room, and cozy living room. The main house has four bedrooms, and three and half bath. The master bedroom has a queen bed, and an attached area with a single bed, another room with a queen bed, and the last on has two sets of single bunks, and one set of single over full bunks. There is an attached mother-in-law suite that has one bedroom with queen bed, a full bathroom, a kitchenette, and a living area with a sleeper sofa. The basement has a nice game area with ping pong and corn hole and plenty of open space for your games. The deck offers lovely views of the grounds and farmyard. There is a marked and maintained walking trail on the property that meanders through the beautiful farmland.

If your check-out date falls on a Sunday, we offer free 6:00 PM Sunday checkout. It's our way of saying thank you.

IMPORTANT INFORMATION:

- We kindly ask that there are no fireworks, loud music, alcohol (with the exception of wine).

- Check-in is at 3:00 PM and check-out is at 10:00 AM.
description.house_rules:
Dear guest,
Welcome to Lancaster County PA 
I’ve carefully curated this house manual to include everything you need to know about during your visit. Please look over this prior to your arrival.
You’ll be staying at:
[15 Church Rd New Providence PA ]
If you have questions about your visit, what you’re looking for is likely included here. If not, feel free to reach out via Airbnb messages. I am always here to serve you and ensure your stay is great!
Blessings,
John Troyer Jr. 
Sandpiper Homestays LLC

- We kindly ask that there are no fireworks, loud music, alcohol (with the exception of wine).  

CHECK-IN TIME
Check-in time is any time after 3 pm. That’s because before you arrive, we need to ensure our previous guests have checked out, that the cleaning service and maintenance has been through the unit, and that linens and towels are fresh and ready for your visit. All this takes time and needs to be done before you check in. Due to this tight timeframe, we don’t allow early check-ins, however we do make exceptions whenever possible if arranged beforehand. We apologize for any inconvenience.

PARKING
Dutch Country Acres is a stand alone unit; therefore, you will be the only guests on the premises during your stay. There is sufficient parking on the blacktop driveway by the barn. 

ENTERING THE PROPERTY
From the parking area, follow the sidewalk to the front door. Press the Yale button, then 9292 then the check mark.  

HOUSE RULES
● We do not allow parties in the home.
● Pets are allowed if arrangements are prior. 
•Please do not enter bedrooms that will not be used during your stay. We want to keep them clean for the next guests.
● No smoking on premises. 
● No illegal substances are allowed.
● No food or drinks in the bedrooms.
● No candles or other open flames.
● Please turn off most of the lights when you leave. Leave a few lights on.
● Please take off your shoes when inside the home.
● Please be sure to put all trash in the barrels by the garage and the road! 
● Please close and lock all windows and doors when you leave the property.
● Please only throw toilet paper in the toilet; there is a trash can beside it for everything else.
● If you break or damage something, please let us know and together we can arrange for its replacement or repair.

LINENS
If you need any additional towels or sheets during your stay, feel free to use the washer and dryer whenever needed.
● Bath Towels: You can find the extra bath towels in each of the bathrooms. 
● Sheets: There are extra sheets and linens in the closets for that specific bed. 
● Kitchen Towels: Kitchen towels are in a drawer in the kitchen. 

TV
• There is a smart no TV in the unit. (We encourage family time) 
• Washer and dryer: Feel free to use the washer and dryer. Detergent and fabric softener are provided. 

CONTACT DETAILS
Feel free to reach out if you have any questions or requests via Airbnb messaging.
DEPARTURE
• Please make sure the dishes are cleaned before you leave.
• Please put all wet towels and wash clothes in the clothes bag in the bathroom. DO NOT PUT THEM ON BEDS!
• Please strip the beds that were used and put the sheets on a pile on the beds.
• When you leave, please make sure the temp is set at 72 degrees. 
If you need anything at all before or during your stay, feel free to reach out via Airbnb app and I’ll be available to help! I look forward to welcoming you to rural PA. Thanks, and enjoy your stay.

Blessings,
Den,
Sandpiper Homestays LLC Management

description.space:
The Loft is a spacious studio apartment located above our detached garage. Featuring unique architecture and plentiful skylights letting in the natural light. King size bed, sitting area, dining area and kitchenette with Mini Fridge, Microwave, Toaster Oven, and Hot Plate. Keurig coffee pot as well as traditional drip and a pour over option. We provide coffee and creamer. 

We do not have TV as we would rather you focus on connection. There is a jet pack hotspot for WiFi connection and a Bose Radio/CD player. 

We are exited to offer our newly completed (Spring 2022) backyard Garden Patio for our guests.  Relax and enjoy your coffee in the peaceful Amish countryside listening to the birds and the soothing sound of the water fountain, watching the Amish buggies go by. Curl up in the egg chair with a good book. Eat your chicken bbq from our Amish neighbors at the bistro set. Bask in the golden sunset roasting s’mores over the tabletop fireplace or if you prefer the crackling ambiance of wood, there’s that option too. A truly gorgeous relaxing spot to relax in tranquil Amish country. PLEASE NOTE the backyard Garden Patio is a shared space with guests that may have booked The Cottage over your same dates. 

Over two dozen purifying house plants as well as the soft glow of a Himalayan salt lamp and bubbling fountain add to the ambience. 

I am all about natural health so you will not find air fresheners or strong scented candles in my units. 

You can rest assured we strive for spotless cleanliness. In the unit you will find a high quality air purifier so you can feel completely safe staying in our space.   

More about the space…The Loft was once the hayloft for Ammon’s Amish grandfather whose horse and buggy were housed below. Ammon who works in construction, turned it into a lovely open sanctuary with nine skylights and eight windows.

Famous Amish cooking restaurants such as Bird In Hand Family Restaurant, Miller’s Smorgasbord, Dienner’s Country Restaurant and Katie’s Kitchen are all nearby for your enjoyment and convenience.
