description.summary:
Welcome to the Stone House at Beaver Creek located in beautiful Lancaster County.

This historical home built in 1840 has been fully renovated with all modern conveniences. It boasts 3 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms, 1 half bath, and sleeps up to 8 guests. It is fully furnished throughout with everything you'll need for a relaxing stay or family vacation.

Come and relax in the cool breeze on Beaver Creek or kick back with a book. Enjoy the beautiful views, peace, and tranquility.
description.space:
The Fisher family, who reside on the Amish  farm across the street, are the proud owners and caretakers of this charming residence. Originally constructed in 1840 by early settlers seeking to establish themselves near Martinsville Village and Beaver Creek, this two-story dwelling was crafted from creek bed stone and surrounded by farmland. The rich soil, plentiful timber, water sources, and wildlife helped the settlers thrive.

Notably, it is one of the few surviving structures from the area's earliest days, with the original well still standing beside it, thoughtfully safeguarded to prevent accidents. 

During the 1890s, the Pennsylvania Railroad Company laid tracks through the villages and farms using eminent domain. The route remained active for nearly a century until its removal in the 1980s. The land was gradually returned to the farming families, and the Stone House's property was the last to be repurchased this year. The bridge supports in the creek behind the home and the graded earth where the tracks once lay are a reminder of the railroad's presence.

In the 1950s, an extension containing a kitchen and dining room was added to the Stone House, and in 2020, it underwent a complete renovation. After serving as a private vacation residence for two years, it was purchased by Isaac and Linda Fisher.

The Fishers extend a warm welcome to visitors and are available to assist with any needs that may arise during your stay.
description.access: Guests have access to the property except for the nearby sheds. Beaver Creek is also accessible during times of low water but please be mindful of the steep slopes and slippery rocks. If the water is high or running fast please do not attempt to ford the stream. Fishing is allowed if you obtain a Pennsylvania fishing license. Please always be vigilant and take the highest safety precautions.
description.notes:
Bedrooms 2 and 3 on the 2nd floor are small as this is located in the original stone house. The Master bedroom has ample room. 

From time to time, the Fisher family may need to access the basement of the home. However, the egress is outside so they will enter from the cellar doors and leave you undisturbed. 

In addition, locals will sometimes fish on Beaver Creek. The bridge serves as a public access point. They will remain on the creek and not enter the property. If there is every a problem, please let us know.
description.neighborhood: Located in Rural Lancaster County on Big Beaver Creek. Resides on a quite road with a few neighbors and farms.
description.transit: The gravel driveway has enough parking for 4 vehicles.
description.interaction: We are here to help if you need anything but will leave you to your privacy. Please reach out to Joshua, the property manager at the posted numbers or through Airbnb. In case of emergency always dial 911. The local fire department is only minutes away.
description.house_rules:
1.	Quiet hours: Between 10 pm and 7 am. Please be considerate of our neighbors.

2.	Access: Guests are allowed access to the property with the exception of the barns.

3.	Alcohol: Wine and beer consumption is allowed on the property in moderation. No hard alcohol (liquors, whiskey, bourbons, etc.) No drunkenness.

4.	Drugs: No drugs or illegal substances on any kind, including marijuana.

5.	Smoking: Allowed outside only. NO smoking in the home. Do not dispose of buds on the ground. A $200 cleaning fee will be assessed for violation of this policy.

6.	Behavior: No foul language, inappropriate, lewd, or provocative behavior. Please dress modestly.

7.	Trash: Please dispose of trash and pet waste in appropriate containers.

8.	Pets: We have a No Pets policy unless it is a certified service animal. However, we will consider requests on a case by case basis. Sorry, due to allergens and cleaning cats are not allowed.

name: Log cabin w/ Mtn Views & Private Pool
title: New Market, Virginia

gallery.caption: Basement room with air mattress set up, gym equipment and piano.
Air mattress set up and piano

hosts.about: I am the owner & operator of One House One Home, LLC! We are a small business based out of Basye, VA that focuses on Vacation Rental Management. All of our listings have different owners who started this journey to share their happy place with others. Our mission is to make your stay as peaceful and stress-free as possible with fully stocked homes, quick communication and more!

recent.comments: We had a great time staying here. Plenty of room and great surroundings. Very easy to relax and spend time with the family. We spent the morning antiquing, the afternoons by the pool, and movie nights using the projector screen in the basement. The nearby caverns were fantastic as well.

items.comments: We had a great time staying here. Plenty of room and great surroundings. Very easy to relax and spend time with the family. We spent the morning antiquing, the afternoons by the pool, and movie nights using the projector screen in the basement. The nearby caverns were fantastic as well.

The place was great overall and the host and co-host were very responsive and proactive! The pool and outdoor amenities were incredible and worth the price! Very clean and spacious! The place was mostly private, but we were not aware in advance that the driveway was shared and went to other properties past this property, which scared us at first. I think this Airbnb will continue to get better and better as they continue to host!
We had a great time. House was open and had plenty of space for our group. Pool was fun. Location is wonderful. The house could use more upkeep. Overall we had a great time.

Brooke's place was described just like the description along with looking just like the pictures. We thoroughly enjoyed the pool and being in a private area with beautiful surroundings. We had 10 people with us and it was roomy enough for everyone but would have liked to of had more furniture on the first floor so everyone could have sit together or at least not on the floor. Overall, would stay at Brooke's place again.

It was a pleasure working with Brooke and Kim for our vacation stay. They went out of their way to help with our perfume sensitivities, cleaning the house and bedding with unscented products prior to our arrival.
The house was ideal for our family of eight with plenty of privacy for all, and a beautiful private setting. We came for the hiking but found other attractions such as paddle boarding at Lake Laura, evening swims in the pool and music by the fire pit, visiting the Caverns and a fun eclectic general store, John Henrys, which kept us in vintage puzzles and wholesome snacks.
Highly recommend this airbnb for an active family.
Very enjoyable!

Loved this house. Plenty of room for 6 adults spending weekend together for a family birthday. Beds and linens were comfortable and clean. Cozy throws on couches too making it feel just like home. Plenty of quality towels and wash clothes. Kitchen well stocked with basics including a crock pot. Fridge in garage was perfect for overflow drink items from kitchen. We bought plastic cups to avoid washing glasses all weekend. Home could use two more table height chairs for dining table but we just used bar stools and made it work. There is even a small fridge at the pool that we used for keeping drink while we swam. Dogs loved the yard and we felt safe having them in the yard. Beautiful weekend in a great house.

description.summary: This home is located in the heart of the Shenandoah Valley.  Come enjoy peaceful and serene mountain views, beautiful sunrises, and breathtaking starry night skies. Enjoy as a single family or bring multiple friends/families. This home is spacious and perfect for large gatherings.
description.space:
Shenandoah Caverns: 10 minutes
Luray Caverns: 45 minutes
Bryce Resort: 25 minutes
Lake Laura: 25 minutes
James Madison University: 30 minutes
Eastern Mennonite University: 30 minutes 
Skyline Drive/Shenandoah National Park: 35 minutes
Massanutten Resort: 45 minutes

***This home is pet friendly therefore we do not recommend guests book if you have extreme allergies to dogs or cats. We do our best to ensure the home is adequately cleaned between each guest but cannot guarantee all pet hair be removed from the home.

This is a spacious home with plenty of space both indoors and out. The main floor has an open floor plan, front and back porches, oversized main bedroom with a king size bed, closet and full bath, and a half bath off of the pantry. The second floor has a balcony overlooking the living room, 3 bedrooms, and a full bath. The basement has large open spaces for family games and watching movies, as well as an office space, laundry room, and and extra room for additional sleeping accommodations (1 queen air mattress suppled). The basement door leads to the pool, fire pit, and decorative fish pond. Many spaces are available to relax, read, or enjoy bird watching. The pool has a bar area for family entertaining. The backyard has a basketball goal and room for many yard games (cornhole and ladder ball is provided). The horse barn is available by request only.

We have well water at the property with a small Brita pitcher for use. We would recommend that you bring bottled water and bagged ice if you are not comfortable drinking well water during your stay.
description.access: Guests will have access to the home, garage, and surrounding spacious yard. The pool is open mid-May to late September. The horse barn has 3 stalls and 2 turnouts available by request.
description.notes:
We are dog friendly and love allowing guests to bring their pets along with them. We do have some breed restrictions for insurance purposes. Those include the following: 
Akita, American Staffordshire Terrier (Pit Bull), Chow, Presa Canario, Pit Bull, Rottweiler, Shar-pei, Wolf Hybrid or any mixed predominantly with a listed breed

The horse barn has 3 stalls and 2 turnouts available for your horse(s). There is an additional fee of $50 per horse/night. A wheelbarrow and pitch fork are provided and guests are required to clean the barn/stalls after their stay. Additional onsite property is not available for riding but the area does have options for public horse trails.
description.neighborhood: This home is located in a quiet country setting. Nearby neighbors are friendly and are private in nature. Many attractions are nearby and the home is not far from grocery and convenience stores.
description.transit:
The property has ample parking space and includes access to a 2 car garage. The driveway is shared, so you will see other vehicles on the driveway passing to get to homes located behind the property. 

The home is minutes from Rt. 11 and I-81, 2.5 hours from Washington DC, 30 minutes from Harrisonburg, 50 minutes from Winchester, and 20 minutes from Luray. 

Nearby attractions include museums, caverns, golf courses, wineries, breweries, orchards, skyline drive, covered bridge, rivers, fishing, and much more.
description.interaction: We are not physically on the property but only 30 minutes away if any issues arise. We try to tend to such matters in a timely fashion to keep your trip running smoothly therefore are available via phone at any time.
description.house_rules: We ask that you do not use the wood stove located in the basement. There are propane heaters in the basement, a wood burning fireplace on the main floor and central heating upstairs for use instead.

name: Luxury Cabin on Secluded Mountain Ridge--Sleeps 14
title: Fairhope, Pennsylvania

gallery.caption: Primary Bath off Primary Bedroom on Main Level

recent.comments: This place was great!  My large family enjoyed staying here and everyone had their own bed, and we had plenty of room and seating in the house, on the  porch and around the fire pit to sit and visit. We enjoyed walking the trails on the property. The kitchen had everything we needed to prepare meals while we were there.  And the game room was fun!  We stopped at  a maple sugar camp and store that was close by and visited Meyersdale and Flight 93 Memorial, both of which were about 30 minutes away.  It was a beautiful property for our family to reconnect and spend time together for a few days.

items.comments: This place was great!  My large family enjoyed staying here and everyone had their own bed, and we had plenty of room and seating in the house, on the  porch and around the fire pit to sit and visit. We enjoyed walking the trails on the property. The kitchen had everything we needed to prepare meals while we were there.  And the game room was fun!  We stopped at  a maple sugar camp and store that was close by and visited Meyersdale and Flight 93 Memorial, both of which were about 30 minutes away.  It was a beautiful property for our family to reconnect and spend time together for a few days.

A great place for large families/ groups! 
Actually more spacious than appears in pictures. Truly peaceful. Very private, but does not feel isolated. Lots of usable outdoor lawn space. Corn hole provided; bring your own balls or other outdoor games. Great fire ring (didn’t get at round to using, but would be fun!) 
Huge front porch for reading.  All ages enjoyed the foosball, table shuffleboard, & checkers table. We never turned tv on,  but if you like movies there are literally 2 bins of dvds! Tracy was lovely to work with  and very responsive!

Tracy's place is fantastic and she was an excellent host. We held a small family wedding on their beautiful grounds for our guests, and the place was perfect for us. The location is beautiful and peaceful, and the house was comfortable, spacious, and exactly as advertised. The kitchen was well stocked, and everything was spotless. We would definitely stay here again, and couldn't have asked for a better weekend. Also, the descriptor 'rather large' does not do their movie collection justice!
Beautiful location, very responsive host, and incredibly clean cabin!
The home was a beautiful place to stay.  Lots of space and the game room was a hit.
Great syay! would definitely come back.

Absolutely wonderful home and beyond responsive host! We booked Tracy’s home with 2 other couples and their children. We didn’t know what to expect given that 6 adults and 6 children would be under one roof for a whole long weekend. Immediately upon arrival, the home surpassed our expectations. It was spacious and had more than enough room for our group. The basement was filled with movies and games (corn hole, shuffle board, huge checkers and more). The fire pit out back was a major hit for everyone, especially the kiddos who got to try s’mores for the first time! The home was fairly close to Seven Springs and we were able to take the kids there for 2 of the days during our stay. We couldn’t have asked for more! Great home, amazing and gracious host and an insanely peaceful property. Thank you Tracy!

description.summary: Located on 90 acres of a secluded mountain ridge, our 3000 sq.ft. log home is your perfect luxury vacation destination!  Located between the quaint towns of Bedford and Somerset, we are close to  many area attractions including Mountain Ridge ATV Park, Shawnee State Park, Flight #93 Memorial and so much more!
description.space:
Our log home sleeps 14 and contains 4 BRs plus a loft, and 3 full baths. The main level has a LR, DR, fully equipped kitchen, laundry room and primary BR with a king bed and private bath. The second floor has a BR with queen bed, a bunk room with 2 twin bunks (sleeps 4) and a queen bed, plus a loft area with a queen bed. All 2nd floor sleeping areas share a full bath on 2nd floor. The daylight lower level has a family room / game room with foosball, shuffleboard, TV and DVD/Blue Ray player, a BR with a queen bed, and a full bath.  The rear yard has a deck with a gas grill and picnic table and a  fire pit area. The covered front porch has rocking chairs and a porch swing with endless mountain views. Be sure to hike the trail to our private sunset vista!

We’re so happy that you are considering a stay with us. We hope that you’ll have a great time and make many memories during your stay. Our home has all of the amenities you need for a wonderful vacation including clean bedding and dish rags/towels, however you will need to bring bath towels and toiletries. It’s our pleasure to serve you and provide a wonderful experience for you and your family. Once you book your vacation, we will send you a more complete list of items included to help you plan your stay.

Please note that AT&T does NOT have service on our ridge. Verizon DOES have coverage. We do have a house phone for use during your stay. 

For winter rentals, four-wheel drive is HIGHLY recommended. We do have a contract with a snow plower; however, depending on the amount of snow, it may be necessary to cancel or postpone your arrival with a full refund. If you are at the home when a large storm hits, we will make every effort to get the lane plowed for your departure. If it’s necessary to stay any extra days, there will be no charge for the extra days until the lane is able to be opened. We will be watching the weather and will be in touch with you throughout your trip. 

Wi-Fi is for email and basic internet only, not for streaming movies. We do have TVs, DVD and blue ray players in each bedroom and the lower level family room, along with a rather large selection of movies to choose from. Please note, this is not by choice; however no other internet is currently available in our area. So plan to unplug as much as possible and enjoy the beauty of the land! 

Cancellation Policy: We request 50% deposit at booking with the remainder due within 30 days of check-in. Full refund provided if cancelled prior to 30 days. After 30 days up until 7 days prior to check-in, 50% refund is provided. No refunds within 7 days of check-in. 

Our family loves to call Mountain Ridge Retreat our second home, and we want our guests to feel the same way.
description.access: Our property is located in a rural area of central Pennsylvania. A four-wheel drive vehicle is needed during winter months. A car is required for your stay and to visit local attractions.
description.neighborhood: Rural, Mountain Ridge, Wooded, Fields
description.house_rules:
We’re so happy that you are considering a stay with us. We hope that you’ll have a great time and make many memories during your stay. Our home has all of the amenities you need for a wonderful vacation. It’s our pleasure to serve you and provide a wonderful experience for you and your family. 

Please note that AT&T does NOT have service on our ridge. Verizon DOES have coverage. We do have a house phone for use during your stay. 

Due to poplar weekend rental requests, we require 7 day rentals to begin on Friday or Sunday.

For winter rentals, we do have a contract with a snow plower; however, depending on the amount of snow, it may be necessary to cancel or postpone your arrival with a full refund. If you are at the home when a large storm hits, we will make every effort to get the lane plowed for your departure. If it’s necessary to stay any extra days, there will be no charge for the extra days until the lane is able to be opened. We will be watching the weather and will be in touch with you throughout your trip. 

Wi-Fi is for email and basic internet only, not for streaming movies. We do have TVs, DVD and blue ray players in each bedroom and the lower level family room, along with a rather large selection of movies to choose from. Please note, this is not by choice; however no other internet is currently available in our area. So plan to unplug as much as possible and enjoy the beauty of the land! 

Cancellation Policy: We request 50% deposit at booking with the remainder due within 30 days of check-in. Full refund provided if cancelled prior to 30 days. After 30 days up until 10 days prior to check-in, 50% refund is provided. No refunds within 10 days of check-in. 

Additional Rules:
1.   No parties or events allowed.
2.   No smoking, hunting, pets, unregistered guests or illegal substances allowed.
3.   ATVs or other motorized sports are prohibited from being driven on the property.
4.   No access to the barn or chicken house, and please observe our property boundaries - no trespassing on neighbors’ land. A map of the property has been provided for your reference.
5.   Please observe check-in and check-out times unless prior arrangements have been made with host.
6.   Wi-Fi is for basic email and internet service only. No streaming of movies or live TV. This will result in an additional charge or loss of some security deposit monies since the Wi-Fi is limited.
7.   Please note that only toilet paper should be flushed in toilets, no feminine hygiene products, or other inorganic materials.
8.   Please enjoy the outside fire pit, but fires in the woodstove are prohibited. All fires must be put OUT at night with water to avoid fire spreading to cabin or the woods.
9.   Please don’t eat or drink in the bedrooms, and please do not place drinks on the shuffle board table.
10. Please take care of the furnishings. You have to pay for damages that exceed the security deposit. 
11. Please don’t rearrange the furniture.
12. Please do your dishes or start the dishwasher before you leave.
13. Please empty trash cans and place bags in outdoor trash bins before you leave.
14. Please empty all food from refrigerator before you leave.
15. Please remove sheets from beds that were used and leave them in the bedroom or bring to the mud room before you leave.

recent.comments: Had a great stay for my friend's bachelor party. The house is beautiful and within easy driving distance of many wineries. Katie was quick to respond to our messages when we were checking in. I will only add that our stay was the first week of August and some recent storms had damaged the grill we planned to use our first night. The kitchen is great and we were still able to cook so no harm, no foul.

items.comments: Had a great stay for my friend's bachelor party. The house is beautiful and within easy driving distance of many wineries. Katie was quick to respond to our messages when we were checking in. I will only add that our stay was the first week of August and some recent storms had damaged the grill we planned to use our first night. The kitchen is great and we were still able to cook so no harm, no foul.

My family and I live in Charlottesville, and Guildford Farm was used as a vacation retreat for visiting family (appx. 12) from the Midwest. The home isn't perfect - sloping floors , some of the furniture (couches/chairs) are a little worn, and the kitchen is starting to show its age... some to be expected given home's age. The pond was rarely usable too with algae (though the wind at times would allow us some fishing). But none of this got in the way of our family truly enjoying the amazing property. We took full advantage of the ping pong and pool and the hot tub (nice and clean).  But perhaps biggest underrated feature of the home is the front porch with nice/new rocking chairs  - when not gathered around the dining room table for dinner or cards, countless hours were wasted here with good conversation and reading. The house is extremely clean and even in the August heat, was VERY cool inside.  The family all agreed our stay was a "home run" and we hope to make a return visit.

We had a wonderful stay at Katie's place! It is a beautiful historic home, perfect for a large group. The large front porch with rocking chairs provided the ideal location for watching a summer storm come up.  :)  Katie was super responsive and gave clear instructions for finding the house. Not too far from Charlottesville, and seemed like there were several cute little towns closer that would have been fun to explore if we had the time. Also only 10 minutes from the airport. Would 100% stay here again!
We had a great stay with our extended family. Katie was very responsive to any issues that came up and we would definitely stay again.

My girlfriends and I had an amazing time staying at Guilford Farm. The home is tastefully decorated and very clean. We really enjoyed the front porch and used it for rocking in the chairs in the evening as well as yoga in the morning. Katie was very responsive and helpful the couple of times I reached out to her during our stay.
The cutest farm house! The beds and linens where so comfortable and very clean. Kitchen came very well stocked with supplies. Lastly Katie was very responsive when we did have a few questions.

We can’t even put into words how beautiful this house and property is. We got married and stayed here with our wedding party. It was a wonderful way to stay connected and feel loved all weekend. You NEED this house if you want stunning scenery, immaculate furniture and decorations, and of course some relaxation. As someone who was born and raised in Virginia, this home really captures all of the beauty Virginia has to offer with a beautiful collection of some Virginia history. Would give 6 stars if I could! Also best host ever!

description.summary: Our home is ideal for families/large groups! Tucked away in the heart of Virginia’s wine country, Guildford Farm welcomes you with cozy rooms, beautiful views, and peaceful relaxation. We are located just 15-30 minutes from local wineries, 20 miles from the University of Virginia, and 10 miles from the Shenandoah National Park.
description.space:
This spaced used to be our family home (and we still gather here from time to time for special occasions!) so please treat it kindly. We ask that you treat our home with as much respect as you would treat your own. If an accident does occur, we ask that you let us know as soon as possible so we can get it taken care of.

Our home was built in the 1790. In 2003, the nearly 8,000 square foot country home was completely restored. The home contains 7 bedrooms, 5 bathrooms, 10 foot ceilings, and a stunning 13 original fireplaces (not suitable for use). During the restoration, the original architecture of the home was meticulously preserved. The inside of the home offers exquisite woodwork, hand-carved mantels and wide heart pine floors. The home is located in the middle of a 100-acre picturesque estate overlooking a 2-acre pond to the East and the majestic Blue Ridge Mountains to the West.

**Please note we are a working farm. Although rare, we do occasionally have lawn maintenance (cutting hay/maintaining the fields) on the property. Additionally, there is an event center on the property that is not included with this listing. This should in no way disrupt your stay as we never book events when our Airbnb is rented it is roughly 150 yards away from the house!*
description.access: Guests will have access to all rooms in the basement, main floor, and second floor. No access to the 3rd floor or barn is permitted.
description.notes:
Sports:
•	John Paul Jones Arena (UVA): 17 miles
•	Scott Stadium (UVA): 20 miles

Hiking and Outdoors:

description.interaction:
•	Help is just around the corner! Our host lives nearby and is part of the host’s family.

•	For all logistical questions, please contact your online host – Katie. Katie will be able to answer all questions related to your stay.
description.house_rules: This is our personal family home, please treat it with respect as you would treat your own home. We understand that accidents happen! We just ask that you let us know as soon as possible so we can act accordingly. No guest access to the barn or 3rd floor of the home.  No use of the fireplaces. No open fires on the premises with the exception of the grill. There is no swimming allowed in the pond due to safety concerns. It is, however, suitable for catch and release fishing!

hosts.about: I teach in TV/Film in Houston and help actors establish themselves in Texas, Louisiana, L.A. and NY. I originally grew up in St.Pete, FL and spent 18 years there, 18 years in Los Angeles and New York, one year in Holland and 18 years in Houston.

recent.comments: We had a great time! Look forward to returning again!

items.comments: We had a great time! Look forward to returning again!

My husband and I loved our stay at Kim & Nico’s place. The cottage was beautiful, clean, and decorated so cute! The AC and pool were so nice to have and kept us cool. Their property is gorgeous and they have well marked trails if you’d like to take a nice evening stroll. Would love to stay again!! Such a cozy and welcoming place to spend a weekend away.
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Gorgeous surroundings! Great hosts. Responded quickly to any questions.

Kim is an amazing host! She gave me clear instructions prior to arrival how to find the cabin and how to check in and what not. The place was as described and the cabin offers lots of sittings which was a big hit for my dogs. The place is absolutely private and quite. One fair warning: the trail gets very bushy in the summer to the point there is no trail! Be aware of the trail condition and get dressed properly.

My husband and I had a wonderful stay at the 1700s summer kitchen. We loved the historic feel of the cottage and the amenities that were provided. We especially enjoyed the view of the landscape from the cottage, the clear night skies, and the peacefulness of the location. We wanted to escape the 4th of July fireworks and this location was excellent for that. Being a film buff, my husband was impressed by the For Your Consideration collection available at the cottage. We would love to return to this Airbnb location in the fall or even make it a yearly tradition.
Kim was a thoughtful and communicative host. We really enjoyed our stay with her and would recommend it to anybody!

yes this place is nice and peaceful. The pool was great. there were condiments left in the the kitchen that were helpful..spices for cooking  and plenty of cook ware to use thank you. There is a walking trail that we tried to find with no luck. overall  peaceful and relaxing..And restaurants and shopping close by. Any, we look forward tofuture visits..

description.summary:
My place is close to historic attractions and quaint towns . You’ll love my place because of the gorgeous outdoors and historic charm . My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids), and furry friends (pets).
** We have wifi. so WFH ( work from home) as you enjoy beautiful setting while work on the go.
Only 20 minutes away from Jefferson's Montecello, also enjoy a large verity of vineyards.  or play golf only ( 5 min) away.
description.space:
Escape and unwind from city life on a beautiful and historic estate just 20 minutes from Charlottesville! Our historic bungalow comfortably fits 2-4 people and is perfect for those who just want to take a step back and enjoy the wonder nature has to offer! 

This cottage was originally the Summer Kitchen for the Main House at Green Springs. The fireplace works wonderfully and has its original hardware!
description.access:
The bungalow is located on a historic 255 acre estate with 2 ponds (one right outside your rental), a creek, and a lake! Feel free to walk around and explore. We have bikes, fishing poles, croquet, a hammock!
Your cottage has the address that is listed on the description, #147
description.notes:
This is a historic home dating around the late 1700's, so it's old! And we want our guests to enjoy all the charm its age brings with it, but we do expect guests to treat the home with care and absolutely no smoking or candles.

Welcome to Green Springs! 

Just a couple of things to mention so you can fully enjoy your stay on the farm. 

1. The back light is motion sensor, but the front light is manual. The switch is right next to the front door. 

2. Watch your head going up the stairs! The clearance is low. 

3. We do NOT have cable, but provide lots of DVDs, and if there isn't anything to your liking, text us and we can bring some more options over. 

4. There is WIFI 

5. Close all gates you open so that the cows stay where they're supposed to stay. Be mindful of where you step because there will be cow pies. 

6. It's about a 20 minute hike to the Lake. You will have to cross a creek (that can get high after a big rain). There is absolutely NO swimming-no humans or dogs. It's a private shared lake among the neighbors. 

7. Being in the country, there are a fair share of spiders, ticks, bugs, and animals. Just be aware of your surroundings. 

10. When checking out, please turn off both ACs and let us know that you have left.

11. If there is ANYTHING that you need, please text/call/carrier pigeon/knock on the door. We want to make your stay as wonderful and peaceful as possible. 

8.  Absolutely NO animals in the pool under any circumstances! 

RULES FOR GUESTS BRINGING THEIR PET/S:
1. You must pick up after them. 

2. If you're planning to leave the cottage for an extended amount of time, your pet must be in a crate (that you bring) or taken with you. They cannot stay in the cottage unattended (it's a historic home and we don't want anything to be damaged).

3. No pets in the pool at all. Ever. 



Thank you!! And we look forward to having you here!
description.neighborhood:
We are in historic Green Springs conveniently located 20 minutes from Charlottesville, 20 minutes from Gordonsville and Orange.

Gordonsville transports you to a small town in England where you can stroll the downtown Main St and pop into the local shops. It's also home to The BBQ Exchange (some of the best BBQ in Virginia). 

Orange is equally as quaint but a tad bigger town with great antique shopping and rich Civil War history and activities. 

There are in a range of 30-40 minutes great wineries that not only serve great wines but also have great food pairings to make your visit and outing memorable. 

This region of Virginia and our estate is situated in the historic time period of our founding fathers , and you will be not far away to visit some of these presidents homes.  
We're very close to James Madison's Montpellier and Thomas Jefferson's Monticello, plus lots of other historical destinations!

We,  moved 5 years ago to the area and we feel positively overwhelmed with all there is to do!
description.transit: You will need a car to access all the wonderful things to do in the area!
description.interaction:
We love to meet new people, but if you're here trying to unwind and relax and rather not interact, you never have to meet us! 

You'll see us running around the property, but don't be shy. Come talk to us- we love nothing more!
description.house_rules:
This is a historic home dating around the late 1700's, so it's old! And we want our guests to enjoy all the charm its age brings with it, but we do expect guests to treat the home with care and absolutely no smoking or candles.

Welcome to Green Springs! 

Just a couple of things to mention so you can fully enjoy your stay on the farm. 

1. The back light is motion sensor, but the front light is manual. The switch is right next to the front door. 

2. Watch your head going up the stairs! The clearance is low. 

3. We do NOT have cable, but provide lots of DVDs, and if there isn't anything to your liking, text us and we can bring some more options over. 

4. There is no wifi; however, cell reception is fine and we do everything on our phones. 

5. Close all gates you open so that the cows stay where they're supposed to stay. Be mindful of where you step because there will be cow pies. 

6. It's about a 20 minute hike to the Lake. You will have to cross a creek (that can get high after a big rain). There is absolutely NO swimming-no humans or dogs. It's a private shared lake among the neighbors. 

7. Being in the country, there are a fair share of spiders, ticks, bugs, and animals. Just be aware of your surroundings. 

10. When checking out, please turn off both ACs and let us know that you have left.

11. If there is ANYTHING that you need, please text/call/carrier pigeon/knock on the door. We want to make your stay as wonderful and peaceful as possible. 

8. Absolutely NO animals in the pool under any circumstances! 

RULES FOR GUESTS BRINGING THEIR PET/S:
1. you can bring 1 pet, however if you intend to bring 1 EXTRA BUT YOU MUST inform and ask permission before booking.
2. You must pick up after them. We have provided little green bags for your use. Please use them. 

3. If you're planning to leave the cottage for an extended amount of time, your pet must be in a crate (that you bring) or taken with you. They cannot stay in the cottage unattended (it's a historic home and we don't want anything to be damaged).





Thank you!! And we look forward to having you here!

name: Lapp Family Amish Guesthouse
title: Gordonville, Pennsylvania

recent.comments:
Awesome experience! Super nice host very friendly.
Would definitely go back soon

items.comments:
Awesome experience! Super nice host very friendly.
Would definitely go back soon

This place is truly an amazing place to stay at.
The house itself is perfect, nothing fancy but clean and taken care of, the outdoors is what it’s meant for! Surrounded by farms on all sides, goats in the backyard, fire pit/grill/swings, it’s just amazing!!
The views in the front is so serene and beautiful, worth going out on the front porch watching sunrise with a coffee…

We had a wonderful time! The house was clean and comfortable for out group pf 15. The Lapp Family was very helpful and so kind answering all our questions about their customs and way of life. The goats and "Gracie's Pony Rides" were a special treat for the kids. We are looking forward to returning.

John and his family were perfect hosts and their home was very country, open and comfortable.  We loved hearing horses and buggies trotting by the house.  We appreciated the notes in the entry and kitchen.  The large open basement was a perfect space for our children to play.  John welcomed our children and also our relatives residing in the area.  John was so kind to set up a pool for the kids.  Our children loved the goats and were so excited to get to feed and hold a young one.  John and his family made the last night a remembered occasion with his lovely daughter giving pony cart rides and John offering horse-guided rides.  Our little three-year-old calls it our farm home.  It will definitely be our destination when visiting our son, even without the extras.  We were blessed.

We loved everything about this property.   We wanted a place to make a few memories before my mother begins her treatment for a recent diagnosis of Mesothelioma.  The simplicity of being on a real Amish Property brought much joy and peace.   There was lots of space for us to spread out and my grandson loved the baby goat he was able to play with and they were so kind as to give him pony rides which he loved.  We were treated like friends and that meant so much.   The location was right in the middle Of beautiful Amish Country.   Nothing was too far.    Our favorite thing to do is drive through the countryside looking at the immaculate properties and stopping for fresh flowers and produce along the way.  Don’t hesitate to stay here.  You won’t be disappointed.

Great place for reunions, families and friends. We were a party of 10 adults with room to move around.  

Prepare to go wifi-free because there is none, nor cable or tv services. This is a place to be somewhat off the grid - take advantage of it and the time.

Revive the art of conversation.

The house is cute, and has a kind of old fashioned feel. 
It has lots of beds which is great so the family could spread out. 
Super close to some great Amish attractions. 
We enjoyed our family trip.

description.summary: The Lapp Family Amish guesthouse is located just outside the town of Intercourse and is a short drive from most Lancaster County attractions. It’s surrounded by Amish farmland with a view from the front porch of the valley.
description.space:
There are horses in the meadow, and depending on time of year the farmers may be working the fields with horses or mules. Our guesthouse has 6 bedrooms and sleeps up to 12 people.  It also features a large fully furnished kitchen with stove, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, etc. with dining area, a sitting room and full bath on the first floor. (please scroll through our photos above) Or enjoy an evening around a campfire in the outdoor picnic area. This is a modern guest house situated in the heart of Amish country.

Ground floor: Master bedroom with queen, a bedroom with a single, and another single bed in the living room (with privacy doors).
Upstairs: 3 bedrooms, each with a full size bed.
Basement: Bedroom with a queen bed and a queen air mattress, as well as sofa in the main area of the basement.
description.notes: This Amish owned lodging doesn't have TV or Wifi. Depending on your phone carrier & plan, you shouldn't have any problem getting cell phone service & internet on your phone. It may be possible to funnel the internet from your phone to your laptop using a "personal hotspot". Advertised rate is for up to 2 guests. Be sure to enter total number of guests on the booking form to get the accurate rate for your stay.

name: Romantic Cottage with Private Hot Tub
title: Castleton, Virginia

gallery.caption: Front view of our beautiful Rock Cottage
Studio style living room and bed room
Lovely pedestal and floor to ceiling mirrors.
Piano and wood burning stove. We provide the fire wood.
Living room with plenty of seating to stretch out on
Private hot tub to enjoy all year round
Our Rock Cottage, Blue Ridge Cottage, and Fitness Center
Rolling hills and the Blue Ridge Mountain View will take your breath away.
Castleton's cows enjoy dinner with a view
Optional and communal Pool House. Additional fee paid at check in.
The south double tennis courts let everyone join in
Our Rock Cottage, Blue Ridge Cottage, Fitness Center all at the Silo
Fitness Center with Sonos speaker and internet based TV.

recent.comments: This was our 4th stay at the rock cottage we are already planning our 5th. Love the house and the surrounding area so much. We had a really bad storm Monday night which caused power disruption and took out some trees but the cottage was equipped with a generator which kicked right on and we received ample notice of weather and what to do. Picture do not do the area justice and need to be seen first hand to truly appreciate.

items.comments: This was our 4th stay at the rock cottage we are already planning our 5th. Love the house and the surrounding area so much. We had a really bad storm Monday night which caused power disruption and took out some trees but the cottage was equipped with a generator which kicked right on and we received ample notice of weather and what to do. Picture do not do the area justice and need to be seen first hand to truly appreciate.

Uns hat der Aufenthalt in Connie’s Rock Cottage sehr gut gefallen. Das Cottage besticht mit seiner unfassbar schönen Lage. Der Whirlpool mit dem Blick in die Natur macht das Cottage zu einem außergewöhnlichen AirBnb. Wir kommen gerne wieder!

Great host- even came to save us when we accidentally locked ourselves out of our house. Super gorgeous property with fantastic and relaxing views. If you need an escape from life the stone cottage is perfect
This was an amazing trip! We will definitely be coming back! Thank you so much for your hospitality and kindness!

The rock cottage is so beautiful! It was bigger than the listing made it look and so adorable. It was very clean and had amazing views in every direction ! There are so many places to walk and explore on the whole farm and every area is beautiful! The hot tub is perfect! This place is perfect for unwinding and getting out of the busy city for a few days to just enjoy peace, quiet and nature ! The WiFi was very spotty because of remote location , it didn't bother us since we wanted to be off the grid , but just be aware in case you need to be online for anything. 
We will definitely stay here again!

We had a wonderful weekend at the Rock cottage! Very peaceful and quiet with beautiful surroundings. The walking trails were great. Even with storms that came through we still enjoyed the cozy cottage. We did lose WiFi for a few hours because of that but it was time to unplug and get away anyway! Just be prepared for no cell service. 

One thing to note- if you have back issues, while the bed is very soft and comfy, it was not good for people with back issues and I had to deal with that so in the future I’d look for a travel firm mattress topper. 

Also be prepared that you are in nature and there are bugs! We had several stink bugs in the house but would just remove them and they didn’t cause too much issue.
Connie was a fantastic host that made our two year anniversary super special! Looking forward to coming back next year.

description.summary:
Exhale, unwind, and welcome to Castleton Farms. 

This spacious and airy open-plan cottage has a fully equipped kitchen, a large bathroom with garden tub, and a romantic fireplace. The king bed sleeps two.
description.space:
ABOUT THE GROUNDS:
Castleton Farms is a sprawling, 500-acre compound at the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains and Shenandoah National Park with a working animal farm, fishing ponds, and gorgeous views. A five-mile paved footpath spans the property and is perfect for walking, jogging, or biking. Visit the friendly menagerie with emus, goats, chickens, a pig, donkeys, a zebra, and a zonkey. The magnificent Pool House has an indoor pool and hot tub (Additional  fee — paid at check-in).
description.access:
The house/cottage is private and for guests that have rented this property only
Communal and complimentary amenities provided on our 550-acre estate:
Each house has access to a pond. We have a catch and release policy. You must bring your own fishing gear.
There are three tennis courts, we can provide a small supply of equipment on a first come first service basis.
Our Fitness Center is open daily.
We have a menagerie of animals for viewing.
We offer paved walking paths throughout property
description.notes:
Children under the age of 1 year old are not counted in guest count/occupancy numbers. Any child over the age of 1 is counted. 
No smoking allowed inside the house or garage.
WE DO NOT PROVIDE SALT/PEPPER, OTHER SPICES, OR ANY OTHER FOOD FOR HUMAN CONSUMPTION IN THE HOUSE DUE TO CONTAMINATION POTENTIAL.
Must have prior approval to bring a pet and there is an additional fee ($75.00) per pet. Any undeclared pet(s) or unleashed pet(s) found in or about the property is grounds for expedited eviction and forfeiture of all monies paid.
Maximum weight limit per pet is 65 lbs.
Must be 25 years old to book
NO PARTIES OR EVENTS ALLOWED PER AIRBNB GUIDELINES
See booking contract for all other rules
description.neighborhood:
NEARBY:
Rappahannock County (and the neighboring Fauquier and Culpeper Counties) offer scenic outdoor adventures and unique shopping experiences, as well excellent cuisine and wine tasting at some of Virginia’s best artisanal wineries. Here’s just a taste of what you can do:
- Shenandoah National Park: hike, camp, or bike through this famous natural beauty, or take a car anywhere along Skyline Drive, the 105-mile scenic byway — 18 miles, 30-minute drive
- Copper Fox Distillery: tour and sample this local American whiskey— 11 miles, 20-minute drive
- The towns of Little Washington and Culpeper: visit these charming villages and historic landmarks — 20-30 minute drives
- Multiple vineyards and wineries with tours and tastings — ask for recommendations!
- Civil War Trail: the Shenandoah Valley is home to more than 100 historic Civil War sites with colorful interpretive markers and historical information.
description.transit:
No public transportation and there is plenty of room for guest parking.
Dulles International Airport is 42 miles away
Culpeper Amtrak Train Station is 18 miles away
description.interaction: May call or text my cell phone.

name: Farmhouse on River, 12 Miles to Liberty Mountain
title: Taneytown, Maryland

gallery.caption: Take the family on a farm-style retreat they'll never forget!
This property promises a peaceful retreat!
This Taneytown vacation renal has plenty of space for the whole group!
Enjoy all the comforts of home while you vacation in Maryland!
Cozy up to the wood-burning fireplace on a cold day.
Serve up something delicious at the first dining table!
The kitchen comes fully equipped with the cooking basics to get you started.
Whip up that famous home recipe while on vacation in Maryland!
The second dining table can sit up to 4 comfortably.
Catch up on your favorite shows with the flat-screen TV!
The bonus room is a great place to play some games!
There are toys and games included for the kids.
There's plenty of living space for everyone to spread out in.
Bring a good book to read in the rocking chair.
Rest easy in the master bedroom.
This room comes equipped with a full bed and a twin-over-full bunk bed.
Ceiling fans will help keep you cool at night.
Rinse off after a day of hiking around the farm in the first bathroom.
Wake up to some Maryland sunshine in the second bedroom!
This room has a queen and a twin bed to drift off on.
Freshen up with the complimentary toiletries provided for your stay.
Drift off to dreamland in the third bedroom.
This room comes equipped with a full bed and a twin bed.
Catch some Z's in the fourth bedroom.
This room has two twin beds for a great night's sleep.
There is whole separate unit in the garage!
The unit has a full bed for two additional guests to drift off in.
The property can sleep up to 15 comfortably.
This farmhouse was originally built in 1816!
The grass yard is perfect to play yard games in!
Take a walk around the beautiful farmland!
Catch dinner in the Monocacy River that runs near the property!

hosts.about:
Hi! We’re Evolve, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.

recent.comments:
Super friendly host.
 Property was amazing. Although isolated, nothing is far (Gettysburg, geat golf, good food and all conveniences).
 Definitely planning another stay!!

items.comments:
Super friendly host.
 Property was amazing. Although isolated, nothing is far (Gettysburg, geat golf, good food and all conveniences).
 Definitely planning another stay!!

We loved staying here! It was incredibly peaceful. Couldn't even hear cars in the distance - just nature sounds! And there was plenty of room for all 11 of us to hang out in the kitchen/dining area. The bedrooms were quite spacious too. And the 5th bedroom across the driveway from the house was an added bonus since we had a last minute addition to our group. The only issue we had was with finding the house. GPS sent us down a road that ended up at a closed gate, and we had to back up all the way to the road entrance because there was nowhere to turn around. So don't go down any road that doesn't have a road sign. And I wouldn't suggest arriving after dark if you haven't visited before. It's very dark and signs are harder to read. But once you know the area, it's not a problem. And the roads leading to the house are so picturesque. We'd definitely stay here again! Also, the lack of WiFi was not a problem for us. As long as someone was able to get internet using a hotspot we were good.

The place is awesome and totally relaxing! Very spacious, organized and clean house! Our whole family felt at home.
I definitely recommend it!
Very accommodating for our family. 8 people coming from different locations. Enjoyed watching the little birds in the nest on the porch. You could get to the house from two different directions.

The farmhouse was about as peaceful of a location as one can imagine with no neighbors in sight. The back (front) porch viewed rolling fields and distant woods. The home itself was roomy and well stocked. As it is an old farmhouse, it was a bit quirky, but interesting. Melody was friendly and responsive. We hope to rent it again sometime and look forward to hanging out on the porch.

I personally liked the place very much.  It was a cozy, private place where one goes to get away from it all.  In today's day & age, it would have been ideal to have internet, because the phone service was ok, but it will depend on which company you have.  The host said that there's no wifi, but that a phone could be set up as a hot spot.  I wish I had their phone company, because my phone had ok coverage in the kitchen area, but in the upstairs bedroom where I stayed, coverage was very poor.  I only had to walk halfway down to the other end & had coverage - strange!
My family mentioned that they didn't like the stuffed animals (personally, not a problem for me), so if that's something you are uncomfortable with, take note.  
Everything seemed clean & orderly.  Lots of little details.  
A 10 AM check-out is a little early.  I wish it could have been 11 or noon since check-in was 3 or 4pm.  Hotels usually have it set up this way, with check-out no earlier than 11 .
This place was perfect for a lowkey get together with friends! Loved every minute of the stay at the farm. Plenty of parking and room for kids to play.

description.summary: Ready for a quiet getaway? This spacious 5-bed, 2-bath vacation rental home is the perfect place to take your family on an unforgettable retreat. Spend your days hiking around the farm, catching some dinner in the Monocacy River, or just relaxing on the covered porch. With both the historic town of Gettysburg and the slopes of Liberty Mountain Resort within minutes, you'll be busy year-round. Come home to a charming interior boasting a fully equipped kitchen and a bonus room with games and toys!
description.space:
Built in 1816 | RV & Trailer Parking | Fully Equipped Kitchen

Whether you want to find an outdoor adventure on Liberty Mountain, host a wedding, or just want to enjoy the peace and quiet of the farm, this family-oriented home is the perfect Maryland refuge!

Bedroom 1: Full Bed, Twin/Full Bunk Bed | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed, Twin Bed | Bedroom 3: Full Bed, Twin Bed | Bedroom 4: 2 Twin Beds | Bedroom 5 (Garage Unit): Full Bed

OUTDOOR LIVING: Covered porch, patio furniture, grass yard, gas grill
INDOOR LIVING: 2 flat-screen TVs w/ cable, 2 dining tables, exposed beams, ceiling fans, wood-burning furnace & fireplace, bonus room w/ games & toys
KITCHEN: Fully equipped w/ cooking basics, microwave, toaster, blender, drip coffee maker, island
GENERAL: Complimentary toiletries, washer/dryer, towels/linens, cleaning essentials, air conditioning, central heating
EXTRAS: Homeowner offers in-home dining and event catering at this property. Reach out to the guest contact after booking for more details
FAQ: No on-site WiFi (but strong reception for hotspots)
PARKING: Driveway (5 vehicles)
description.neighborhood:
OUTDOOR ADVENTURES: Monocacy River (on-site), Liberty Mountain Resort (11.8 miles), Gettysburg National Military Park (15.3 miles), Catoctin Mountain Park (16.3 miles)
DAY-TRIP DESTINATIONS: Gettysburg (14.0 miles), Frederick (27.1 miles), Baltimore (53.2 miles), Washington D.C. (71.8 miles), Annapolis (74.9 miles)
EASY-ACCESS EATS: No Anchovies (5.3 miles), Stone House Cakery and Cafe (5.4 miles), Country Kitchen (5.5 miles), The Smokehouse Restaurant at Antrim 1844 (5.8 miles), Carriage House (6.0 miles) 
NEARBY COLLEGES: Mount St. Mary's University (5.2 miles), Gettysburg College (15.4 miles), McDaniel College (16.8 miles), Hood College (29.3 miles)
AIRPORT: Baltimore/Washington International Thurgood Marshall Airport (54.5 miles)
description.interaction: Evolve makes it easy to find and book properties you’ll never want to leave. You can relax knowing that our properties will always be ready for you and that we’ll answer the phone 24/7. Even better, if anything is off about your stay, we’ll make it right. You can count on our homes and our people to make you feel welcome--because we know what vacation means to you.
description.house_rules:
- No smoking
- No pets allowed
- No events, parties or large gatherings
- Must be at least 25 years old to book
- Additional fees and taxes may apply
- Photo ID may be required upon check-in
- NOTE: While this property does not offer WiFi, there's very good reception for setting up a personal hotspot

name: The Barn at Haden in Crozet near Wineries/C'ville
title: Crozet, Virginia

gallery.caption: Welcome to The Barn at Haden! You won't want to leave!
This is a 2 bedroom apartment above our detached 3 car garage.
There is a designated parking area and exterior private staircase/entrance to the barn.
Enjoy sitting outside on the elevated deck for your morning coffee or meals.
Spring views from the upper deck.
Open and full of natural light!
Full size kitchen to serve your every need.
Kitchen with view to the 2nd bedroom
Fully equipped kitchen with custom cabinetry
All appliances including a microwave are provided.
Whether a preparing a quick bite to eat or a full meal, we've got you covered!
The kitchen sink with a view!
The open layout makes hanging out together comfortable and casual.
The dining area is cozy and can seat up to 6 people.
Laptops are a usual carry along item and we have the perfect desk to set up a workspace.
Queen size bed in the main bedroom. Plenty of storage in the built-in niches.
This versatile space can be used as a vanity area equipped with a mirror, natural and additional light, extra outlets and a hair dryer is provided.
The luxurious shower features double shower heads including a rain head and swivel handheld for multiple pressure settings of your choice.
This is the sitting room/2nd bedroom. It's a versatile room. Behind those reclaimed Armoire cabinet doors is a 2nd closet and additional storage space.
The murphy bed is disguised as a Mission Armoire. It opens to be the 2nd bed in the space and the barn doors can be closed to create the 2nd bedroom.
The 2nd bed is a Full size memory foam bed.
The barn doors close to create the 2nd bedroom when it is needed.
Did we mention we have a laundry room! Always comes in handy when you need it.
The Barn at Haden is private and may feel rural when you first arrive but you will quickly realize how close it is to everything in Crozet - even walking!
Get away from the hustle and bustle and enjoy a stay at The Barn at Haden!
Neighborhood playground just 100 meters from The Barn at Haden. Easy to walk to and a large neighborhood great for recreational walking/jogging.
The Barn at Haden is located within walking distance of downtown Crozet (1/2 mile).

Piedmont Place is within a 1/2 mile walk/bike/drive of The Barn at Haden. Piedmont Place offers Smoked Kitchen and Tap (BBQ), Morsel Compass (Tacos), Crozet Creamery (Ice Cream), Blue Ridge Bottle Shop (beer & cider), The Rooftop (small plates & craft cocktails), Barre Studio and Over the Moon (Bookstore).
King Family Vineyard is less than 2 miles away and Route 151 with several Breweries & Vineyards (Veritas) is located 10 minutes away.
King Family Vineyard is open every Wednesday until 8:30 for Wine Wednesday with a food truck and views for days. Perfect place to watch the sun set.

Chiles Peach Orchard is 3 miles down the road with strawberry, peach, blueberry, apple and pumpkin picking seasonally. There's also St. Michel Winery and Boldrock Cider Beer tasting rooms attached to the Orchard.
Greenwood Gourmet Grocery - Our top recommendation for ordering an afternoon sandwich!
Looking for a quick hike? Mint Springs Park, just 3 miles away has miles of wooded trails and a public lake with a beach open in the summer.
Crozet Pizza and Sals are located 1/2 mile away as well with other great shops and restaurants to try.
The Barn at Haden - Crozet's newest and nicest Airbnb! Check us out on Instagram and Facebook at @thebarnathaden

hosts.about: Hi there! My husband, Damond and I built our forever home on one acre in the lovely town of Crozet! We met while attending the University of Virginia and we got married and lived in Charlottesville after graduating. We love Charlottesville but just needed more space for our kids to run so we built our home in Crozet. We spend a lot of time in the nearby area of Afton along Route 151 going on hikes, visiting the local breweries and vineyards - all the things we recommend to our guests to do! We not only own the spaces that we rent out to our amazing guests but we spend time in those spaces as a family. I am a Realtor at Nest Realty and being a super host has been an avenue of real estate that I enjoy. We built and remodeled our properties and take a lot of pride in them to attract our guests to our little slice of heaven in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains.

recent.comments: Beautiful space with best interior design we've seen at an Airbnb. Enjoyed our walks to Downtown Crozet. Friendly hosts! Hope to visit again!

items.comments: Beautiful space with best interior design we've seen at an Airbnb. Enjoyed our walks to Downtown Crozet. Friendly hosts! Hope to visit again!

We absolutely loved Dawn and Damond’s place. We had an infant and a 4 year old. My 4 year old loved the Murphy bed and there was everything for a baby- including a baby bathtub! We just stayed one night on the way to our beach house but wish we would have been there longer to explore what the area had to offer! Definitely hope to be back! Everything was exactly as described in the listing.

This was the perfect place to stay to take advantage of 'downtown' Crozet while feeling just a little bit away from it all.  Easy walk to everything downtown, sidewalks, streetlights and so on.  It's also almost as easy to walk to Old Trail, so the home is in a really great spot.  Inside, it felt like a perfect little farmhouse, smartly built to feel private and secluded. Really can't wait to stay there again.
This was our 2nd stay at Dawn and Damon’s. The Barn is beautifully appointed with high quality finishes & decor, just a perfect getaway setting.
The stay was great! Hosts were so friendly!!! We loved our stay and will def come back!!!

This was a beautiful place to stay in Crozet!  It was very peaceful and relaxing. The Barn at Haden has everything you need and more.  The kitchen is fully stocked and all the furniture is cozy and comfy. The bed is superb and extremely comfortable. Highly recommend this place and I plan to go back for sure!
Our experience was amazing. They had everything we needed for the adults and the kids. It is a beautiful place and Dawn and Damon were awesome hosts. We would definitely stay here again.

description.summary: The Barn at Haden is a custom well appointed finished 2 bedroom, 1 full bath space elevated above a detached 3 car garage with a large outdoor private deck to enjoy Blue Ridge Mountain views. It features a fully equipped gourmet kitchen with high end finishes. Whether staying for a night or for the weekend, it is an experience to enjoy the easy living Crozet has to offer. Walkable/bikeable to downtown Crozet, 2 miles to King Family Vineyard & Chiles Orchard and 15 minutes from Charlottesville.
description.space:
*COVID UPDATE: Cleanliness is more important than ever. To help reduce the spread of COVID-19, we’ve put together cleaning guidelines based on recommendations from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) that our cleaners are implementing after every guest. With the extent of the extra cleaning measures, we can NOT accommodate any early check-in or late check-out requests.  We are also NOT interested in renting our space out to long term guests more than 8 days.

Whether visiting family or friends in the area, attending a wedding or event or just getting away for a great experience you'll find your happy place at The Barn at Haden. If you enjoy staying in a place that has all the conveniences of your own home, that's how we designed the space. It features, a fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher, microwave, stove/oven, farmhouse sink, full size refrigerator and quartzite countertops. The oversized island will surely be the hangout spot in the space. A full size dining table is offered for meals. The family room offers a large HDTV. There's a laundry room with washer and dryer and both bedrooms have their own closets with hangers. The 2nd bedroom can be created by closing the two 4' barn doors and pulling down the double size murphy bed. If you are a guest that only needs one bed, then the barn doors remain open for an additional sitting room to retreat to. There's an abundance of natural light thru every window but the lights you do need to turn on are powered by solar energy in the home. There is a separate exterior staircase that leads to an oversized elevated deck for enjoying mountain views. 

We are equipped for children! The space includes a pack n' play (bring your own crib sheet), infant bathing tub, step stool for the bathroom sink and a small basket of toys/books to keep small children entertained. There is also a full size playground within walking distance down the street in the Old Trail Neighborhood.

We do not accept short term or long term rental requests. Please no inquiries for this!
description.access: Guests will have access to the entire apartment that offers free high speed internet via WIFI. There is an assigned parking spot in the driveway for guests and if traveling with more than one vehicle, we do have additional off street parking areas in our driveway.
description.notes:
Parties of 4 will be an additional $30/night.

Please indicate when you make your reservation if you will need the 2nd bedroom prepared for your reservation. We will assume parties of 3-4 will definitely need the 2nd bedroom. Otherwise the 2nd bedroom will be staged as a sitting room if it is not needed. Please also indicate if you will need the infant crib set up prior to your arrival along with the high chair. 

Check-in time is 3:00PM.

There is a unique code to access the front door lock. You will receive your custom code that will be good for the duration of your stay. There is no need for us to meet you to let you in and you can arrive/depart whenever you would like to.
description.neighborhood: Downtown Crozet is less than 1/2 mile (walkable with sidewalks the entire way) with many options for food and activities to choose from. The newly finished Piedmont Place Market is home to a craft brew and wine shop, a quick-serve restaurant, a smoothie and coffee bar, a bookstore, and an ice cream shop. Piedmont Place offers two unique, full-scale dining experiences. Smoked Kitchen & Tap is located on the terrace level (BBQ) and The Rooftop is a third-floor sky bar (Small plates & cocktails). Other options for food and beverage are Greenhouse Coffee (breakfast served all day), Mudhouse Coffee and Fardowners. The Crozet public library and Crozet YMCA (indoor pool in the winter) are all available for family fun. Great Value is a quick and easy grocery store to get to within 3/4 mile and Harris Teeter is 3 miles away. The Old Trail Village Center is 1 mile away and features Grit Coffee and a Mexican and Seafood restaurant. Chiles Orchard is 3 miles away and offers seasonal picking of strawberries, blueberries, peaches, apples and pumpkins. Please ask us for any recommendations for places to visit nearby that you might have in mind!
description.transit: By car, bike or foot! With a sidewalk accessed community and neighborhood around us it is easy to go out the door for a jog in the neighborhood or a stroll or bike downtown (bike lanes accessible but bikes are not provided).
description.interaction:
The Barn at Haden was designed with guests in mind. Our home is adjacent to this space but detached so you are able to maintain full privacy. We are available on the spot should you need anything but otherwise plan to respect your privacy. Plan to see us coming and going with our family throughout the day and we welcome any questions or concerns during your stay as well as the opportunity to make new acquaintances! 

Please follow us on Instagram and Face book at "The Barn at Haden" for additional pictures/videos of the space. 
@thebarnathaden
#thebarnathaden
description.house_rules: Check-in time is at 3pm. Please request no more than 2 days in advance if you would like early check-in and we will let you know what time would be possible.

title: Harrisonburg, Virginia

gallery.caption: New queen size bed - multiple guests have complimented the very comfortable mattress
Plenty of sunlight, a place to relax
We include fruit & snacks, and eggs and a few things for breakfast
Vegetable & flower gardens , view from the porch
Usually a few cows grazing nearby
Our 4 ewes are due to lamb in late January 2023
Solar panels on our shed now power the cottage
View from the hill 1/4 mile from cottage
You may see some of our sheep!
Side porch facing west, evening sunlight
Deck which catches the morning sun.
In Fall the maple trees' colors are spectacular - and we've just built a new side porch

hosts.about: University professor in Applied Social Sciences.  Areas of interest:  gender, race, immigration.  Hobbies: gardening, growing food and flowers to share with others; travel.  I am married and have two sons who are in college.

Both of us teach at a small local university, Byron was born in Harrisonburg, Deanna grew up in Idaho. We lived for many years in the D.C. area, then lived for 4 years in El Salvador, and now have lived on this farm for almost 20 years.  We've traveled extensively in Latin America & Spain. And Deanna loves to garden!

recent.comments: We had a wonderful time here! The Spring House is so quaint and peaceful, I wish we stayed longer! Snacks, breakfast, & beverages were a great touch and very appreciated. The hosts also gave great local recommendations! I had not realized how close to the main house it would be, but still felt private for what it was! For those that are questionable about the compost toilet, it’s not bad at all!

items.comments: We had a wonderful time here! The Spring House is so quaint and peaceful, I wish we stayed longer! Snacks, breakfast, & beverages were a great touch and very appreciated. The hosts also gave great local recommendations! I had not realized how close to the main house it would be, but still felt private for what it was! For those that are questionable about the compost toilet, it’s not bad at all!
We had a great time at Byron and Deanna’s place. The location was beautiful and very peaceful. There are many good local restaurants around the area!!!

We had a great visit! Place was peaceful and hosts were responsive and eager to assist. Kitchen supplies (pots, pans, etc.) are sufficient to cook a basic meal and there's space inside and on the deck to eat or relax. Hosts were also flexible with check-in and check-out time. If you're looking for a rustic, quiet getaway that's close enough to restaurants and activities, this is the place.

Byron and Deanna’s springhouse is absolutely adorable.  We loved the location, the farm, the sheep, and the gardens. It was really special. Also very spacious and well appointed with fresh eggs! Thank you for a lovely stay!

Beautiful setting. Very peaceful and private. Byron greeted us upon arrival, and cleaned the cottage (fresh compost and took recycling), when we left for the music  festival we were attending for the day. He left the light on for us in the cottage so we could find our way there. Byron and Deanna also left snacks and fresh farm eggs, which were a nice addition.
Very peaceful B&B with great location and style
We loved our stay.  It was so nice to have breakfast on the patio and watch the birds in the garden.  Their recommendations for local places to go were very helpful.

description.summary:
Renovated 1800's cottage next to our 230 year-old house, all surrounded by flower and vegetable gardens. Located on quiet country road, an easy 8 minute drive to Harrisonburg - excellent restaurants and unique shops. Powered by solar panels - woodchip composting toilet. Note - no wifi, time to disconnect!

We live in main house and the cottage is nearby. You have whole cottage to yourself, including a spacious deck, which affords plenty of  privacy. Wood stove & baseboard heat. A place to relax.
description.space: Full kitchen, claw-footed bathtub/shower, composting toilet.  Toilet works great using sawdust, you'll be amazed how well it works! Queen size bed.  Side porch looks out over garden and sheep pasture.  Back of cottage looks into small woods.  Quiet, restful setting. Solar panels power entire cottage. Note that in winter cottage is heated by combination of wood stove and electrical baseboard heaters.
description.transit: 10 minute drive to Harrisonburg (& JMU) which has a growing, thriving downtown with excellent restaurants and coffee shops, Farmers market on Tuesday and Saturday mornings. We'll send you a list of our favorite wineries, restaurants, breweries, hikes, etc.

name: Farm Stay
title: Gap, Pennsylvania

hosts.about:
Hi I’m Juana, me and my husband bought the farm late 2016, we have been restoring this beautiful home built in 1735 and now want to share it with our guest.
We love to travel with our young children.
My husband is a chef an we can catered meals at the house, we also host weddings at the farm for those interested

recent.comments: I do recommend this place because it is historic place as well as you can really enjoy the environment, too.

items.comments: I do recommend this place because it is historic place as well as you can really enjoy the environment, too.
Incredible stay and host

I don’t even know what to say. 
Immediately you feel a sense of home here. Soo cozy and amazingly beautiful.
I wish we had more time to spend here. 
The goat has week old babies that were adorable. The chickens were friendly and healthy.
We truly don’t want to leave. It was such a unique stay. 
I’m going to look at the calendar to try and schedule another trip!

Absolutely wonderful place to stay!  Whether you want a catered meal by the host, a relaxing afternoon on the front porch watching Amish buggies go by, or cooking a meal in the well-equipped kitchen…they’ve got you covered!! Our group slept soundly and enjoyed having our own private bathrooms. We were even able to have dinner with the Amish neighbors one night…what a treat!  The beautiful home is rich with history and we enjoyed reading all about it. Watching the goats and chickens was also fun!  We highly recommend!!!
Beautiful location and comfortable house for our family- albeit a quick stay!
An amazing house for our family getaway. Peaceful Amish neighborhood and beautiful farm land. The host Junaa is very nice and responsive to all our questions. Would highly recommend

great place to have a good time.  family time is an excellent place to enjoy the land, shops and restaurants of the Amish people, very large house, very comfortable beds, very large space, my family and I were delighted with the place, excellent attention.  of juana

description.summary: farm stay on the heart of amish country, beautiful restored home from 1845, four bedrooms and 4.5 bathrooms. Full kitchen and big farm style table on dinning room sits 20
description.space:
The house has full stocked kitchen, living room with smart tv and dining room on the first floor as well as a half bathroom 
Four bedrooms and four bathrooms on the second floor 
Guest would have full access to house and the backyard is a share space with us.
We do have two acres of land so it doesn’t feel crowded and we try not to use the yard if we have guest staying
We have a gazebo, fire pit, playground and play house for our guest to enjoy 
The fence around the house is electric to keep the cows and horses from coming into the yard, the fence around the hens and the goats is not. You are welcome to pet them, the farm animals are all very friendly
description.access: The guest have full access to the main porch, gazebo, playground and fire pit.
description.notes: We welcome pets, they need approval and there is a pet fee.
description.interaction: we live on the same land but a different house. you will see outside taking care of the garden and the animals.
description.house_rules:
PleAse do not bring the farm animals inside the house 
Please leave doors close at all times 
Please don’t cut the flowers on our garden as we have a bee hive and they need the pollen
Don’t leave windows open if you are running heat or air 
All beds need to be stripped and towels that were used on the floors
Please leave all dishes clean and put away
There is a pet fee if you are coming with a dog (pets that you bring with you are allowed inside the home)
