all.name: No stairs or steps to enter

hosts.about:
Howdy Y’all,

VA Boy born and raised! My family settled in Charlottesville, VA in the late 1800’s. I reside in Ivy, VA with my wife Jill of 22 years and our 4 children. 

We recently purchased the old Page Family Farm in Nellysford, VA.  The original house on the farm dates back to the 1840’s. The Farm consists of two cottages and the main farmhouse. 

As a family we’ve been working together to bring this ole farm back to life. Our 4 kids (16,14,9,8) have been hard working this summer to get things ready for our guests. 

I have a background in Landscape Design and construction. We have a master plan of turning this farm into one of the premier venue destinations in the area. Check back often for photo updates and additional Airbnb homes.


Thank you for sharing your vacation and getaway time with our family. If we can do anything to make your stay more comfortable or special never hesitate to let us know. 

Thanks Y’all!

The Snow Family

recent.comments: A perfect location to explore the wineries and breweries along Rt 151. The home was very clean, full of amenities with comfortable beds and great bathrooms. Will definitely stay here again, and again, and again!

items.comments: A perfect location to explore the wineries and breweries along Rt 151. The home was very clean, full of amenities with comfortable beds and great bathrooms. Will definitely stay here again, and again, and again!

our group enjoyed our stay! the first night we were fortunate enough to have clear skies to enjoy stargazing around the firepit- saw a few shooting stars and spotted a satellite or two. the space was very clean and just as described. house is central to all the breweries and wineries on nelson 151. there are two smaller properties next to the house but still felt private. the view of the mountains was beautiful.

We loved staging at Corbin’s large home! It was the perfect size for our group of adults and children. The space was comfortable and had everything that we needed! The area is beautiful and we have visited many times. The house is located right off the main winery road and about 25 mins from Charlottesville. We would absolutely it let visit again!

This was the second time that we’ve stayed at one of Corbin’s properties on 151. The property is beautiful, and the location is central. Corbin was quick to reply. The farmhouse was charming. Everything was as described/pictured. The house was stocked well. Though, our dog found a poison mouse trap and tried to get into it -  we put it out of her (and my toddler’s) reach. 

During our stay, a tub in one of the bathrooms did not drain properly and leaked into the dining room. We contacted the host immediately and they apologized for the inconvenience, but didn’t send anyone out to look at it. In full transparency, I would have given our stay a better rating, but a week after our stay, Corbin requested $2,800 in damages to replace the drywall from the leak, claiming the tub overflowed (it did not) and there was faulty plumbing. The incident and request for damages is currently under review by AirBnB. I hope we are not responsible for the damages. In the meantime, it’s a cautionary tale.

Awesome location! Centrally located to wintergreen resort and local wineries, breweries, and distilleries! Beautiful historic farm house with awesome amenities! Host was extremely descriptive about check in and check out! Everything we wanted and more!
Stayed here for the weekend to do a winery tour with friends. House was really cute, clean, and had great A/C for being an old house. We loved it. I recommend staying here!

We have now stayed at all 3 properties on the farm. The Farmhouse (our new favorite) and the New Old Barn work very well for us. Communication with Claire/Corbin is excellent and if there is ever an issue they address it right now. We will be returning this fall for sure.

description.summary: This refurnished Farmhouse with spectacular mountain views is set up to accommodate large groups & families. Set in 6 acres of incredible surroundings makes for a picturesque stay to be remembered. Close to all wineries & breweries it Includes: large fully stocked family kitchen & dining room, front porch, fire pit & grill, WiFi, Netflix, private parking, laundry room, large flat screen TVs, Kuerig machine, fully air conditioned, all basic cooking supplies incl: crockpot. Self check-in provided.
description.space:
Wake up to breathtaking views of the Blue Ridge Mountains overlooking beautifully landscaped gardens and open meadows. This picture perfect Farmhouse is nestled in 6 stunning acres where many of its original features remain untouched. You will be sure to re-charge your sole in this quiet, unique and wonderful country setting. The clear, crisp views of Humpback Rock will make you appreciate the natural beauty that surrounds Blue Ridge Farm. You will be staying in the most central location along the Brew Ridge Trail.

*Please note there is an additional $50 fee for pets* Maximum of 2 pets please

*Firewood & Charcoal can be purchased locally from Ashley’s market, gas stations or other local stores as this is not provided*


*pack’n’play available upon request. Subject to availability*
description.access:
The guests will have full access to the Blue Ridge Farmhouse and the surrounding sprawling land.  The farm is shared with two other small properties. (The Blue
Sky Cottage and the Old-New Barn)
We offer keyless entry for your convenience.
description.notes:
The Brew Ridge Trail (aka Route 151)  is THE place to be for Virginia wine, craft beers, cider, local food and recreation. It really does have it all for EVERY season and EVERY one! 

Nelson County gets you outdoors and back to nature:

-There are so many great hikes just a stones throw away. 
-Visit the many wineries, breweries, cideries & distilleries
-Explore the stunning Blue Ridge Parkway and Skyline Drive enjoying scenic drives with phenomenal overlooks
-Take time to explore the numerous historic places and museums the area has to offer including the Walton Mountain Museum
-Nelson County is renowned for its many Farms & Orchards. Critzer Family Farm and Chiles Orchard are two of our favorites. Or you could go a little further a field to Carter's Mountain
-Wintergreen Resort is also right on your doorstep. Offering something all year round from The Performing Arts Summer Festival in the summer to Ski, Snowboard and Tubing in the winter
So, get ready to explore, hike and wonder the area around you!

description.transit:
The best way to get around is by car. Uber can be unreliable but is always worth a try. Lyft also operate out of Afton. There are various tour buses of which we will be happy to share the details with you when you book & are included within our on line guidebook. 
The best resource for transportation can be found on the Nelson County Government Website. This offers a fantastic resource. Simply access the website, click on departments, then click on Tourism and you will see a link to transportation. 'Yelp' also offers reliable suggestions.
description.interaction: The Blue Ridge Farm is easy to find and is simple to check in to. We will send you detailed check in instructions before your arrival. You will be able to check yourself into the Farmhouse with the code we will provide.

hosts.about: I am a graduate of Virginia Tech. My mom and I currently work for Creed Realty in Virginia Beach. My family and I are now pursuing a business in Airbnb rentals. We love to travel and explore. We are big outdoors people and want to provide our properties to other families to enjoy.

recent.comments: Super comfortable, peaceful, and quick access to food and Luray caverns. Would definitely stay here again.

items.comments: Super comfortable, peaceful, and quick access to food and Luray caverns. Would definitely stay here again.

The house was in great condition and clean. The host was responsive. Our daughter loved seeing the cows at the farm next door. Make sure you read the directions carefully so you don't miss the driveway. We did not have a problem but you can't just navigate to the address.

Nice isolated house next to a farm. Plenty of room and yard for kids and a pet to have a nice few days in the area. It feels isolated from things, but is only a 9 minute drive to downtown for food, ice cream, etc. Luray Caverns, Skyline Drive, horseback riding, river adventures seem to all be 20 minutes away.

The house is nicely decorated and has a fun area downstairs with foosball and a pool table. Modern furnishings, temperature controls, kitchen, but a classy traditional aesthetic. Would stay there again.

This home was so conveniently located to the Shenandoah National park and Luray caverns.  It was very kid friendly with a small playground (swings and slide) next to a farm with cows and sheep. The home was very comfortable and super cute inside. We loved the fire pit and games! If going in the summer, bring bug spray if you plan to be outside!

Beautiful place! It was very clean and well stocked. Christian accomplished an amazing feat by creating an attractive place that felt safe for a toddler to run around without much worry about breaking things. My daughter really enjoyed the cows.

Super responsive host with a beautiful property. House was clean, and beds comfortable. Within easy access <10 mins from both town for supplies and food, and the national park for hiking! Puppers loved their time there as well. Highly recommend.
Excellent location for Shenandoah National Park. Can get to stores in less than ten minutes for groceries. Clean comfortable furniture.

description.summary: Moo Moo Meadows Cabin getaway surrounded by the Blue Ridge Mountains nestled on 5 acres with woods & wildlife. This modern mid-century 3 bedroom, 2 bath cabin has a new addition with a spacious living room and master suite. The renovated basement features a pool table, and a 55-inch smart TV. Also, has 3 decks and a fire-pit with swings and chairs. Just 5 miles from Luray caverns, Skyline Drive, Luray Zoo, rivers, breweries & wineries, kayaking & tubing. 30 minutes to Massanutten.
description.space:
Attractions nearby within 5 miles: 
Luray Caverns, Shenandoah Skyline Drive, ziplining, hiking, fishing, tubing, wineries & breweries. Just around the corner from the Yogi Bear Water Park.

Indoor Living: Large Living room with 8 piece sectional & a 55 inch flatscreen smart TV w/cable, 8 person dining room, spacious master bedroom & bathroom with walk in closet, standup shower & full bathtub, 2 additional bedrooms with full bathroom, laptop friendly workspace. Full walkout basement with game room, mahogany pool table, foosball table, family room with a 55 inch TV, couch & cornhole boards. 

Outdoor Space: 3 decks, gas grill, table & chairs and front porch seating. Fire pit with wicker swings, 4 Adirondack chairs & a bench.
 
Kitchen: Electric Range, Refrigerator with Ice maker, dishwasher, microwave, Keurig coffee maker, pots & pans, dishes and glasses and silverware.  Crockpot, toaster & utensils.

General: Linens & towels will be provided. Central air & heating in the whole house. Washer & dryer for guest use.

Parking: Out front of the house with 6 to 8 car spaces in the front of the home designated.  No driving past the front of the home.  

The Property: High speed internet Wi-Fi, Family friendly and pet friendly.
description.access: The guests will have access to the whole home besides our storage closet and the 5 acre property. But they must stay within the area marked off by the pink flags on the left side of the property to the farm fence on the right side.
description.notes: Dog Friendly
description.neighborhood: 5 miles from the Shenandoah Skyline Drive and 5 miles outside of Luray in the mountains. It is located adjacent to a farm with cows, sheep & goats.
description.interaction: Guests will be provided with the hosts phone number and email to contact host with any problems. These will be provided at check in.
description.house_rules:
Pets:
- Must clean up all pet waste 
- No pets on the couches or beds
- Recommended to keep dog on a leash if walking the property
-Please contact host if early check in or late checkout is needed (extra fees may apply)

name: Garage apartment
title: Madison, Virginia

hosts.about: Quiet middle aged couple. We are horse farmers and small business owners who live at home with our  friendly dogs, horses and cats.  We enjoy meeting new people who visit for local weddings or just to explore the Blue Ridge.

recent.comments: Great hosts on a beautiful farm property. Highly recommended

items.comments: Great hosts on a beautiful farm property. Highly recommended
Very nice place in a pretty, quiet setting, but close to good attractions.  Liked the place very much.

We had a terrific experience at Hedi and Steve’s place.  Wonderful hosts, beautiful setting and the accommodations were perfect.  Clean, comfortable and very convenient for our visit.  We recommend Hedi & Steve’s place to other guests.  Thank you Hedi and Steve!
Great place for the weekend! Close to Skyline Drive, Charlottesville, and very convenient for a wedding at Early Mountain Winery! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!
The apartment itself and the property were both beautiful, plus Hedi and Steve were super welcoming and easy to communicate with. Overall great experience and would recommend!
Nice little getaway spot. It was a comfy and cozy place for a couple looking to get away.
Great place close to Early Mountain, perfect for our overnight stay. Adorable fire pit and lovely dogs.

description.summary: This is a small garage apartment. It has its own bathroom, queen sized bed, small work space, and a kitchen with microwave, toaster oven, small refrigerator, and coffee maker. We have an outdoor fire pit that seats four, firewood is included. You do have to navigate stairs for this space. The entrance is semi private.

name: Garden Thyme Farm 2bdrm,1bath / Enjoy the Outdoors
title: New Holland, Pennsylvania

gallery.caption: Living room w/ 2 pull out couches
Kitchen & dining room. table is extendable & extra chairs are in the kitchen.
Kitchen & dining room w/ door leading to living room

Coffee maker & supplied coffee
You are welcome to bring your own favorite coffee.
Bedroom 1. Extra blankets & linens are found in the chest
Front porch w/ hammock & wicker sofa
View of the farmhouse and our large berry patch
Driveway leading in from the road
View of flower gardens from the road
surrounding farmland with a view of the farmhouse in the background
Beautiful renovated, stonelined creek runs behind the house.
The dockhouse & fun stuff at the pond!
Beautiful swimming pond w/ fountain & beach area

hosts.about:
I live with my wonderful husband, Matt, and our precious daughters, Katherina & Gracelyn, on a 60 acre property in New Holland, Pennsylvania, and enjoy traveling and making new friends. Our goal is to offer you a beautiful home so you can reconnect with those important to you. 
My favorite quote "How often do we walk by someone's Calvary and think it only a hill"?

recent.comments: this was a great stay! very nice and peaceful. my boys loved running the grounds. definitely recommend this place to friends.

items.comments: this was a great stay! very nice and peaceful. my boys loved running the grounds. definitely recommend this place to friends.

Our time at the Garden Thyme Farm was an enjoyable one.  Our hosts, Matthew and Suzanne were friendly, gracious, and helpful during our visit.  The authentic farm property presented a beautiful garden, farm animals, and well kept yards and buildings.  The apartment above their home is ready for use, provides satisfying accommodations, and offers nice furnishings and comfortable beds for a restful and relaxing vacation.  The wide-open kitchen features a floor made of historic planks and has standard appliances and plenty of cabinet space for storing groceries.  It was a real treat for my family of five to step into the Thyme Farm, as it took us back from our familiar ways.

It was a very nice experience, Suzanne and her family are very nice and friendly. 
My kids loved their stay, spending time running around the fields and visiting the horses, cows and chickens. 
We definitely plan to stay there again, very beautiful and peaceful!

Suzanne was a great host.  She was very responsive in the booking process and met us as we arrived to check in.  We felt very welcomed and at home! The suite was very clean, well stocked, and comfortable. It is a cozy old farmhouse that has been very well taken care of.    The exterior of the property was beautiful. Very well kept and landscaped!  What you see in the photos is real but does not show the extent of the property. Excellent location and super quiet and peaceful.  There is nothing that we were disappointed in about the property.  We hope to stay there again next year as this will be a yearly trip for us for mission meetings. So, if you like what you see in the photos and its available, book now! You will not be disappointed!

I stayed with my wife and three kids at Suzannes lovely place for three nights. The appartment is on the second floor of their farmhouse, but it feels like you have the whole place to yourself. It is very spacious and private, although outside space is shared.

We explored the farm with the kids, they liked to see the animals up close and we enjoyed the peace and quietness of the countryside. Since it was winter we did not try the swimming pond, but it looked impressive.

The place was very cozy and comfortable. Suzanne and her husband Matt have nicely renovated the place while keeping the old atmosphere. Everything was very clean and tidy.
We hope to stay here again if we visit the area in the future.
Lugar limpio y tranquilo.

This beautiful apartment is on one of the prettiest streets in the area. It’s a very high quality place hosted by a lovely family. You will be in good company  as George Washington supposedly stayed for the night!

description.summary: This is a one of a kind 2nd floor suite of a beautiful 1700's Brick Farm House with flower gardens, a small stream behind the house, a beautiful pond with a dock and a water fountain, plus pastures and fields. It is located approx. 5 miles east of Intercourse, Pa and 3 miles south of New Holland, Pa plus close to many major attractions of Amish Country.
description.space:
Our farm is located in the fertile area of Lancaster County. Come and enjoy life with us. There are LOTSand lots of flower gardens for you to enjoy. The horses, longhorn cattle, the pig, and the chickens will love your attention:) There is a smal creek and a  beautiful pond behind the house. Lots of outdoor space for you to enjoy the cool clean air of the country. 
This beautiful suite is located on the 2nd floor, accessed by stairs, of a historic 1700's brick home. It boasts a full kitchen, fully equipped with pots and pans for your convenience. You will find dishes and plates in the cupboards plus utensils and cooking accessories. A full dining suite graces the kitchen making for a comfortable and enjoyable time. 2 Couches and 2 recliners in the living room provide plenty of space for lounging. Both couches are pull out couches for extra sleeping room. The suite is completed with 2 bedrooms each with one queen bed. A full bath finishes this beautiful suite. Linens and towels are provided to make your get away a breeze. A washer and dryer are found in the suite if you need to do laundry. We do provide laundry soap, Arm & Hammer.

This beautiful suite is newly renovated. A fresh coat of paint has been applied and new carpets cover all the floors except the kitchen and bathroom which have original hardwood flooring. New doors for the bedrooms have been installed plus other small upgrades. We hope you will love these renovations as much as we do! 

The outdoors is a beauty with many flower gardens & trees & shrubbery. Feel free to stroll the gardens or find a spot to sit and relax. The kids and adults alike are welcome to splash & wade in the creek. Please be mindful of the rocks and slippery spots as we are not responsible for accidents. Please no throwing rocks into the creek. Everything has been newly renovated and the rocks are in place to help with erosion of the banks.

Our pond has been newly renovated turning a dirty farm pond into a swimming pond. We are so excited! :) We can offer our guests use of the pond if arrangements have been made ahead of time as we do rent it out to local groups for day use. Please ask permission before using the pond and the facilities down there and know that at times it will be rented out to other groups and will not be available. All guests and visitors enter the pond area at their own risk. We are not responsible for accidents.  we hope you will enjoy it as much as we do:):)

A once in a lifetime opportunity to stay with an Amish family and experience the culture first hand.
description.access: The entrance is the middle door on the front porch. You will have the entire second floor to yourselves.... NO living spaces are shared.
description.notes:
The animals love to be petted, so feel free to do so:) Please do not feed the animals without permission. If you wish to help with the daily feeding we can arrange that. All guests and visitors enter the barns and barnyard at their own risk. We are not responsible for accidents.
NOTE: Please do not enter the animal meadows at any time.
description.neighborhood: Located in the Garden Spot of America, Lancaster County, Garden Thyme Farm is here to make your vacation perfect. Nestled at the foot of the Welsh Mountains within 10 minutes of two of the most popular Amish towns, New Holland and Intercourse we offer you the opportunity to experience the Amish culture while staying in the same house as an Amish family. The live on the first floor and you have the entire second floor all to yourself. Plus lots of yard and flower gardens to explore or sit and rejuvenate. The neighborhood is quiet and peaceful and most of the neighbors are Amish as well.
description.transit:
Garden Thyme Suite is 20 minutes from Strasburg Railroad and all the rail adventures including Choo Choo Barn.
2 minutes from Lapp Valley Farm. Lancaster's famous ice cream.
2 minutes from Emma's Gourmet Popcorn.
12 minutes from Shady Maple Smorgasbord & Shady Maple Farm Market.
20 minutes from Sight & Sound theaters.
About 45 minutes from French Creek State Park. 
60-75 minutes from Appalachian Trail access points.
description.interaction: We, as your host family, live on the first floor of the farmhouse and love hosting. We look forward to meeting you and your family.
description.house_rules:
- Quiet hours are after 10:00 PM.
- No Food or drinks on carpeted areas
- Enter barns & barnyards at your own risk
- Enter pond area at your own risk
- Owners are not responsible for accidents
- Animal meadows are off limits
- Please respect all private property

name: Scenic Private Farm House Great for Large Groups
title: Charlottesville, Virginia

gallery.caption: Great Room looking into Dining Area

recent.comments: Ned's home is so beautiful and the view is amazing!  I loved that the house was big enough (and then some) for our group. It was the perfect place to get away and feel like we were on our own little farm, yet close enough to downtown Charlottesville and so many great wineries.  I would definitely recommend this home to people interested in going to the Charlottesville area.  There were a few areas in the house that could have used a bit more cleaning before we showed up, such as a couple of the bathrooms but otherwise the house was nice and clean. It also had everything we needed for our stay which was very helpful.

items.comments: Ned's home is so beautiful and the view is amazing!  I loved that the house was big enough (and then some) for our group. It was the perfect place to get away and feel like we were on our own little farm, yet close enough to downtown Charlottesville and so many great wineries.  I would definitely recommend this home to people interested in going to the Charlottesville area.  There were a few areas in the house that could have used a bit more cleaning before we showed up, such as a couple of the bathrooms but otherwise the house was nice and clean. It also had everything we needed for our stay which was very helpful.

We enjoyed our weekend stay. The farm house was the perfect place to getaway and relax with beautiful views. It was also conveniently located to wineries and downtown Charlottesville. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone interested in staying in a beautiful old farm house located close to some of the best wineries in Charlottesville.

My husband and I traveled to the area with 3 other couples for a wedding. Edwards place was clean, spacious and comfortable.  We enjoyed the beautiful surroundings. Edward shared great recommendations about the local wineries which we enjoyed. We were able to end the day with a lovely meal prepped in the well equipped kitchen before sharing some laughs around the firepit. All commented on how comfortable the beds were. Wonderful stay!

We cannot say enough about Ned and the beautiful scenery surrounding his home. Ned was incredibly gracious and communicative. He is very flexible and made the the booking process, as well as checking in and out seamless and easy.  We were a large group visiting for UVA graduation, and the house was perfect for our party. Although the furnishings within the home are dated, it didn't matter as the view and land are the highlights.  Loved building fires in the pit and watching the gorgeous sunset. The beds are very comfortable, the AC was excellent, and plenty of hot water - so all the necessities were covered. We are forever grateful to Ned for sharing his beautiful farm and allowing us to experience an amazing weekend!

We had an absolutely amazing weekend at Ned’s place! He went above and beyond at every point to make sure we had the best weekend. The house was PERFECT for our group in every way with the best views. Can’t say enough positive things about this place!!
Great views! Edward was an excellent host.

Great place to stay for the weekend! Close to downtown Charlottesville and conveniently located close to the wineries. Ned’s place has a beautiful view and the place was very clean. He was also very communicative and flexible! Thanks Ned for a great stay.

description.summary:
CHURCH FIELD HOUSE.
Large 5 bedroom, 4 bath house with sweeping 360 degree views featuring beautiful pastoral and mountain landscapes on a 250 year old family farm in the Southern Albemarle Historic District. Enjoy large windows in almost every room with unobstructed western views. Large outdoor deck and a separate fire pit area are favorite places to view spectacular sunsets over the Blue Ridge Mountains.
description.space:
* Five Bedrooms : 3 with King Sized Beds, 1 with a Queen Size Bed, and 1 with 2 Double Beds. 

* 4 Bathrooms with showers and tubs (one with a Jacuzzi) (bathroom includes: shampoo, conditioner, soap, skin lotion, hairdryers, etc. ----everything to make you feel at home during your stay)

* Fully equipped kitchen including a 50-gallon icemaker

* Bar with separate sink

* Two wood burning fire places (one in great room and one in den)

* WiFi

* One large flat screened TV and Full Sound System (DirectTV)

* Washer and Dryer
description.notes:
* Parties + Events larger than 10 people, please reach out to discuss options.
* Check-in and Check-out times are firm, but, often can be flexible upon request
description.neighborhood: Perfect location and house for: wedding weekends, girls weekends, family getaway, UVA: football, Parents, Graduation and Reunion weekends,, wine tours, as it is very close to: Dave Matthews's Blenheim Vineyards (5 minutes), Trump Winery (5 minutes), Jefferson Vineyards (9 miles), the Lodge at Mt.Ida (7 minutes), Pippen Hill Farm & Vineyards (10 miles), and Monticello (10 miles), Carter Mountain Orchard, the Downtown Mall (10 miles) and the University of Virginia (11 miles).
description.interaction: I live locally in Charlottesville. Should there be any pressing issues, I am more than happy to stop by and help.
description.house_rules: - Due to the red clay in our area, please be extra extra mindful of muddy shoes in the house!
